Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: AAA size 6.0 cm; progressive expansion; no symptoms
Medical_Record.Background: Renal transplantation 21 years ago for renal failure secondary to diabetes and hypertension; renal artery of transplanted kidney from right internal iliac artery; chronic rejection; marginal renal function; creatinine 4.0 mg/dL, BUN 50 mg/dL; no mention of medications, allergies, family or social history

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Creatinine 4.0-4.4 mg/dL; BUN 50-58 mg/dL; completion angiogram showed type Ib endoleak from right iliac artery, resolved after additional stent; no endoleak on final angiogram; serial colorized duplex scan over 12 months showed no endoleak

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Recurrent syncope; 6-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: First syncope during exercise; no prodromal symptoms; recurrent non-exertional syncope; new left bundle branch block; pre-syncopal event with atrial tachycardia during stress test; mild reduced LVEF; moderate ischaemia and scar in inferior wall; intermittent high-grade AV block; progression to complete heart block; pacemaker dependence
Medical_Record.Background: History of Lyme’s disease; no hypertension, hyperlipidaemia, or diabetes; no angina or congestive heart failure symptoms; dual antiplatelet therapy (aspirin, ticagrelor); guideline-directed medical therapy for heart failure (lisinopril, metoprolol); no significant surgical history, family or social history, allergies, or other contextual data mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Blood pressure 140/66 mmHg; heart rate 54 beats/minute; respiratory rate 18 breaths/minute; temperature 36.2°C; oxygen saturation 99% on room air; normal heart sounds; no murmurs; no jugular venous distension; no pitting oedema; unremarkable remaining examination
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: ECG: sinus rhythm, first-degree AV block, prolonged QTc, intermittent high-grade AV block, brief atrial tachycardia; cardiac enzymes, thyroid function, serum calcium, ACE level normal; Lyme antibody negative; chest X-ray unremarkable; echocardiogram: LVEF 45–50%, later 31%, then 40–45%, no regional wall abnormalities; nuclear stress test: LVEF 42%, moderate ischaemia and scar; coronary angiogram: luminal irregularities, normal coronary vessels, LVEF 35–40%; CMR: focal transmural late gadolinium enhancement basal anteroseptal wall, LVEF 31%, RV EF 23%; CT chest: mediastinal and bilateral hilar lymphadenopathy; transbronchial biopsy unrevealing; mediastinoscopy and lymph node biopsy: non-caseating granulomas; fungal and acid-fast stains negative

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Bad breath, bleeding gums, difficulty in mastication, inability to maintain deposit-free teeth in right lower back region; unknown duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Local factors present; faulty tooth brushing; isolated Miller's Class III recession defect at mesial root of 46; missing and un-replaced 45; collapsed edentulous space due to mesio-buccal tilting of 46; food impaction between 46, 47, 48; dental caries distal to 46 and 47
Medical_Record.Background: Systemically healthy; no deleterious habits; no significant PMH; no surgical history; no family history; no social history; no medication allergies

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Isolated Miller's Class III recession defect at mesial root of 46; gingival recession 4 mm wide, 8 mm deep; sufficient keratinized tissue at donor site; non-vital 47
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Vitality check: non-vital 47; clinical measurement of recession; dental caries diagnosed distal to 46 and 47

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Abdominal discomfort and back pain; unknown duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Abdominal discomfort and back pain; irregularly outlined, centrally ulcerated gastric mass; progression to abdominal mass involving umbilicus and transverse colon two years after surgery; ascites with adenocarcinoma cells
Medical_Record.Background: No past history of malignancy; non-contributory family history; no information on medications, allergies, social history, or other contextual data

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Gastric endoscopy shows irregular, centrally ulcerated mass at lesser curvature of mid body to antrum; biopsy shows poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma with signet ring cell carcinoma; post-operative evaluation T3N2M0; biopsy of abdominal mass shows metastatic adenocarcinoma; ascites contains adenocarcinoma cells; light microscopy and immunohistochemical detection of cytokeratin in lymph nodes

Diagnosis: Gastric cancer (poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma with signet ring cell carcinoma), metastatic

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Worsening renal function and nephrotic range proteinuria; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Multi-organ sarcoidosis; type 2 diabetes; subnephrotic-range proteinuria; hypertension; recurrent hypercalcaemia-induced acute kidney injury; history of iritis and hilar adenopathy; prior pulmonary, ocular, and neurologic symptoms; multiple episodes of hypercalcaemia and acute renal failure with steroid tapering; progressive increase in proteinuria and creatinine
Medical_Record.Background: History of sarcoidosis diagnosed by bronchial biopsy; prior steroid therapy with side effects (diabetes, hypertension, hyperlipidaemia, obesity); methotrexate intolerance; negative workup for multiple myeloma; poorly controlled diabetes; maximal angiotensin receptor blocker therapy; unable to tolerate ACE inhibitor due to cough

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Serum creatinine ranged 141.4–345 μmol/L (1.6–3.9 mg/dL); proteinuria up to 10 g/24 h; corrected calcium 2.46 mmol/L; albumin 36 g/L; negative urine and serum electrophoresis; renal biopsy: granulomatous interstitial nephritis consistent with renal sarcoidosis, moderate-to-severe chronic tubulointerstitial disease, multiple granulomas, hypertensive vasculopathy, diabetic glomerulosclerosis; repeat biopsy: resolution of interstitial granulomas, stable diabetic glomerulosclerosis, moderate chronic tubulointerstitial inflammation

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Right breast nodule; 4-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Gradual increase in nodule size; hard, mobile, non-painful nodule; regular margins; smooth surface; 1.5 cm diameter
Medical_Record.Background: No family history of breast carcinoma; no core biopsy performed; surgical removal of nodule; adjuvant chemotherapy (CMF) and radiotherapy; periodic follow-up; no evidence of recurrence or metastases after seven years

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Hard, mobile, non-painful right breast nodule; regular margins; smooth surface; 1.5 cm diameter; no clinical alterations in ipsilateral or contralateral lymph nodes
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Breast ultrasound: ovular hypoechogenic formation, regular margins, 1.5 cm diameter; histopathology: secretory carcinoma, no capsule, mucus-like foci; immunohistochemistry: positive for cytokeratins (MNF116, CK7), EMA, S100, e-cadherin; negative for chromogranin, sinaptophysin, NSE, smooth muscle actin, p63, Her-2, oestrogen and progesterone receptors; Ki67 and P53 positive in <5% cells; DNA flow cytometry: diploid, low proliferative activity; quadrant histology: in situ secretory carcinoma, ductal papillomatosis with atypia; sentinel lymph node: metastasis (0.3 cm), intracytoplasmic secretory globules; 18 axillary lymph nodes: no metastases

Diagnosis: Secretory breast carcinoma with metastatic sentinel lymph node

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Lower abdominal pain and fever; 1-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Lower abdominal pain; fever; no nausea; no vomiting; no vaginal bleeding; no vaginal discharge; no diarrhea
Medical_Record.Background: Gravid 4 Para 0; history of three spontaneous abortions; history of ectopic pregnancy treated with laparoscopic right salpingectomy 2 weeks ago; no other surgical history; no significant medical problems; no medication use; trying to conceive for 2 years; nonsmoker; no personal or family history of bleeding or thrombotic disorders

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Febrile at 101°F; abdomen nontender, nondistended, no palpable masses; surgical wound inspection negative; Homans' sign negative; Moses' sign negative; pelvic exam: anteverted, normal size, nontender uterus, no adnexal tenderness, no palpable masses; other vital signs normal
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Urine pregnancy test negative; WBC 13.4 × 10^9/L (elevated); 78% neutrophils; C-reactive protein 120 mg/dL (elevated); rest of CBC and metabolic profile normal; chest X-ray negative; urinalysis negative; blood cultures sent; hypercoagulable workup negative; CT abdomen/pelvis: right ovarian vein thrombosis without extension into IVC

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Left iliac fossa pain and discomfort; 3-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Vague mass at left lower abdomen; no altered bowel habit
Medical_Record.Background: No family history of colorectal disease

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Well-built; purplish striae; soft, palpable mass at left lower abdomen (~6 × 4 cm); well-demarcated margin; mild tenderness
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT: well-defined heterogeneous enhancing soft tissue mass at left lower anterior abdominal wall (6.04 × 3.91 × 6.09 cm); central necrosis; punctate wall calcification; no fat component; good plane with external/internal oblique muscle; poor fat plane with left rectus/transversus abdominis; colonoscopy unremarkable; histopathology: densely cellular malignant spindle cell tumour, fascicular and herringbone patterns, non-immunoreactive to CD34, SMA, S100

Diagnosis: Malignant spindle cell tumour of anterior abdominal wall

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Locally advanced left breast tumor; unknown duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Locally advanced left breast tumor; axillary node involvement; red wide cutaneous rash on left chest wall during trastuzumab treatment; rash confirmed as HER2+ skin recurrence
Medical_Record.Background: HR-/HER2+ invasive ductal carcinoma; neoadjuvant chemotherapy with paclitaxel plus trastuzumab; cyclophosphamide, epirubicin, fluorouracil; left mastectomy plus axillary node dissection; radiotherapy to chest wall and supra-clavicular fossa; trastuzumab for 1 year; no residual disease on axillary nodes; no distant metastasis on CT; TDM1 initiated after trastuzumab failure

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Red wide cutaneous rash on left chest wall
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Core needle biopsy: HR-/HER2+ invasive ductal carcinoma; surgical specimen: scattered foci of ductal carcinoma in situ, no residual disease on axillary nodes; biopsy of skin lesion: HER2+ skin recurrence; restaging CT: no distant metastasis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Acutely worsening breathlessness; 7-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Chronic shortness of breath for several weeks; no improvement with inhaled beta-2-receptor agonist; increased breathlessness when lying on left side; mild chest discomfort; sudden severe shortness of breath and chest pain on rising from examination couch
Medical_Record.Background: Never smoked; no significant family history; no benefit from asthma treatment; no mention of other PMH, medications, allergies, or social history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Reduced breath sounds in left hemithorax; vital signs within normal limits; oxygen saturation >95% initially, dropped to 89% and later to 85%
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Normal chest radiograph initially; normal full blood count and electrolytes; VQ scan: complete absence of ventilation and perfusion to left lung; CT chest: mass obstructing left main bronchus; bronchoscopy: fleshy mass almost completely occluding left main bronchus; histology: bronchial carcinoid tumor; repeat chest radiograph: complete collapse of left lung; post-op chest radiograph: surgical staples at bronchial anastomosis, normal lung fields; repeat VQ scan: almost complete recovery of ventilation and perfusion

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Choreic movements; 2-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Choreic movements onset 2 weeks ago; prior catarrhal illness without fever 3 weeks before; bilateral tenosynovitis in feet for 1 year; no other significant symptoms reported
Medical_Record.Background: No significant past medical history; normal psychomotor development; no regular medications; lives with parents and brother; no family history of movement disorder

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Afebrile; haemodynamically stable; right hemichorea with brachial predominance; facial grimacing; restless tongue movements; milkmaid’s grip; motor impersistence; fidgety; inattentive; reduced verbal fluency and executive functions; emotional lability; bilateral ankle edema without inflammatory signs; normal cardiopulmonary auscultation
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Brain CT normal; blood tests: leukocytes 6100/mm3, CRP 1.1 mg/dL, ESR 20 mm/h; CSF and antibody panels normal; serum copper and ceruloplasmin negative; brain MRI normal; ECG normal; echocardiogram: mild aortic regurgitation, mild mitral regurgitation with valve thickening; negative streptococcal pharyngeal culture; ASOT decreased from 458 IU/mL to 291 IU/mL over 4 weeks

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Two episodes of nighttime headache
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Headaches not new; not severe; rarely occur at night; asymptomatic at time of visit
Medical_Record.Background: History of allergic rhinitis; sleep apnea syndrome; no prior imaging studies; no abnormal neurological findings; treated with non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: No abnormal neurological findings
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: MRI/MRA shows chronic sinusitis; no organic lesions associated with headache; MRI shows fenestration at right posterior cerebral artery P1-P2 segment; MRA reveals small fenestration at right PCA P1-P2 junction; vessel diameter in each limb forming fenestration almost equal; no concomitant vascular lesion

Diagnosis: Fenestration of the posterior cerebral artery P1-P2 junction

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Fever and headache; 2-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Febrile episodes (100–102°F); severe right-sided headache; no vomiting, nausea, or aura; previously healthy
Medical_Record.Background: No significant PMH; history of fall 2 years ago; no ENT, chest, or bleeding symptoms

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Tenderness over right mastoid bone; intact tympanic membrane; bilateral papilledema; normal vision
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: ESR three-fold increase; positive Mantoux test (22-mm induration); increased serum homocysteine; MRI brain normal; 99Tc-MDP bone scan and SPECT-CT: increased uptake in right temporal bone; HRCT: mild sclerosis and cortical destruction of right temporal bone; intraoperative: mass with cheese-like material on sigmoid sinus bony plate, erosion, compression of sigmoid sinus; histopathology: Mucor mycosis-induced osteomyelitis; post-op MRI and MRV: post-canalised sigmoid sinus with good flow

Diagnosis: Mucor mycosis-induced osteomyelitis of the right temporal bone

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Dyspnoea, peripheral oedema; duration of a few months
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive dyspnoea; peripheral oedema; elevated serum BNP 393 pg/mL; cardiomegaly and slight bilateral pleural effusion on chest radiograph
Medical_Record.Background: History of lumbar spinal stenosis surgery at age 67; carpal tunnel syndrome at age 75; renal dysfunction with eGFR 30 mL/min/1.73 m2 and proteinuria; no mention of medications, allergies, family or social history

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: ECG: atrial fibrillation, poor R progression, non-specific ST-T change; echocardiography: concentric left ventricular hypertrophy (IVS 14 mm, PW 12 mm), preserved ejection fraction 58.5%, elevated E/e' 23.8; serum-free light chain: κ 80.3 mg/dL, λ 169.8 mg/dL, κ/λ ratio 0.47; serum and urine immunofixation: IgA λ monoclonal protein; 99mTc-pyrophosphate scintigraphy: abnormal cardiac uptake (Grade 3); genetic testing for transthyretin: no mutations; endomyocardial biopsy: Congo-red positive, apple-green birefringence, immunohistochemistry positive for transthyretin and immunoglobulin light chain λ; LMD-LC–MS/MS: confirmed concurrent ATTR-CM and AL amyloidosis; kidney biopsy: Congo red-positive amyloid deposits, λ chain positive on immunostaining

Diagnosis: Concurrent light chain (AL) and transthyretin (ATTR) cardiac amyloidosis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Progressive dyspnea
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive dyspnea following multiple radiofrequency ablation procedures for atrial fibrillation
Medical_Record.Background: Nonobstructive hypertrophic cardiomyopathy; atrial and ventricular arrhythmias; multiple RFA procedures; no additional history provided

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Cardiac CT: mild right superior and significant left pulmonary vein stenosis; Quantitative V/Q scan: diffusely decreased perfusion to left lung (16%) compared to right (84%); preferential perfusion to right lower lobe; no ventilation defects; Pulmonary vein angiography: high-grade stenosis at left pulmonary venoatrial confluence; Balloon angioplasty and stent placement; CT venography after 4 months: widely patent stents, no intrastent stenosis; V/Q scan post-intervention: improved left lung perfusion (36.5%)

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Hypertension; 5-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Blood pressure fluctuated between 150-160/100-110mmHg; controlled by medication; no headache, dizziness, palpitation, hyperhidrosis; good general condition
Medical_Record.Background: Diabetes mellitus for 9 years; fasting blood glucose 6-7mmol/L, postprandial blood glucose 7-10mmol/L; hyperlipidaemia for 2 years; history of tonsillectomy; no special personal or family history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: No obvious positive signs
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Normal blood meta-norepinephrine and metanephrine; normal 24-hour urine catecholamines; hemoglobin 90g/L (declined); contrast-enhanced CT: solid cystic mass in right retroperitoneal space (50×45×62mm), obvious enhancement in solid part, mass located between IVC and phrenic foot, compression of IVC, right renal vein, right and caudate lobes of liver; somatostatin receptor imaging and 131I-MIBG imaging: increased uptake in solid portion; 3D printing of tumor morphology; pathological diagnosis: paraganglioma without adrenal involvement; immunohistochemistry: soluble protein-100 (+), synaptophysin (+), chromogranin A (+), cytokeratin (-), Ki-67 (2%), melanoma antigen (-), α-inhibin (-), succinate dehydrogenase B (+), O-6-methylguanine-DNA methyltransferase (-)

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Progressive neurological signs; sudden onset of epileptic cluster seizures (five in 24 hours); 1-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Underweight; underdeveloped; altered mentation; circling; ataxia; seizures every 2–3 hours prior to euthanasia
Medical_Record.Background: No history of toxin exposure; other littermates normal; blood parameters normal; owner declined MRI; treated with benzodiazepine and phenobarbital without improvement

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Blood parameters normal; MRI not performed

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Severe central chest pain; 1-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Severe central chest pain; no history of cardiac disease or cardiovascular risk factors; unintentional weight loss 6.5 kg; poor recent health; drenching night sweats
Medical_Record.Background: History of asthma since childhood; recent respiratory tract infection 2 months prior; received antibiotics and steroid therapy; possible occupational exposure to unusual sources of infection; no history of cardiac disease or cardiovascular risk factors

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Solitary liver mass; 1-year duration after lung surgery
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: History of left lower lobectomy for non-small cell lung cancer; new liver mass detected on CT 1 year post-operation; rapid growth from 3.1 x 2.9 cm to 9.6 cm within 7 months; no other metastatic lesions identified
Medical_Record.Background: Previous squamous cell carcinoma of the lung (pT1aN0M0, stage IB); no lymph node metastasis; no adjuvant chemotherapy; no reported allergies or family history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Good general condition; major organ functions tolerable to anesthesia
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT: 8.3 cm irregular liver mass in segment five; MRI: well-defined, hypointense on T1, hyperintense on T2, hypointense in late dynamic and hepatobiliary phases; PET and brain MRI: no other metastases; Serum CEA: 11.0 ng/ml (elevated); Serum CYFRA: 23.0 ng/ml (elevated); Intraoperative: large right liver mass, no other metastases; Pathology: metastatic squamous cell carcinoma of the lung

Diagnosis: Solitary liver metastasis from non-small cell lung cancer

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Sudden gait instability; 2-week duration; two episodes of falling
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Tingling sensation in right arm and leg; progressive depression over several months; 4-kg weight loss over several months; no headache, vertigo, loss of consciousness, fever, night sweats, or other associated symptoms
Medical_Record.Background: History of prostate cancer (diagnosed 1995), treated with prostatectomy, radiotherapy, hormone therapy (Zoladex); history of common B-cell acute lymphoid leukemia (B-ALL) with t(1;19)(q23;p13) E2A-PBX1 fusion, treated with chemotherapy and intrathecal methotrexate, complete remission; diagnosis of chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) in July 2011; no evidence of B-ALL relapse; watchful waiting for CLL; no other background data provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Unstable gait; tendency to fall to left; left central facialis paresis
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: PET scan: multiple faintly FDG-avid, slightly enlarged lymph nodes (bilateral axillar, retroperitoneal, iliacal, liver hilus, hepatogastric, mesenterial, retrocrural); CT and MRI brain: polylobular contrast-captating tumor in right parietotemporal area with perilesional edema and mass effect; Histopathology: dense lymphoid infiltrate with small cell and large blastoid components; Immunophenotype: CD20, CD79a, PAX5, CD5, CD23 positive; EBER positive in large blastoid population; PCR: monoclonal B-cell population identical to CLL clone

Diagnosis: Secondary central nervous system lymphoma (EBV-induced Richter transformation of CLL to diffuse large B-cell lymphoma)

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Progressive loss of eye contact, irritability, loss of speech; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Normal neurodevelopment until 20 months; progressive loss of consistent eye contact; persistent irritable mood with inconsolable high-pitched cry; worsening loss of prior vocabulary and speech abilities; increased clumsiness and frequent falls since walking at one year; decreased interaction with family and social cues
Medical_Record.Background: Born at term after uneventful pregnancy and uncomplicated normal delivery; no family history of neurological or developmental disorders in close relatives; previously healthy

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Well-looking; no acute illness; poor eye contact; irritable mood; diffusely decreased axial and appendicular tone; brisk deep tendon reflexes in all extremities; no nystagmus; no cranial nerve palsies; no abnormal facial features; no neurocutaneous signs; no joint contractures or deformities
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Brain MRI with magnetic resonance spectroscopy unremarkable; metabolic screening (lysosomal, thyroid, amino acid, fatty acid, immune disorders) negative; DNA genomic micro-array sequencing shows heterozygous de novo p.L3101 pathogenic variant of GABRB3

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Lumbar pain radiating bilaterally; 1-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive lumbar pain; radiation in L5 and S1 distribution; aggravated by walking; walking distance limited to 500 m; multiple work absences; no improvement with anti-inflammatory medications, analgesics, and physiotherapy
Medical_Record.Background: Diabetes mellitus type 2; no history of steroid intake, epidural steroid injection, or endocrinopathy; morbid obesity (BMI 48.9, 143 kg, 171 cm); referred for surgical assessment by family physician

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Morbid obesity; paresthesias in L5 and S1 dermatomes bilaterally; no focal motor deficits; normal gait; lumbar pain aggravated by palpation of soft tissues and paraspinal musculature; deep reflexes 2+ at patellar and Achilles tendons bilaterally; VAS of radicular pain 7/10; denied anal sphincter dysfunction
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: MRI: epidural lipomatosis at L4, L5, and S1; follow-up MRI after weight loss: resolution of epidural lipomatosis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Dyspnea with palpitations; acute onset
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Untreated hyperthyroidism for 5 years; loose stools; no daily medications; symptoms resolved after 5 days of treatment
Medical_Record.Background: History of hyperthyroidism; no current medications; no surgical history, family history, allergies, or social history mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: BP 150/78 mmHg; HR 130-170 beats/min; Temp 36.7°C; RR 24 breaths/min; SpO2 100% on room air; alert and oriented; hyperactive; anxious affect; pacing; tremulous; no focal neurologic deficits; tachycardia; lungs clear; skin normal color; hyperactive bowel sounds; abdomen non-tender
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: EKG: tachycardia at 170 beats/min, improved to 140 beats/min after lorazepam; D-dimer elevated; BMP, CBC, troponin unremarkable; thoracic CT angiogram: multiple branching filling defects

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: High fever; pruritic erythematous maculopapular rash with target lesions on legs; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Initial high fever, asthenia, adynamia, cephalalgia, pruritic erythematous maculopapular rash with target lesions on legs spreading to torso and arms; initial diagnosis of dengue; fever ceased after 2 days; recurrence of fever after 1 week with abdominal pain, nausea, dizziness; rash intensified with diffuse muscular pain; adverse drug reaction leading to hepatitis during hospitalization
Medical_Record.Background: No personal pathological antecedents; no surgical or traumatic history; no food or environmental allergies; lives with domestic dog diagnosed with terminal illness and covered with ticks; no treatment or restriction for dog

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Hyperbilirubinemia (elevated indirect bilirubin); thrombocytopenia; elevated lactate dehydrogenase; high C-reactive protein; leukocytosis with neutrophilia (92%) and lymphopenia; IgM- and PCR-positive for Rickettsia rickettsii (1:64)

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Difficulty in swallowing and impaired speech; duration 3 years
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Partial resection of tongue; persistent difficulty in swallowing and speech since glossectomy; use of palatal augmentation prosthesis with limited benefit
Medical_Record.Background: History of squamous cell carcinoma of right lateral border of tongue; anterior two-third glossectomy and neck dissection performed; diabetes mellitus for 5 years on medication; floor of mouth reconstructed with split-thickness skin flap from thigh; missing few teeth; no information on allergies, family history, or occupation

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Collapse of soft tissue on right cheek and right side of neck; adequate mouth opening (50 mm); obliterated lingual sulcus on resected side; dentulous with few missing teeth; concave, non-functional right-sided floor of mouth; altered posture and restricted movements of floor of mouth

Diagnosis: Squamous cell carcinoma of tongue, status post partial glossectomy

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Consultation for rectal cancer resected more than 1 month ago
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Blood in stool in February 2020; colonoscopy showed irregular protuberant lesions 7 cm above anus; pathologically diagnosed with moderately to poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma on April 3, 2020; history of abdominal distention in December 2014; gastric body and antrum lesions found by gastroscopy; distal gastrectomy and gastrojejunostomy performed; diagnosed with stomach carcinoma with lymphoid stroma; epistaxis in March 2017; diagnosed with poorly differentiated squamous cell carcinoma of nasopharynx
Medical_Record.Background: No history of diabetes mellitus, hypertension, tobacco or alcohol abuse; unremarkable family history; adjuvant chemotherapy after gastric surgery; chemotherapy and radiotherapy for nasopharyngeal carcinoma; no palpable superficial lymph nodes; Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group score 1

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: No palpable superficial lymph nodes
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Colonoscopy: irregular protuberant lesions 7 cm above anus; Pathology: moderately to poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma (rectum); Gastroscopy: circular protuberant lesions in gastric body and antrum; Histopathology: stomach carcinoma with lymphoid stroma, diffuse type; Immunohistochemistry: EBER (+) in stomach and nasopharynx; Biopsy: poorly differentiated squamous cell carcinoma (nasopharynx); MRI: rectal malignant tumor 58 mm above anus; PET/CT: thickening of mid-rectal wall with high FDG uptake; Postoperative pathology: ulcerative, moderately to poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma, T2N0, mesorectal fascia (-), extramural venous invasion (-); IHC: Ki-67 (80%+), EBER (-) in rectal tumor; Serum tumor markers and other labs within normal range

Diagnosis: Heterochronic triple primary malignancies (gastric carcinoma with lymphoid stroma, nasopharyngeal carcinoma, rectal adenocarcinoma) with Epstein-Barr virus infection and tumor protein 53 gene mutation

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Flu-like symptoms after recent hysterectomy; surgical site burst with severe bloody discharge; subsequent depression and heart palpitations
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Flu-like symptoms post-hysterectomy; surgical site dehiscence after sneeze with severe bleeding; onset of depression and heart palpitations; prescribed antidepressant, insomnia, and indigestion medications; developed anxiety, worsening palpitations (pulse 90 bpm), and insomnia; painful response to palpation at anterior chest; improvement in symptoms after taping therapy; pulse improved to 82 bpm, then 72 bpm; reported increased alertness, resolution of palpitations, improved sleep, and digestion; discontinued medications; complete symptom resolution after 40 days
Medical_Record.Background: Recent hysterectomy; no other past medical history, surgical history, family or social history, medications, allergies, or contextual data mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Painful response to palpation at anterior chest; no pain on back or sides; initial pulse 90 bpm; pulse improved to 82 bpm after taping; pulse 72 bpm next day; pulse stable at 68 bpm on follow-up; speech slower compared to initial visit

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Chronic cough; 4-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Cough with yellowish expectorant; cyclic jaundice; dyspnea; fever; onset after cholecystectomy in 2018; recurrent bacterial pneumonia; no verified periods of fever during initial course
Medical_Record.Background: History of cholecystectomy (2018); multiple hospitalizations for bacterial pneumonia; cirrhosis secondary to bile duct stenosis; MELD score 17; Child–Pugh score 7; no mycobacteriosis; no coagulogram abnormalities

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Severe jaundice; decreased vesicular murmur at lower right hemithorax; crackling noises; palpable liver 2 cm below right costal margin with blunt edge; cholecystectomy scar
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Total bilirubin 8.6 mg/dL; conjugated bilirubin 7.2 mg/dL; AST 218 U/L; ALT 131 U/L; GGT 533 U/L; AP 1,301 U/L; hemoglobin 14.2 g/dL; hematocrit 42.8%; WBC 10.9 × 10^3/mm3; platelets 343 × 10^3/mm3; chest and abdominal CT: right lower lobe alveolar consolidation with air bronchograms, ground-glass opacities, enlarged right liver lobe, marked intrahepatic bile duct dilation; sputum conjugated bilirubin 14.4 mg/dL; magnetic resonance cholangiography: bile duct stenosis, interconnection between posterior liver bile duct and right lower bronchi; post-surgery labs: total bilirubin 3.1 mg/dL, conjugated bilirubin 2.7 mg/dL, AST 40 U/L, ALT 46 U/L, GGT 503 U/L, AP 593 U/L; chest CT (4 months post-op): partial resolution of inflammation, sequelae bronchiectasis, parenchymal fibrosis

Diagnosis: Biliobronchial fistula secondary to biliary tract stenosis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Palpitations and fatigue; 27-day duration after nivolumab initiation
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Cough and dyspnea; diagnosed with stage IIIA squamous cell carcinoma of the lung; treated with chemoradiation and intratumoral cisplatin; developed recurrent disease; started nivolumab; presented with palpitations, fatigue, hyperglycemia, and ketonemia; developed diabetic ketoacidosis; later developed primary hypothyroidism; repeated episodes of DKA after immunotherapy
Medical_Record.Background: No prior history of diabetes mellitus; no surgical history stated; no family or social history stated; medications include carboplatin, paclitaxel, cisplatin, nivolumab, insulin, levothyroxine; no allergies stated

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT scan: 5-cm right hilar mass, bulky mediastinal adenopathy, new enhancing pleural nodule, chest wall involvement; transbronchial biopsy: squamous cell carcinoma; blood glucose: 592 mg/dL; ketonemia; elevated anion gap; anti-GAD antibody positive; TPO antibody positive; initial TSH normal; later developed hypothyroidism; PET scan: widespread metastatic disease

Diagnosis: Autoimmune diabetes mellitus and autoimmune thyroiditis induced by nivolumab

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Peripheral vision loss and impaired night vision; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive peripheral vision loss; impaired night vision; onset in early adulthood; stable best-corrected visual acuity over 10 years
Medical_Record.Background: Congenital hearing loss; cochlear implant surgery in early childhood; nonconsanguineous parents; no family history of similar disease; unaffected brother; no smoking or drinking history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Best-corrected visual acuity 20/50 right eye, 20/40 left eye; mild bilateral retinal vessel attenuation; bone spicule pigment deposits in mid-periphery of both eyes
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Color fundus imaging: bilateral retinal vessel attenuation, bone spicule pigment deposits; Fundus autofluorescence: parafoveal hyperautofluorescence ring, hypoautofluorescence spots; SD-OCT: preserved ELM and ISe band in foveal region, reduced ONL thickness, cystoid macular edema; ffERG: extinguished rod, combined rod-cone, cone, and 30 Hz flicker responses; Whole exome sequencing: homozygous c.60_61del variant in PCDH15 gene; Sanger sequencing confirmation

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Left shoulder pain; onset after waking up confused
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Restricted shoulder motion; pain and guarding; history of traumatic brain injury in 2006; first seizure in 2014 with prior left shoulder dislocation
Medical_Record.Background: History of traumatic brain injuries; fractures of left radius and ulna; concussions; cerebral edema; prior left shoulder dislocation treated with closed reduction; no antiseizure medications previously; started on levetiracetam; no seizure recurrence since discharge

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Restricted shoulder motion; pain and guarding
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Left shoulder X-ray: significantly displaced proximal humerus fracture; glenohumeral joint dislocation. CT shoulder: comminuted proximal humerus fracture; anterior glenohumeral dislocation; bony-Bankart fracture of anterior inferior glenoid rim (20% articular surface). Postoperative CT: confirmed reduction; glenoid bone loss 25% (best fit circle technique)

Diagnosis: Anterior shoulder dislocation and proximal humerus fracture secondary to generalized tonic-clonic seizure

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Lower back pain, leg weakness, gait disturbance; 3-hour duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Gradual onset weakness; ascended to bilateral upper extremities; four episodes nonbloody, nonbilious emesis; 15-pound unintentional weight loss over one month
Medical_Record.Background: No significant past medical, family, or social history; no previous similar events; no prior illness or gastrointestinal symptoms; no medication or allergy history provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: BP 148/70 mmHg; HR 107 bpm; BMI 28.72 kg/m2; motor strength 2/5 upper and lower extremities; movement only in digits; benign sensory exam; upper extremity DTRs 1/4 bilaterally; knee DTRs 1/4; ankle DTRs 0/4; tachycardic, regular rhythm, no murmurs or gallops; cranial nerves intact; no facial muscle weakness
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Lumbar spine MRI unremarkable; ECG: wide complex tachycardia (ventricular tachycardia); potassium 1.6 mEq/L (low); phosphorus 1.7 mg/dL (low); magnesium 1.6 mg/dL (low); thyroid profile: TSH 0.018 μIU/mL (low), T4 18.4 μg/dL (high), T3 2.52 ng/mL (high); repeat ECG after treatment; potassium overcorrected to 6.1 mEq/L

Diagnosis: Thyrotoxic periodic paralysis with hypokalemic ventricular tachycardia

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Recurrent fast breathing, darkened oral and lip mucous membranes, abnormal digits; noticed since 1st week of life
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Feeding difficulties; symptoms persistent since 1st week; multiple outpatient treatments with amoxicillin and Vitamin C; referred for worsening symptoms
Medical_Record.Background: Term gestation; no surgical history; no family or social history provided; no medication allergies reported

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Marked respiratory distress; mild cyanosis; tachypnoea (respiratory rate 65/min); SpO2 82% room air, 96% on oxygen; tachycardia (pulse 164/min); synchronous brachiofemoral pulses; bounding femoral pulses; blood pressure 76/38 mmHg (right arm, supine); displaced apex beat (left fifth intercostal space, lateral to midclavicular line); normal first heart sound; loud, single second heart sound; grade three continuous murmur at left sternal margin; tender hepatomegaly (5 cm below right costal margin)
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Chest radiograph: enlarged cardiac shadow, increased pulmonary vascular markings; initial echo: reported Tetralogy of Fallot; repeat echo: persistent truncus arteriosus with incompetent truncal valve, dilated branch pulmonary arteries (right 10 mm, left 8 mm), malaligned unrestrictive perimembranous VSD (16 mm), PDA with nonrestrictive left to right flow, pulmonary hypertension (TRV 4.3 m/s, mPAP 53.2 mmHg), reduced ejection fraction (50%), fractional shortening 24%, normal tricuspid annular plane systolic excursion (1.2 cm)

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Facial swelling and rashes; more than 3 years duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Swelling around eyes; rashes on face and dorsal hands; mild symmetrical proximal muscle weakness in upper arm; burning sensation with facial rash; no dysphagia; no respiratory symptoms
Medical_Record.Background: No positive myositis-specific autoantibodies; no significant family or social history mentioned; previous treatment with systemic corticosteroids, hydroxychloroquine, mycophenolate mofetil; refused rituximab and IVIG due to cost; refused topical glucocorticoids due to side effects; used topical tacrolimus cream without improvement; no allergies or occupation mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Violaceous papules and plaques on metacarpophalangeal and interphalangeal joints; facial swelling; rashes on face and dorsal hands
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Elevated lactate dehydrogenase; elevated creatine kinase; normal aldolase; normal antinuclear antibodies; normal rheumatoid factor; normal anti-mitochondrial antibody; normal anti-neutrophil cytoplasmic antibody; negative myositis-specific autoantibodies; Cutaneous Dermatomyositis Disease Area and Severity Index activity score 9, damage score 4; pathology: vascular dilatation and perivascular lymphocytic infiltrate

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Short bowel syndrome with severe malnutrition and enteritis
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Fever; history of intrauterine distress and enterectomy; deterioration during hospitalization; CRKP detected in blood culture; clinical improvement after antibiotic regimen change
Medical_Record.Background: History of intrauterine distress; history of enterectomy; no additional PMH, surgical history, family or social history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel history provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Temp 37.9°C; blood pressure 115/70 mmHg; pulse 88 bpm; SpO2 98%
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: WBC 12.22 × 10^9/L; neutrophil ratio 28.8%; CRP 8 mg/L; blood culture positive for carbapenem-resistant Klebsiella pneumoniae; C. elegans model susceptibility testing; K-B method susceptibility testing

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Fever, cough, malaise; 2-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Fever up to 103.3°F; tachycardia (heart rate 130s); symptoms present for two weeks; no IV drug or alcohol use; no recent travel
Medical_Record.Background: History of hypertension and benign prostatic hyperplasia; medications include angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor and amlodipine; no history of bacteremia; no significant family or social history provided; no allergies mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Abdominal, cardiovascular, and pulmonary examinations unremarkable; febrile; tachycardia
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: WBC within reference range; elevated C-reactive protein and procalcitonin; negative COVID-19 PCR; two blood cultures positive for Klebsiella pneumoniae; urinalysis: 11 WBCs, 1+ protein; urine culture negative; serum creatinine and liver function tests satisfactory; chest radiograph normal; abdominal CT: complex cystic area in posterior right liver lobe (5.2 cm septated abscess), questionable sigmoid colon wall thickening, distal abdominal aortic aneurysm with left common iliac artery involvement; liver biopsy: fibroblastic proliferation compatible with abscess; tissue culture: K. pneumoniae sensitive to trimethoprim/sulfamethoxazole, meropenem, ceftriaxone; colonoscopy: 8-mm transverse colon polyp, 20-mm distal sigmoid colon polyp (both tubular adenoma); follow-up CT: 2.4-cm subcapsular lesion (small hematoma), no abscess

Diagnosis: Liver abscess caused by Klebsiella pneumoniae

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Multiple somatic symptoms; duration since 2006
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, diarrhea; partial improvement with antidiarrheal and spasmolysis; persistent nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, anal distension; later limb weakness, soreness, insomnia, weight loss; repeated consultations and investigations with no organic pathology; symptoms refractory to multiple medications; worsening in 2018; severe somatic symptoms with depression, anxiety, and sleep disorders; suicidal ideation prior to neurosurgical intervention
Medical_Record.Background: No significant past medical history; no previous mental illness; no family history of mental illness; no history of psychotropic drug use prior to 2011; no known allergies; medications included flupentixol and melitracen, duloxetine, lorazepam, buspirone, agomelatine, dexzopiclone; no stressful life events, trauma, or psychosocial factors reported

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Mental status: logical thought content, alert, able to concentrate, intact cognition; mild somnolence postoperatively (resolved by day three); vital signs normal one week post-op
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Gastroenteroscopy, abdominal-thorax CT, MRI, stool routine: normal; laboratory: low total protein (49.7 g/L), low albumin (32 g/L), low globulin (17.7 g/L); preoperative cranial MRI and CT: no organic disease; psychiatric scales: PHQ-15: 20, HAMD-17: 32, HAMA-14: 28, SCL-90: 156, MMSE: 27, PSQI: 27; postoperative head CT: small intracranial gas, no hemorrhage

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Sudden onset headache; followed by right hemiplegia and global aphasia
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Acute headache; rapid development of right hemiplegia and global aphasia; no history of coagulation abnormality, recent trauma, or hormonal substitution
Medical_Record.Background: No past medical history of coagulation abnormality; no recent trauma; no hormonal substitution; vegetarian diet without proper iron substitution; no B12 or folate deficiency; no gammopathy; no malignant disease or source of active bleeding detected; no pelvic vein thrombosis; no deep venous thrombosis of lower limbs

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT and MRI: massive left frontotemporal hemorrhagic infarction; thrombosis of superior sagittal sinus, left sigmoid/transverse sinus, and cortical vein; chest tomography: bilateral subsegmentary pulmonary embolism; Doppler: no deep venous thrombosis of lower limbs; hemoglobin 3.4 g/L (severe hypochromic microcytic anemia); serum iron 1 μmol/L (low); ferritin 2 mg/dL (low); normal B12 and folate; normal coagulopathy screen; protein immunofixation: no gammopathy; endoscopies, mammography, echography, CT: no malignancy or bleeding source

Diagnosis: Iron-deficiency anemia with cerebral venous thrombosis and pulmonary embolism

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Severe preeclampsia; acute onset
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Headache; blurring of vision; severe epigastric pain; vomiting; BP 210/110 mm Hg on admission
Medical_Record.Background: Chronic idiopathic thrombocytopenic purpura diagnosed 1 year ago after menorrhagia post-hysterolaparoscopy; thrombocytopenia; normocellular marrow with megakaryocytes; methylprednisolone 20 mg/day for 6 months, tapered; regular antenatal care; mild thrombocytopenia during pregnancy; last ANC 5 days prior with normal platelets and BP 130/80 mm Hg; gravida 2, abortion 1, para 0; no evidence of neonatal thrombocytopenia

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: BP 210/110 mm Hg on admission; headache; blurring of vision; severe epigastric pain; vomiting; intraoperative BP increased to 180/100 mm Hg; APGAR scores 7 and 9 at 1 and 5 minutes
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Platelet count 60 × 10^9/L on admission, decreased to 25 × 10^9/L postoperatively, improved by discharge; liver enzymes elevated (SGPT 422 IU/L, SGOT 765 IU/L); S. Bilirubin total 3.6, direct 2.4, indirect 1.2; LDH 958 IU/L on admission, increased to 1592 IU/L postoperatively, decreased to 493 IU/L by discharge; Hb 9 g/dL; INR normal; S. creatinine 0.7; electrolytes normal

Diagnosis: Idiopathic Thrombocytopenic Purpura, Preeclampsia, HELLP Syndrome

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Incidental right-sided laryngeal tumor; unknown duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: No laryngeal symptoms; tumor discovered during upper gastrointestinal endoscopy
Medical_Record.Background: History of hypertension and hyperlipidemia

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: No hoarseness; no dysphonia
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Flexible fiberscope: 10 mm mass on right aryepiglottic fold with smooth mucosa; Endolaryngeal microsurgery: total mass excision; Pathology: 8 mm reddish-brown, submucosal, encapsulated tumor; Histopathology: well-demarcated, covered with squamous epithelium, adipocytes, large meandering arterial and venous vessels, spindle-type smooth muscle cells; Immunohistochemistry: positive for SMA and desmin, negative for HMB-45 and Melan-A

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Asthma exacerbations; 12-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Four exacerbations in past 12 months; persistent dyspnea despite escalated anti-asthma treatment; recent acute asthma attack and respiratory tract infection triggered by cold; cold symptoms improved after anti-infective and nebulized corticosteroids therapy; dyspnea not relieved
Medical_Record.Background: 2-year history of asthma; treatment with salmeterol/fluticasone and montelukast; no additional PMH, surgical history, family or social history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel history mentioned

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Frontal and temporal hair shedding; 2-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Onset 2 weeks ago; diffuse hair loss in frontal and temporal areas; history of hair transplantation 3 weeks prior to hair loss
Medical_Record.Background: No medical history; no smoking history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Diffuse hair loss in frontal and temporal areas; positive hair pull test with more than 10 hairs
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Histopathology: normal follicular density; increased telogen hair follicles; no inflammatory cell infiltration

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Headache; 3-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Headache started on second post-operative day after fissurectomy under spinal anaesthesia; headache present all over head; increased on erect posture; relieved on supine position; no nausea, vomiting, or neurological signs; partial relief after autologous epidural blood patch; transient unresponsiveness after procedure; headache increased next day; orthostatic in nature
Medical_Record.Background: ASA physical status 1; underwent fissurectomy; no mention of past medical history, surgical history, family or social history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: No neurological deficit; fundus examination revealed papilloedema
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: MRI brain showed acute thrombosis of entire superior sagittal sinus and bilateral major cortical veins; features of increased intracranial pressure (effacement of parietal lobe sulci); Protein C, Protein S, and antithrombin III levels within normal limits

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Headache and nuchal rigidity; onset in June 2019
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: History of extranodal NK/T cell lymphoma with initial presentation in caecum, hypopharynx, and bone marrow; first relapse in nasopharynx; isolated CNS relapse with headache and nuchal rigidity; chronic EBV infection; persistent elevated EBV load despite antiviral therapy
Medical_Record.Background: Diagnosed at age 21; treated with SMILE protocol and autologous stem cell transplant (BEAM regimen); relapsed after 4 years with left hemifacial pain, left otorrhea, fever, night sweats, fatigue, nasal obstruction, anosmia, anorexia; enrolled in clinical trial for atezolizumab; minimal side effects; developed diabetes during follow-up; no surgical history stated; no family or social history stated; no medication allergies stated

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Nuchal rigidity; headache
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: PET-CT: left cervical lymphadenopathy, nasopharynx, oropharynx, soft palate involvement; PCR: EBV detectable in blood and CSF; Biopsy: EBER-positive cells in nasopharynx and tonsils; CSF: persistent disease after TIT chemotherapy; plasma EBV load elevated; post-radiation: EBV viral load diminished but detectable

Diagnosis: Extranodal NK/T cell lymphoma with isolated central nervous system relapse

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Less and narrow stool with hematochezia; 3-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive change in stool caliber; hematochezia; colonoscopy showed multiple protuberant ulcer lesions in sigmoid colon and rectum; initial partial response to cetuximab, oxaliplatin, and capecitabine; disease progression after 10 months; new right ovarian lesion during maintenance treatment
Medical_Record.Background: Family history: mother and sister with breast cancer, father with prostate cancer; germline BRCA1 mutation detected; no lesions in breast and ovary at admission; no other background information provided

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Colonoscopy: multiple protuberant ulcer lesions in sigmoid colon and rectum; Pathology: poorly differentiated adenocarcinoma; IHC: CK7 (+++), CDX-2 (+), SATB2 (+), Her2 (+), Ki67 (50%+), MLH1 (+), MSH2 (+), MSH6 (+), PMS2 (+); CT scan: peritoneal lesions, rectal lesion enlargement; PCR sequencing: KRAS (-), NRAS (-), BRAF V600E (-); Surgical pathology: tumor from serosal layer; IHC after surgery: Villin (-), CK7 (+++), CK20 (-), ER (++), PAX8 (+++), SATB2 (-), CDX-2 (-); NGS: germline BRCA1 mutation; IHC after ovarian surgery: Her2 (Br)-, ERCC1 (+), ER (+), PR (-), P53 (+), Ki67 (30%+), P16 (+), WT1 (+), CD31 (+), D2-40 (scattered+)

Diagnosis: Hereditary breast and ovarian cancer syndrome presenting as primary peritoneal carcinoma with colorectal metastasis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Bony exposure on left posterior maxilla; 3-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Spontaneous loss of left maxillary first and second molars; bony exposure developed after tooth loss; pus discharge and bleeding at site; sequestrum detached from area
Medical_Record.Background: History of osteoporosis; oral risedronate 35 mg once weekly for 4 years; no other background information provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Bony exposure on left maxillary alveolar region; pus discharge; bleeding; sequestrum present
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Panoramic radiograph: large osseous crater, cortical bone destruction on left maxillary edentulous area; CT: cortical bone destruction, sclerotic change in trabecular bone, lesion extension to maxillary sinus floor, mucositis, scattered sequestra; Biopsy: sequestrum infiltrated with chronic inflammatory cells, absence of osteocytes in lacunae

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Multiple asymptomatic, hypopigmented, raised lesions over neck and upper back; 2-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Gradual increase in number of lesions; no hypopigmented anesthetic patches; no epistaxis; no pedal edema; no other systemic complaints
Medical_Record.Background: History of 6 months antitubercular treatment 2 years ago

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Multiple, well-defined, hypopigmented and erythematous papules (1 mm to 1 cm) over nape of neck and upper back; few papules coalescing to form plaques
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Skin biopsy: normal epidermis, papillary dermis with well-defined granuloma of epithelioid cells, absence of lymphocytic rim, Langhan's giant cells; raised serum angiotensin converting enzyme (72U/L); chest X-ray: bilateral hilar lymphadenopathy; CT-guided lung biopsy: necrotizing granuloma

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Weight loss, severe nausea, emesis, mild imbalance, involuntary body shakes; 6-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive weight loss (30 pounds); severe nausea and vomiting; mild imbalance progressing to bedbound instability; involuntary body shakes worsening over 6 months
Medical_Record.Background: History of hypothyroidism, hyperlipidemia, hypertension; 50 pack years of smoking; no reported drug allergies; family/social history not specified; medications include sertraline, lorazepam, levetiracetam, methylprednisolone; acute H. Pylori infection on duodenal biopsy

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Disorganized high amplitude conjugate horizontal eye movements persisting with eye closure; severe truncal ataxia; unable to sit up without support; distinct abdominal myoclonus; otherwise unremarkable neurological exam
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Contrast enhanced-MRI of neuroaxis normal; EEG normal; colonoscopy normal; hematologic and chemistry panels normal; EGD shows possible gastritis; TSH mildly elevated (9 U/mL); anti-thyroid peroxidase antibody elevated (50 mg/L); CSF lymphocytic pleocytosis (25 WBCs); CSF cytology negative for malignancy; flow cytometry shows T cell dominant inflammatory process; paraneoplastic panel negative in CSF; serum VGKC antibodies elevated (0.05 nmol/L; normal <0.02 nmol/L); duodenal biopsy shows acute H. Pylori infection; chest CT normal; abdominal CT shows pancreatic duct cut-off sign; MRI and endoscopic ultrasound-guided biopsy confirm ductal adenocarcinoma of pancreas; histologic grade 3/4, size 1.8 x 1.7 x 1.5 cm; negative operative margins; lymph nodes negative for metastasis

Diagnosis: Paraneoplastic Opsoclonus Myoclonus Syndrome secondary to Pancreatic Adenocarcinoma

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Bilateral cervical lymph node enlargement; 3-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Intermittent fever; 1-month duration; tachypnea; 15-day duration; no significant weight reduction; no apparent changes in cervical lymph nodes during prior treatment
Medical_Record.Background: Pollen pini used for 3 years; intermittent fever relieved by physical cooling and oral antipyretics; stopped Pollen pini 2 months ago due to COVID-19 restrictions; no significant family history; parents and two sisters healthy

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Height 116 cm; weight 19.5 kg; BMI 14.49 kg/m2; several soft, non-tender swollen lymph nodes in left neck; largest 2 x 3 cm; pale; anemic appearance; heart rhythm regular; no murmurs; heart rate 102 bpm
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: WBC 5.56 x 10^9/l; Hb 82 g/l; platelet count 172 x 10^9/l; abdominal CT: enlarged liver, spleen, kidneys, multiple enlarged lymph nodes; echocardiography: LVEF 27%, moderate tricuspid regurgitation, low to mild mitral regurgitation; 24-h Holter: average heart rate 136 bpm; CHIPS score 2; lymph node biopsy: classic Hodgkin lymphoma (lymphocyte depleted cHL, LDCHL); IHC: CD3(-), CD20(-), CD30(+), ALK(-), CD68(-), MUM1(+), Ki-67(+), LCA(-), BOB1(-), OCT2(weak +), PAX-5(weak +), CD4(-), LMP(+), PD-1(-), CD15(-), BcL-2(NS); EBER(+); WES: TTN gene mutation; PET-CT: systemic tumor invasion after first chemotherapy; tumor reduced >85% after fourth cycle; complete remission after six cycles; LVEF recovered to 62%; no abnormality in thyroid, electrolytes, liver, kidney function

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Fainting and general malaise; 5-year duration, worse in prior 6 months
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Symptoms triggered by neck flexion and changing body position; no other discomfort
Medical_Record.Background: No significant past history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: BMI 28.52; blood pressure 144/77 mm Hg; radial pulse 80 beats/min, regular; slight pitting edema in both legs; no pathologic cardiac murmur; no significant abdominal findings
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Echocardiogram: left ventricular mass attached to posterior wall near apex (16.1 mm × 11.1 mm), well-defined border, mobile; laboratory tests, ECG, coronary angiography, brain MRI: no abnormalities; intraoperative TEE: mass attached by pedicle to LV posterior wall near apex; intraoperative findings: well-encapsulated, yellow mass (25 mm × 10 mm), no invasion; histopathology: lipoma

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Nonproductive cough, dyspnea at rest, dysuria, urinary frequency and urgency; 1-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Persistent respiratory and urinary symptoms; diagnosed with UTI and viral upper respiratory tract infection; no improvement with ciprofloxacin; presented to ED
Medical_Record.Background: No significant past medical history; medications: ciprofloxacin; allergies not specified; family and social history not specified

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Oxygen saturation 90%; tachycardia; low-grade fever; bibasilar crackles; holosystolic apical murmur; 2+ lower extremity edema; punctuate macular lesions on feet
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Leukocytosis with neutrophilia (14.7 bil/L and 11.3 bil/L); acute kidney injury; urinalysis: bacteriuria and leukocytes; chest X-ray unremarkable; blood and urine cultures: gram-positive cocci, AU identified; transthoracic echocardiogram: mobile mass on posterior mitral valve leaflet; ejection fraction 40%; transesophageal echocardiogram: 1.4 cm × 2.5 cm vegetation, severe mitral regurgitation, posterior leaflet perforation

Diagnosis: Mitral valve endocarditis with posterior leaflet perforation secondary to urinary source

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Back pain; VAS 7/10; numbness below umbilicus; bilateral lower limb weakness
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Gradual onset back pain; numbness and weakness; no other symptoms
Medical_Record.Background: No significant past medical history; no smoking history

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Laboratory findings unremarkable; CT and X-ray show abnormal mass at T9 and left upper lobe of lung; MRI, PET-CT, and biopsies confirm single metastatic lesion at T9; primary site lung; staging T1N0M1; non-small cell lung cancer (adenocarcinoma); EGFR exon 21 deletion; MRI shows pedicle involvement and spinal canal stenosis; vertebral lesion spans entire T9; Tokuhashi score 9

Diagnosis: Non-small cell lung cancer with spinal metastasis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Delayed attainment of age appropriate milestones; 3-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Tightness of all four limbs; onset at 3 months; no antenatal or perinatal adverse events
Medical_Record.Background: Born at term; birth weight 2.9 kg; history of chill blains on exposure to cold; more severe than unaffected family members

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Occipito-frontal circumference 35.5 cm; spasticity; brisk reflexes; normal abdominal and ophthalmological assessment
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CSF mild pleocytosis (0.012 x 10^9 WBCs/L); CSF elevated proteins (82 mg/dL); negative TORCH titres; normal EEG

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Severe bilateral nipple pain during and after breastfeeding; 2-week duration postpartum
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Onset in second week postpartum; severe bilateral nipple pain; associated with breastfeeding technique difficulties; persistent pain for one month; biphasic nipple color change (pallor then blushing); transient relief with warm compresses and electric breast pump; complete resolution after four weeks of nifedipine treatment
Medical_Record.Background: Healthy; no regular medication; G1P1; history of uncomplicated pregnancy; spontaneous conception; eutocic term delivery at 40 weeks; no complications

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Pale and whitish nipple; no other changes

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Chest pain and shortness of breath; acute onset during night
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Awoke with chest pain (4/10 severity), shortness of breath, diaphoresis; airlifted to emergency department
Medical_Record.Background: History of hypertension, type 2 diabetes mellitus, hypersensitivity pneumonitis, obesity with gastric band placement, right breast cancer status post-lumpectomy; no cardiac disease; denies tobacco use; social alcohol use; recreational drug use unknown

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Grossly unremarkable; regular heart rate and rhythm; no murmurs or gallops; clear lungs on bilateral auscultation
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Electrocardiogram shows anterior ST elevation; troponin >10,000 ng/dL; findings consistent with ST-elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI)

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Dyspnea; duration not stated
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Dyspnea; CT scan shows right lower lobe lesion, pleural effusion, multiple mediastinal lymphadenopathy; PET/CT shows increased metabolic activity in bilateral adrenal glands; diagnosis of advanced lung adenocarcinoma; BRAF V600E mutation detected; high PD-L1 expression; treated with dabrafenib and trametinib; developed peripheral leg edema and hypoalbuminemia after four weeks; pneumonia detected on CT scan seven weeks after treatment initiation; no pneumonia symptoms
Medical_Record.Background: History of smoking, one pack per day from age 20 to 70; no other PMH, surgical history, family or social history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel history stated

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: No dyspnea after two weeks of therapy; peripheral leg edema (grade 3 CTCAE); cardiac function preserved; no renal dysfunction
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT scan: right lower lobe lesion, pleural effusion, mediastinal lymphadenopathy; PET/CT: increased metabolic activity in bilateral adrenal glands; NGS: BRAF V600E mutation; Immunohistochemistry: high PD-L1 expression (TPS 90%); Laboratory: leukocyte count 7100/μL, hemoglobin 11.5 g/dL, CRP 1.56 mg/dL, total protein 8.6 g/dL, albumin 2.4 g/dL, BUN 18 mg/dL, creatinine 0.85 mg/dL, albuminuria 1+; chest X-ray and CT: reduction in pleural effusion and mass shrinkage after therapy; ultrasound cardiography: cardiac function preserved; CT scan: further tumor shrinkage and pneumonia

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Nasal discharge and cough; 2-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Onset of nasal discharge and cough 2 days after contact with SARS-CoV2-positive relatives; positive SARS-CoV2 PCR 4 days before admission; increasing nasal discharge; poor sleep; slight exacerbation of general condition after admission
Medical_Record.Background: Born at 41 weeks gestation via vacuum extraction; birth weight 3348 g; transient tachypnea in neonatal period with oxygen therapy; no further complications; mother unvaccinated for SARS-CoV2 during pregnancy

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Weight 4488 g; body temperature 36.5°C; SpO2 97% on room air; heart rate 130–140 bpm; no respiratory distress; no crackles or wheezing on auscultation
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Chest radiography: no pneumonia, bronchiolitis, or heart failure; initial labs: AST 146 IU/L, ALT 87 IU/L, LDH 370 IU/L, ferritin 570 ng/mL; improvement on day 10: AST 91 IU/L, ALT 82 IU/L, LDH 300 IU/L, ferritin 368 ng/mL; further improvement on day 20: AST 68 IU/L, ALT 53 IU/L, LDH 313 IU/L, ferritin 286 ng/mL

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Infertility; 5-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Normal sexual desire and sexual life; no other diseases; no positive family history
Medical_Record.Background: No significant past medical history; no family history of genetic disease; no reported allergies; no medication history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Height 172 cm; weight 73 kg; BMI 24.6 kg/m2; normal secondary sexual characteristics; normal testicular and penis development; no gynecomastia; bilateral vas deferens and epididymis not palpable
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Semen analysis: azoospermia; hormone levels (testosterone, LH, FSH, prolactin) normal; ultrasound: normal testicular volume, absent epididymal tails; transrectal ultrasound: left seminal vesicle missing, right seminal vesicle atrophied; karyotype: 46, XY/47, XYY mosaic; genetic testing: heterozygous CFTR mutations (c263T > G, c2249C > T); Y chromosome microdeletion negative; testicular puncture: some sperm present

Diagnosis: Congenital absence of bilateral vas deferens with 47, XYY mosaic karyotype

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Confusion and sepsis secondary to deep infection of left big toe

Second episode: Eye exposure to coughing droplets; eye redness, inflammation, infection; persistent symptoms despite chloramphenicol and artificial tears; positive RT-PCR in eye and nasopharyngeal samples; high viral load in eye; onset of fatigue, fever, shortness of breath, muscle pain; milder symptoms than first episode; CRP double positive; normal lymphocyte and neutrophil count; recovery after 10 days.
Medical_Record.Background: No underlying medical conditions; no diabetes, hypertension, or cardiovascular disease; medications: azithromycin, naproxen, acetaminophen, baclofen, gabapentin, fluorometholone eye drops, chloramphenicol drops, artificial tears; no reported allergies; no relevant surgical history, family history, immunizations, or travel history mentioned.

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: First episode: Positive SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR (ORF1N gene); CT scan shows mild pulmonary congestion; CRP positive; lymphocyte depletion. Second episode: Positive RT-PCR (ORF1ab and N) in eye and nasopharyngeal samples; high viral load in eye; CRP double positive; lymphocyte count 36%; no change in neutrophil count.

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CV sampling cytogenetics; amniotic fluid karyotype; CMA and FISH analysis; subtelomeric FISH; fetal karyotype 46,XY.ish der(6)t(6;19)(p25.1;q13.43)(6PTEL48-,D19S238E+)dn.arr[GRCh37] 6p25.3p25.1(204009_4397431)×1,19q13.43(58800403_59095418)×3

Medical_Record.Background: History of controlled hypertension and diabetes; diagnosed with poorly differentiated cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma in right palpebral region in 2016; complete surgical resection with negative margins; no adjuvant therapy; recurrence in right parotid gland and ipsilateral cervical lymph nodes in December 2019; PET-CT showed nodular formations in parotid gland and enlarged cervical lymph nodes; cemiplimab therapy initiated; no distant metastases; no reported drug allergies

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Scattered white exudates in oropharynx; large, coalescent, painful ulcerative lesions in oral mucosa; no skin manifestations
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: PET-CT: hypoattenuating nodular formations in right parotid gland (SUVmax: 7.7), enlarged ipsilateral cervical lymph nodes (SUVmax: 5.4), no distant metastases; repeat PET-CT: near-complete reduction in parotid gland and lymph nodes, sarcoid-like reaction in mediastinal lymph nodes; hemogram, renal and liver functions normal; oral biopsies: non-specific inflammatory reaction, ulcerated epithelium, fibrin and leukocyte exudate, no malignant cells, no bacterial or fungal infection

Diagnosis: Drug-induced stomatitis and sarcoid-like reaction in lymph nodes after cemiplimab therapy for cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Creatinine 17.31 mg/dL; BUN 121 mg/dL; potassium 7.3 mEq/L; inorganic phosphorus 10.1 mg/dL; LDH 666 IU/L; sIL-2R 9334 IU/mL; plain CT: 9x5 cm retroperitoneal mass, bilateral hydronephrosis, partial kidney invasion, pleural effusions, right cardiophrenic and bilateral inguinal lymphadenopathies; bone marrow: no tumor infiltration, normal karyotype; pleural fluid cytology: large abnormal lymphocytes; inguinal lymph node biopsy: diffuse involvement, medium to large abnormal lymphocytes, loss of lymphoid follicle structure; immunostaining: negative CD3 and Bcl-6, positive CD10, CD20, CD79a, Ki67, c-Myc, Bcl-2 (>90%); FISH: split signals at 8q24 (MYC) and 18q21 (BCL2); lumbar puncture: invasion of large abnormal lymphocytes; head MRI: swelling of bilateral abducens nerves and left optic nerve

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Asymptomatic left submandibular mass; 3-month duration

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Ultrasound: mixed cystic and solid areas with high flow vascular fibrous septa in level Ib; MRI: 5 × 4 × 3 cm multilobed mass from left submandibular gland with fluid and solid components, no distant metastases; CT: colliquate areas with thick pathological peripheral tissue; Fine-needle aspiration cytology: malignant cells, type not identified; Histology: two distinct malignant components—mucoepidermoid carcinoma and osteosarcoma; Immunohistochemistry: cytokeratin, PAS, and vimentin positivity; Features: cellular atypia, mitoses, necrosis, bleeding, angioinvasion
