Medical_Record.Background: Nulliparous; no history of sexually transmitted disease, pelvic inflammatory disease, or gynecological surgery; no information on medications, allergies, family or social history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Initial BP 110/70 mmHg, pulse 80/min, temperature 37.5°C; small amount of vaginal blood, closed cervical os; normal size anteverted uterus; no cervical motion tenderness; left adnexal tenderness, no mass; on third day: BP 95/60 mmHg, pulse 90/min, abdominal rebound tenderness
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Urine pregnancy test positive; serum beta-hCG 592 mIU/mL (initial), decreased to 364 mIU/mL; transvaginal ultrasound: empty uterus, corpus luteum in left ovary, 25 mm hyperechoic mass with central hypoechoic shadow in left adnexa, no yolk sac or fetal pole, no free fluid initially; WBC 4.6 × 10^9/L, Hb 12 g/dL, Hct 34%, Plt 216 × 10^9/L, RBC 4.2 × 10^12/L; on third day: Hb 8.5 g/dL, RBC 3.17 × 10^12/L, Hct 23.5%; ultrasound: large amount of fluid in cul-de-sac and abdominal cavity; laparoscopy: 600 mL blood evacuated, left ovary hemorrhagic mass (5 × 4.5 × 3.5 cm), left fallopian tube normal; pathology: left ovarian gestation with necrotic chorionic villi and corpus luteum

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Abrupt pruritus and jaundice
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Sudden onset pruritus and jaundice; no prior similar episodes
Medical_Record.Background: History of right hepatectomy and closure of left hepatic duct for living donor liver transplantation 8 years ago; no mention of other PMH, medications, allergies, family or social history

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT: enhancing lesion with eccentric wall thickening of proximal bile duct; MRI and cholangiopancreatography: enhanced wall thickening in common hepatic duct, dilated left proximal intrahepatic duct; Endoscopic ultrasonography: mass-like heterogeneous echogenic lesion (15.6 × 11.4 mm) at hilar level; ERCP: proximal common bile duct dilated up to 9 mm; Biopsy: normal duodenal epithelium preoperatively; Intraoperative findings: firm adhesion to portal vein and duodenal wall, fibrotic mass-like lesion in hilum and proximal common bile duct; Gross specimen: common bile duct dilated up to 2.2 cm, inner surface thickened and fibrotic (2.2 × 1.8 cm); Microscopy: hyperplastic and disorganized nerve fibers, thick collagenous fibrous connective tissue, compressed bile duct, mature lymphoid cells, hemosiderin-laden macrophages; Immunohistochemistry: S-100 positive, Masson-Trichrome stain shows perineurial and epineurial fibrosis; Enlarged periportal lymph nodes with reactive hyperplasia; Liver function tests: total bilirubin 1.5 mg/dL (↑), gamma-glutamyl transferase 258 U/L (↑), alkaline phosphatase 177 U/L (↑), alanine transaminase 49 U/L (↑); Tumor markers: CA 19-9 and CEA within normal range

Diagnosis: Amputation traumatic neuroma of the bile duct

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: High fever and cloudy peritoneal dialysis effluent; 2-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Fever 103°F; abdominal pain; purulent peritoneal dialysis effluent; no improvement after 4 days of vancomycin and imipenem
Medical_Record.Background: End-stage renal disease; continuous ambulatory peritoneal dialysis; type 2 diabetes mellitus for 15 years

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Fever 103°F; abdominal pain; other systemic examinations normal
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Ultrasonography: no abdominal fluid collection; peritoneal dialysis fluid WBC 960/μL; microscopy: pus cells, no bacteria; culture: Gram-positive cocci in tetrads, non-motile, non-spore forming, catalase negative, oxidase negative, PYR negative; identified as Pediococcus pentosaceus; antibiotic sensitivity: resistant to vancomycin, sensitive to ampicillin, amikacin, ciprofloxacin, doxycycline

Diagnosis: Peritonitis caused by vancomycin-resistant Pediococcus pentosaceus

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Unconsciousness; unknown duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Known superior sagittal sinus thrombosis for 8 years; on warfarin 2.5 mg nightly; found unconscious; no head injury, headache, fever, or vomiting; non-compliance with physician follow-up and PT-INR monitoring for 1 year; regular warfarin intake per relative
Medical_Record.Background: Superior sagittal sinus thrombosis; on warfarin; no reported allergies; no surgical history, family, or social history provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Unconscious (Glasgow Coma Scale 3); feeble pulse; blood pressure not recordable; pupils 6 mm dilated, non-reactive to light
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT brain: 24.2 mm hyperdense crescentic subdural hematoma in left fronto-temporo-parieto-occipital region with subfalcine extension and midline shift; PT-INR 9; genotyping: CYP2C9*1/*3 polymorphism, VKORC1 wild-type

Diagnosis: Subdural hematoma due to CYP2C9*3 polymorphism and warfarin therapy

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Refractory lupus nephritis; prolonged duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Severe arthritis; Raynaud's phenomenon; photosensitivity; malar rash; scarring alopecia; relapsing-remitting disease; nephritic syndrome; seizures due to malignant hypertension; persistent proteinuria; severe general symptoms; severe diffuse discoid rash; severe mucocutaneous component; relapsed nephritis
Medical_Record.Background: Diagnosed with SLE in 2011; initial treatment with methylprednisolone, prednisolone, hydroxychloroquine; azathioprine and methotrexate for arthritis; thalidomide for discoid rash; rituximab for disease flares; mycophenolate mofetil for nephritis; immunoglobulin cycles; belimumab; HPV infection identified; leflunomide started; secukinumab initiated; no data on occupation, surgical history, family history, social history, allergies, immunizations, travel

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: No specific vital signs reported; seizures due to malignant hypertension
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: High C-reactive protein; elevated erythrocyte sedimentation rate; complement consumption (C3, C4); anti-dsDNA >400 IU/ml; renal biopsy: class IV lupus nephritis, interstitial inflammatory infiltrate, minimal fibrosis, tubular atrophy <5% cortical extension; direct immunofluorescence: glomerular deposits of C3, C4, C1q, IgA, IgG, IgM; proteinuria; normal glomerular filtration rate (CKD-EPI 115mL/min/1.73m2)

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Painful torticollis; 4 days postoperative
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Onset of painful torticollis on fourth day after adenotonsillectomy; no detected surgical complications; normal neurological examination
Medical_Record.Background: Recent adenotonsillectomy; no reported past medical history; no family or social history; no medication or allergy information

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Painful torticollis; normal neurological examination; cock-robin position
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Anterior-posterior direct cervicography shows cock-robin position; cervical CT shows asymmetric thickening of right parapharyngeal soft tissue and rotator atlantoaxial subluxation

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Right eye pain, injection, tearing; several hours duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Acute onset after accidental exposure to coral reef fluid while cleaning aquarium; immediate irrigation; use of artificial tears every 3–4 hours; worsening lid edema over 24 hours; improvement by day 3; complete resolution by 2 weeks
Medical_Record.Background: No history of contact lens wear; healthy; no significant past medical history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Visual acuity 20/20 both eyes; normal intraocular pressures; upper greater-than-lower lid edema; minimal erythema; no induration; significant inferior bulbar conjunctival epithelial defect; injection; subtle blanching of conjunctival vessels; chemosis; patchy subconjunctival hemorrhage; no corneal epithelial defect; afebrile
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Ocular pH 7.0; conjunctival swabs for bacterial culture and gram stain negative for neutrophils or organisms

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Right sub-mental triangle swelling; 1-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Gradual increase in right sub-mental swelling over 1 year; no additional symptoms reported
Medical_Record.Background: No pathological personal history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Right sub-mental mass detected
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Cervical ultrasound and CT: malignant lesion suspected; Ultrasound-guided fine-needle aspiration biopsy performed; 75 mCi I-131 thyroid scintigraphy: normal uptake, 16% in thyroid; Histopathology: papillary thyroid carcinoma from thyroglossal cyst

Diagnosis: Papillary thyroid carcinoma from thyroglossal cyst

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Road traffic accident; hemodynamic instability
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Acute trauma following road traffic accident; initial hypotension; tachycardia; perisplenic fluid on ultrasound; massive intraperitoneal bleeding on CT
Medical_Record.Background: Previously healthy; no significant past medical history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: GCS E4V4M6; sBP 103–145 mmHg; HR 113–136/min; RR 26–30/min; BT 34.4–36.3°C
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Focused assessment with sonography for trauma: perisplenic echo-free space; Contrast-enhanced CT: grade V liver laceration with massive intraperitoneal contrast extravasation; Postoperative labs: AST 2270 IU/L, ALT 1144 IU/L (day 3); Creatinine 4.78 mg/dL, BUN 86 mg/dL (day 5); Injury Severity Score 34

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Swelling in right palatal region; problems with pronunciation and chewing; 1-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Painless, progressively enlarging mass in right preauricular region; no fever, weight loss, or night sweats
Medical_Record.Background: No palpable lymph nodes in head and neck; no history of autoimmune disorders; hepatitis B, C, HIV negative; chest and abdominopelvic CT, bone marrow biopsy, gastroscopy unremarkable

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Swelling of right parotid gland; 2 x 2.5 cm mass with central ulceration on right hard palate
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Hemoglobin 13 g/dL; leukocyte count 6,240/mm3; platelet 185,000/mm3; normal LDH, beta-2 microglobulin, protein electrophoresis; MRI: 2 x 2.5 cm mass on right hard palate, 2.5 x 3.5 cm mass in right parotid gland; biopsy: subepithelial infiltration of atypical centrocyte-like cells, CD20 and kappa positive, CD5, CD10, CD23, lambda negative; autoimmune screening negative

Diagnosis: Primary B-cell mucosa-associated lymphoid tissue (MALT) lymphoma of the hard palate and parotid gland

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Pus at implant site; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: History of implant placement for lower left mandibular first molar 15 years ago; inflamed peri-implant mucosa; tenderness on palpation; pus discharge around implant; ill-fitting crown
Medical_Record.Background: No significant past medical history; daily vitamin D (5000 I.U); no other medications or allergies mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Inflamed peri-implant mucosa; tenderness on palpation; pus discharge around implant; ill-fitting crown
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Panoramic and intraoral periapical radiographs: crestal and horizontal bone loss around implant; CBCT: bone loss around implant, class II peri-implant defect; bone resorption up to two-thirds of implant; alveolar bone-height measurements: 3, 4.2, 3.6, 4.2 mm (mesial, distal, lingual, buccal); pocket depth 8 mm

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Pain and numbness in right lower jaw; 4-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Pain and swelling in 48 region; extraction 1.5 years ago; subsequent pus discharge and treatment; development of diffuse bony hard swelling in right mandibular ramus region; facial asymmetry; palpable, fixed, tender right submandibular lymph node; intraoral expansion in right ramus region; diffuse erythema distal of 46 to pterygomandibular raphe; tenderness on palpation; sinus opening in alveolar ridge retromolar area; 18 and 48 clinically missing
Medical_Record.Background: No significant medical history; no contributory family history; no contributory habit history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Diffuse bony hard swelling in right mandibular ramus; facial asymmetry; palpable, fixed, tender right submandibular lymph node; intraoral expansion in right ramus region; diffuse erythema; tenderness on palpation; sinus opening in alveolar ridge retromolar area; 18 and 48 clinically missing
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Orthopantomogram: radiolucent osteolytic lesion in right mandibular ramus with irregular, ragged margins; cone beam CT: osteolytic lesion with moth-eaten appearance, destruction of buccal and lingual cortices, thinning of anterior border of ramus, periosteal reaction, sclerosis in surrounding bone; blood investigations: within normal range; incisional biopsy: fibro-cellular stroma with hyperchromatic epithelial tumor cells, cellular and nuclear pleomorphism, palisaded basal columnar cells, squamous and stellate reticulum-like cells, PAS negative; segmental mandibulectomy specimen: irregular solid epithelial islands, keratin pearl formation, degeneration and necrosis, palisading, reverse polarity, subnuclear vacuolization, marked pleomorphism, increased mitosis, abnormal mitotic figures, necrotic bone with neoplastic epithelial islands infiltrating marrow spaces

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Severe, early-onset developmental and epileptic encephalopathy; duration since infancy
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Developmental delay; epileptic seizures; early onset; severe progression
Medical_Record.Background: No significant family history of mutation; de novo GNAO1 Gln52Arg (c.155A > G) heterozygous mutation; no other pathogenic mutations identified

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Whole-exome sequencing: GNAO1 Gln52Arg (c.155A > G) heterozygous mutation; Sanger sequencing confirms mutation; predictive algorithms: likely pathogenic

Diagnosis: Developmental and epileptic encephalopathy due to GNAO1 Gln52Arg mutation

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Diffuse hair loss; 4-day duration after azathioprine dose increase
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Diurnal ptosis and tiredness under pyridostigmine; azathioprine started January 2020; dose increased after 2 weeks; diffuse hair loss 4 days after dose increase; decreased appetite and fatigue; azathioprine discontinued after 19 days; fever and sore throat 17 days after discontinuation; frequent soft/watery stool and worsening dull abdominal pain 20 days after discontinuation; persistent bloody stool and lower abdominal pain after admission
Medical_Record.Background: Diagnosed with myasthenia gravis; treated with pyridostigmine since December 2019; refused prednisolone initially; genetic predisposition to azathioprine intolerance (NUDT15 diplotype *2/*3); no pathogens detected in stool; no iron-deficiency anemia on follow-up; hair returned to previous level after azathioprine discontinuation; switched to cyclosporine after poor response to prednisolone; ptosis improved with cyclosporine

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Respiration 20/min; blood pressure 74/34 mm Hg; pulse rate 89 beats/min; body temperature 35°C; prominent bowel wall edema on sonography
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Pancytopenia; prolonged prothrombin time; impaired renal function; abdominal CT shows ileocolitis and reactive lymphadenopathy; negative viral and autoimmune antibody tests; colonoscopy with biopsy shows large ulcers and polypoid lesions in terminal ileum, cecum, ascending colon, and rectum; pathology shows necrotizing granulomas without caseation or inclusions; stool negative for pathogens

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Unresponsive and gasping state after snakebite; 1-hour duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Snakebite on left foot; developed bilateral severe ptosis 15-20 minutes after bite; rapidly progressive dyspnea; intubated for respiratory distress; improvement after antivenom; on day 6, sudden onset severely blurred and diminished vision, bilateral ptosis, slurred speech
Medical_Record.Background: No significant medical history or comorbidities

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: SpO2 70-80% on high-flow oxygen; other vitals stable; bite marks on left foot; peripheral pulses present in all limbs; no neurologic deficit except visual findings; bilateral ptosis; only light perception in both eyes; swelling and tenderness at bite site
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Whole blood clotting test normal; CT and MRI normal; visual evoked potential shows bilateral axonopathic optic neuropathy with maculopathy; diagnosis of optic neuritis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Weakness, dry cough, shortness of breath; 3-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive weakness; dry cough; shortness of breath; difficulty walking due to back pain; mainly bedbound; bilateral leg swelling; denies chest pain, palpitations, fever, other systemic complaints
Medical_Record.Background: History of compression deformity of L1 vertebra; no history of venous thromboembolism or cancer; no recent prolonged travel; vaccinated against Covid-19 with booster; no other background information provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: SpO2 88% on room air, improved to 94–96% with 2–3 L/min O2; afebrile; BP 93/51 mm Hg initially; sinus tachycardia 120/min; bilateral pitting pedal edema; rest of exam unremarkable
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: EKG: sinus tachycardia, new complete right bundle branch block; chest X-ray: clear lungs; WBC 15.1 K/μL; hemoglobin 14.8 g/dL; platelet 275 K/μL; INR 1.5; normal PTT; BUN 33 mg/dL; creatinine 1.54 mg/dL (baseline 0.8); troponin 0.12 ng/mL; BNP 655 pg/mL; negative Covid-19; venous blood gas: pH 7.36, PaCO2 35, lactic acid 6.2; POCUS: extensive DVT (left common femoral to left popliteal vein, right popliteal vein); multiple large mobile clot-in-transit in right atrium, prolapsing into RV; clot migration into pulmonary vasculature; repeat POCUS: no clot in right atrium or RV, severely dilated hypokinetic RV during CPR

Diagnosis: Acute massive pulmonary embolism due to clot-in-transit

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Relapse of ulcerative pancolitis with severe activity; extraintestinal manifestations
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Severe relapse of ulcerative pancolitis; sacroiliitis; venous thrombosis on leg; ulcerative skin lesion on right breast
Medical_Record.Background: Ulcerative pancolitis; treated with mesalazine; azathioprine and warfarin administered; adalimumab for ankylosing spondylitis; no recurrence after corticosteroid weaning; intestinal disease in remission

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Extensive, deep ulcerative lesion on right breast

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Chest discomfort; acute onset
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Chest discomfort; hypotension; irregular polymorphic ventricular rhythm; seizure-like movement; repeated ventricular arrhythmia; no vomiting or diarrhea
Medical_Record.Background: No family history of sudden cardiac death or genetic disease; not taking other medication; no use of diuretics or laxatives; history of herbal medicine containing licorice for several months for herniated intervertebral disks

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Body temperature 36.7°C; pulse 183 beats/min; breathing 25/min; blood pressure 70/40 mmHg
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: ECG: polymorphic ventricular tachycardia; coronary angiography: almost normal; echocardiography: no structural heart disease; WBC 9,560/mm3; hemoglobin 10.9 g/dL; platelets 232,000/mm3; sodium 138 mmol/L; potassium 2.4 mmol/L; chlorine 105 mmol/L; calcium 9.65 mg/dL; magnesium 2.48 mg/dL; spot urinary K 20.7 mmol/L; transtubular K gradient 4.8; plasma aldosterone 0.6 ng/dL; plasma cortisol 23.8 ug/dL

Diagnosis: Electrical storm due to hypokalemia induced by licorice-containing herbal medicine

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Acute chest pain; 45-day duration post pacemaker implantation
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Acute chest pain exacerbated by deep breathing; initial minimal pericardial effusion; symptoms resolved with ibuprofen; 4-month follow-up showed increased pericardial effusion; suspected RV lead displacement; sudden onset shortness of breath; massive pericardial effusion with impending tamponade
Medical_Record.Background: Familial biventricular hypertrophic cardiomyopathy; dual chamber permanent pacemaker for complete atrioventricular block; RA and RV leads implanted; no other history provided

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Chest X-ray: intracardiac leads in place; Pacemaker interrogation: normal RV and RA lead function; Echocardiography: minimal then aggravated pericardial effusion; Device interrogation: normal R wave amplitude and pacing impedance, increased pacing threshold; Chest CT: RV apex perforation by RV lead; Echocardiography: massive pericardial effusion; Bedside ultrasound-guided pericardiocentesis performed

Diagnosis: Delayed right ventricular lead perforation complicated by cardiac tamponade in biventricular hypertrophic cardiomyopathy

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Nasal obstruction right side; postnasal drip; duration since February 2006
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Nasal obstruction and postnasal drip; progressed after one month to aural fullness, right-sided hearing loss, autophonia; December 2006: odynophagia, dysphagia; 2013: dyspnea at rest, cough, dysphagia
Medical_Record.Background: Nasopharyngeal carcinoma in situ (T1N0M0) diagnosed by incisional biopsy; 35 sessions of 2D radiotherapy (70Gy primary, 30Gy lymphatic drainage); 3 sessions of chemotherapy; treated with amoxicillin-clavulanate, omeprazole, speech therapy; tracheostomy performed; currently awaiting supraglottoplasty; uses tracheostomy and phonatory valve

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Nasofibrolaryngoscopy: tumor mass in rhinopharynx, occlusion of right auditory tube; December 2006: diffuse edema of epiglottis, aryepiglottic folds, arytenoid cartilages, vestibular folds; 2013 videolaryngoscopy: circular supraglottic stenosis (~95% lumen), hypoplasia of epiglottis, altered valleculae anatomy
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Incisional biopsy: nasopharyngeal carcinoma in situ; videolaryngoscopy: supraglottic stenosis; upper digestive endoscopy: no changes; videotracheostomy: normal carina and bronchi, supraglottic ring stenosis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Severe right-sided occipital headache; 1-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Unilateral pulsatile throbbing occipital headache radiating to ipsilateral face; increasing intensity; unresponsive to simple analgesics; mild-to-moderate nausea; infrequent vomiting; no prepregnancy headache
Medical_Record.Background: Dichorionic–diamniotic spontaneous twin pregnancy at 8 weeks gestation; previous uncomplicated term pregnancy; early first-trimester abortion; BMI 21.4 kg/m2; recent contact with COVID-19-infected person; no significant past medical history mentioned; no drug allergies stated; no family history stated; no social history stated; medications: enoxaparin, levetiracetam, acetaminophen, remdesivir, dexamethasone; no immunization or travel history stated

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Afebrile; stable hemodynamic condition; fully conscious; normal neurological examination; no dyspnea; O2 saturation >98%
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Brain MRI: large parenchymal hematoma in right temporal lobe, peripheral white matter edema, 2 mm midline shift; MRV: engorged right transverse and sigmoid dural sinuses, diffuse filling defects compatible with cerebral vein thrombosis; thrombosis in right inferior anastomotic vein (Labbé vein); partial thrombosis in superior sagittal, left transverse and sigmoid sinuses; straight sinus partially obliterated; serial CBC: gradual decrease in WBC and platelet count, peripheral blood smear normal; viral hepatitis tests negative; ultrasound: no organomegaly or lymphadenopathy, no retroplacental hematoma, normal fetal cardiac activity; blood group O-negative; direct and indirect Coombs test negative; Coombs–Wright test negative; nasopharyngeal COVID-19 PCR: initial negative, repeat positive; all inherited and acquired thrombophilia tests negative

Diagnosis: Cerebral vein thrombosis associated with COVID-19 infection in twin pregnancy

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Chronic respiratory disease; 2-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Dry cough; nocturnal fever to 38°C; no improvement with amoxicillin
Medical_Record.Background: No history of mycobacterial infection; no contact with elephant; no significant past medical history mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Unremarkable
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Elevated CRP 34 mg/L; ESR 45 mm/hr; chest X-ray shows diffuse shadow in right apex; tuberculin test negative; bronchial lavage shows small coccobacillary acid-fast organisms; culture on Löwenstein-Jensen medium; molecular identification confirms Mycobacterium elephantis; resistant to rifampicin; susceptible to amikacin, clarithromycin, ciprofloxacin, ethambutol, isoniazid, doxycycline, streptomycin, cefoxitin, sulfamethoxazole, imipenem

Diagnosis: Pulmonary infection due to Mycobacterium elephantis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Influenza-like symptoms; 7-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: General malaise; chills; dry cough; chest pain; shortness of breath; fever up to 39.5°C; symptoms unresponsive to paracetamol or ibuprofen; onset 10 days after experimental intranasal infections with C. abortus in sheep
Medical_Record.Background: No information on past medical history, surgical history, family history, social history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Crackling sounds on lung auscultation
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Chest x-ray: consolidation of lower lobe of left lung (pan-lobar pneumonia); blood tests: non-significant increase in mean corpuscular hemoglobin, slight increase in urea (50.3 mg/dl) and creatinine (1.3 mg/dl), high C-reactive protein (8.9 mg/dl); negative serology for Mycoplasma pneumoniae, Legionella pneumophila, Rickettsia conorii, Chlamydia pneumoniae; positive ELISA for C. abortus IgM and IgG; C. abortus isolated from sputum by cell culture and immunofluorescence; C. abortus DNA detected by PCR and sequencing

Diagnosis: Atypical pneumonia due to Chlamydia abortus

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Chest pain, shortness of breath, bilateral leg swelling with bluish discoloration of left big toe; acute onset
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: History of lupus since 2010; initial symptoms pleuritic chest pain and arthralgia; progression to lupus nephritis stage III by 2016; end-stage renal disease by 2022; non-compliance with medications and peritoneal dialysis; current presentation with chest pain, dyspnea, leg swelling, digital discoloration; progression to ischemic changes and gangrene despite therapy
Medical_Record.Background: Lupus; end-stage renal disease secondary to lupus nephritis; peritoneal dialysis; prior medications: prednisone, hydroxychloroquine, mycophenolate mofetil, calcium, vitamin D; poor medication compliance; no data on occupation, allergies, family or social history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Tender hyperpigmentation on left foot; tender superficial vasculature on right foot; progression to black, ischemic changes and gangrene of feet; right axillary hematoma
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT chest: pulmonary embolism in left upper segmental arteries; echocardiogram: no wall motion abnormalities; CRP 423.6mg/L (elevated); ESR 87mm/hr (elevated); C3 107mg/dL; C4 9mg/dL (low); DNA IgG titer 1:160; lupus anticoagulant positive; aCL IgG negative; aCL IgM 15.3; anti-Beta 2 Glycoprotein IgA 10.42; IgG 4.39; IgM 4.83; CT angiogram lower extremity: no proximal vessel occlusion; punch biopsy left dorsal foot: fibrin thrombi occluding vessels and papillary dermis; biopsy from amputation: extensive atherosclerosis with 60-90% occlusion of arteries; platelets dropped to 79 k/mm then increased to 160 k/mm

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Fever of unknown origin; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Fever; PET/CT shows bilateral adrenal masses; enlarged spleen without increased FDG uptake
Medical_Record.Background: No underlying disease; no additional history provided

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: PET/CT: bilateral adrenal masses, enlarged spleen without increased FDG uptake; Laboratory: anemia, thrombocytopenia, elevated C-reactive protein, elevated lactate dehydrogenase; Adrenal gland biopsy: diffuse large B-cell lymphoma

Diagnosis: PD-L1-expressing extranodal diffuse large B-cell lymphoma, NOS

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Lower back pain; onset early September 2021
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive lower back pain radiating to left posterior thigh; numbness and prickling pain on stepping; severe lower extremity weakness; difficulty in voiding and defecation; loss of independent ambulation
Medical_Record.Background: Achondroplasia; obesity (BMI 31.9 kg/m2); epiphyseal stapling of left distal femur and proximal tibia (2009, 2010) for genu varum; bilateral paratubal cystectomy for mesothelial cysts (2020); acetaminophen 500 mg bid for lower limb pain; no other systemic disease; no assistive device for ambulation prior to 2021; mild lower limb weakness after walking 15 minutes; normal urination and defecation prior to current illness; no information on family history, smoking, drug allergies, immunizations, or travel

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Stable vital signs; bilateral reduced muscle strength (2/5) in lower limbs; normal cranial nerve and speech functions; prompt and symmetric light reflexes; no visual field defect; normal extraocular movements; normal facial sensation and movements; full muscle strength of bilateral sternocleidomastoid muscles; midline tongue protrusion; normal phonation; normal deep tendon reflexes in upper limbs; decreased deep tendon reflexes in lower limbs; negative Babinski sign; impaired pinprick and light-touch sensation below hip level
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Normal liver and kidney function tests; MRI shows syrinx at T6-T8, posterior vertebral scalloping, decreased interpedicular distance, short lumbar pedicles, severe lumbosacral stenosis on axial images

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Involuntary facial movements and phonic tics; 11-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Onset one month after non-commotional cranio-facial trauma from car accident; involuntary stereotyped facial movements (forceful eye closure, grimacing, forced lip closure), phonic tics (deep prolonged sounds, vocalizations); high frequency; socially disabling; required quitting job; increased with attention; no preceding urge or warning signs; unable to voluntarily interrupt tics; poor attention and memory; fear of developing dementia
Medical_Record.Background: No significant pre, peri-, or postnatal history; no family history of tics or movement disorders; difficult socio-financial situation; poor school performance; lives with elderly mother; part-time job without public contact; medications tried: alprazolam, sertraline, risperidone, haloperidol (all ineffective); no allergies mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Intermittent motor tics (blepharospasm-like forced lid closure, grimacing, forced lip closure, noisy suction movements); phonic tics (grunting, vocalizations); neurological exam otherwise unremarkable; tics increased with attention; distractibility observed
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Cerebral CT scan unremarkable

Diagnosis: Adult-Onset Gilles de la Tourette Syndrome

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Progressive exertional dyspnoea; 3-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive shortness of breath on exertion; lower extremity oedema; palpitations; history of large pericardial effusion with prior pericardial window; recurrent symptoms despite medical therapy
Medical_Record.Background: History of Hodgkin's lymphoma (diagnosed 1986; treated with surgery, high-dose mantle radiation, chemotherapy); limited scleroderma; paroxysmal atrial fibrillation; kyphosis; prior pericardial effusion; post-operative atrial fibrillation; medications include amiodarone, colchicine, prednisone, mycophenolate mofetil; no mention of allergies

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: 1+ bilateral lower extremity oedema; normal cardiac auscultation; clear lungs
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Transthoracic echocardiography: normal LV function, reduced RV function, septal flattening, septal bounce, small localized pericardial effusion, pericardial thickening; cardiac MRI: diffusely thickened pericardium with enhancement, exaggerated septal motion; right and left heart catheterization: increased SVC pressures with inspiration, Kussmaul's sign, right atrial W-pattern, RV dip and plateau, LV/RV systolic pressure discordance; CT chest: circumferential nodular pericardial thickening, focal mass-like area; intraoperative findings: thickened anterior pericardium, loculated masses, irregular lobulated epicardial masses; pathology: tumour of epithelioid cells, high-grade sarcoma positive for vimentin, ERG, CD34, negative for calretinin and WT-1; diagnosis consistent with epithelioid angiosarcoma

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Progressive weakness and atrophy of right upper arm; 3-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Initial twinge sensation from posterior thoracic to sacrum on neck flexion; slowly progressive weakness and atrophy of upper arm, especially right shoulder
Medical_Record.Background: No previous disease or trauma; no family history of similar symptoms

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Gross atrophy of right shoulder triceps and biceps; deep tendon reflexes symmetrically normal; sensation to sharp pain, vibration, and light touch intact; no Horner sign, Hoffman sign, or Babinski sign
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Dynamic cervical spine imaging shows segmental instability at C4-5, C5-6; MRI shows atrophic spinal cord and increased signal intensity at C5-6; flexion MRI shows prominent posterior epidural space with engorged epidural venous plexus; no significant pathologic lesions on neutral position MRI

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Incidental right vertebral artery fusiform aneurysm; unknown duration

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Generalized, nonfocal headache and dizziness; several weeks duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Gradual onset headache and dizziness; no visual obscurations, nausea, or vomiting; symptoms improved after initial ED visit; became dyspneic and mildly anxious during endobronchial ultrasound
Medical_Record.Background: 45-pack-year smoking history; history of asthma; family history of hypertension and type 2 diabetes mellitus; no family history of hypercoagulable diseases; no mention of medications or allergies prior to presentation

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Brain MRI: innumerable bilateral lesions with peripheral hyperdensity (suspicious for metastases with internal hemorrhage); Chest CT: 2.2-cm right upper lobe spiculated mass, extensive hilar lymphadenopathy; Immunohistochemistry: TTF-1 positive adenocarcinoma, PD-L1 30%; Gene amplification: KRAS G12C and EIF1AZ mutations; CT angiogram: 2.4 x 1.1 x 1.1 cm thrombus in proximal aortic arch, no pulmonary emboli; Hypercoagulable workup negative; Transthoracic echocardiogram: LVEF 65%, no LV thrombus, no septal defects; Lower extremity ultrasound: negative for DVT; Respiratory pathogen panel negative

Diagnosis: In situ ascending aortic thrombus in metastatic lung adenocarcinoma

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Persistent fever; left-sided weakness; 15-day duration; slurring of speech; profound visual loss in left eye

Medical_Record.Background: Type 2 diabetes mellitus; systemic hypertension; no history of COVID-19 infection; vaccinated (two doses); recent cerebrovascular accident; medications: clopidogrel, aspirin, telmisartan, metoprolol succinate, prazosin, atorvastatin, cilnidipine, glimepiride; no reported drug allergies

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Conscious and oriented; pulse 60 beats/minute; blood pressure 130/80 mmHg; respiratory rate 18 breaths/minute; cardiovascular and respiratory systems normal; left-sided ataxic hemiparesis; significant reduction of power in upper and lower limbs; dysarthria
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: MRI brain: fresh non-hemorrhagic infarct in left thalamocapsular and left parieto-occipital regions; chronic microhemorrhages bilaterally; carotid bulb flattening; irregular narrowing of internal carotid artery bilaterally and M1 branch of left middle cerebral artery; PET/CT: abnormal FDG uptake in brain; diffuse low-grade uptake and circumferential wall thickening in aorta and major arteries; suggestive of active large-vessel vasculitis; elevated leucocyte count; elevated C-reactive protein; elevated erythrocyte sedimentation rate; negative autoimmune antibodies; mildly deranged renal and hepatic functions; ophthalmology: visual acuity 6/9 right eye, perception of light left eye; relative afferent pupillary defect left eye; fundus: multiple hemorrhages, cotton-wool spots, retinal thickening, hard exudate; OCTA: superficial capillary plexus loss; left eye: subretinal whitish-yellowish mass, retinal hemorrhages; B-scan: subretinal mass, choroidal breakthrough; positive serum galactomannan

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Left renal tumor; duration not specified

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Orthostatic dizziness and disorientation; duration not stated
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Episodes of dizziness and disorientation on standing; sometimes results in loss of balance and falls; no chest pain; no complete loss of consciousness

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: VEEG: epileptiform interictal abnormalities over right central region; focal seizures of right central onset; repeat VEEG: multifocal interictal epileptiform abnormalities, frequent focal seizures with migrating character; 3T MRI brain: no structural lesions; next-generation sequencing: heterozygous missense variation in exon 24 of KCNT1 gene (p. Ala934Thr); serial ECG: QTc within accepted limits

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Planned right lower lobectomy for suspected lung malignancy

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Generalized weakness, subjective fevers, lower extremity abscesses, occasional chest pain; duration not specified

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Nipple discharge from right breast; 3-month duration
