Medical_Record.Background: History of left invasive ductal carcinoma (triple negative, grade 3, Ki-67 70%, pT1bN0M0, stage IA) treated 2 years prior with lumpectomy, sentinel lymph node biopsy, adjuvant anthracycline/taxane chemotherapy, and radiotherapy; no germline gene variants detected; no evidence of metastases on imaging

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Painless, mobile, firm 2.5-cm lump in lower outer quadrant of left breast; no axillary lymphadenopathy; contralateral breast normal
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Mammography and ultrasonography: irregular, bulky mass with lobulated border in lateral left breast; MRI: 3-cm mass with high peripheral signal; core needle biopsy: spindle-cell malignant tumor with osteoid matrix and necrosis; excisional biopsy: nodular lesion 20 mm, pleomorphic spindle and oval cells, high mitotic index, osteoid matrix, necrosis; IHC: AE1/AE3 (-), CD56 (focal+), SATB (+), MDM2 (+), SMA (partial+), Ki-67 (80%), CK7 (-), ER (-), PR (-), Her2 (0), CD34 (-), S-100 (-); NGS: CN gains of FGFR1, CN loss of CDKN2A and TSC2, somatic mutations in PIK3CA, PTEN, TP53, TSC2; CT and 18F-FDG PET/CT: no metastases, no primary bone osteosarcoma

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Abnormality on chest CT; detected during routine health screening
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: No symptoms reported; abnormal chest CT led to further evaluation
Medical_Record.Background: History of diabetes mellitus and atrial fibrillation; no abnormal findings on physical examination; no additional background information provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Unremarkable
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Chest CT: irregular emphysematous cyst and infiltrative shadow (60 mm) in right upper lobe; no hilar or mediastinal lymphadenopathy; tumor biomarker: elevated carcinoembryonic antigen (7.3 ng/ml); histology: lung adenocarcinoma (pT1cN0M0, stage IA3); postoperative pleural fluid: milky appearance, triglyceride 457 mg/dl

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Chest pain; one-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Chest pain for one month; ovoid soft tissue mass in left posterior costophrenic angle found on CT; mass resected under VATS; initial diagnosis neurogenic tumor; final pathology bronchogenic cyst; uneventful operative course; chest tube inserted; two episodes of hypotension on second postoperative day; sudden hemorrhagic shock and cardiac arrest with gush of blood from chest tube; emergent thoracotomy performed
Medical_Record.Background: No history of surgery or trauma; family history unremarkable

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Hypotension on second postoperative day; hemorrhagic shock; cardiac arrest; pericardial distension by accumulated blood
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Thoracic CT: ovoid soft tissue mass (4.3 x 2.6 x 5.8 cm) in left posterior costophrenic angle; intraoperative findings: mass closely located to diaphragm; final pathology: bronchogenic cyst; intraoperative finding: 3 mm hole on pericardium; bleeding from injured obtuse marginal artery of left coronary artery

Diagnosis: Delayed bleeding of coronary artery after thoracoscopic intradiaphragmatic bronchogenic cyst resection

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Painless progressive decrease in vision in both eyes; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive decrease in vision; preoperative evaluation showed cataract and poorly dilating iris in both eyes
Medical_Record.Background: Hypertension on oral amlodipine; history of depression on oral imipramine (25 mg once daily) for 1 year, discontinued 2 months prior; no surgical history, family history, social history, allergies, immunizations, or travel history mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Preoperative pupil dilation to 5.5 mm; poorly dilating iris

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Systolic murmur; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: No exertion intolerance; no chest pain; no palpitations; no dyspnea; no syncope; no presyncope; murmur detected during school examination
Medical_Record.Background: No significant PMH; no history of myocardial infarction, arrhythmias, or stroke; family history positive for hypertension in maternal grandparents; no family history of congenital heart disease or sudden death in young adults; no medications; no drug allergies

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Regular rhythm; normal S1 and S2; grade 2/6 continuous murmur at apex; no S3, S4, or click; 2+ pulses bilaterally in upper and lower extremities
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: ECG: normal sinus rhythm, poor precordial R-wave, no conduction or repolarization abnormalities; chest radiography: normal heart silhouette, prominent localized bulge at left ventricular apex; echocardiogram: normal cardiac connections, normal left ventricular size and function, diverticulum 4.5 x 4.3 cm at inferoapical/apical-lateral walls of left ventricle, prominent trabeculation, muscle thickening during systole, no thrombus; aortic valve bicuspid, no hemodynamic disturbances; right ventricle smaller, normal contractility; Holter: scant supraventricular extrasystoles, rare ventricular extrasystoles in pairs

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: COPD exacerbation; second episode in two weeks
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Dyspnea on exertion for months; 8 kg weight loss in less than a month; admitted to ICU for COPD exacerbation; required orotracheal intubation, mechanical ventilation, antibiotics; another exacerbation with fever and productive cough after transfer to internal medicine unit; multiple seborrheic keratoses appeared over previous four months
Medical_Record.Background: Heavy smoker (120 pack-years); no other known comorbidities

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Multiple seborrheic keratoses on back of hands, elbows, trunk; lesions asymptomatic
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Thorax CT-scan negative for malignancy; upper GI endoscopy negative; colonoscopy: four sessile polyps (one tubulovillous adenoma with high-grade dysplasia, three tubular adenomas with high-grade dysplasia); blood analysis negative for malignancy; abdomen CT-scan: irregular-shaped vegetation on bladder floor (22 × 18 × 16 mm), no adipose tissue invasion; cystoscopy and transurethral resection; histopathology: noninvasive low grade papillary urothelial carcinoma; control cystoscopy: no residual mass

Diagnosis: Noninvasive low grade papillary urothelial carcinoma

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Intraoral swelling on left hard palate; 2-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Gradually increasing size; discomfort; no pain; no fever; no bleeding; no pus discharge
Medical_Record.Background: No relevant medical, dental, family, or habit history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Ovoid, solitary, well-defined swelling; regular borders; 3-4 cm diameter; overlying mucosa intact; no ulceration; non-tender; soft; non-fluctuant; no lymphadenopathy
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT scan: ill-defined soft tissue density lesion (1.7 x 1.6 x 1.2 cm) involving left hard palate; scalloping and thinning of bone; no cystic lesion; CBCT: soft tissue shadow covering half of palate; thinning of palatal cortex; hypodense shadow suggestive of salivary gland lesion; histopathology: cystic spaces with cholesterol-cleft nests, glandular mucinous cells, intermediate cells, squamous epithelium, infiltrative tumor nests, no perineural invasion, no high-grade nuclear anaplasia, no prominent mitotic activity

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Nausea, emesis, abdominal bloating; 3-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Persistent nausea, vomiting, abdominal bloating; onset 3 days prior to admission; developed cough and hemoptysis on night of admission; subsequent dyspnea and respiratory failure
Medical_Record.Background: History of uremia for 13 years; kidney transplantation 2 months prior; post-transplant immunosuppression with prednisone, tacrolimus, mycophenolate mofetil; no PJP prophylaxis; travel to Guangdong in February 2021; transient eosinophilia in April 2021; no additional medical, surgical, or family history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Stable vital signs on admission; coarse breath sounds in both lungs; slight tenderness in upper left abdomen; 7–8 bowel sounds per minute; no other positive signs; later: oxygen saturation 70–85% on 100% FiO2, heart rate 95–110 bpm, systolic BP 80–100 mmHg, diastolic BP 50–70 mmHg on vasopressors
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CBC: WBC 5.34×10^9/L, hemoglobin 91→57 g/L, lymphocytes 0.18×10^9/L, eosinophils 0.29×10^9/L; procalcitonin 0.63 ng/mL; serum creatinine 283.4 μmol/L; abdominal X-ray: partial intestinal gas accumulation; chest CT: widespread nodular opacities, patchy increased density in both lungs; ABG: pH 7.35, PaO2 71 mmHg, PCO2 29 mmHg, oxygenation index 192→65; sputum mNGS: Strongyloides stercoralis (271,732 reads), Escherichia coli, Klebsiella pneumoniae; sputum smear: Strongyloides stercoralis; bronchoscopy: large amount of bloody secretions, blood clot in right lower lobe bronchus

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Intermittent rectal bleeding; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Intermittent rectal bleeding; no weight loss; no altered bowel habits
Medical_Record.Background: History of hyperplastic polyps (7 years prior); family history of colorectal cancer (father, paternal aunt in 60s, maternal uncle in 40s); 30-pack-year smoking history; cluster headaches; no other medical or surgical history; no regular medications

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Colonoscopy: multiple polyps (12 total), serrated/hyperplastic appearance, 4-10 mm, sessile, removed via cold snare; caecal hard submucosal lesion (10x10 mm), two smaller yellow submucosal lesions (lipomatous); deep biopsies of caecal lesion normal; other polyps hyperplastic; CT abdomen/pelvis: no metastasis or advanced local spread; serum serotonin, chromogranin A, 24-h urinary 5-HIAA: normal; intraoperative: caecal polyps, firm nodules; histopathology: five firm nodules in caecum, seven polyps in ascending colon; eight lesions in caecum/ascending colon were granular cell tumours (GCTs), 1-7 mm, submucosal, PAS-positive granular cytoplasm, S-100 and inhibin positive; 24 lymph nodes: no abnormality; spindling in some tumours; two hyperplastic polyps and submucosal lipoma

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Redness and swelling in left eye; 2-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Bilateral diminished vision, mainly left eye, over 1 month; mild right upper quadrant pain; jaundice; unintentional weight loss (22 kg in 3 months); pruritus; dark-colored urine; no ocular trauma
Medical_Record.Background: History of heavy alcohol intake (3–4 drinks/day for 4 years); alcoholic liver cirrhosis (Child–Pugh C/MELD 22); portal hypertension; esophageal varices grade 2; no mention of medications, allergies, family history, or occupation

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CBC: WBC 10.3 × 10^3/μL, RBC 3.5 × 10^6/μL, hemoglobin 11.2 g/dl, platelets 225 × 10^3/μL; creatinine 64 μmol/L; sodium 131 mmol/L; potassium 4.4 mmol/L; magnesium 0.74 mmol/L; corrected calcium 2.2 mmol/L; ESR 95 mm/hr; CRP 92 mg/L; total bilirubin 132 μmol/L; alkaline phosphatase 151 U/L; ALT 33 U/L; albumin 28.7 g/L; lactic acid 1.8 mmol/L. CT brain/orbits: two ring-enhancing lesions in left frontal lobe, left orbital endophthalmitis. MRI: supra- and infratentorial brain abscesses, left eye endophthalmitis with subretinal abscess. MRCP: cirrhotic liver, portal hypertension, no focal lesions. Chest CT: multiple small bilateral cystic and cavitary lung lesions. Blood/bronchoalveolar lavage cultures, AFB, QuantiFERON TB, HIV, syphilis serology negative. Ophthalmic exam: subretinal abscess in right eye. Microbiology: modified ZN stain positive, partial AFB positive, culture confirmed Nocardia farcinica. Histopathology: dense histiocytic and neutrophilic infiltrates, abscess. Special stains negative except partial AFB positive. Follow-up MRI: regression of brain lesions. Follow-up chest CT: progression of bilateral cavitary lung lesions, pneumomediastinum. Developed acute pancreatitis, acute kidney injury, septic shock, cardiac arrest.

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Sudden onset headache
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Acute headache; brain imaging shows acute cerebral infarction; electrocardiography shows atrial fibrillation; persistent palpitation and chest discomfort before operation
Medical_Record.Background: No intracardiac thrombus; normal valvular function; left atrial dimension 32.7 mm (parasternal long axis), 38.6 mm (apical four-chamber); left ventricular ejection fraction 86%; amiodarone and coumadine administered for five months; no mention of occupation, allergies, family or social history

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Brain imaging: acute cerebral infarction; electrocardiography: atrial fibrillation; echocardiography: left atrial dimension 32.7 mm and 38.6 mm, left ventricular ejection fraction 86%, no intracardiac thrombus, normal valvular function; intraoperative transesophageal echocardiography: no intracardiac thrombus

Medical_Record.Demographics: 45-year-old male; college graduate; rental income; higher socioeconomic class
Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Tremors, sleep disturbances, lack of focus, tingling and numbness in lower limbs; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Persistent use of anti-tuberculosis therapy drugs for 20 years; belief that discontinuation causes cough, indigestion, epigastric discomfort, loose stools; obsessions with seeking and using ATT drugs
Medical_Record.Background: History of pulmonary tuberculosis in 2003; no smoking or alcohol use; no prior psychiatric or family psychiatric history; no head trauma or drug abuse; no reported allergies; elevated fasting blood sugar (250 mg/dL) and HbA1C (9); no reported orange-coloured urine or blurred vision

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: General and systemic examinations normal; no neurological impairment
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Normal blood count, electrolytes, liver and kidney function; fasting blood sugar 250 mg/dL; HbA1C 9; radiological investigations planned

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Fever and abdominal distension; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Fever; abdominal distension; CT scan shows 6.5 cm abdominal lymph node mass with peritoneal infiltration; progressive leg weakness; sudden urinary retention; saddle sensory deficit
Medical_Record.Background: HIV-1 infection; CD4+ T cell count 55/μl at diagnosis; HIV-RNA 232,000/ml; positive anti-Toxoplasma IgG; chemotherapy for Burkitt lymphoma (Magrath protocol: CODOX-M/IVAC, Rituximab); cART with emtricitabine/tenofovir/lopinavir; prophylaxis for Toxoplasmosis/Pneumocystis jiroveci pneumonia/Mycobacterium Avium Complex with trimethoprim/sulfamethoxazole and azithromycin; G-CSF administration; cat ownership

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Absent ankle reflexes; reduced lower limb strength (3/5); saddle sensory deficit
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT scan: abdominal lymph node mass; lymph node biopsy: Burkitt lymphoma; CD4+ T cell count 55/μl at diagnosis, 270/μl at relapse; HIV-RNA undetectable at relapse; MRI spine: focal conus medullaris lesion, cauda equina nerve roots involvement, T2 hyperintense, contrast-enhancing; MRI brain: deep right frontal lesion (0.5 cm), similar signal alterations; CSF: increased protein (199 mg/dl), increased cells (56/mm3), CD19+ B lymphocytes without light chain restriction; PCR for Mycobacterium tuberculosis, EBV, CMV negative; Cryptococcus antigen negative; total body CT: no systemic lymphoma relapse; open biopsy of conus medullaris lesion: numerous Toxoplasma tachyzoites with inflammatory cells; MRI after treatment: disappearance of lesions

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Refractory metastatic colorectal cancer; ongoing disease progression
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Initial diagnosis of stage IIIB rectal adenocarcinoma in 2012; progression to stage IV with liver metastases and peritoneal carcinomatosis in December 2016; multiple lines of chemotherapy and local therapies; persistent disease progression; intermittent GI bleeding; weight loss; nausea; anorexia; neutropenia
Medical_Record.Background: KRAS G13D mutation; wild-type BRAF; prior chemoradiotherapy and abdominoperineal resection; no active GI bleeder identified; enrolled in phase IV clinical trial; multiple regimens including bevacizumab, irinotecan, S-1, oxaliplatin, HDFL; local radiotherapy; Yttrium-90 radioembolization; trans-arterial chemoembolization; trifluridine/tipiracil therapy; no significant weight loss at last follow-up; good quality of life; no information on occupation, family history, social history, allergies, immunizations, or travel

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT scans showing liver metastases and peritoneal carcinomatosis; Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumor version 1.1; Bremstrahlung scan; enteroscopy (no active bleeder); grade 2-3 neutropenia; grade 2 nausea and anorexia; stable disease on latest CT scan

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Left testicular mass; unknown duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Left testicular mass; no other symptoms reported
Medical_Record.Background: History of asthma; no other past medical history; no information on occupation, family history, social history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT: enlarged para-aortic lymph nodes; retroperitoneal tumor (45 mm); Serum LDH 317 IU/L (elevated); β-HCG 0.5 ng/mL (elevated); AFP 1 ng/mL (normal); Pathology: pure seminoma; TNM: pT1N1M1aS1; LDH increased transiently after G-CSF during chemotherapy; LDH isoenzymes: increased LDH-3 and LDH-4 after G-CSF; CT after chemotherapy: resolution of lymph node swelling, reduction of retroperitoneal mass; LDH normalized after chemotherapy

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Rapidly expanding, painful pretibial hematoma in right leg; sudden onset on day of admission
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Minor trauma to right leg 1 month prior; initial limited superficial hematoma; sudden expansion of hematoma on day of admission, extending to ankle and calf; severe pain; inability to bear weight
Medical_Record.Background: Paroxysmal atrial fibrillation on fluindione (anticoagulation) for 3 years; sarcoidosis treated with prednisone for over 10 years; chronic respiratory insufficiency on long-term oxygen therapy; osteoporosis; hypothyroidism; daily medications: bosentan, furosemide, levothyroxine sodium, fluticasone propionate/salmeterol inhalation, potassium chloride, estradiol patches; former smoker; no current smoking

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: BMI 20.6 kg/m2; weight 61 kg; blood pressure 147/96 mmHg; heart rate 101 bpm; temperature 36.5°C; severe pain (NRS 8–9); limited palpation of pedis and posterior tibial pulses; senile purpura, atrophy, large lacerations, superficial hematomas on forearms; no erysipelas; no weakness or paraesthesia
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: WBC 12.1 x10^9/L (neutrophils 10.3 x10^9/L); platelets 366 x10^9/L; hemoglobin 13.4 g/dL (admission), 8.4 g/dL (post-op); hematocrit 42.4% (admission), 27.1% (post-op); CRP 7.5 mg/L; creatinine normal; INR 3.15; X-ray: no bone fracture; Doppler US: no DVT, well-defined hypo/heterogeneous mass between skin and muscle fascia; intraoperative: bulky hematoma (15 x 20 cm, 5–6 cm thick) between muscle fascia and hypodermis; intraoperative samples: RBCs, no WBC or germs, sterile culture

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Progressive left shoulder and arm pain with paresthesia; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive left shoulder and arm pain; paresthesia; no other neurological symptoms
Medical_Record.Background: History of papillary thyroid carcinoma with cervical lymph node metastasis; total thyroidectomy with lymph node dissection performed few months earlier; no medication, allergy, family, social, or other contextual data provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Few enlarged cervical lymph nodes; neurological examination normal; intact sensory and motor functions in upper and lower limbs
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Laboratory tests normal; low serum thyroglobulin; CT and MRI: left paraspinal mass centered at left C6 vertebral body (C4–C7), large extra-osseous soft tissue component, multiple enlarged mediastinal lymph nodes, lung nodules, lytic bone lesions; endoscopic ultrasound-guided FNA of paratracheal and subcarinal lymph nodes: scattered granulomas, no malignancy; excisional biopsy of lung nodule: sheets of epithelioid to spindle cells, moderate eosinophilic cytoplasm, irregular vesicular nuclei, non-necrotizing granulomas, tumor necrosis, subset with cleared cytoplasm; immunohistochemistry: positive for pankeratin, CK19, EMA; negative for TTF-1, PAX8, thyroglobulin, P63, CK5/6, S100, CD34; INI-1 loss in tumor cells; brachyury positive

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Bilateral lower limb weakness; 2-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Initial left lower limb weakness; progression to bilateral lower limb weakness; inability to walk; difficulty sitting; disturbed gait; no vomiting, loose stools, fever, cough, seizures, trauma, or injury
Medical_Record.Background: No significant past medical, surgical, or family history; fully immunized; father with travel history; no known COVID-19 exposure or infection; no COVID-19 vaccination

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Temp 36.7°C; heart rate 101 bpm; respiratory rate 28/min; blood pressure 100/60 mmHg; oxygen saturation 99% on room air; conscious and cooperative; cranial nerves normal; muscle strength 4/5 upper limbs, 2/5 lower limbs; absent deep tendon reflexes in lower limbs; normal muscle tone in upper limbs; intact pain, temperature, and fine touch sensations
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Nerve conduction study day 1 normal; nerve conduction study day 7: prolonged latencies, reduced compound muscle action potential, conduction block in bilateral median and left ulnar nerve, normal conduction velocity, normal sensory conduction, demyelinating neuropathy; CSF analysis: albuminocytologic dissociation, negative AFB and Gram stain; chest X-ray normal; SARS-CoV-2 rapid antigen and RT-PCR negative; SARS-CoV-2 IgG antibodies positive (high titer 5.73)

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: High-grade fevers, weight loss, diarrhoea, joint pain; 3-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Initial symptoms of fever, weight loss, diarrhoea, joint pain; swollen and reddened major joints; initial suspicion of Crohn's disease; prednisone started with improvement; relapse of diarrhoea, malaise, weight loss several months later; anemia detected; duodenal biopsy showed PAS-positive particles; diagnosis of Whipple disease; treated with trimetoprime-sulfametoxasole; diarrhoea subsided; 1.5 years later, lower limb oedema, weakness, anorexia; nephritic proteinuria, increased creatinine, iron deficiency anemia, decreased GFR; kidney biopsy showed secondary amyloidosis; further deterioration with bloody diarrhoea, bilious vomiting, malnutrition, anemia, intradialysis hypotension; progressive renal failure requiring replacement therapy; severe exacerbation of Whipple disease; improvement after ceftriaxone and parenteral nutrition; pharmacological nephrectomy performed; ongoing renal replacement therapy
Medical_Record.Background: No mention of past medical history, surgical history, family or social history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Swollen and reddened major joints; poor general condition; orthostatic hypotension 60/0 mm Hg; blood pressure 80/50 mm Hg recumbent; heart rate 64/min; body temperature 36.6°C; BMI 20; muscular atrophy; malnutrition
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Initial labs unremarkable except hemoglobin 10 g/dL; duodenal biopsy PAS-positive; proteinuria 4-6 g/day; creatinine 1.2 mg/dL rising to 2.7 mg/dL; ESR 115 mm; GFR 52 ml/min; urea 42 mg/dL rising to 170 mg/dL; kidney biopsy: secondary amyloidosis; CT: enlarged mesenteric and retroperitoneal lymph nodes; hemoglobin 8.5 g/dL; hematocrit 25%; RBC 2.8 × 10^6/μL; WBC 5.67 × 10^3/μL; lymphocytes 16%; serum total protein 3.1 g/dL; albumin 1.6 g/dL; CRP 43 mg/dL; ferritin 1839 ng/mL; CD8 deficiency; abnormal CD4/CD8 ratio; decreased IgA, IgM, IgG; elevated IgE; reduced FT3, testosterone; normal TSH, cortisol, prolactin, fasting insulin; urine protein 2.9 g/dL; upper endoscopy: severe duodenal inflammation, diffuse erosions, fistula; biopsy: blood extravasation, PAS-positive macrophages; follow-up CT: reduced lymph nodes

Diagnosis: Renal amyloidosis secondary to Whipple disease

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Suspected enlarged cisterna magna; 21-week gestation
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: First trimester aneuploidy screening at 11+4 weeks; normal nuchal translucency; low risk for trisomy 21; at 21 weeks, ultrasound showed connection between cisterna magna and 4th ventricle; rotated cerebellar vermis with normal biometry; persistent Blake's pouch cyst diagnosed; pregnancy concluded uneventfully; neonate with normal neurological findings at birth; regular psychomotor development at one month
Medical_Record.Background: Gravida 3, Para 1; no additional medical, surgical, family, or social history provided; no medication or allergy information

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Ultrasound: enlarged intracranial translucency (IT 3 mm, >95th percentile), thin brainstem, BS/BSOB ratio 0.4 (<5th percentile), CM diameter 2.2 mm (5th percentile), BS diameter 2.2 mm (95th percentile); MRI confirmed persistent Blake's pouch cyst; neonatal transfontanellar ultrasound confirmed prenatal diagnosis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Lower extremity weakness and pain; 1-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progression from subtle paraparesis to dense lower-extremity predominant quadriparesis within one week; onset two days after second dose of Moderna SARS-CoV-2 vaccine
Medical_Record.Background: Atrial fibrillation; diabetes mellitus type 2; aortic stenosis; ischemic stroke with no residual deficits; no mention of occupation, medications, allergies, family or social history

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CSF analysis: albuminocytological dissociation (WBC < 1 cells/μL, protein 129 mg/dL); negative CSF immunological studies (protein electrophoresis, gram stain, glucose, viral PCR panel, paraneoplastic antibody evaluation); negative immunoserologies (thyroid function tests, anti-ganglioside antibodies); electromyography and nerve conduction studies: low amplitude right peroneal, tibial, and ulnar motor evoked responses with normal distal latencies, segmental conduction velocities, and sensory responses

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Asymptomatic brownish lesion over left lower eyelid; 6-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Brownish lesion appeared; after 2 months, loss of few eyelashes; for 1 month, surrounding skin and eyelashes turned whitish
Medical_Record.Background: No family history of similar lesions or autoimmune conditions; no impaired vision; no depigmented lesions elsewhere; rest of cutaneous and systemic examination normal

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Single brownish-black papule (0.5 cm × 0.5 cm) over left lower eyelid; depigmentation of surrounding skin (0.5 cm) with leukotrichia; normal visual acuity
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Dermatoscopy: bluish pepper-like granules, globules, surrounding depigmentation, leukotrichia

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Right-sided chest pain; 1-day duration, aggravated for 1 hour
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Obvious right-sided chest pain radiating to ipsilateral shoulder; persistent chest tightness; worse on deep inspiration and movement; relieved by leaning forward or lying down; associated dry cough; no hemoptysis; no trauma, injury, dyspnea, or palpitations; similar episode 4 years prior with spontaneous resolution
Medical_Record.Background: No significant past medical history; no prior hospital admissions; no history of hypertension, heart disease, microcirculation disturbance, peripheral neuropathy, diabetes, immunodeficiency, malignancy, leukemia, corticosteroid use, liver cirrhosis, renal failure, urinary tract infection, hemodialysis, tuberculosis, hepatitis, AIDS, trauma, blood transfusion, surgery, or serious events; no epidemic area residence; no toxin or radioactive exposure; no personal or family history of bleeding diathesis; 10-year history of smoking 8–10 cigarettes/day; no drug allergies

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Awake and alert; mild to moderate painful distress; respiratory rate 22–26 breaths/min; oxygen saturation 97%; pulse 96 beats/min; blood pressure 115/74 mmHg; temperature 36.7°C; slight tenderness along right posterolateral chest wall (eighth to tenth ribs); normal breath sounds and percussion; mild tracheal deviation; decreased air entry on right side
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Electrocardiogram: sinus rhythm, normal axis; chest X-ray: right-sided primary spontaneous pneumothorax (~30%) with small pleural effusion; chest tube drainage: initial 50 mL light red pleural effusion, then 420 mL blood in 15 minutes, then 750 mL blood in 4 hours; hemoglobin dropped from 12.6 g/dL to 9.2 g/dL; prolonged prothrombin time (19 seconds); bedside supine chest X-ray: findings consistent with primary spontaneous hemopneumothorax and tension pneumothorax; intraoperative findings: 800 mL blood and clots, collapsed right lung, apical bullae, bleeding adhesion at subclavian artery region; histopathology: bullous and string-like tissues rich in blood vessels, granulomatous

Diagnosis: Primary spontaneous hemopneumothorax with atypical tension pneumothorax

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Microscopic hematuria and proteinuria; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Microscopic hematuria and proteinuria detected at annual checkup; referred for further examination; initial examination normal; skin erythema on trunk and extremities treated in dermatology clinic; history of blisters with severe itching 20 years ago; diagnosed as dermatitis herpetiformis by skin biopsy; treated with dapsone; recurrence of blisters 7 years later; responded to dapsone; recent accidental discontinuation of dapsone led to skin blisters; lesions diminished after resuming dapsone
Medical_Record.Background: No significant past medical history reported; no mention of surgical history, family history, social history, medications (except dapsone and losartan), allergies, immunizations, or travel history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Blood pressure 138/76 mm Hg; pulse rate 66 bpm; well-developed and well-nourished; skin tanned well; no vesicles
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Urinalysis: 2+ protein, 1+ occult blood, negative for sugar; urinary sediment: 10–19 RBCs/HPF; urinary protein-to-creatinine ratio 1.2 g/gCr; serum urea nitrogen 12.1 mg/dL; creatinine 0.68 mg/dL; uric acid 7.5 mg/dL; eGFR 99.2 mL/min/1.73 m2; hematologic, liver function, cholesterol, serological tests normal; serology negative for syphilis, hepatitis B, hepatitis C; immunoelectrophoresis: normal IgG, IgA, IgM; negative for ANA, anti-DNA, PR3-ANCA, MPO-ANCA, anti-GBM; complement C3 and C4 normal; chest and abdominal X-ray and CT: no malignancy; renal biopsy: 3 cores, 30 glomeruli, 3 globally sclerosed, focal tubular atrophy, interstitial fibrosis, moderate mesangial widening, thickened capillary walls, lobular accentuation, segmental nodular formation, double contours in capillary loops; immunofluorescence: strong IgG, C3, C1q in glomerular capillary walls and mesangial areas; weak/negative IgA, IgM, fibrinogen; electron microscopy: effaced foot processes, massive electron-dense deposits in mesangial, basement membrane, subendothelial, subepithelial areas; segmental GBM doubling; immunohistochemistry: IgG with both kappa and lambda positive; HLA-DQB1: 06:02 and 06:04; negative anti-tTG IgA and anti-EMA; skin biopsy: blister localized to epidermis with edema

Diagnosis: MPGN Type 3 associated with pemphigus herpetiformis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Episodes of memory loss and aphasia following migraine headaches; one-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Self-limiting memory loss and aphasia after migraines; persistent symptoms; MRI brain revealed non-hemorrhagic infarct; reported fatigue and dyspnea on exertion; denied chest pain, leg swelling, lightheadedness, dizziness, syncope, fever, chills, weight loss, sensory or motor loss
Medical_Record.Background: History of essential hypertension, migraine headaches, gastroesophageal reflux disease due to eosinophilic esophagitis, generalized anxiety disorder; occasional alcohol use; no tobacco or illicit drug use; family history of diabetes mellitus, stroke, coronary artery disease, brain angiomas

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Right-sided facial droop; diastolic murmur near apex; hypotension (BP 88/56 mm Hg); heart rate 92 beats/min; respiratory rate 16 breaths/min
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: MRI brain: non-hemorrhagic infarct in right superior parietal cortex, old left cerebellar infarct; EKG: tachycardia, low voltage QRS complexes; Echocardiogram: 5 cm mass in left atrium attached to atrial wall and mitral valve, partial prolapse into left ventricle, moderate left atrial enlargement, elevated pulmonary artery pressures, ejection fraction >60%; Pathology: malignant spindle cells, necrosis, mitotic figures, FNCLCC grade 3/3, CD31 positive, weakly positive pan-cytokeratin; PET scan: reactive changes only; Repeat MRI brain: metastatic lesions; Restaging scans: negative for recurrence or metastasis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Relapse of aggressive lymphoma; 7-month duration after CAR T-cell therapy
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Primary mediastinal B cell lymphoma stage IIA; mediastinal tumor mass; cervical lymph-node involvement; refractory to R-CHOEP and R-DHAP; CAR T-cell therapy administered; initial complete metabolic remission; relapse in multiple lymph node sites and left upper abdomen; no bone marrow infiltration
Medical_Record.Background: No surgical history stated; no family history stated; no social history stated; medications include R-CHOEP, R-DHAP, CAR T-cells, Pola-BR, busulfan, fludarabine, cyclophosphamide; no allergies stated; immunosuppression discontinued after alloHSCT; severe hypogammaglobulinemia

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: No signs of acute GvHD, VOD, or SOS; moderately decreased CD3+ CD4+ counts (344/μl); no CD19+ cells
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Immunohistochemistry: CD23, bcl-2, FOXP1 positive; CD138, CD5, cycline-D1, CD10 negative; no MYC staining; FDG PET: initial complete metabolic remission, relapse with Deauville score 5 in mediastinal and abdominal lymph nodes; bone marrow: no infiltration; FDG PET CT after alloHSCT: complete metabolic remission

Diagnosis: Primary mediastinal B cell lymphoma, relapsed after CAR T-cell therapy

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Fever and abdominal pain; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Fever and abdominal pain; imaging showed pleural effusion and splenomegaly; pancytopenia; diagnosed with acute monocytic leukemia; multiple episodes of febrile neutropenia; hematemesis, petechiae, splenomegaly, and fever after remission; progressive clinical deterioration
Medical_Record.Background: Previously healthy; no significant past medical history; no allergies mentioned; no family or social history provided; multiple chemotherapy regimens; central catheter placement; multiple antibiotic therapies

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Imaging: pleural effusion, splenomegaly; Laboratory: pancytopenia, elevated C-reactive protein, elevated lactate dehydrogenase, elevated ferritin; BM aspirate: blast infiltration, hemophagocytosis; Immunophenotyping: abnormal cell populations; Karyotype: complex chromosomal rearrangement; Blood cultures: coagulase-negative Staphylococcus, multidrug-resistant Klebsiella pneumoniae

Diagnosis: Acute monocytic leukemia with hemophagocytosis by blasts

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Progressively worsening double vision; duration not stated
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Double vision; complete right sixth nerve palsy; stable postoperatively; sixth nerve palsy resolved at six-month follow-up
Medical_Record.Background: Otherwise healthy; no significant past medical history; no surgical history; no family history; no social history; no medications; no allergies

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Complete right sixth nerve palsy; neurological examination stable postoperatively
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: MRI: enhancing lesion of upper clivus with dural penetration abutting basilar artery; CT: partially calcified bony lesion with partial erosion of right posterior clinoidal process; CTA: tumor close to basilar tip and terminal branches, anterior displacement of right cavernous ICA; intraoperative MRI: gross total resection confirmed; pathology: grade I chondrosarcoma; surveillance imaging at one year: no recurrence

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Gingival bleeding; 4-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Gingival hemorrhage and perioral erosions onset at 6 years 8 months; dry lips; poor dietary intake limited to processed snacks and lacto-fermenting drinks; anemia detected during evaluation for common cold; no symptoms of nail or hair changes, myalgia, weakness, subcutaneous bleeding, purpura, or petechiae
Medical_Record.Background: Born twin at term by caesarean section; birth weight 2.51 kg; no prenatal or postnatal complications; twin brother with ADHD and normal eating habits; diagnosed with psychomotor retardation at 1 year 3 months (DQ 51); imbalanced diet since 1.5 years; diagnosed with autism spectrum disorder; ferric pyrophosphate initiated for anemia; no reported allergies

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Height 110 cm (-2.07 SD); weight 19.05 kg; body temperature 36.7°C; blood pressure 90/80 mmHg; heart rate 117 bpm; respiratory rate 28 breaths per minute; oxygen saturation 98% on room air; dry lips; perioral erosions; gingival swelling; gingival hemorrhage; otherwise normal physical examination
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Hemoglobin 7.0 g/dL (anemia); AST 98 IU/L (elevated); ALT 64 IU/L (elevated); CK 45 IU/L; TSH 2.55 μIU/mL; FT4 1.36 ng/dL; vitamin C 1.1 μg/dL (low); selenium 2.8 μg/dL (low); retinol protein 1.3 mg/dL (low); vitamin B1 22 ng/mL (low); folic acid <1.3 ng/mL (low); echocardiogram normal; lumbar and head MRI normal; selenium content in snacks and drinks <0.1 μg/g

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Unconsciousness and apnea following high-speed motor vehicle collision
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Unconscious on arrival; not breathing independently; unsuccessful intubation at scene; death soon after hospital arrival
Medical_Record.Background: No known past medical history; no surgical history; AO assimilation unknown to family

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Radiographs show traumatic dislocation of atlas from axis; internal decapitation; atlantooccipital assimilation between anterior arch of atlas and basiocciput; no fractures including odontoid process

Diagnosis: Traumatic dislocation of atlas from axis with atlantooccipital assimilation

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Recent onset jaundice
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: History of neuroendocrine tumor in pancreas head with hepatic metastasis; recent jaundice; underwent percutaneous transhepatic biliary drainage; developed high fever 8 days after returning to ward; persistent right pleural effusion
Medical_Record.Background: Neuroendocrine tumor in pancreas head; hepatic metastasis; no additional PMH, surgical history, family or social history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel history mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: High fever; right side pleural effusion
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Abdominal CT: pancreas head tumor, multiple hepatic metastasis, dilated intrahepatic and common bile ducts; chest X-ray: right pleural effusion; thoracentesis: greenish fluid, high bilirubin (23.7 mg/dl); culture: Enterococcus, Candida albicans; PTBD follow-up: biliopleural fistula with contrast media backflow into right pleural space

Diagnosis: Biliopleural fistula following percutaneous transhepatic biliary drainage

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Severe metrorrhagia; 2-month duration after aspiration curettage for delayed abortion
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Severe vaginal bleeding; onset 2 months post-aspiration curettage; moderate bleeding on arrival
Medical_Record.Background: Obstetric history G1A1; no allergies; no significant medical or surgical history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Moderate vaginal bleeding observed
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Ultrasonography: endometrial cavity with protruding formation (38 × 15 mm), vascularisation of right lateral uterine wall, pulsed Doppler peak systolic velocity > 100 cm/s; CT angiography: complex network of tortuous vessels with rapid contrast enhancement, extension through right parametrium, myometrial fundus, and endometrium; Follow-up ultrasound: no AVM detected after 4 months of combined hormonal contraceptives

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Sudden-onset chest pain; 2-3 hours duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Chest pain; EKG shows ST-segment elevation in V1-V5; diagnosed with anterior-wall myocardial infarction; underwent primary PCI with drug-eluting stent to LAD; post-PCI developed drowsiness, confusion, hemiparesis
Medical_Record.Background: History of hypertension; no other past medical history provided; no surgical history provided; no family or social history provided; started on dual antiplatelet therapy (aspirin, P2Y12 inhibitor) after PCI; no allergy information provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Drowsiness; confusion; hemiparesis (motor power 1/5 in all four limbs); gradual improvement to full consciousness and motor power 4/5
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: EKG: ST-segment elevation in V1-V5; coronary angiography: 90% proximal LAD stenosis with clots; non-contrast CT brain: bilateral periventricular hypodensities, mild sulcal effacement, hyperdensity in subarachnoid space; MRI without contrast: not beneficial; repeat CT: reversal of initial changes; serum creatinine peaked at 4.89, returned to 1.53 on discharge

Medical_Record.Demographics: 70-year-old male; unemployed; history of odd jobs
Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Found down in parking lot; confusion; fatigue; unknown duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Confusion and fatigue on arrival; oriented to name and date only; not oriented to location or situation; improved over 1 week with supportive measures; persistent lapses in judgment and memory
Medical_Record.Background: Hypertension; polyarthritis; active alcohol and tobacco use; opioid abuse disorder in remission on methadone; no Durable Power of Attorney; lives with brother (recently deceased); estranged from adult son; brother managed finances; lost driver's license 20 years ago due to DUI; monthly social security stipend; no significant social support

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: SpO2 88% on room air, improved to 92% on 2L oxygen; stable other vital signs; dry crackles on pulmonary exam; cardiac, abdominal, neurologic exams unremarkable
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Chest X-ray: bilateral multifocal airspace opacities; SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR positive; Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA) score 13/30 with deficits in executive function, attention, and short-term memory

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Pain, irritability, difficulty with mobilization; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Swelling and erythema over interphalangeal joints; polyarthritis of hands and wrists; hoarse voice; right vocal cord paresis; gastroesophageal reflux; mild delay in gross and fine motor skills; erythematous nodules progressed over multiple areas; developmentally delayed for age; hypertonicity and irritability 12 months after HSCT; progressive loss of previously acquired skills; increased autonomic dysfunction with severe constipation; swallowing and feeding difficulties; multiple respiratory infections; died of respiratory failure at 37 months
Medical_Record.Background: Second child of nonconsanguineous healthy Caucasian couple; born at term with normal birthweight and height; homozygous mutation (c.458A > G [p.Tyr153Cys]) in ASAH1 gene; no significant transplant-related complications; full recovery of all three cell lines; no signs of acute or chronic GvHD; chimerism at day +475 was 100% donor cells; cyclosporin and mycophenolate mofetil used as GvHD prophylaxis; elevated ALT and AST preceding transplant; no significant family or social history mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Swelling and erythema over interphalangeal joints; polyarthritis of hands and wrists; hoarse voice; right vocal cord paresis; cherry-red spot on ophthalmological examination; hypertonicity; irritability; developmental delay; increased autonomic dysfunction; severe constipation; swallowing and feeding difficulties
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Electroencephalography unremarkable; electromyography showed no evidence of peripheral neuropathy or myopathy; MRI prior to transplant unremarkable; cherry-red spot on ophthalmological reassessment; CT scan at 1 year showed corticosubcortical bilateral frontotemporal volume loss, hypodensity of brain parenchyma, mild ventriculomegaly; elevated ALT and AST preceding transplant; chimerism studies 100% donor cells

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Jaw pain; 10-minute duration after bicycle accident
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Rapid deceleration; fall over handlebars; landed on face; conscious on arrival; jaw pain; episodes of confusion and tachycardia 1.5 hours after admission; impaired finger-nose test on right side; decline in GCS to 7; further decline in GCS to 6; palsy in right extremities; anisocoria with larger right pupil; aphasia and right-sided hemiplegia 2 months after injury
Medical_Record.Background: Healthy; non-smoker; no significant past medical history; no drug allergies; no family history mentioned; no medication history mentioned; no surgical history prior to trauma; no social history mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Blood pressure 130/60 mmHg; respiratory rate 20 breaths per minute; normal heart and lung auscultation; normal initial GCS; slightly impaired finger-nose test on right side; decline in GCS to 7 then 6; palsy in right extremities; anisocoria with larger right pupil
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Normal CBC, bleeding status, coagulation status, liver and renal function; initial CT scan: normal brain, fractures of mandible (bilateral condylar necks and left paramedian corpus); repeated CT scan: no recent changes; MRI and MRA: extensive left MCA infarction, occluded left ICA, occluded left MCA; CT angiography and ultrasound: dissection and total occlusion of left ICA, dissection and 40% stenosis of right ICA

Diagnosis: Dissection of the internal carotid artery and stroke

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Right upper quadrant abdominal pain; 18-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Right upper quadrant pain radiating to back; worsened by fatty food and coffee; relieved by medications; significant weight loss (21 kg); drenching night sweats; onset after laparoscopic cholecystectomy; history of Pseudomonas abscess treated with antibiotics; pain relapsed after temporary relief
Medical_Record.Background: Known bronchial asthma; history of bariatric surgery before cholecystectomy; contact with domestic cats; no nausea, vomiting, change in bowel habits, skin rashes, visual symptoms, joint pains, travel history, or sick contact; on Symbicort and Ventolin; received meropenem, vancomycin, fluconazole, and enoxaparin prophylaxis; no drug allergies mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Temp 36.7°C; heart rate 66 bpm; respiratory rate 20/min; oxygen saturation 98% on room air; blood pressure 110/65 mmHg; abdomen soft and lax; no tenderness; organomegaly or masses on palpation; normal bowel sounds
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Hemoglobin 12.3 g/dL; mild leukocytosis (11.8 × 10^9/L); liver and renal function tests normal; peripheral blood smear borderline normocytic normochromic anemia; blood cultures and tumor markers negative; PET-CT shows increased FDG activity in perihepatic/hepatic soft tissue deposits; MRI shows multifocal infiltrative lesions in hepatorenal space invading adjacent liver, right kidney, and abdominal wall; liver biopsy shows suspected granulomatous inflammation or pseudotumor; frozen section negative for malignancy; intraoperative findings of thick-walled cystic lesions with caseating material, pus, and multiple small stones

Diagnosis: Intra-abdominal spilled gallstones with granulomatous inflammation mimicking malignancy

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Palpable thyroid mass; unknown duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Solitary thyroid nodule on right lobe; isoechoic and hyper-vascular; FNA cytology suggestive of papillary thyroid carcinoma
Medical_Record.Background: Unremarkable medical history; negative family history for thyroid disease and FAP-related tumors; no colon cancer or colonic polyposis

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Ultrasonography: solitary nodule (1.5 x 1.8 x 2.1 cm), isoechoic, hyper-vascular; FNA cytology: Bethesda V; NGS panel: no somatic DNA variants in common driver genes; Histology: encapsulated, highly cellular tumor with trabecular, solid, cribriform, follicular patterns, morules; IHC: positive nuclear and cytoplasmic β-catenin; APC sequencing: two somatic inactivating variants; Sanger sequencing and MLPA: negative for germline APC variants; NGS deep sequencing: somatic variants absent in leukocyte and normal thyroid DNA

Diagnosis: Cribriform-morular variant of papillary thyroid carcinoma

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Easy bruising and petechiae; unspecified duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Easy bruising; petechiae; urinary urgency; urinary frequency
Medical_Record.Background: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease; gastroesophageal reflux disease; human papillomavirus; mitral valve prolapse; acute pyelonephritis; anxiety; asthma; essential hypertension; hyperlipidemia; hyperthyroidism; migraines; nephrolithiasis; obstructive sleep apnea; smoking half pack daily for 10 years; non-protective antibody titers against Haemophilus and diphtheria-tetanus; multiple vitamin deficiencies; medication follow-up

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Perifollicular hemorrhage; petechiae; bruising on various parts of body
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Vitamin C level 22 umol/L (low)

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Sudden chest pain and shortness of breath
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Acute onset chest pain and dyspnea; no fever, chills, or prior episodes; recurrence of similar symptoms two weeks later
Medical_Record.Background: Hypertension; diabetes; renal cell carcinoma; status-post nephrectomy; chronic kidney disease stage IV; 20 pack-year smoking history; intravenous drug abuse; nonadherence to warfarin; no significant family history or allergies mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Blood pressure 160/95 mm Hg; pulse 90 bpm; respiratory rate 18 breaths per minute; temperature 37.8°C; nonobese male in acute distress; chest wall tenderness on palpation; physical examination unchanged on second presentation
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: 12-lead ECG: no ischemic findings; creatinine 4.3 mg/dL (baseline 3.0-4.5 mg/dL); normal troponin and BNP; initial planar V/Q scan: large filling defect in inferior lingula, small defects in posterior inferior left lower lobe and posterior inferior right upper lobe; follow-up echocardiogram: no ventricular strain; INR 2.3 at discharge, INR 1.12 on readmission; repeat V/Q SPECT: no filling defects; lower extremity Doppler: no clot; D-dimers normal; urine drug screen positive for cocaine

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Hematochezia and malaise; duration 10 days
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Fresh bloody stool on admission and 10 days earlier; malaise; history of open surgery with bifurcated graft for abdominal aortic aneurysm 20 months prior; uneventful postoperative course until current episode
Medical_Record.Background: History of abdominal aortic aneurysm repair with bifurcated graft; no remarkable findings on CT at 6 and 18 months postoperatively; no other past medical history, medications, allergies, family or social history stated

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Blood pressure 122/75 mmHg; heart rate 86/minute; temperature 36.6°C; respiratory rate 16/minute; abdominal exam unremarkable; no tenderness
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Hemoglobin 9.0 g/dL; esophagogastroduodenoscopy and colonoscopy show only colon diverticula, no bleeding; contrast-enhanced CT shows gas within aneurysm sac, adhesion between graft and intestinal tract at three sites; Enterococcus faecium isolated from blood culture; autopsy reveals ulcerative fistula in distal ileum adhered to graft anastomosis, small hole at aortic anastomosis, destruction of arterial structure, fibrous thickening of arterial wall, disappearance of external elastic lamina, firm adhesion between serosa of small intestine and adventitia of artery, no marked sign of infection

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Absent secondary sexual characteristics; delayed growth
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Delayed puberty; 20 cm height gap compared to monozygotic twin brother; abnormalities noticed since childhood
Medical_Record.Background: History of right ulna fracture at age 2; mother and twin brother with blue sclera and multiple bone fractures before adulthood; father healthy; mother and twin brother with blue sclera; no significant surgical history; no allergies or medication history reported

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Height 158 cm; weight 53 kg; BMI 20.70 kg/m2; arm span 153 cm; triangular face; light blue sclera; lack of facial hair, Adam's apple, underarm hair, pubic hair; carinatum; enlarged breasts; palpable breast nodules with mild tenderness; stretched penis length 4 cm; both testes palpable
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Testicular ultrasound: right testis 1.64×0.73×1.16 cm (0.73 ml), left testis 1.48×0.65×1.01 cm (0.51 ml); normal olfactory test; bone mineral density analysis: decreased lumbar vertebrae density (Z = -3.1); hand radiography: skeletal age 14 years; pituitary MRI: reduced anterior pituitary, absent pituitary stalk, ectopic posterior lobe; labs: pituitary hypothyroidism, pituitary-adrenal axis dysfunction, hypogonadotropic hypogonadism, slightly increased prolactin, insulin resistance with normal glucose, basal GH < 0.5 μg/l, basal IGF-I < 25 ng/ml; genetic testing: heterozygous mutations in COL1A1 (c.658C>T, p.Arg220Ter) and COL1A2 (c.2569C>A, p.Pro857Thr); no pathogenic variants for PSIS, PHD, HPE; ophthalmologic and audiologic exams normal

Diagnosis: Osteogenesis Imperfecta due to combined heterozygous mutations in COL1A1 and COL1A2, coexisting with Pituitary Stalk Interruption Syndrome

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Seizures; 5-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Onset of seizures 5 years ago; finger fumbling; lip smacking; unresponsiveness during episodes; one episode of secondarily generalized seizure before antiepileptic drugs; frequent abdominal aura; rare vertiginous or psychic aura; seizures persisted despite polytherapy; simple partial seizures monthly; complex partial seizures twice per year
Medical_Record.Background: Family history of seizures (grandmother); apparent axillary pigmentation and freckling; seven café-au-lait spots (>15 mm) on back; no focal neurological deficit; on oxcarbazepine 1,500 mg, topiramate 400 mg, levetiracetam 3,000 mg, clobazam 10 mg, pregabalin 150 mg daily; intellectual assessment: full scale IQ 85, verbal IQ 87, performance IQ 84; diffuse cerebral dysfunction on neuropsychological tests; normal Beck’s depression inventory

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Apparent axillary pigmentation and freckling; seven café-au-lait spots (>15 mm) on back; no focal neurological deficit
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Initial brain MRI: multifocal lesions; serial MRI: multifocal lesions in right temporal area, left tectum, right cerebellar peduncle, thalamus, basal ganglion, intraventricular cyst in left trigon; lesions compatible with CNS hamartomas; right mesial temporal area: increased signal and volume; hippocampal volumetry: right hippocampus 4,105 mm3, left 3,659 mm3; enhanced MRI: multiple small scalp lesions (neurofibromas); video-EEG: interictal discharges in right mid-temporal area, ictal onset in right temporal area; SPECT: ictal hyperperfusion and interictal hypoperfusion in right mesial temporal area; PET: right temporal hypometabolism; Wada test: left hemisphere dominant for speech and memory; pathology: mild neuronal loss at hippocampus, dysplastic changes, no neoplasm

Diagnosis: Mesial temporal lobe epilepsy with neurofibromatosis type 1

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Localized pain in left lateral tongue and foreign body sensation; 3-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Penetrating sensation during fish and rice meal; attempted removal of fish bone; persistent pain; able to tolerate normal diet with discomfort
Medical_Record.Background: No significant past medical history; no medications; no allergies

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Tender indurated focal point in posterior left lateral tongue near circumvallate papillae; no foreign body visualized in oral cavity, oropharynx, or on flexible nasendoscopy
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Lateral neck x-rays unremarkable; contrast-enhanced CT neck shows 9mm linear hyperdensity in left superior tongue; intra-oral ultrasound confirms foreign body <1mm diameter, 4.7mm deep to mucosal surface

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Distal sensory loss in upper limbs; progressive ascending weakness; 3-4 days duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Gradual onset ascending weakness; recent diarrhoeal illness; returned from Pakistan four weeks prior; stool positive for Cryptosporidium spp. DNA PCR; treated with ciprofloxacin; symptoms followed daughter's gastroenteritis admission
Medical_Record.Background: Past history of acute Guillain-Barré Syndrome six years prior; treated with IVIG; no respiratory failure; gestational diabetes mellitus; no other significant history mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Symmetric ascending flaccid paresis; weakness and areflexia; MRC Grade 2/5 at hip, knee, ankle; MRC Grade 3/5 at wrist; MRC Grade 4/5 at elbow and shoulder; MRC-sum score 36/60; EGRIS score 4; physiologically stable on admission; developed weak voice and rising oxygen requirement; intubated and mechanically ventilated; cranio-bulbar signs
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Admission blood tests normal; rising white cell count and CRP; aspiration pneumonia diagnosed; CT Brain normal; MRI brain and spinal cord normal; lumbar puncture shows cyto-albuminological dissociation; negative for HIV, hepatitis viruses, EBV, CMV, ANA, GM1 Abs, GQ1B Abs, Anti-MPO, Anti-PR, Lyme disease, syphilis; nerve conduction studies show in-excitability of peripheral motor nerves, normal sensory nerves

Diagnosis: Relapse of Guillain-Barré Syndrome secondary to Cryptosporidiosis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Pain and deformity over left thigh; following road traffic accident
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Acute onset pain and deformity; lacerated wound over distal thigh; bone exposed; abnormal mobility at distal thigh
Medical_Record.Background: Poorly controlled diabetes mellitus (HbA1C 8.2%); hypertension; no other injuries; no skin loss; no post-operative complications in donor leg

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Glasgow coma scale full; blood pressure 90/60 mm Hg; pulse rate 122 beats/min; 5 × 3 cm lacerated wound over distal thigh; bone exposed; local tenderness; abnormal mobility at distal thigh
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT scans: no chest, abdomen, pelvis, or spine injuries; Radiographs: comminuted displaced fracture left distal femur with intra-articular extension and bone loss; Gustilo-Anderson type IIIA; AO 33C3; injury severity score 9; CT with 3D reconstruction: multifragmentary articular fragments; CT angiography: normal vascularity of lower limb; Doppler scan: satisfactory flap vascularity; radiographic union with callus formation at 4 months

Diagnosis: Open intra-articular distal femur fracture with massive bone loss

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Acute urinary retention; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Acute urinary retention; catheterization and alpha-1 antagonist for 3 days enabled voiding; follow-up after 1 month for voiding function evaluation; desire for prostate surgery with preservation of ejaculatory function
Medical_Record.Background: No past medical history stated; no surgical history stated; no family or social history stated; no medication or allergy history stated

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Serum prostate-specific antigen 1.10 ng/mL; prostate size 40.2/8.6 mL (total/transitional); IPSS score 15; maximum urine flow rate 9.8 mL/sec; IIEF-5 score 15; post-op at 3 months: PSA 1.06 ng/mL, prostate size 34.1/5.6 mL, IPSS 5, Qmax 15.1 mL/sec, IIEF-5 14; reduction in prostate volume (total 15.2%, transitional zone 34.8%); no postoperative complications

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Unspecific epigastric pain; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Large palpable upper abdominal tumor; referred for further evaluation after imaging suggested hepatocellular carcinoma
Medical_Record.Background: Previous inguinal hernia surgery; no other concomitant disease; smokes 20 cigarettes daily; no alcohol consumption; no family history of liver disease

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Hard palpable mass in upper mid and right quadrant
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Normal liver parameters; increased CA 19-9 (163 U/mL); AFP and CEA within reference range; CT: large multiloculated tumor in liver segments IVb and V with arterial hyperenhancement, washout, central necrosis; MRI: 15.5 × 9.6 × 14.2 cm tumor, T1 inhomogeneous hypointense, hemorrhagic content, T2 hyperintense, peripheral enhancement, washout; compression of bile ducts with intrahepatic duct dilation; no cirrhosis; no metastases initially; postoperative CT: 15 mm lesion in segment VI, previously 8 mm, suspicious for metastasis; FDG-PET CT: positive for segment VI lesion, no other metastases

Diagnosis: Biliary adenofibroma with transition to invasive carcinoma

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Left knee pain; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: History of tri-compartmental osteoarthritis and lateral condyle insufficiency fracture of left knee; pain worsening; mechanical ground level fall resulting in ipsilateral medial condyle fracture; pain affecting activities of daily living
Medical_Record.Background: Previously managed conservatively; no further past medical history, surgical history, family or social history, medications, or allergies specified

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Imaging shows medial condyle fracture of left knee; post-operative imaging and intra-operative photos available; range of motion 0–120° at 3 months post-op, regressed to 0–95° at 8 weeks, 5–95° at 3 years follow-up

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Gait disturbances and dysphonia; gradual onset
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive gait disturbances; dysphonia; dysmetria; dysdiadochokinesia; dysarthria; ataxia of stance and gait; rapid progression of predominantly static and lower-limb cerebellar syndrome
Medical_Record.Background: Previously healthy; no abnormal renal or hepatic function; no inflammatory syndrome; normal vitamin B12, B9, E, and thyroid function; negative genetic tests for SCA 1, 2, 3, 6, 7, 17 and Friedreich's ataxia; BRCA 1/2 status unknown; no mention of occupation, family history, social history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Dysmetria; dysdiadochokinesia; dysarthria; ataxia of stance and gait; moderate executive dysfunction; areflexia; isolated absence of sensory potentials on right superficial peroneal nerve
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Brain MRI: diffuse cerebellar atrophy, predominant in vermis; neuropsychological exam: moderate executive dysfunction; nerve conduction: areflexia, absence of sensory potentials on right superficial peroneal nerve; CA-125: 307 kU/L (elevated); lumbar puncture: discrete elevation of protein, intrathecal IgG synthesis, no pleocytosis; PET-CT: 3 suspicious left ovarian masses, 2 pathological lymph nodes near portal vein and vena cava; anti-Yo anti-neuronal antibodies: positive; laparoscopy and biopsy: FIGO IIIC high-grade serous ovarian cancer; radiological follow-up: persistent stable left iliac lymph node; brain imaging: stable diffuse CNS atrophy

Diagnosis: Paraneoplastic cerebellar ataxia secondary to high-grade serous ovarian cancer

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Subjective fever; 2-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Fever; headache; non-projectile vomiting of food; decreased oral intake; tea-colored urine; no abnormal movements; no loss of consciousness; no other urinary symptoms; no change in bowel habits
Medical_Record.Background: Sickle cell anemia (confirmed by hemoglobin electrophoresis); Moyamoya syndrome (confirmed by brain MRI); three previous cerebrovascular accidents; multiple vaso-occlusive crises; hydroxyurea; folic acid; deferasirox; regular exchange transfusion

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Temp 38.6°C; heart rate 125 bpm; blood pressure 118/70 mmHg; ill appearance; drowsy; jaundiced; no respiratory distress; hypertonia and hyperreflexia of right upper and lower limbs; 4/5 power in right upper and lower limbs; normal left upper and lower limbs; negative Kernig’s and Brudzinski’s signs; rest of examination unremarkable
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CBC: low hemoglobin, high reticulocyte count, high LDH, high bilirubin, leukocytosis (neutrophilia); high urea; normal creatinine; liver function: high bilirubin; electrolytes normal; blood and urine cultures; brain CT: no new findings; CSF analysis: WBC 1 cell/mm3, RBC <1 cell/mm3, protein 0.19 g/L, glucose 5.5 mmol/L, Gram stain negative; blood culture: Gram-negative bacillus (Pantoea spp.); urine and CSF cultures negative

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Chronic symmetric inflammatory arthritis of both hands; duration not specified

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Progressively increasing ulcerated mass in right breast
