Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Rising CA-125 levels; duration unclear
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: History of moderately-differentiated adenocarcinoma of right adnexal region (excised April 2017); routine follow-up; recent COVID-19 infection (January 2022); received Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 mRNA vaccine (first dose February 10, 2022; second dose March 24, 2022); CA-125 level elevated to 78.0 U/ml on March 7, 2022; previous CA-125 normal (October 4, 2021); CA-125 returned to normal (24.4 U/ml) in April 2022
Medical_Record.Background: Primary gynecological malignancy (endometrial vs. ovarian) suggested by immunostaining; no pelvic recurrence on CT (October 2020); PET/CT (April 21, 2022) negative for recurrence; routine monitoring planned; no additional PMH, medications, allergies, family or social history provided

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CA-125 elevated to 78.0 U/ml (March 7, 2022); previous CA-125 normal (October 4, 2021); CT abdomen-pelvis (October 2020) no recurrence; PET/CT (April 21, 2022) no uptake in pelvic region; CA-125 normalized to 24.4 U/ml (April 2022)

Diagnosis: Adenocarcinoma of right adnexal region, status post excision; no evidence of recurrence

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Abdominal distension and hypokalemia; unknown duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Recurrent abdominal distention; persistent hypokalemia; brought from nursing home to ER; history of abdominal distention with recurrent hypokalemia during previous admissions; asymptomatic COVID-19 infection during admission
Medical_Record.Background: Hypertension; heart failure with reduced ejection fraction; diabetes mellitus; gastroesophageal reflux disease; dementia; previous use of losartan and spironolactone; no neuroleptic, anticholinergic, steroid, amphetamine, or narcotic use

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Abdominal distension; bradycardia in 40s; relief of distension after NG and rectal tube insertion; presence of bowel sounds
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Potassium 2.0 mg/dl (hypokalemia); hyperkalemia (6.4 mmol/l) after spironolactone; abdominal X-ray: numerous distended bowel loops; CT abdomen: marked gaseous distention of colon, no obstructing lesion; negative workup for hyperaldosteronism, Cushing's disease, Clostridium difficile; hypokalemia with kalikuria

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Nausea and vomiting; 1-month duration; altered consciousness; 1-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Repeated episodes of nausea and vomiting; progressive altered consciousness; deterioration in GCS; development of spastic quadriparesis
Medical_Record.Background: 9 weeks gestation; previously healthy; miscarriage; evacuation of retained products of conception under general anesthesia

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: GCS 8/15 to 9/15; quadriparesis; rigidity; exaggerated reflexes; upgoing plantars; dystonic limb posturing; normal cranial nerve examination including ophthalmoscopy
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Hyponatremia 113 mmol/L; hypokalemia 2.7 mmol/L; sodium increased to 127 mmol/L over 48 h; serum sodium 136 mmol/L on transfer; normal basic biochemical investigations; normal inflammatory markers; normal noncontrast CT brain; lumbar puncture: cytoprotein dissociation, CSF protein 103 mg/dL; MRI brain: hyperintensities in pons and basal ganglia; MR angiography and venography: no venous sinus thrombosis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Visual loss in right eye; 2-month duration after cataract surgery; subsequent visual loss in left eye after cataract surgery
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Initial dense mature cataract in right eye; underwent phacoemulsification with posterior chamber intraocular lens implantation; postoperative course initially normal; 2 months after surgery, sudden visual loss in right eye; 4 months later, decreased vision in left eye; underwent cataract extraction in left eye; 5 months after left eye surgery, abrupt visual loss in left eye
Medical_Record.Background: Heavy smoking; hypertension; hyperlipidemia; noninsulin-dependent diabetes mellitus; no past ocular history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Initial VA right eye hand movement, left eye 20/50; no RAPD initially; post-right eye surgery VA 20/50; corneal edema resolved; IOP 15 mm Hg; after right eye visual loss: VA 20/120, positive right RAPD, swollen optic disc, flame-shaped hemorrhages; after left eye visual loss: VA finger counting, sluggish pupil reaction, swollen left optic disc, flame-shaped hemorrhages; last follow-up: VA right eye 20/100, left eye 20/200, reduced color vision, right-trace RAPD, bilateral optic nerve atrophy and pallor
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Ultrasonography normal; dilated fundus exam left eye normal pre-op; 30-2 Humphrey visual field: severe depression, remnants in inferotemporal quadrant right eye, superotemporal quadrant left eye; OCT: bilateral thinning of retinal nerve fiber layer

Diagnosis: Bilateral sequential non-arteritic anterior ischemic optic neuropathy (NAION) following cataract extraction

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Sudden headache, nausea, vomiting; onset during 13th week of pregnancy
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Acute headache, nausea, vomiting; tetraventricular bleeding; progressive neurological symptoms including left-sided hemiparesis and hemihypesthesia; recurrent symptoms post-delivery
Medical_Record.Background: Pregnant at presentation; no additional PMH, surgical history, family or social history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel history mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Mild left-sided hemiparesis; recurrence of left-sided hemiparesis and hemihypesthesia post-delivery
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT: severe tetraventricular bleeding, hypodense deep lesion in right posterior hemisphere; MRI: irregular brain tumor with contrast enhancement and intratumoral bleeding near occipital horn of lateral ventricle; volumetric measurements: initial 2.5 cm, 4.2 cm3; follow-up: 3.6 cm, 8.7 cm3; pre-treatment: 14.1 cm3; post-partum: 21 cm3, 28.8 cm3; post-treatment: reduction to 11.1 cm3, eventual disappearance; stereotactic brain biopsy: WHO Grade III high-grade glioma

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Fever and swollen lymph nodes; onset June 2021
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Fever and lymphadenopathy; WBC 1.3×10^9/L; Hb 82 g/dL; BM aspirates 65% blasts; partial remission after induction chemotherapy; persistent cytopenias; subsequent complete remission after reinduction; developed fever, elevated liver enzymes, and rash after micro-transplantation
Medical_Record.Background: No standard allo-HSCT due to frail condition and lung infections; received induction chemotherapy (idarubicin, cytarabine), reinduction (decitabine, venetoclax), and consolidation; underwent micro-transplantation from HLA haplotype homozygous donor (son); no GVHD prophylaxis initially; self-discontinued Tacrolimus 5 months post-MST; no current infection, rash, diarrhea, or abnormal liver function; Tacrolimus continued for prophylaxis

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Fever up to 40.2°C; mild rashes on back, chest, palms; no current infection, rash, diarrhea, or abnormal liver function
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: WBC 1.3×10^9/L; Hb 82 g/dL; BM aspirates 65% blasts; flow cytometry: blasts positive for CD123, CD117, CD13, CD33, HLA-DR, CD45; negative for CD34; cytogenetics: normal male chromosomes; NGS: KMT2A-PTD, DNMT3A, IDH2, STAG2 mutations; BM blast count 7% post-induction; MRD negative; PCR-STR: donor chimerism up to 98.8%; elevated liver enzymes; no blasts on BM re-exam; MRD negative; mutations undetectable by qPCR and PCR-pair end sequencing

Diagnosis: Acute Myeloid Leukemia with KMT2A-PTD and Graft-versus-Host Disease

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Fever, urinary frequency, dysuria; 1-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Fever, urinary frequency, dysuria for 1 week; headache for 5 days; no nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, or abdominal pain
Medical_Record.Background: First in birth order; vaginal delivery at 39 weeks; normal birth weight (3630 g); normal growth parameters; no recent family gastrointestinal or urinary complaints; toilet trained with infrequent voiding; no recent travel or river/sea water exposure; consumed salmon in past month without gastrointestinal symptoms; exposure to household goldfish tank; history of two prior UTI hospitalizations in past year; no vesicoureteral reflux on prior voiding cystourethrogram; no medications prior to admission

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Good general condition; heart rate 98 bpm; blood pressure 115/65 mmHg; respiratory rate 23/min; oxygen saturation 97% on room air; axillary temperature 38.6°C; no costovertebral tenderness; negative neck rigidity; unremarkable abdominal and genital examination
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Urinalysis: 3–4 RBCs, many WBCs, many bacteria/HPF, 1+ protein, positive nitrite; urine culture: Edwardsiella tarda >100,000 CFU, resistant to cefixime, ciprofloxacin, cotrimoxazole, nalidixic acid, sensitive to meropenem, tetracycline, nitrofurantoin; blood culture negative; organism: motile, rod-shaped, positive H2S and indole, negative mannitol fermentation, positive glucose fermentation, negative urease, O-nitrophenyl-beta-d-galactoside, cytochrome oxidase, citrate, VP; initial blood tests: WBC 11.93 × 10^3/μL (59% neutrophils, 36% lymphocytes), hemoglobin 13.32 g/dL, platelets 359 × 10^3/μL, blood sugar 96 mg/dL, CRP 3+; brain MRI normal; follow-up urinalysis: 3–4 WBCs, 0–1 RBC, no bacteria/HPF, negative protein, negative nitrite; urine culture: no growth after 24 h

Diagnosis: Urinary tract infection caused by Edwardsiella tarda

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Status epilepticus; acute onset
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Seizures at 37 weeks gestation; intubation required; emergency lower segment cesarean section performed; ICU admission for elective ventilation
Medical_Record.Background: G3P2L1; unbooked pregnancy; eclampsia; brainstem bleed on CT; no further PMH, surgical, family, social history, medications, allergies, or other contextual data provided

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT brain: brainstem bleed; chest radiograph: abnormal central line course crossing midline to left superior mediastinum; repeat chest radiograph: catheter descending vertically along left mediastinum below left hilum

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Severe headache; drowsiness; mild left hemiparesis
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: 2-year history of gastric adenocarcinoma with regional lymph node involvement; recent diagnosis of multiple systemic metastases including bilateral ovarian masses (Krukenberg tumor), pulmonary lymphangitic carcinomatosis, multifocal bone involvement; onset of headache after 3 courses of systemic chemotherapy; no prior head injury; no anticoagulant use
Medical_Record.Background: History of gastric adenocarcinoma; received systemic chemotherapy; no history of head injury; no anticoagulant use

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Conscious but agitated; left extremity strength 4/5; developed dysphasia and worsened hemiparesis
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Brain CT: crescent-like hypodense subdural collection in right fronto-parietal region, 1 cm diameter, midline shift; hyperdense rim at lateral border; evacuated subdural fluid: high protein, no malignant cells; repeat CT: re-accumulation of subdural effusion, increased midline shift, persistent hyperdense rim; MRI: right subdural effusion, hypointense T1, hyperintense T2, abnormal dural and gyral enhancement; histopathology: thickened dura with nests of metastatic adenocarcinoma and inflammatory cells

Diagnosis: Malignant subdural effusion secondary to metastatic adenocarcinoma

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Hilar cholangiocarcinoma; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Diagnosis of hilar cholangiocarcinoma (Klatskin tumor Bismuth type IIIa); prior diagnosis of Lynch syndrome; history of multiple malignancies; chronic renal insufficiency; prior radiochemotherapy for esophageal cancer
Medical_Record.Background: Lynch syndrome (heterozygous MLH1 mutation); surgical history of renal cell carcinoma, urothelial carcinoma, bladder carcinoma, breast cancer; chronic renal insufficiency; radiochemotherapy for esophageal cancer; no information on medications, allergies, family or social history

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT: Dilated intrahepatic bile ducts in right lobe; MRCP/MRI: Hilar tumor compressing right hepatic duct, contact with right portal vein; GGT 66–80 U/l (elevated); normal liver function tests; post-LVD CT: Hypertrophy of segments 2 and 3, sufficient remnant liver parenchyma (552 mL); LiMax test: Normal; intraoperative frozen section: Negative for tumor cells; postoperative fever and elevated infection parameters; cholangiography: No anastomotic leakage; final histology: Medium-highly differentiated cholangiocarcinoma stage pT2b L0 V0 pN0 (0/1) G2, R0 resection

Diagnosis: Hilar cholangiocarcinoma (Klatskin tumor Bismuth type IIIa)

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Left scrotal swelling; 3-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Slight discomfort; swelling particularly noticeable for 3 months
Medical_Record.Background: History of non-insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus; hepatic cirrhosis likely secondary to non-alcoholic steatohepatitis; oesophageal varices (asymptomatic, monitored)

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Lax left hydrocoele; testis difficult to palpate within fluid collection
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Scrotal ultrasound: no focal testicular lesion; Doppler ultrasonography: flow within fluid surrounding left testis, large scrotal varicocoele with large varices, dilated vessels communicating to left renal vein; extensive spleno-renal varices

Diagnosis: Scrotal varicocoele associated with portal hypertension

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Dysphagia; 1-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Difficulty swallowing liquids progressing to solids; choking sensation; food stuck in chest; partial relief with belching; pyrosis; occasional vomiting; subacute nonproductive cough for 3-4 weeks; worsening cough; exertional and talking-induced shortness of breath; no nausea; no abdominal pain; no change in bowel habits; no hemoptysis; no fevers; no chills; no night sweats; no weight loss; no myalgia; no arthralgia
Medical_Record.Background: No significant past medical history except prior COVID-19 infection; no palpable lymphadenopathy; HIV Ag/Ab negative; COVID-19 PCR negative

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Afebrile; HR 94; RR 19; O2sat 100% RA; BP 129/81; mild wheezes over lung bases bilaterally; remainder unremarkable
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CBC and CMP normal; ACE level 81 U/L (elevated); CT chest: prominent mediastinal and bilateral hilar adenopathy, multiple pulmonary nodules, mild interlobular septal thickening, peripheral left lower lobe ground-glass opacities; Esophagram: extrinsic mass effect on middle esophagus, bulky mediastinal lymphadenopathy; EBUS with transbronchial needle aspiration: abundant non-necrotizing granulomas, mature lymphocytes, endobronchial cells; Flow cytometry: negative for monoclonal B-cells and abnormal T-cells; GMS and AFB stains negative; Fungus and AFB cultures negative; EGD with dilation: mucosa grossly and histologically normal; Manometry studies unremarkable

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Progressive right ear hearing impairment; 3-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Painless progressive right ear hearing loss culminating in complete hearing loss 2 months prior; associated dizziness; mild gait disturbances
Medical_Record.Background: Well-controlled diabetes; hypertension; history of gastric cancer (no recurrence >20 years); no other relevant history provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Conscious; intact higher cerebral function (MMSE 30); right ear sensorineural hearing loss; pure-tone audiometry 90 dB; speech discrimination test 0 (AAO-HNS class D); other cranial nerves intact; positive Bruns nystagmus; mild derangement in tandem walk
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Brain MRI: right-sided cerebellopontine angle meningioma (26 × 15 × 30 mm), cerebellar peduncular compression; CT: no calcification, normal internal acoustic meatus; postoperative MRI: satisfactory tumor excision, small remnant near right facial-vestibulocochlear nerve complex; histology: WHO CNS grade 1 meningothelial meningioma; preoperative audiometry: PTA 90 dB, SDS 0%; postoperative audiometry: PTA 18.8 dB, SDS 100%

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Sudden onset right hemicranial headache; 6-hour duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Headache waking from sleep; intensity 6/10; right occipital region; not relieved by ibuprofen; dizziness; imbalance; tendency to fall right; numbness and tingling right side of face; choking sensation and cough with drinking water; difficulty speaking; partial closing of right eyelid; no limb weakness; no loss of consciousness
Medical_Record.Background: History of primary hypothyroidism; no diabetes mellitus, hypertension, coronary artery disease, atrial fibrillation, valvular heart disease; non-smoker; no significant family history; no drug allergies; medications include betahistine, aspirin, clopidogrel, statin

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Conscious; normal vitals; unable to speak; understands spoken words; normal muscle tone and power; bilateral plantar reflex flexor; preserved abdominal reflexes; deep tendon reflexes 2+; no clonus
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: MRI brain: small focal area of restricted diffusion in right postero-lateral medulla; MR angiography: irregular narrowing of right vertebral artery; ECG: normal sinus rhythm; Holter and echocardiography unremarkable; routine haematology and biochemistry normal

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Pharmacoresistant headache, behavioral changes, rapid cognitive decline; 2-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Headache unresponsive to medication; behavioral changes; rapid cognitive decline; delay in evaluation due to arm fracture
Medical_Record.Background: History of arterial hypertension, dyslipidemia, breast cancer (negative oncologic follow-up), possible cerebral amyloid angiopathy (CAA)

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Subacute left hemiparesis
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: FLAIR-MRI: moderate ARIA-E in left rolandic sulcus and parietal lobe, decreased sulcal spaces, BGTS value 4; T2-GRE*: multiple cerebral microbleeds (CMBs) in parietal and temporal lobes, CAA severity score 2; CSF: positive anti-Aβ autoantibodies; AT(N) biomarker profile: A+T+(N)−, later A−T+(N)+; APOE genotyping: ε2/ε4 allele; 11C-PK11195 PET: microglial activation in ARIA-E region; follow-up MRI: partial resolution of ARIA-E, 1 new CMB; follow-up CSF: borderline anti-Aβ autoantibodies, reduced Aβ40; follow-up PET: decreased microglial activation

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Headache; 1-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Bitemporal headache; similar to chronic tension headaches; no chest pain; no vision changes; hypertensive urgency with blood pressures 180–220s/140–150s mmHg; three ED visits in one week
Medical_Record.Background: Dyslipidemia; hypothyroidism; nicotine dependence (1/2 pack-per-day cigarette smoker); gender reconstruction surgery (bilateral mastectomy, oophorectomy, hysterectomy at age 29); oral/topical testosterone therapy since age 18; regular care by primary care physician and endocrinologist; no known history of hypertension; taking amlodipine; no cocaine use; no abdominal striae; no drug allergies stated

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Blood pressure 207/136 mmHg; pulse 105 bpm; absence of cervical bruits; normal cardiac and vascular examination; equal bilateral upper extremity blood pressure; normal peripheral pulses; no abdominal bruits; no lower extremity edema
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Electrocardiogram: left ventricular hypertrophy; chest radiography: negative for acute processes; renal duplex ultrasound: severely increased velocities in right mid-to-distal renal artery (peak-systolic velocity 501 cm/s, end-diastolic velocity 246 cm/s, renal/aortic ratio 7.6), right kidney 8.6 cm (smaller than left 10.5 cm); CTA abdomen/pelvis: beading of right renal artery, mild right kidney atrophy, multiple arterial ectasia/aneurysm (splenic, hepatic, bilateral internal iliac arteries); MRA head/neck: no FMD in intracranial arteries, moderate atherosclerotic carotid stenosis; carotid duplex: 50–69% stenosis right internal carotid, <50% left internal carotid; echocardiogram: ejection fraction 60%, left ventricular concentric remodeling; urine drug screen: negative; thyroid-stimulating hormone, aldosterone, cortisol: normal; serum potassium 4.9 mmol/L; sodium 136 mmol/L; creatinine 1.20 mg/dL; angiography: multifocal FMD of right renal artery with severe stenosis; IVUS/OCT: circumferential fibrotic tissue at stenotic lesions; post-angioplasty duplex: improved velocities in right renal artery

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Congenital widespread skin dyspigmentation; duration since birth
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Swirls and streaks of hypo- and hyperpigmentation; sharply demarcated at midline on anterior and posterior trunks; hypertrichosis; dorsal scoliosis; mild asymmetrical distortion of skull; fine motor coordination disturbance; dysorthography
Medical_Record.Background: Amniocentesis performed due to cystic hygroma in first trimester; normal karyotype (46,XY) on amniocentesis; non-consanguineous parents; family history not relevant

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Cytogenetic study on skin fibroblasts: trisomy 7 mosaicism in 5% of metaphases in both hyperpigmented and hypopigmented skin; remaining ancillary exams normal

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Upper abdominal discomfort; 7-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Mild abdominal distension; right lower abdominal tenderness; no specific past medical history including liver disease; no risk factors for portal vein thrombosis
Medical_Record.Background: No significant past medical history; no congenital hematologic disease; no autoimmune disease; no collagen disease; no vasculitis; no family or social history provided; no medication or allergy history provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Mild abdominal distension; right lower abdominal tenderness
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Elevated total leukocyte count (20,500/cm3); elevated C-reactive protein (12.28 mg/dL); contrast-enhanced CT: portal vein thrombosis, mesenteric vein thrombosis, cavernous transformation at porta hepatis, poor contrast area of small bowel loops; pathological examination: segmental whole circumferential mucosal necrosis with congested and edematous mucosa; echocardiography: compression of left ventricle by right ventricle; contrast angiography: bilateral pulmonary artery thrombus; lower extremity echocardiography: deep vein thrombosis in left popliteal vein

Diagnosis: Fatal pulmonary embolism after surgery for small intestinal necrosis caused by idiopathic portal vein thrombosis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Persistent gingival swelling; 3-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Generalized gingival overgrowth; spontaneous bleeding while brushing; throbbing pain from lower left posterior tooth; pus discharge; chronic periapical abscess of tooth 34
Medical_Record.Background: Diabetes mellitus type 2; hypercholesterolemia; hypertension; medications: Glucovance, Simvastatin, Felodipine, Indapamide, Valsartan; last dental visit in 2009 for fixed prosthodontics; poor oral hygiene; no prosthesis for multiple loss of upper posterior teeth; no allergies mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Generalized gingival enlargement and inflammation; abundant calculus; swollen interdental papillae; fiery red, granular, pebbly surface; over erupted tooth 16 with grade II mobility and grade II furcation involvement; palatal root caries; sinus discharge at abutment tooth 34; retained root of 23; poor oral hygiene; pseudopockets 3-7 mm depth
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Panoramic radiograph: periodontal ligament space widening of tooth 16; retained root of 23 with short root canal filling; unilocular radiolucency (11x9 mm) at apical part of tooth 34; histopathology: inflammatory fibro-epithelial hyperplasia

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Erythematous macules, plaques, rare nodules on nose; 1-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Lesions with irregular borders; no improvement with oral tetracyclines, metronidazole, steroids
Medical_Record.Background: Hypertension; ischemic heart disease; benign prostatic hyperplasia; prior treatments for rosacea/rhinophyma

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Skin biopsy: vascular proliferation, atypical plump endothelial cells; immunohistochemistry: CD31 and CD34 positive; total body CT: no significant findings

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Multiple small brown macules on palms and soles; over 4 years
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Macules appeared after cessation of chemotherapy for pre-B acute lymphoblastic leukemia; persistent for over 4 years
Medical_Record.Background: Diagnosis of pre-B acute lymphoblastic leukemia in 2013; treated with UKALL 2011 protocol regimen A (dexamethasone, vincristine, pegaspargase, methotrexate, mercaptopurine, doxorubicin, cyclophosphamide, cytarabine); no further background provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Multiple small brown macules on palmar and plantar surfaces of hands and feet

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Jaundice; 60 days duration after bariatric surgery
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Gradual deterioration of hepatic function and lipid values; onset of jaundice; clinical deterioration after LL-RYGB; initial postoperative course notable for anastomotic leak requiring small bowel resection and new anastomosis; improvement after gastrostomy and enteral feeding
Medical_Record.Background: BMI 80; arterial hypertension; dyslipidemia; waist circumference 135 cm; medications for type 2 diabetes mellitus; underwent scheduled LL-RYGB; postoperative small bowel resection; no longer has diabetes or hypertension at 6 months post-op

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Jaundice; clinical deterioration; improvement after gastrostomy and enteral feeding
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT scan negative for sepsis; blood cultures negative; ultrasound shows serious liver steatosis and perihepatic fluid; total bilirubin 20 mg/dL; liver biopsy reveals steatohepatitis with bridging fibrosis (S3A3F3); improved hepatic values after intervention

Diagnosis: Steatohepatitis with bridging fibrosis after bariatric surgery

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Progressive right arm ecchymosis; 2-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Ecchymosis developed on right upper arm three days after influenza vaccination; initial bruises 0.5 cm; gradual increase in size; spread to entire arm over 1 week; nasal-oral bleeding; alteration in mental status
Medical_Record.Background: No underlying disease; received influenza vaccination (A/Singapore/Infimh-16-0019/2016 (H3N2)-Like Virus; A/Michigan/45/2015 (H1N1)Pdm09-Like Virus ADIMFLU-S (QIS)) on October 18, 2022; intramuscular injection without complications

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Blood pressure 102/69 mm Hg; heart rate 105/min; multiple bruises; nasal-oral bleeding; substantial blood clot in nasal-oral region; alteration in mental status
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Hemoglobin 6.7 g/dL (normocytic anemia); prothrombin time 15.3 seconds; aPTT 78.7 seconds; platelet count 102,000/μL; mixing study: aPTT remained prolonged at 60 seconds after 2 hours; abdominal CT: left retroperitoneal hematoma; Factor 8 assay: 1%; Factor 9 assay: 60.5%; Factor 8 inhibitor: 7.0 BU; Factor 9 inhibitor negative

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Odynophagia and bilateral tonsillar swelling; 3-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Odynophagia and bilateral tonsillar swelling; initial improvement with Augmentin, steroids, Motrin; symptom worsening after 4 days with fevers, chills, tachycardia, dysphagia
Medical_Record.Background: History of hypertension; no other PMH, surgical history, family or social history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel history mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Swelling in posterior pharyngeal wall on flexible endoscopy; neck tenderness bilaterally; restricted neck range of motion due to pain; 1 cm lymph nodes in level IV bilaterally
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: WBC count 13 (elevated); CT soft tissue neck with contrast shows retropharyngeal fluid collection from C2 to C7; interval improvement in RPE from 9 to 4 mm on repeat CT

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Sub-acute neurocognitive decline; several months duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Unable to perform routine daily tasks; difficulties recalling events; disorganized speech; re-oriented easily
Medical_Record.Background: Graves disease (diagnosed 2005, treated with methimazole); endometrial adenocarcinoma s/p total abdominal hysterectomy-bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy and chemotherapy (carboplatin and paclitaxel) in 2009, in remission; no mention of allergies, occupation, family history, social history, immunizations, or travel

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Bilateral and symmetric proptosis; neurological examination: difficulties recalling events, disorganized speech, re-oriented easily
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Laboratory values unremarkable; CT brain: 6.1 x 4.8 x 4.9 cm mass over anterior falx cerebri, moderate surrounding hypodensity, effacement of adjacent sulci, patchy hyper-density (>200 HU, calcification); MRI: irregular intra-axial mass, heterogeneous contrast enhancement, abutting anterior communicating artery; FLAIR: hypointense tubular outlines, considerable vascularity; MR angiogram: multiple vascular pedicles from ACA branches, prominent venous drainages; Cerebral angiogram: extensive blood supply from bilateral ACAs and left MCA, 2.4 x 1.4 x 2.3 cm AVM nidus, prominent venous drainages; Intraoperative frozen section: high-grade glioma; Permanent sections: anaplastic oligodendroglioma (WHO Grade III) and AVM; Immunohistochemistry: IDH1 R132H mutation in tumor, not AVM vessels; FISH: 1p19q deletion; Immunohistochemistry for MLH1, MSH2, MSH6, PMS2: all positive, no mismatch repair gene mutation; Postoperative MRI: gross total resection; Follow-up MRI: no tumor recurrence

Diagnosis: Arteriovenous malformation within isocitrate dehydrogenase 1 mutated anaplastic oligodendroglioma

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Right upper quadrant pain; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: History of acute abdomen; symptomatic liver mass; pain in right upper quadrant; onset and progression not specified
Medical_Record.Background: 15-year history of oral contraceptive use; pregnancy at 12 weeks gestation; no other PMH, surgical history, family/social history, medications, allergies, or contextual data mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Lumpy mass with overswelling vessels projecting from lower margin of liver observed during surgery
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Transabdominal ultrasound: 7 cm mass adjacent to inferior border of liver; CT: exophytic hyperdense lesion from segment VI, central stellate scar, arterial and portal venous phase enhancement; MRI: strong early phase contrast uptake; Macroscopic: multinodular mass with central fibrous scar; Microscopic: multiple nodules, thick fibrous bands, blood vessels with thick walls, mildly enlarged nuclei, partial fatty changes; Immunohistochemistry: map-like pattern of glutamine synthetase

Diagnosis: Pedunculated focal nodular hyperplasia of the liver

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Diarrhea, weight loss, cough; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Symptoms suggestive of AIDS; no opportunistic infection identified
Medical_Record.Background: No data on occupation; no data on PMH, surgical history, family/social history, medications prior to admission, allergies, immunizations, or travel

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CD4+ cell count 50 cells/mm3; HIV viral load undetectable; HIV-2 infection confirmed

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Unexplained rash; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Incidental adrenal tumour detected during investigations for rash; left adrenalectomy performed; postoperative recurrence with peritoneal nodules and left kidney metastasis nine months after diagnosis
Medical_Record.Background: No information on occupation; no details on past medical history, surgical history (other than adrenalectomy), family or social history, medications (except hydrocortisone and mitotane), allergies, immunizations, or travel history

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Preoperative hormonal measurements: plasma cortisol, aldosterone, ACTH, plasma renin activity (non-functional tumour); CT: 9.5 cm left adrenal tumour, peritumoral adipose tissue infiltration, no lymph nodes or distant metastases, native density +40 HU; Histology: vascular invasion, Ki67 10%, mitotic count 3/10 HPF, p53 positivity; TNM T2N0M0, ENSAT stage 2; Postoperative CT: no tumour lesion at 3 and 6 months; 9 months post-diagnosis: abdominal US and CT showed multiple peritoneal nodules, periventricular lymph node, left kidney metastasis; Laparoscopic biopsy: peritoneal carcinomatosis from ACC; Mitotane plasma levels monitored; Serial CT: stable disease at 3 months, partial remission at 6 months, complete remission at subsequent intervals; Autopsy: no metastatic lesions

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Excruciating intractable back, buttock, and leg pain; duration several months

Medical_Record.Background: History of psychiatric disorders; diabetes mellitus; asthma; smoking; middle cerebral artery stroke with persistent sequelae

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CRP negative on admission, positive at 108.0 mg/L next day; procalcitonin negative; chest CT scan unremarkable; fibroscopy removed mucous plug; microscopy of samples negative; cultures identified oropharyngeal microbiota and white mold; subcultures grew white to cream-colored velvety colonies; microscopy showed hyaline septate hyphae with conidiophores producing cylindrical arthroconidia; H. aspergillata confirmed by ITS sequencing; antifungal susceptibility testing performed

Diagnosis: Bacterial aspiration pneumonia with fungal colonization (Hormographiella aspergillata)

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Abdominal cramps, change in bowel habits, tenesmus, weight loss (4 kg); 6-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Abdominal cramps; altered bowel habits; tenesmus; progressive weight loss over 6 months
Medical_Record.Background: History of type I neurofibromatosis (NF1); total thyroidectomy 8 years ago for medullary thyroid carcinoma (MTC); family history of NF1 in daughter and grandson; no family history of thyroid neoplasia; no data on medications, allergies, smoking, or occupation

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Multiple café-au-lait spots on trunk and limbs; numerous skin tumors; freckles in inguinal and axillary regions; Lisch nodules in both irises; abdomen and digital rectal examinations normal; no palpable mass
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Positive fecal blood test; colonoscopy: extrinsic compression of colon wall by 6 cm oval lesion in upper rectum, second submucosal tumor (2 cm) above first; MRI: expansive infiltrative rectal wall lesion (6.0×2.0 cm), isointense to muscle, target signal, variable enhancement, mucous and submucosal involvement, no lymph node enlargement, normal adrenal glands; CEA 0.9 ng/mL, Ca 19-9 6 U/mL; histopathology: neurofibroma of rectum, mesenchymal proliferation, S100 and SOX10 positive, CD117/desmin/CD34/smooth muscle actin/GLUT1/claudin-1 negative; epithelial proliferation with chromogranin A, synaptophysin, cytokeratin positive, confirming well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumor (NET); Ki-67 1%; skin nodules: cutaneous neurofibroma; genetic testing: NF1 exons 2-30 deletion (pathogenic), POLE exon 14 variant of uncertain significance, RET gene negative

Diagnosis: Multiple neuroendocrine neoplasia associated with type I neurofibromatosis (NF1) and well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumor of rectum

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Fever and severe nausea; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Fever 38.4°C; severe nausea; persistent nausea; sudden onset abdominal fullness on day 4
Medical_Record.Background: Gallbladder stones; mild jaundice; elevated hepatobiliary enzymes; slight anemia; diagnosed with cholangitis; treated with antibiotics; no other history provided

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Aspartate aminotransferase 290 U/L; alanine aminotransferase 349 U/L; gamma-glutamyl transpeptidase 511 U/L; total bilirubin 4.8 mg/dL; ultrasonography shows gallbladder stones; CT day 1: no ileus, bile duct obstruction, or dilation; CT day 4: hematoma 72 mm, pseudoaneurysm 24 mm in mesentery of duodenum; angiography: pseudoaneurysm of anterior inferior pancreaticoduodenal arterial branch, early portal vein visualization; slight anemia; elevated hepatobiliary enzymes

Diagnosis: Ruptured pancreaticoduodenal pseudoaneurysm causing arterioportal fistula

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Cardiac tamponade after right coronary artery rupture during coronary angioplasty
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Acute myocardial infarction; underwent coronary angioplasty with drug-eluting stent; developed large hemopericardium and tamponade; pericardiocentesis attempted; abnormally high blood drainage observed; imaging revealed catheter misplacement
Medical_Record.Background: No occupation stated; on aspirin, clopidogrel, and heparin; no other PMH, surgical, family, or social history provided

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Fluoroscopy: catheter tip in inferior vena cava; CT: transhepatic trajectory of catheter, perihepatic peritoneal effusion, no active bleeding; hepatic arteriogram: no arterial injury; digital subtraction angiography: contrast leakage in peritoneal space; cone-beam CT: correct vascular plug placement

Diagnosis: Misplaced pericardiocentesis catheter into inferior vena cava

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Absent anal opening and short right lower limb; since birth
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Asymmetrical abdominal distension toward left; absent anus; poorly developed midline perineal raphe; short right lower limb compared to left; no significant antenatal insult; no maternal diabetes; no consanguinity; no family history of major congenital anomaly
Medical_Record.Background: Born to 38-year-old primigravida; spontaneous vaginal delivery; routine blood investigations within normal limits

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Narrow eyelid folds; widely spaced eyes; rocker bottom feet; asymmetrical abdominal distension; absent anus; poorly developed midline perineal raphe; short right lower limb
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: X-ray spine: kyphoscoliosis, absent right femur, distal femur overriding right iliac bone; Prone cross-table X-ray: high-type anorectal malformation; Echocardiography: atrial septal defect (ostium secundum 1.8 mm, resolved later); Ultrasound abdomen: no abnormality; High-resolution chromosome analysis: 47,XY,+18; Distal cologram: high rectoprostatic fistula

Diagnosis: VACTERL association with Edward syndrome (Trisomy 18) and rare limb anomaly

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Worsening generalized edema, fatigue, shortness of breath; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive edema, fatigue, shortness of breath; lethargy; alert and oriented on presentation
Medical_Record.Background: Hypertension; hyperlipidemia; chronic kidney disease stage 3; heart failure with ejection fraction 27%; atrial fibrillation; metoprolol tartrate, apixaban, dapagliflozin, sacubitril/valsartan, furosemide, aspirin; family history of hypertension and diabetes in mother, hypertension in father; no family history of heart disease

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Afebrile; heart rate 39 bpm; blood pressure 83/38 mmHg; MAP 53 mmHg; oxygen saturation 99% on room air; respiratory rate 20 breaths/min; jugular venous distension; bibasilar lung crackles; generalized pitting edema; cold extremities; 1+ peripheral pulses bilaterally; lethargic but alert and oriented
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Elevated troponin; elevated brain natriuretic peptide; elevated serum creatinine; elevated blood urea nitrogen; elevated serum potassium; elevated lactate without acidosis; ECG: low voltage QRS, no P wave, ventricular escape rhythm, ventricular rate 34 bpm, QRS duration 120 ms; chest X-ray: cardiomegaly, bilateral pulmonary vascular congestion; echocardiography: severe left ventricular concentric hypertrophy, ejection fraction <30%, global longitudinal strain -16% with apical sparing; serum and urine immunofixation unremarkable; serum-free light-chain assay normal; technetium-99m-pyrophosphate scintigraphy: intense diffuse left ventricular myocardial uptake, H/Cl ratio 1.76; gene sequence analysis: pathogenic transthyretin (TTR) gene (p.Val142Ile), heterozygous

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Chronic low back pain; several years duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressively worsening pain; lumbosacral region; radiates down left leg; constant 8/10 throbbing, cramping, shooting pain; all movements elicit pain; exacerbated by prolonged sitting and physical activity; impairment in daily functioning; no inciting events or triggers; no other neurologic sequelae
Medical_Record.Background: Extensive history of treatment-resistant pain; tried meloxicam, duloxetine, muscle relaxants; physical therapy (two courses, six and eight weeks); home isotonic and isometric stretching; steroid injections; lumbar medial branch nerve radiofrequency ablations; spinal cord stimulation; no mention of other PMH, allergies, family or social history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Positive FABER (Patrick’s) test
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Pain relief with steroid injections at pseudoarticulations; intraoperative fluoroscopy confirmed pseudoarticulation; no other labs or imaging specified

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Shortness of breath; rapid deterioration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Admitted with mild COVID-19 pneumonia; rapid progression to acute respiratory distress syndrome; high oxygen requirements; fluctuating clinical state during ICU stay
Medical_Record.Background: Diabetes; hypertension; chronic kidney disease stage 3B (baseline creatinine 81 μmol/L); no occupation stated; no surgical history, family history, social history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel history mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Initial creatinine 81 μmol/L; acute kidney injury with creatinine 134 μmol/L; diagnosis of COVID-19 pneumonia; ARDS; received Remdesivir, dexamethasone, and one dose of Tocilizumab

Diagnosis: COVID-19 pneumonia with acute respiratory distress syndrome and acute kidney injury

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Altered sensorium and syncope; acute onset
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Initial presentation with intracranial hemorrhage; subsequent recurrent headaches and cerebral aneurysms over two years; episodes of congestive heart failure exacerbation
Medical_Record.Background: No specific PMH provided; spouse owned a cat; no medication or allergy history mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT head: large intracranial hemorrhage in left occipito-parietal area with intraventricular extension; catheter cerebral angiogram: fusiform aneurysms in left PCA and right MCA; TTE: moderate to severe mitral regurgitation, thickened anterior mitral leaflet; TEE: myxomatous changes, severe mitral regurgitation; blood cultures: negative; renal biopsy: immune complex-mediated focal segmental necrotizing glomerulonephritis; serology: Bartonella henselae IgG reactive at 1:2560; broad-range bacterial PCR and valve tissue PCR: positive for Bartonella henselae

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Acute respiratory distress syndrome; 2-day duration after hiatal hernia surgery
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Intubation and ventilation; fever; worsening condition with sepsis on day 16; blood cultures positive for Staphylococcus epidermidis and Streptococcus mitis; multiple broad-spectrum antibiotics administered; persistent clinical decline; subcutaneous emphysema and right pneumothorax developed; death on day 45 due to sepsis and myocardial incompetence
Medical_Record.Background: Second surgical treatment for hiatal hernia; supra-mesocolic surgery; prolonged hospital stay; catheter; broad-spectrum antibiotic therapy; no autopsy performed

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Blood cultures positive for Staphylococcus epidermidis and Streptococcus mitis; transoesophageal echocardiography negative for cardiac vegetation; CT scan negative for intra-abdominal infection; mycological cultures positive for Candida glabrata from urine, anal, throat, gastric fluid, and peritoneal samples; antifungal susceptibility testing performed; FKS2 gene mutations detected in peritoneal isolates

Diagnosis: Peritoneal candidiasis due to Candida glabrata with FKS mutations

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Acute onset intractable hiccups, vomiting, dysphagia
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Acute onset intractable hiccups, vomiting, dysphagia; next day development of blurry vision, motor weakness, paresthesias of bilateral lower limbs; subacute onset lower extremity paraparesis, dysesthesia, hyperreflexia; multiple readmissions for painful paroxysmal tonic spasms
Medical_Record.Background: No known past medical history; no finger ulceration, nail pitting, dry eyes, mucus membranes, or skin rash; positive for Raynaud’s phenomenon; no significant family or social history mentioned; medications included IV fluids, anti-emetics, high-dose intravenous methylprednisolone, ACE inhibitor, Azathioprine (discontinued due to hepatotoxicity), Rituximab, Gabapentin, Baclofen, Carbamazepine; allergies not mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Thin appearance; skin thickening of fingers extending proximal to metacarpophalangeal joints bilaterally; stable vital signs; cardiac and pulmonary examinations unremarkable; lower extremity hypertonia, paroxysmal tonic spasms; motor strength 0/5 in lower extremities, intact upper extremity strength; upper extremity reflexes 2+, knee and ankle reflexes 4+ bilaterally; bilateral Babinski’s sign; loss of pinprick and vibratory sensation up to bilateral anterior superior iliac spine; diminished visual acuity bilaterally, no visual field defects, intact extraocular movement; other cranial nerves intact
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Hyponatremia, hypokalemia; brain MRI: multiple scattered hyper-intense T2 flair foci in bilateral periventricular white matter; MRI spine: multiple enhancing lesions C2–C6 consistent with transverse myelitis; CSF: lymphocytic pleocytosis, no oligoclonal bands; negative serologies and PCRs for neurotropic viruses; immunological tests: ANA, anti-RNA polymerase III, Scl-70, NMO-IgG positive; repeat NMO-IgG positive; renal biopsy: obliteration of vascular lumen, concentric fibrinoid necrosis, onion-skin hypertrophy consistent with steroid-induced scleroderma renal crisis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Mobility of left lower back teeth; metallic taste; 2-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Loss of appetite; blue coloration of fingertips in response to cold; morning stiffness affecting small and large joints; progressive skin tightening; dental extractions due to mobility
Medical_Record.Background: Poorly built and nourished; past dental history of extractions (26, 27, 36) 3 years ago; no other medical, surgical, family, or social history mentioned; no medication or allergy history provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Vital signs within normal limits; tightening of skin of extremities; claw-like hands; hypopigmented areas on hands, knee, ankle, pre- and post-auricular region; pale, swollen, stiff, deformed fingertips; smooth, taut mask-like facial skin; atrophied nasal alae; reduced mouth opening; missing teeth (13, 26, 27, 31, 36, 43); mobile teeth (12, 33, 35, 42); root stumps (18, 16, 24, 28, 34, 45, 46); blanching on buccal mucosa and soft palate; hypopigmented areas on mandibular labial mucosa; depapillation and restricted tongue movement; generalized gingival edema with bleeding on probing; stains and calculus deposits
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Intraoral periapical radiographs and orthopantomogram: widening of periodontal ligament space in molars; routine blood investigations: raised ESR (36 mm), positive ANA; hand and feet radiographs: shortening and resorption of phalanges, soft tissue calcific deposits; barium swallow: esophageal constriction; skin biopsy: normal to thin epidermis, dermis replaced by compact collagen, thick-walled dermal blood vessels, hyalinization, sparse lymphocyte infiltration; histopathology suggestive of scleroderma

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Speech impairment; 1-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Speech impairment for 1 month
Medical_Record.Background: History of stage IIIA classical Hodgkin lymphoma (mixed cellularity, EBV-negative) 2 years ago; treated with six cycles of ABVD chemotherapy in January 2017; achieved complete response; no abnormal laboratory findings; no cardiac or abdominal abnormalities reported

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Normal flat affect; normal cardiac and abdominal findings
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Normal complete blood cell count; normal biochemical parameters; cranial MRI shows cranial meningeal carcinomatosis, left frontal space-occupying lesions, prominent vasogenic perilesional edema; histopathology shows classical Hodgkin lymphoma infiltration in CNS and RS cells; positive immunohistochemistry for CD30 and CD15

Diagnosis: Central nervous system involvement by classical Hodgkin lymphoma

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Multiple asymptomatic red spots; 1-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Scattered red spots; linear and unilateral distribution; right upper extremity; C6, C7, C8 dermatomes; blanchable telangiectases; pale ring
Medical_Record.Background: No family history of similar cutaneous findings; no laboratory abnormalities; normal testosterone and estrogen; negative hepatitis A, B, C antibodies

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Blanchable telangiectases; pale ring; right upper extremity; C6, C7, C8 dermatomes
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Normal complete blood cell count; normal serum chemistry panel; normal liver function test; normal testosterone and estrogen; negative hepatitis A, B, C antibodies

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Gait abnormality, hypermobile joints, short stature; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: History of hypotonia and gross motor delay noted at 9 months; gradual improvement in motor milestones; presented at 7 years with gait abnormality, hypermobile joints, short stature; no current motor delay
Medical_Record.Background: Second birth order; third degree consanguineous marriage; full-term gestation; lower segment caesarean section for breech presentation; normal birth weight and length; megalocornea and blue sclerae at birth; no visual impairment; no significant family history; no similar phenotype in family; occupational and physiotherapy for hypotonia; no evidence of scars or ecchymosis; no significant past medical history reported

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Proportionate short stature (height 105 cm, -2SD to -3SD); weight 15.02 kg (-2SD to -3SD); mild hypotonia; waddling gait; hypermobile joints (Beighton score 8); hyperextensible skin (2.8 cm volar forearm, 1.5 cm volar palm); finely wrinkled palms; pes planus; protuberant eyes with bluish sclerae; atrophy of thenar muscles; tapering fingers; no scars or ecchymosis; normal neurological examination except hypotonia
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: MRI brain: abnormal T2 and FLAIR hyperintense signals in bilateral peritrigonal and frontal white matter and centrum semi-ovale, non-progressive; normal thyroid function tests; normal systemic screening (CBC, metabolic profile, liver/renal function, urine, stool, celiac screening); karyotype 46XX; bone age 6 years, height age 4 years at age 7; whole exome sequencing: homozygous missense variation c.682G>A in SLC39A13 gene (p.Asp228Asn); skeletal survey: small ilia, short and wide femoral neck, platyspondyly; 2D ECHO normal

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Dizziness, shortness of breath on exertion, abdominal pain, weight loss; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Chronic dyspepsia; symptoms of dizziness, shortness of breath, abdominal pain, weight loss; no past medical history of chronic illnesses or malignancy; chronic use of proton pump inhibitors
Medical_Record.Background: No significant past medical history; no malignancy; chronic proton pump inhibitor use; no family or social history provided; no medication allergies mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Soft, lax abdomen; mild tenderness on deep palpation in right upper quadrant, epigastrium, peri-umbilical regions
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Hemoglobin 5.8g/dl (anemia); normal electrolytes, urea, creatinine, liver function tests; abdominal ultrasound: small ascites; initial upper GI endoscopy: reflux esophagitis (Los Angeles grade B), scattered polypoid gastric masses, large pedunculated antral polyp with punctate hemorrhages, Forrest class III duodenal ulcer; gastric biopsies: Helicobacter pylori-associated gastritis; follow-up endoscopy: increased size and number of gastric masses, removal of large antral polyp; histopathology: fundic gland polyp; follow-up endoscopy: reduction in size and number of gastric polyps, persistent Helicobacter pylori

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Severe dyspnoea; acute onset
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Severe dyspnoea; no angina pectoris; vertigo after acute phase; paraesthesia of entire left side of body and right arm and leg for 5 days before admission; unsteady gait
Medical_Record.Background: No medical history; no information on surgical history, family history, social history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Blood pressure 240/110 mmHg; upbeat nystagmus; hyperreflexia of lower limbs; unsteady gait
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: ECG: no relevant abnormalities; troponin T and NT-proBNP elevated (27-fold and 26-fold UNL); echocardiography: impaired left ventricular function with basal hypokinesia; cardiac MRI: no acute myocarditis; coronary angiography: no coronary heart disease; echocardiography and blood cultures: endocarditis excluded; catecholamines and metanephrines: normal; brain and spinal MRI: supra- and infratentorial and spinal T2-hyperintense lesions, pontomedullary lesion with Gadolinium-enhancement and high DWI signal; CSF: lymphocytic pleocytosis (13 leucocytes/μL), oligoclonal IgG bands; autoimmune/infectious screening: negative; serum neurofilament: elevated; serum-Aquaporin-4- and -MOG-antibodies: negative; evoked potentials: lesions in somatosensory pathway of left leg and visual pathway of right eye

Diagnosis: Stress cardiomyopathy associated with first manifestation of multiple sclerosis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Depressive symptoms; recurrent episodes since 1999
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: First major depressive episode at age 38; apathy, abulia, social withdrawal, inability to work; multiple severe relapses since 2015; frequent psychiatric hospitalizations for suicide attempts; persistent cognitive symptoms (short-term memory impairment, poor concentration, psychomotor retardation, emotional lability, crying fits, excessive guilt, hopelessness); residual symptoms despite multiple treatments; depressive relapse in May 2021; severe episode in December 2021 with mood deflection, apathy, abulia, anhedonia, somatic anxiety, guilt, suicidal thoughts, hyporexia, weight loss
Medical_Record.Background: Family history of bipolar disorder (mother), MDD and anorexia nervosa (daughter); history of severe dilated cardiomyopathy with ICD and pacemaker implantation; multiple pharmacological treatments (imipramine, lithium, carbamazepine, sertraline, quetiapine, amisulpride, SAMe, choline alfoscerate, nortriptyline, bupropion, atomoxetine, L-methylfolate, minocycline, intranasal esketamine); contraindication to rTMS and ECT due to ICD; no reported side effects or dysbiosis with minocycline; ESR and CRP within reference range

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Severely depressed mood; cognitive symptoms; psychomotor retardation; emotional lability; crying fits; mood stabilization and improvement with treatment; no side effects with minocycline
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: MADRS scores: 36 (initial), 10 (post-lithium), 7 (post-therapy modification), 30 (relapse), 6 (post-ESK), 35 (maintenance phase), 8 (post-atomoxetine/L-methylfolate), 0 (remission), 46 (severe episode), 32 (post-minocycline week 1), 30 (week 2), 6 (week 4); pharmacogenetic analysis: MTHFR activity reduction (~35%); ESR and CRP normal

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Generalized tonic-clonic seizures; 30-minute duration without recovery of consciousness
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Three events of generalized tonic-clonic seizures; persistent coma; myoclonic jerks from chest and abdominal wall; no recovery of consciousness between seizures
Medical_Record.Background: History of left frontal intracranial hemorrhage due to ruptured anterior communicating artery aneurysm; diabetes mellitus; liver cirrhosis due to chronic hepatitis B; medications: metformin, linagliptine, tenofovir; no surgical history, family or social history, allergies, immunizations, or travel history mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Blood pressure 125/55 mmHg; heart rate 112/min; body temperature 37.2°C; coma with intact brainstem reflexes; no lateralizing sign; no focal neurological deficit except myoclonic jerks
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Initial CK 727 IU/L (elevated); eGFR 70 mL/min/1.73 m2 (normal); BUN 13 mg/dL (normal); creatinine 1.31 mg/dL (normal); brain CT: encephalomalacia at left frontal lobe; 24hr EEG: continuous medium amplitude theta to delta slowing on left hemisphere, no epileptiform discharges; CK and creatinine increased to 1,823 IU/L and 2.93 mg/dL on day 2; CK peaked at 3,825 IU/L on day 7; CK normalized at day 13 after phenytoin discontinued

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Heavy dysuria, pollakisuria, lower-abdominal cramps; 8 months after cervical cancer diagnosis
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Persistent dysuria and pollakisuria; lower-abdominal cramps; symptoms unresponsive to antibiotics and analgesics; admitted for further evaluation
Medical_Record.Background: History of stage IVB cervical cancer; treated with 6 courses of radiochemotherapy and brachytherapy; right kidney obstruction with ureter catheter; past surgical history: gastric banding, abdominoplasty, recurrent breast abscess excision; smoking history: 45 pack-years; past cocaine and heroin abuse (ceased); spontaneous vaginal deliveries at ages 18 and 20; no previous cancer; no proven urinary tract infections; one episode of pyelonephritis post-therapy; unable to quit smoking despite nicotine-replacement and varenicline

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Not specified
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Sterile leukocyturia; cystoscopy: 3 small mucosal lesions, 1 ulceration; CT: multiple micronodular and cystic lung lesions, diffuse hypodense liver lesions; ELISPOT for Mycobacterium tuberculosis, HIV, ANA/ANCA negative; liver and lung biopsies: Langerin (CD207) and CD1a-positive histiocytes with eosinophils; BRAF and MAP2K1 wild-type; bladder biopsy: LCH confirmed; PET-CT: multisystem involvement (lungs, liver, bone, bladder); increased alkaline phosphatase; lung function: capacity 86% predicted, diffusion capacity 48% predicted, pO2 63 mm Hg, pCO2 32 mm Hg; no cough or dyspnea; serial PET-CT and CT: partial remission of LCH, persistent bladder infiltration; recurrence of cervical cancer with positive pelvic lymph nodes

Diagnosis: Systemic Langerhans Cell Histiocytosis with bladder involvement

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Abnormal chest X-ray; large right-sided pleural effusion; asymptomatic
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: No respiratory or constitutional symptoms; abnormal chest X-ray during immigration screening; dullness to percussion and absent breath sounds on right lower and middle lung zones
Medical_Record.Background: History of endometriosis diagnosed four years prior; severe dysmenorrhea; hormonal therapy for three months; excisional biopsy of umbilical mass with endometrial origin; primary infertility; no significant findings on initial tuberculosis work-up

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Dullness to percussion; absent breath sounds on right lower and middle lung zones
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Chest X-ray shows right pleural effusion; pleural fluid analysis: glucose 5.3 mmol/L, LDH 314 U/L, protein 47.7 gm/L, total nucleated cells 250/μL, RBCs 104,062/μL; thoracoscopy shows inflamed parietal pleura; tissue biopsy confirms endometriosis; abdominal ultrasound shows fluid in right and left iliac fossae and subcutaneous fat plane of umbilical mass; chest CT shows right pleural effusion, pleural thickening, bilateral apical thickening, mildly enlarged right axillary lymph nodes; follow-up X-ray shows re-accumulation of pleural fluid with menstruation

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Progressively worsening shortness of breath; 2-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Insidious onset dyspnea; MMRC IV; worsened over past 7 days; worsened while sleeping on right lateral side; paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea; left-sided chest pain; abdominal pain; anxiety
Medical_Record.Background: History of multiple episodes of alcohol-induced pancreatitis; significant daily alcohol consumption for over 10 years; family and psychosocial history not relevant; no information on medications, allergies, immunizations, travel

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Blood pressure 150/100 mmHg; SpO2 70%; reduced air entry on left side
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Normal CBC, urine RE, RFT, LFT, glucose, coagulation profile; ultrasonography shows significant left pleural effusion (~1 L); CT scan shows pancreatic inflammation, peripancreatic fat strandings, minimal collections, heterogeneous enhancement, non enhancing areas, gross free fluid in left pleural cavity, left lung collapse/consolidation, modified CT severity index 8/10; MRCP shows heterogeneous pancreatic signal, ill-defined margins, fluid surrounding pancreas, necrotic pancreatitis, possible pseudocyst formation, extension into chest cavity; pleural fluid aspiration: dark red hemorrhagic fluid, ~1000 ml drained, watery consistency, no abnormal odor; pleural fluid analysis: protein 5.3 g/dl, glucose 71 mg/dl, TLC 700/mg (20% neutrophils, 80% lymphocytes), RBCs present, LDH 910–1738 U/L, ADA 33.8 μ/l, amylase 12442, cell count 350 (N60 L50); serum amylase/lipase 224/514; ECG: sinus tachycardia, q-wave in I avL V5–V6

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Increasing dysphagia, odynophagia, otalgia with swallowing; 6-month duration after chemoradiotherapy
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive difficulty swallowing; painful swallowing; ear pain on swallowing; intermittent radiating left neck pain in trigeminal nerve distribution; onset approximately six months post concurrent chemotherapy and radiotherapy for T3N2b oropharyngeal squamous cell carcinoma
Medical_Record.Background: History of T3N2b oropharyngeal squamous cell carcinoma treated with chemoradiotherapy; other past medical history noncontributory; medications include lactulose, allopurinol, vitamin D, omega 3, glucosamine, omeprazole, diclofenac/misoprostol, rosuvastatin, bisoprolol

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Ulcerated area in left pharyngeal wall on flexible nasolaryngoscopy; improvement and eventual healing of ulcerated area after PENTO protocol
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Two biopsies of ulcerated area negative for malignancy; flexible nasolaryngoscopy findings as above

Diagnosis: Soft-tissue radionecrosis of the pyriform sinus

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Severe lower extremity weakness and paresthesia; duration 3 months
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive, ascending numbness and paresthesia of lower extremities and hands; moderate improvement with IVIg; worsening sensory neuropathy and weakness; new-onset dysarthria; minimal improvement with repeat IVIg and steroids; worsening lower extremity weakness; unable to stand; dysarthria; mild dysphagia to thick liquids and saliva; intermittent dizziness; nocturnal leg twitching; marked fatigue; unintentional weight loss of 25 pounds; asthenia; lower extremity muscle wasting; no headaches, visual changes, abnormal bleeding, bruising, skin rashes, myalgias, or neuropathic pain
Medical_Record.Background: History of hypothyroidism, mild sensorineural hearing loss, plaque psoriasis; up to date with colonoscopy and PSA screening; medication: levothyroxine 25 mcg daily; bilateral cataract surgery; no smoking or illicit drug use; occasional social alcohol use; family history: testicular mesothelioma in father; no other cancer, bleeding, thrombotic, or neurologic disorders; no recent travel, sick contacts, or tick bites

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Cachectic appearance; proximal muscle wasting; vital signs within normal limits; unremarkable lymph nodes; no rashes or bruising; soft abdomen; no palpable masses; no hepatosplenomegaly; left-eye horizontal nystagmus; grossly diminished strength in lower extremities; hyporeflexia; 1+ patellar reflexes; absent upper extremity and ankle jerk reflexes; hypersensitivity to pinprick; diminished sensation to soft touch and vibration in all extremities; dysmetria on finger-to-nose testing; positive Romberg's test; ataxic gait with spastic component
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Normal infection, vitamin, mineral, paraproteinemia, inflammatory marker, and compressive neuropathy workup; CSF: high protein (800 mg/L), normal WBC (5/mm3), oligoclonal bands; EMG/NCS: demyelination; CBC: mild thrombocytopenia and anemia; normal electrolytes, coagulation, hepatic, and renal function; negative autoimmune paraneoplastic panel; CSF flow cytometry: negative; serum protein electrophoresis: elevated M-protein (1.2 g/L), IgM kappa restriction; PET/CT: splenomegaly, borderline hepatomegaly, increased mediastinal, axillary, mesenteric lymph nodes (not enlarged or FDG avid), moderate bone marrow hypermetabolism; MRI brain: FLAIR signal abnormality, contrast enhancement of superior cerebellar peduncles; bone marrow biopsy: hypercellularity, DLBCL 15-30% of cells, double-hit negative; LDH: 210 U/L; uric acid: 0.24 mmol/L; IPI: 3 (intermediate CNS risk); follow-up PET/CT and MRI: no active disease; repeat bone marrow biopsy: low-normocellular, no lymphoma

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Chronic cough; 2-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Persistent cough; previously diagnosed clinical asthma; normal spirometry without albuterol; negative allergy tests; episode of pneumococcal bacteremia 12 months prior; no recurrent fevers
Medical_Record.Background: Received all routine childhood vaccinations; pneumococcal vaccine after hospitalization; no follow-up titer; no recurrent/periodic fevers; no mention of surgical history, family history, social history, medications, or allergies

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Maxillary sinusitis on plain film
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Spirometry: 8% improvement in FEV1 post-albuterol; IgA 626 mg/dL (repeat 689 mg/dL); normal IgG, IgM, IgE <2 kU/L; normal T, B, NK lymphocyte subsets; normal DHR flow; pneumococcal titers unchanged or decreased; non-detectable diphtheria, Hemophilus influenza b, varicella titers; rubella titer protective; IgD 23.9 mg/dL (Ref <15.3); post-vaccination: non-responsive diphtheria Ab IgG, tetanus Ab IgG increased from 0.1 to 0.3 IU/mL, no rise in VZV Ab IgG, H. influenzae b Ab IgG fell from 0.1 to negative, pneumococcal antibodies unchanged

Diagnosis: Antibody deficiency with near-normal immunoglobulins or hyperimmunoglobulinemia

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Slurred speech, lower limb weakness, dizziness, nausea; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Acute onset slurred speech, lower limb weakness, dizziness, nausea; progression to fever (max 39.1°C), lethargy, confusion; transferred to ICU; developed respiratory failure, cardiac arrest, pulmonary embolism during hospitalization
Medical_Record.Background: History of cervical polyp surgery; no other comorbidities; no personal or family history; no clear history of contact with birds or poultry

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Height 1.6 m; weight 58 kg; BMI 22.65 kg/m2; HR 124 bpm; RR 23 bpm; SO2 88%; mild cyanosis of lips; dysarthria; shortness of breath; wet rales in both lower lungs; grade IV muscle strength in lower limbs
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: ABGA: pH 7.554, pCO2 27.8 mmHg, pO2 53.6 mmHg; APACHE II score 12; SOFA score 4; brain MRI: reversible lesion of corpus callosum; initial lung CT: extensive patchy and consolidation shadows in right lower lobe, left pleural hypertrophy; repeat lung CT: increased lesion area; lower limb US: no abnormality initially, later inter-muscular vein thrombosis; FFB: blocked bronchial openings with yellow mucous sputum, congested airway mucosa; BALF mNGS: chlamydia psittaci; emergency PA: bilateral main pulmonary artery embolism; follow-up lung CT: pneumonia, mild pleural hypertrophy, interstitial changes, ground-glass nodules, small nodules

Diagnosis: Psittacosis-induced severe acute respiratory distress syndrome with pulmonary embolism and cardiac arrest

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Scheduled LVAD insertion for advanced heart failure
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Inotrope-dependent for 8 months; admitted for LVAD placement; post-operative course complicated by coagulopathy, delayed sternal closure, and progressive renal dysfunction with rising creatinine and decreased urine output
Medical_Record.Background: Stage D HFrEF due to mixed ischemic and nonischemic cardiomyopathy; stage III chronic kidney disease; no additional history provided

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Admission creatinine 1.45 mg/dL; right heart catheterization: PaPi 9.3, CVP 3 mmHg; intraoperative TEE: adequate RV function, PaPi 1.5; post-op PaPi dropped to 0.94, CVP rose to 16 mmHg; creatinine increased to 3.51 mg/dL, urine output dropped to 0.1 cc/kg/h; after RVAD and CRRT, creatinine improved to 1.26 mg/dL, urine output increased to 1 cc/kg/h, CVP 10 mmHg

Diagnosis: Postcardiotomy right ventricular dysfunction with acute kidney injury

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Renal transplantation; duration not stated
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Known hypertension for 14 years; HIV infection diagnosed December 2005 after febrile illness; started on HAART February 2007; ESRD diagnosed February 2007; started on hemodialysis; came to India for renal transplantation
Medical_Record.Background: Hypertension; HIV infection; ESRD; on lamivudine, stavudine, efavirenz; no evidence of opportunistic infections, malignancy, or AIDS-defining illness; donor is elder brother; same blood group; HLA haplo-match; negative lymphocytotoxicity cross-match; donor GFR 118.3 ml/min; no induction therapy; started on tacrolimus, mycophenolate sodium, steroids post-transplant; discharged on tacrolimus; last follow-up at 1 year: serum creatinine 1.1 mg/dl, TAC level 9.1 ng/ml

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: HIV RNA undetectable; CD4 count 415/cmm pre-op, 418/cmm post-op; serum creatinine 0.9 mg/dl third postoperative day; donor GFR 118.3 ml/min; lymphocytotoxicity cross-match negative; HLA haplo-match; TAC level 8.6 ng/ml at discharge; serum creatinine 1.1 mg/dl at 1 year; TAC level 9.1 ng/ml at 1 year

Diagnosis: End-stage renal disease secondary to HIV infection

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Painful mass in left foot; 1-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Spontaneous onset of painful mass; pain and swelling in metatarsophalangeal joints of great and second toes; progressive bone destruction; severe pain
Medical_Record.Background: Hyperuricemia; no history of gout; febuxostat 20 mg prescribed; no other background information provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Pain and swelling in metatarsophalangeal joints of left great and second toes
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Uric acid 9.1 mg/dL (elevated); WBC 8,500/μL (normal); CRP 0.03 mg/dL (normal); Radiographs and CT: bony erosions in first and second metatarsal heads, soft tissue calcification; MRI: mass-like lesions with mixed signals in MTP joints; Intraoperative: milky white fluid, white crystals in fibrous tissue, cartilage covered with crystals; Histopathology: needle-like shell consistent with gouty tophus

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Fever and fatigue; initial presentation
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Fever (38.5°C) on day of Moderna vaccine (second dose); low-grade fever for two days; fatigue, myalgia, headache; new onset nausea, vomiting, diarrhea (one day duration) on return visit; hypotension (BP 80/66 mmHg); progressive hemodynamic instability
Medical_Record.Background: Food allergy to tree nuts and peanuts; partial right nephrectomy; stable mild chronic kidney disease since birth (Urea: 8 mmol/L, Creatinine: 110 umol/L); no known COVID-19 exposures; no recent viral illness; no other risk factors; COVID-19 PCR negative

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Hypotension (BP 80/66 mmHg); hemodynamic instability; anuric state
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: ECG: diffuse ST elevation, short PR interval; echocardiography: decreased right and left ventricular function, EF 27%, moderate pericardial effusion, signs of impending cardiac tamponade; Troponin T: 98–1,632 ng/L (elevated); pro-BNP: 2,862–36,064 pg/L (elevated); other labs: unremarkable CBC, inflammatory markers, autoimmune profile, viral panel, cultures; evidence of acute kidney injury, deranged liver function, DIC; pericardiocentesis: 300 mL fluid drained; serial ECG: no significant changes post-intervention; echocardiography: minimal pericardial effusion post-pericardiocentesis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Recurrent axillary and groin abscesses; more than 20-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressively worsening hidradenitis suppurativa; wider area involvement; more frequent abscess formation and cellulitis; multiple hospital presentations for intravenous antibiotics and incision and drainage
Medical_Record.Background: Hypertension stabilized with ACE-inhibitor; meticulous hygiene; previous oral and topical antibiotics and steroids; BMI 30

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Left axilla with severe hidradenitis suppurativa; multiple abscesses discharging pus; surrounding induration and scarring; other areas not acutely infected
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Intraoperative swabs: Streptococcus milleri growth

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Severe left eye pain, photophobia, decreased visual acuity; 8 days after LASIK
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Uncomplicated bilateral LASIK for low myopic astigmatism; clear cornea and normal anterior segment on postoperative days 1 and 5; acute onset severe pain, photophobia, and decreased visual acuity in left eye on day 8; right eye normal
Medical_Record.Background: No prior systemic or ocular history; preoperative refractive error: right eye -3.00 D Sph / -1.00 D Cyl × 180°, left eye -2.75 D Sph / -1.00 D Cyl × 180°; no significant PMH; no family or social history mentioned; no medication or allergy history prior to event

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Left eye: mild flap edema, peripheral epithelial bullae, intense flare and cells in anterior chamber, thick fibrinous exudates, pigments on endothelium and anterior lens capsule, no keratic precipitates, clear corneal stromal bed; intraocular pressure: right eye 11 mm Hg, left eye 9 mm Hg; posterior segment normal in both eyes
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Uncorrected visual acuity: right eye 20/20, left eye 20/80; blood counts, ESR, CRP, Mantoux test, VDRL, chest X-ray, HIV serology, HLA typing all within normal limits; HLA B27-negative

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Progressively worsening mid back pain; 4-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Mid back pain; gradual progression; no muscle weakness; no sensory loss; no unintentional weight loss; no fever; no night sweats
Medical_Record.Background: Previously healthy; no significant past medical history; no palpable lymphadenopathy; no hepatosplenomegaly; routine blood work normal; no information on medications, allergies, family or social history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Unremarkable; no palpable lymphadenopathy; no hepatosplenomegaly
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: MRI: diffusely altered T2 signal of T11 vertebral body extending into pedicles; no fracture, cord compression, or discrete mass; core needle biopsy: high-grade malignant spindle cell neoplasm, 19 mitoses per 10 HPF, storiform pattern, 50% necrosis; immunohistochemistry: negative for keratin, S-100, CDK4, MDM2; PET-CT: hypermetabolic activity confined to T11 vertebral body, sclerotic deformity; vertebrectomy specimen: DLBCL, intermediate to large lymphoid cells, open chromatin, prominent nucleoli, positive for CD20, CD79A, PAX5, BCL6, CD45; bone marrow biopsy: negative for malignancy

Diagnosis: Primary Lymphoma of Bone (Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma)

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Right-sided nasal obstruction; 3-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Slow progressive right-sided nasal obstruction; right-sided facial fullness and pain; occasional purulent right nasal discharge; post-nasal secretions; no change in smell
Medical_Record.Background: History of dental filling for right upper tooth cavity 1.5 years ago; no co-morbidities; no prior surgeries or trauma; minimal intermittent alternative nasal obstruction prior to current illness

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Nasal polyp descending lateral to middle turbinate and running posteriorly; nasal septal deviation to right; no polyps or discharge on left; clear post nasal drip; unremarkable head and neck exam
