Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Endoscopic nasal exam: protruding soft glistening polyp in right middle meatus extending to posterior choana; severe septal deviation to right; CT: large polypoidal soft tissue mass obliterating right nasal cavity and extending to right choana; complete soft tissue obliteration of right maxillary sinus with central calcific density; intraoperative: cheesy clay-like debris and fungal ball in right maxillary sinus; histopathology: right nasal polyp consistent with antrochoanal polyp, right maxillary sinus content consistent with aspergillus (fungus ball)

Diagnosis: Unilateral concomitant antrochoanal polyp and fungus ball in maxillary sinus

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Progressively worsening left-sided chest wall pain radiating to left shoulder and arm; 4-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Insidious onset; pain worse at night; unresponsive to over-the-counter painkillers; crushing chest sensation; pulsating shooting arm pain; pain radiating down ulnar aspect of forearm to medial one and a half digits; spread over dorsum of forearm and rest of digits; paraesthesia; severe pain with upper limb movement; temporary relief with GTN spray
Medical_Record.Background: Hypertension; gastro-oesophageal reflux disease; medications: losartan, omeprazole; COVID-19 vaccination to left deltoid two weeks prior (fourth dose, Moderna; previous three Pfizer); right-hand dominant; no surgical history, family history, or allergies mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: No wasting; no overlying skin changes; tenderness along shoulder blade and pectoralis major; nil sensory deficit in dermatomes; weakness in abduction of digits 2 and 4; absence of deep tendon reflexes in left upper limb
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Normal full blood count, CRP, inflammatory markers, renal and liver function, troponin; normal ECG, echocardiogram, CT angiogram, aortic angiogram; non-contrast MRI: thickening and high signal change in left brachial plexus; electromyography and nerve conduction studies: partial axonal left medial cord involvement, active denervation in left pronator teres, unstable motor units, slight asymmetry in medial antebrachial cutaneous sensory response, no long thoracic nerve involvement

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Progressive shortness of breath with moderate exertion; several weeks duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Ongoing dyspnea with moderate intensity exertion; fatigue; difficulty maintaining exercise intensity; no orthopnea; no paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea; no chest pain; no dizziness; no syncope; no diaphoresis; no dyspnea at rest or with mild exertion
Medical_Record.Background: History of anabolic steroid use disorder; daily injections for eight months; no family history of cardiomyopathy; no recent viral illness; no alcohol or illicit substance use; polycythemia; borderline dyslipidemia; no drug allergies

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Euvolemic; hemodynamically stable; no peripheral edema; no basilar crackles; no jugular venous distension; no pulmonary vascular congestion
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Transthoracic echocardiogram: severely dilated left ventricle; left ventricular ejection fraction 21.7%; global hypokinesis; grade 3 diastolic dysfunction; normal right ventricular structure and function; no left ventricular hypertrophy; no valvular dysfunction; ECG: sinus rhythm; left anterior fascicular block; T wave inversions in inferior leads, V5, V6; borderline ST segment elevation in V1-V3; reciprocal mild ST segment depression in inferior leads; serial cardiac biomarkers negative; chemistry panel and BNP normal; CBC: polycythemia, normal WBC; lipid profile: borderline dyslipidemia

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Abnormal laboratory workup; unknown duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Elevated serum creatinine (5.9 mg/dL) from baseline (0.9 mg/dL) over six months; subjective oliguria; no flank pain; no abdominal pain; no urinary symptoms
Medical_Record.Background: Asthma; gastroesophageal reflux disease; fibromyalgia; obstructive sleep apnea; osteoporosis (treated with calcium supplements); remote sparse ibuprofen use; no nephrotoxic medications; no herbal supplements; no history of vitamin C, cyclooxygenase-2 inhibitors, orlistat, ethylene glycol, gastric bypass surgery, or malabsorptive disorders; normal vitamin B6 level; negative family history for primary hyperoxaluria

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Serum creatinine 5.9 mg/dL (elevated); urinalysis negative for protein, blood, cells, or casts; renal ultrasound: increased cortical echogenicity, no obstructions or stones; serology negative for ANA, dsDNA, normal complement; 24-hour creatinine clearance 8 ml/min; kidney biopsy: tubular injury with calcium oxalate deposition; serum oxalate 8.9 μmol/L (elevated); genetic testing negative for primary hyperoxaluria

Diagnosis: Idiopathic oxalate nephropathy leading to end-stage kidney disease

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Epigastric pain, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea; 1-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Epigastric pain, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea for 1 week; no weight loss, arthralgia, dysuria, gross hematuria, or fever
Medical_Record.Background: HIV on highly active antiretroviral therapy; no previous renal disease; no prior gastrointestinal disorders, upper respiratory tract infections, systemic allergies, or malignancies; nonsmoker; nonalcoholic; drug-free; family history negative for cancer and renal disorders; sexual history positive for single male partner less than 1 year

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Afebrile; normotensive; maculopapular rash on trunk; palpable small axillary and inguinal lymph nodes; epigastric and perianal tenderness; 1+ leg edema

Diagnosis: Membranous glomerulonephritis secondary to secondary syphilis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Right-sided weakness; 3-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Sudden onset right-sided weakness, hypoesthesia, occasional headaches; initial symptoms included headache, transient vision loss, slurred speech, vomiting, brief loss of consciousness; symptoms began during daily activities; treated conservatively due to lack of imaging; delayed referral due to COVID-19
Medical_Record.Background: No history of trauma, infection, hypertension, diabetes, stroke; no significant personal or family history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Normal vital signs; GCS 15; no meningeal signs; good cognitive function; normal cranial nerves; right-sided motor weakness (strength 4/5); increased tone and physiologic reflexes on right; no pathologic reflexes; right-sided hypoesthesia; normal autonomic function
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Laboratory tests, chest X-ray, ECG normal; non-contrast head CT: left cerebral hemisphere intracerebral hematoma; head CT angiography: left frontal lobe arteriovenous malformation with feeding artery from left anterior cerebral artery, draining into superior sagittal sinus; DSA: AVM fed by left pericallosal artery, two draining veins (one with stenosis); Spetzler-Martin Grade II AVM

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Fever and general malaise; 1-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Fever and general malaise onset; positive PCR for SARS-CoV-2; symptoms persisted for 10 days; developed cough and dyspnea; admitted to hospital
Medical_Record.Background: Multiple myeloma; chemotherapy with lenalidomide and dexamethasone; two SARS-CoV-2 vaccinations (Pfizer/BioNTech) six and five months prior; no other history provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: SpO2 94% on nasal cannula 3 L; respiratory deterioration requiring HFNC O2 60%, 40 L/h; SpO2 improved to 97% on nasal cannula 1 L at discharge
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: WBC 2.16×10^3/μL (68.9% neutrophils, 29.2% lymphocytes, 1.9% monocytes, 0.0% eosinophils, 0.0% basophils); platelet count 97×10^3/μL; hemoglobin 8.8 g/dL; blood urea nitrogen 17.4 g/L; serum creatinine 0.80 mg/dL; AST 36 U/L; ALT 59 U/L; CRP 17.35 mg/dL; SARS-CoV-2 IgM 5.7 COI, IgG-spike 334 IU/mL, IgG-nucleocapsid 5 IU/mL; chest X-ray/CT: massive GGOs in both lung fields, severe deterioration on day 15, improvement by day 30; SARS-CoV-2 Ag titers: 217.0 IU (admission), 2.28 IU (post-treatment), 482 IU (day 23), 1.36 IU (day 30)

Diagnosis: COVID-19 pneumonia with underlying multiple myeloma

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Bilateral ovarian mass; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: History of breast carcinoma operated six years ago; presents with bilateral ovarian mass
Medical_Record.Background: Previous infiltrating ductal cell carcinoma of breast; no other PMH, medications, allergies, family or social history mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: FNAC: cell clusters with high nuclear-cytoplasmic ratio, vesicular nucleus, conspicuous nucleoli; Hysterectomy with bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy performed; Ovaries: multiple nodules 0.5-1 cm, well-circumscribed white to yellow nodules; Histopathology: cords and clusters of malignant cells, tubular glands and nests similar to ductal carcinoma of breast

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Neck pain; immediate onset after eating fish
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Non-radiating neck pain; moderate intensity; worsened with swallowing and coughing; onset immediately after fish ingestion
Medical_Record.Background: History of cerebral vascular accident (3 years ago); hypertension; hyperlipidemia; hypothyroidism; gastroesophageal reflux disease; no known foreign body ingestion reported

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Hemodynamically stable; no acute distress
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Soft tissue neck X-ray: fish hook foreign body in cervical esophagus at cricopharyngeus; pathology: steel metal fish hook (1.7 cm) with attached plastic string; gastrografin swallow: normal esophagus, no perforation

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Painless abdominal distension; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Abdominal mass detected; history of celiac disease for six years; compliant with gluten-free diet; no anemia; developed habit of pulling out and eating hair over last year; stress during examination periods; weak peer relationships; spends time alone
Medical_Record.Background: Celiac disease diagnosed six years ago; no anemia; no pathological findings on direct abdominal radiography or ultrasonography; initial positive celiac serology, now negative; started sertraline for anxiety and depressive disorder; cognitive and behavioral therapy; no other significant PMH, surgical history, family or social history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel history mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Abdominal mass from left upper quadrant to right upper quadrant crossing midline; less hair in frontal region of scalp; other systemic examinations normal
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: WBC 8,900/ul; hemoglobin 12.4 mg/dl; hematocrit 38.4%; thrombocytes 337,000/ul; iron 60 ug/dl; iron binding capacity 250 ug/dl; folic acid 11 ng/ml; ferritin 15 ng/ml; vitamin B12 216 pg/ml; tissue transglutaminase IgA 27.58 RU/ml; anti-gliadin IgA negative; anti-endomysium IgA negative; direct abdominal radiography normal; abdominal ultrasonography normal; CT shows soft tissue densities compatible with bezoar; trichobezoar removed surgically

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: General fatigue, loss of appetite, nausea, vomiting, constipation; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive fatigue, anorexia, nausea, vomiting, constipation; pelvic tumor detected on CT; referred for suspected gynecological disorder
Medical_Record.Background: No significant medical history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Severe fatigue, loss of appetite, constipation; no disturbance of consciousness; no electrocardiogram abnormality
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: WBC 21,060/ml (elevated); CRP 13.3 mg/dl (elevated); BUN 40 mg/dl (elevated); creatinine 1.98 mg/dl (elevated); calcium 18.0 mg/dl (hypercalcemia); CT: 16 cm pelvic tumor with cystic and solid parts; no distant metastasis or lymphadenopathy; CA 19-9 1,611 IU/ml (elevated); PTHrP 25.9 pmol/ml (elevated); PTH-intact 14 pg/ml (low-normal); G-CSF 73 pg/ml (elevated); macroscopic: right ovarian tumor, smooth surface, 2 kg, brown liquid, soft opal-colored solid part; histopathology: atypical cells with clear cytoplasm and anisonucleosis in sheet-like and cystic structures; immunohistochemistry: partial PTHrP positivity, G-CSF positivity; negative peritoneal cytology; staged pT1a

Diagnosis: Ovarian clear cell carcinoma producing parathyroid hormone-related protein and granulocyte colony-stimulating factor

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Diffuse itchy skin; 6-week duration after starting nilotinib
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Onset of diffuse itchy skin; follicular erythematous papules; hair thinning; alopecia; especially on extensor surface of upper limbs; symptoms began six weeks after initiation of nilotinib
Medical_Record.Background: Chronic myeloid leukemia diagnosed in 2004; treated with imatinib (2007-2010); switched to nilotinib due to poor hematologic response; no additional background provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Diffuse itchy skin; follicular erythematous papules; hair thinning; alopecia; especially on extensor surface of upper limbs
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Biopsy of upper right limb lesion: hair follicle with interstitial mucin deposition around atrophic isthmus; mild perivascular lymphocytic inflammatory infiltrate; perifollicular fibrosis excluded

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Oropharyngeal dysphagia; 3-year duration after breast cancer diagnosis
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive dysphagia to liquids and solids; no odynophagia; malnutrition; failure to thrive; PEG tube placement
Medical_Record.Background: History of invasive ductal carcinoma (left breast); HIV (well controlled on zidovudine, lamivudine, efavirenz); ischemic cardiomyopathy (EF 20%); dyslipidemia; essential hypertension; declined BRCA screening; segmental mastectomy with sentinel node biopsy; negative surgical margins; negative sentinel lymph nodes; pathologic stage pT1bN0; declined adjuvant therapy; annual surveillance mammogram; no drug allergies mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Ultrasonography: 0.6 × 0.4 × 0.6 cm breast mass; Biopsy: invasive ductal carcinoma, nuclear grade 3, moderate peritumoral lymphoid infiltrate, ER weakly positive (H score 15), PR weakly positive (H score 30), HER2-negative, Ki-67 70%; Modified barium swallow: severe oropharyngeal dysphagia; Flexible laryngoscopy: normal vocal cords, no anatomical abnormalities; AchR-Ab negative; Brain MRI: ruled out multiple sclerosis, progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy, brain metastasis; CSF: non-specific oligoclonal bands; Infectious workup: negative for syphilis and Lyme disease; CT chest/abdomen/pelvis: no metastatic lesion; Serum onconeural antibodies: VGCC antibodies >30 pmol/L

Diagnosis: Voltage-Gated Calcium Channel Antibody-Induced Oropharyngeal Dysphagia as Paraneoplastic Neurological Syndrome in Breast Cancer

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Genital anomalies; duration since age 7
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Global developmental delay, most profound in language; short stature; microcephaly; facial dysmorphisms including facial asymmetry, midface hypoplasia, broad and prominent forehead, mild hypertelorism, strabismus, broad nasal bridge, long and smooth philtrum, thin upper lip, high palate, low-set ears with prominent antihelix; subglandular hypospadias; cryptorchidism; hands with fifth finger clinodactyly, abnormal palmar creases; severe bilateral hallux valgus
Medical_Record.Background: Born after uneventful pregnancy; birth weight 2300 g (<3rd percentile), height 49 cm (>15th percentile); two healthy brothers; parents healthy and non-consanguineous; bilateral hallux valgus surgically repaired at 13 years old

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Short stature; microcephaly; facial asymmetry; midface hypoplasia; broad and prominent forehead; mild hypertelorism; strabismus; broad nasal bridge; long and smooth philtrum; thin upper lip; high palate; low-set ears with prominent antihelix; subglandular hypospadias; cryptorchidism; fifth finger clinodactyly; abnormal palmar creases; severe bilateral hallux valgus
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Brain MRI normal; auditory evoked potentials: normal left hearing, right conductive superficial hearing loss; X-ray hands: three-year delayed bone age; X-ray feet: absence of mid-foot bone structures, only cuboid and navicular bones observed, bilateral hallux valgus; karyotype and Array CGH: 12.7 Mb deletion at 7p14.2p15.3; FISH: 54.95Kb probe targeted to 7p15.2; nomenclature: 46,XY.ish del(7)(p15.2)(D7Z1+,HOXA6−,HOXA13−).arr[GRCh37/hg19] 7p15.3p14.3(22574164_35288260)x1dn; parents normal

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Swelling and pain in right lower limb; duration more than two months
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive swelling and pain in right lower limb; no obvious cause; mass found in right inguinal area
Medical_Record.Background: No family history; never smoked; normal chest X-ray

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Hard, fixed, goose-egg shaped mass in right inguinal area; mass does not disappear under pressure
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Doppler ultrasound: small blood clots, reduced blood flow in right lower limb veins; CT and CTA: mass in right inguinal area with femoral vein involvement; Surgical excision: tumor 8x6x4.5 cm, firm, white-to-tan; Microscopy: monomorphic, highly cellular, plump spindled cells, ovoid nuclei, minimal cytoplasm, frequent mitoses, atypical nuclei; Immunohistochemistry: positive for EMA, calretinin, CK, VIM; negative for SMA, MSA, CD117, S100; FISH: SYT-SSX fusion transcript

Medical_Record.Demographics: 17-year-old male; high school student; North African
Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Left scrotal mass; several months duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Painless left scrotal tumor; negative light transmittance test; no signs of testosterone deficiency; no palpable regional lymph nodes; normal neurological examination; no significant findings on other physical examinations
Medical_Record.Background: No significant medical or family history; no smoking or alcohol consumption; no prior medications; no allergies mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: 8 cm painless left scrotal tumor; normal vital signs; pulse 84 bpm; blood pressure 120/60 mmHg; afebrile; normal examination on admission
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Tumor markers (alpha-fetoprotein, beta-hCG, LDH) within normal ranges; ultrasound: 6 cm heterogeneous hypoechogenic tissular mass with cystic areas adherent to left scrotal wall, thickened and vascularized; CT: suspicious lateral-aortic enlarged lymph nodes (largest 16 x 23 mm); post-chemotherapy CT: residual paraaortic 5 cm mass; PET CT: 4 cm hypermetabolic mass at renal pelvis; histology: 8 cm paratesticular rhabdomyosarcoma of embryonic type, infiltrating epididymis, rete testis, albuginea, spermatic cord margin free; post-surgery histology: metastatic lymph node from rhabdomyosarcoma; immunohistochemistry: cytoplasmic positivity for desmin, focal nuclear staining for myogenic markers; laboratory findings normal

Diagnosis: Paratesticular rhabdomyosarcoma with metastatic lymph node involvement

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Left hip pain and inability to walk; acute onset after attempt to flex hip
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Sudden pain and loss of ambulation following attempted hip flexion; history of left hip arthrodesis 40 years prior for severe hip dysplasia; able to walk long distances before injury despite leg discrepancy and limited range of motion
Medical_Record.Background: History of left hip arthrodesis for severe dysplasia; no other past medical history, medications, allergies, family or social history mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: X-ray: intertrochanteric fracture of arthrodesed hip; CT scan: detailed fracture location and morphology; intraoperative finding: medial bone gap due to comminution; follow-up X-rays at 1, 2, 6, and 18 months

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Mild left upper abdominal quadrant pain; persistent for two years
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Incidental splenic cyst diagnosis during preoperative assessment for laparoscopic cholecystectomy; initial cyst size 4.6 × 5.0 cm; persistent mild left upper quadrant pain; cyst increased to 6.0 × 5.0 cm after one year and 7.4 × 7.3 cm after two years
Medical_Record.Background: History of laparoscopic cholecystectomy; residence in echinococcosis endemic region; negative echinococcus antigen tests; no other past medical history, medications, allergies, or family history stated

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: No specific findings stated
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Abdominal ultrasound and CT: enlarging splenic cyst; intraoperative finding: nonparasitic cyst in upper spleen; cytology and microbiology: no pathological findings; histology: splenic cyst with epidermoid epithelium; postoperative sonography: normal spleen, good omental incorporation

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Repeated penile strangulation with rubber bands; more than 3 months duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Discontinuous penile binding with rubber bands for 3 months; initial binding 2-3 cm proximal to coronal groove for 1 week; 1 cm deep defect at first strangulation ring; temporary release; re-binding after 1 week; worsening condition; partial penile amputation; urine leakage at tied shaft
Medical_Record.Background: No family history of psychiatric illness; no autism-like manifestations; no notable laboratory abnormalities

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Partial connection in proximal penis; postoperative wound in good condition; satisfactory appearance; recovered urination and erectile function
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Color Doppler ultrasonography: bilateral corpus cavernosum and corpus spongiosum severed near root of penis; partial blood flow in cortex of severed penis; continuous blood flow in part of penile fascia; no blood flow in severed corpus cavernosum and corpus spongiosum. Flexible cystoscopy: circular urethral stenosis 8 cm from external urethral orifice; guide light visible outside second strangulation ring

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Abnormal laboratory findings after clonazepam initiation; 13-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Mild left hand tremor; clonazepam started; tremor improved; 13 days after initiation, marked increases in triglycerides, liver enzymes, and glycometabolism markers; no fever; no skin rash
Medical_Record.Background: Chronic whiplash-associated disorder; hyperlipidaemia; hyperuricacidaemia; liver dysfunction; excessive alcohol intake; high-calorie diet; advised to reduce alcohol and improve diet; medications: fenofibrate, febuxostat; no recent changes in lifestyle except clonazepam usage

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Elevated triglycerides, liver enzymes, and glycometabolism markers; abdominal CT: new remarkable fatty liver; negative viral hepatitis and autoimmune markers; blood glucose increased to 400 mg/dL; HbA1c increased to 6.6%; glycoalbumin 20.4%; negative anti-GAD antibody; postprandial C-peptide 8.27 ng/mL; improvement after clonazepam discontinuation; fasting glucose, HbA1c, and GA normalized; fasting C-peptide 2.41 ng/mL at 28 days; persistent fatty liver on CT at 10 months

Diagnosis: Clonazepam-induced liver dysfunction, severe hyperlipidaemia, and hyperglycaemic crisis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Repeated cholangitis; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Episodes of cholangitis; encephalopathy; deranged liver enzymes; elevated serum bilirubin; elevated serum alkaline phosphatase; dilated common bile duct with calculus; multiple gallbladder calculi; improvement after intravenous antibiotics; spontaneous passage of calculi through common bile duct
Medical_Record.Background: Child's C cirrhosis; no details on occupation, family history, social history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Liver shrunken; irregular surface; no significant varices around Calot's triangle
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Trans-abdominal ultrasound: dilated common bile duct with calculus, multiple gallbladder calculi; MRCP: spontaneous passage of calculi; deranged liver enzymes; elevated serum bilirubin; elevated serum alkaline phosphatase; INR 2.5 (improved to 2 after treatment); platelet count 1,300,000/mm3

Diagnosis: Gallstone disease with Child's C cirrhosis and recurrent cholangitis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Ulcerated brown nodule in left temporal region; 1-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Well-defined erythematous nodule; ulceration; gradual evolution over 1 year
Medical_Record.Background: History of acute lymphocytic leukemia diagnosed in 2013; treated with chemotherapy; no additional background information

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Erythematous, ulcerated brown nodule in left temporal region
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Dermoscopy: polymorphic vessels, exulceration, hematic crusts, chrysalis; Incisional biopsy: nests of cells, eosinophilic cytoplasm, oval/rounded nuclei, prominent nucleoli; Excisional biopsy: nodular, ulcerated, spitzoid, Clark V melanoma; Breslow thickness 4.7 mm

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Lateral left hip pain; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Burning pain started in lateral aspect of left hip, radiated down lateral thigh; worse when rising from seated position, climbing stairs, lying on left side; pain rated 2/10; similar pain prior to pregnancy treated with NSAIDs and corticosteroid injection
Medical_Record.Background: Recently diagnosed gestational diabetes after abnormal glucose challenge test (blood glucose 206 mg/dL at 1 h); 30 weeks pregnant; previous episodes treated with NSAIDs and corticosteroid injection; NSAIDs contraindicated in third trimester; blood glucose controlled by diet and exercise; no skin changes; no tenderness in left groin; positive tenderness over greater trochanter and lateral thigh; normal hip rotation; clearance obtained from OB/GYN for corticosteroid injection; delivered healthy male at 38 weeks and 1 day; no complications

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: No skin changes; no tenderness to palpation in left groin; tenderness to palpation in lateral thigh and over greater trochanter; range of motion limited by gravid habitus; normal external and internal rotation of left hip
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Abnormal glucose challenge test (blood glucose 206 mg/dL at 1 h); daily blood glucose log: average fasting 92 mg/dL, average postprandial 119 mg/dL; ultrasound-guided injection performed

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Assessment for osteoporosis risk; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: No current symptoms reported; history of hyperglycaemia diagnosed 10 years ago; diabetes mellitus managed with diet, exercise, alpha-glucosidase inhibitors; no nephropathy, neuropathy, or retinopathy; diet therapy for dyslipidaemia
Medical_Record.Background: Thin build during youth; menarche at age 14; menopause at age 50; no smoking or alcohol use; family history of proximal femur fracture (mother); no drug allergies mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Haemoglobin A1c 7.2%; total cholesterol 160 mg/dL; LDL cholesterol 145 mg/dL; HDL cholesterol 60 mg/dL; bone mineral density at 1/3 radius 65% of young adult mean; FRAX 10-year major osteoporotic fracture risk 20%

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Relapsing episodes of symptomatic portal biliopathy; 3-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Recurrent right upper quadrant pain; relapsing obstructive jaundice; cholangitis; bleeding episodes from grade II oesophageal varices; ascites; splenomegaly
Medical_Record.Background: Hypercoagulable state due to elevated factor VIII; idiopathic extrahepatic portal vein thrombosis; prior endoscopic sclerotherapy for varices; phenprocoumon discontinued due to variceal bleeding; beta-blocker and nitrate for portal hypertension; family history negative for thromboembolic events; denied oral contraceptive use; treated with ursodesoxicholic acid; multiple ERCP sessions and stent changes; no drug allergies mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Large, dilated, tortuous collaterals at porta hepatis and around CBD; contracted gallbladder; multiple inflammatory adhesions between omentum and gallbladder
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Factor VIII activity 360% (elevated); spiral CT: superior mesenteric and portal vein thrombosis, cavernomatous transformation of portal vein; abdominal ultrasound: normal liver echogenicity, dilated and irregular CBD, contracted gallbladder with stones and debris; ERCP: irregular CBD outline, flat impressions, grade I portal biliopathy; MRI: persistent superior mesenteric and portal vein thrombosis, cavernous transformation of portal vein; PV pressure 30 mm Hg, IVC pressure 9 mm Hg; post-op CT: patent shunt

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Chronic headache after exposure to ‘date-rape’ drugs; persistent since September 2009
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Bifrontal throbbing headache with nausea and photophobia; previously infrequent migraines since age 12; recent chronic squeezing headache started after work dinner; sudden onset slurred speech; amnesia for several hours; headache unresponsive to Zolmitriptan and Co-codamol; partial improvement in sleep with amitriptyline; insomnia persists
Medical_Record.Background: Family history of migraine (mother, maternal grandmother, aunt, older brother); discontinued Microgynon due to weight gain; no significant abnormalities on examination; no mention of other PMH, surgical history, social history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: No significant abnormalities on examination

Diagnosis: Chronic headache secondary to suspected ‘date-rape’ drug exposure

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Dysphagia to solid foods, regurgitation, atypical chest pain; weeks duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive dysphagia, regurgitation, atypical chest pain; symptoms present for weeks; recurrence of dysphagia and reflux 43 months post-operatively
Medical_Record.Background: History of laparoscopic Roux-en-Y gastric bypass 5 years prior; pre-operative BMI 44.57 kg/m2, current BMI 29.7 kg/m2; no mention of occupation, medications, allergies, family or social history

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Upper GI series: dilated oesophagus, stricture at LES, delayed oesophageal emptying; Endoscopy: tortuous oesophagus, retained food, Candida plaques; Oesophageal manometry: elevated resting LES pressure, aperistalsis, failure of LES relaxation; Post-op UGI: free passage of contrast, no leak or delayed transit; Follow-up UGI: oesophageal dilatation, narrowing at GEJ, delayed emptying; Scheduled for repeat manometry and pH testing

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Multiple episodes of dysphasia and transient right arm and leg weakness; short duration episodes
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Recurrent transient ischemic attacks with dysphasia and right-sided motor weakness; right facial hypoesthesia during exercise; symptoms suggest cerebral hypoperfusion affecting left frontal lobe
Medical_Record.Background: History of stereotactic radiosurgery for cavernous sinus meningioma two years prior; left-sided abducens palsy; no infarcts on prior imaging; no mention of family history, occupation, allergies, or other medications

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Normal neurological examination on admission
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: MRI: no infarcts, stenosis of cavernous segment of left ICA; DSA: confirmed left ICA stenosis; A1 segment of right ACA and left PCOM hypoplastic; Perfusion MRI: delayed mean transit time, marginally elevated CBV, reduced CBF, delayed time-to-peak; TCD: reduced flow and pulsatility in left MCA, reversed flow in left A1, increased flow in left PCA P1, intracranial pulsatility in external carotid artery; MR-angiography (post-op): occlusion of left ICA, open left MCA supplied through bypass

Diagnosis: Carotid artery stenosis after radiosurgery for cavernous sinus meningioma

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Persistent mild epigastric pain; 3-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Recurrent onset of mild epigastric pain; worsens with eating; increased intake of sugary beverages one week prior to admission; no diarrhea, dry mouth, polyuria, polydipsia, weight loss, or gastrointestinal disease
Medical_Record.Background: No significant past medical history; family history noncontributory except mother died of gynecological cancer at age 50; father and sister healthy; no drug allergies or relevant social history mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Body mass index 22.7 kg/m2; conscious; dehydrated; soft but tender abdomen; normal heart and lung function; normal vital signs
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Arterial blood pH 7.3; base excess −8.9 mmol/L; random plasma glucose 576 mg/dL; glycosuria; ketonuria; HbA1c 147 mmol/mol; normal serum lactic acid; normal carcinoembryonic antigen and cancer antigen 199; normal liver function, serum amylase, lipase, C-reactive protein, microalbuminuria, and 24-h urine protein; negative for glutamic acid decarboxylase antibody, islet cell antibody, and insulin autoantibody; abdominal CT shows enlarged pancreatic head, absence of body and tail; MRCP shows absence of dorsal pancreatic duct and short duct of Wirsung; fasting C-peptide 0.05 ng/mL; postprandial C-peptide 0.05–0.07 ng/mL (low); fasting plasma glucose 261 mg/dL; postprandial glucose 433–455 mg/dL

Diagnosis: Agenesis of the dorsal pancreas with diabetic ketoacidosis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Penile pain and discharge; 1-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Scant thick urethral discharge; anuric for many years; onset of discharge day prior; no fever, chills, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, or rectal pain; no sexual contact for at least two years; no trauma; no similar episodes in past
Medical_Record.Background: History of hypertension; end-stage renal disease on maintenance hemodialysis via left upper extremity arteriovenous fistula; no other significant PMH, surgical history, family or social history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel history mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Heart rate 68; blood pressure 149/83; respiratory rate 18; temperature 98.9°F; oxygen saturation 99% on room air; no abdominal distention or tenderness; no costovertebral angle tenderness; scant urethral discharge; right-sided inguinal lymphadenopathy; no lesions; no scrotal tenderness or swelling; enlarged, boggy, tender prostate on digital rectal exam
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Urethral swab for gram stain, culture, PCR for gonorrhea and chlamydia; resistance to swab passage in distal urethra; repeat vitals: heart rate 120, blood pressure 160/100, respiratory rate 22, temperature 101.7°F; labs and blood cultures; CT abdomen and pelvis with IV contrast: heterogeneous, thick-walled bladder consistent with pyocystis, communication between posterior bladder wall and seminal vesicles, large prostatic abscess; cultures of discharge fluid and prostatic abscess: E. coli resistant to ampicillin, gentamicin, tetracycline, tobramycin, trimethoprim/sulfamethoxazole, susceptible to cephalosporins, carbapenems, fluoroquinolones, piperacillin/tazobactam; blood cultures unremarkable; stool cultures unremarkable

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Pain on outer aspect of right foot; few weeks duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Twisting injury while walking downstairs; persistent symptoms since injury
Medical_Record.Background: No significant orthopedic or medical history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Normal foot; no instability of ankle or foot; no peroneal spasticity; normal arches
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Right foot radiographs: coalition of base of fourth and fifth metatarsals with cuboid; coalition of third metatarsal with lateral cuneiform; CT scan: confirmed X-ray findings; additional coalition between second metatarsal and intermediate cuneiform; left foot X-rays normal

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Cutaneous lesions; several months duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Initial small lesions on lower extremities after insect bites; onset November 2021; lesions increased in size and darkened over three months; development of smaller satellite lesions on knees and thighs; initial mild erythema; gradual progression to pain
Medical_Record.Background: Travel to Costa Rica, Brazil, Italy, Greece, Peru in 2021; exposure to river water in Costa Rica after bug bite; outpatient antibiotics (amoxicillin/clavulanate, doxycycline) with minimal improvement; no other relevant history provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Multiple lesions on bilateral lower extremities; thick hyperkeratotic crust; surrounding erythema; tenderness to palpation; centralized eschar in larger lesions; largest lesions on left calf (7x5 cm) and right calf (7x6 cm); no other lesions; remainder of examination normal
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Biopsy: visible amastigotes, consistent with leishmaniasis; surface wound cultures: scant Streptococcus agalactiae; PCR: Leishmania (Viannia) guyanensis confirmed

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Whooshing in left ear with soreness and pain on palpation; 1-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Initial whooshing in left ear; soreness and pain on palpation; symptoms worsened over 1 month; acute onset diplopia worse on near vision; later developed right eye proptosis, blurred vision, transient diplopia more pronounced on lateral gaze, chemosis, swelling, hyperemia, epiphora
Medical_Record.Background: History of hypertension, glaucoma, obstructive sleep apnea; no history of head or ocular injury; medications on discharge: acetaminophen, amlodipine, dexamethasone, famotidine, insulin regular, latanoprost ophthalmic, levetiracetam, rosuvastatin; clotting profile within normal limits

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Right eye proptosis; chemosis; swelling; hyperemia; epiphora; high intraocular pressure (28 mmHg); no proptosis, chemosis, or redness at discharge; restricted extraocular motion in right eye; vision 20/25 OU at discharge
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: MRI negative for intracranial pathologies; MRA revealed multiple arteriovenous fistulas including occipital dAVF and bilateral CCFs; DSA confirmed occipital Cognard Type IIB dAVF and bilateral CCFs; postoperative angiogram showed bilateral Barrow Type D indirect CCFs; repeat MRI and MRA confirmed persistent bilateral CCFs; cerebral angiogram confirmed Type D CCFs draining into cavernous sinus; clotting profile: prothrombin time 13.8 s, INR 1.08, aPTT 25.6 s

Diagnosis: Spontaneous resolution of nontraumatic bilateral Barrow Type D indirect carotid-cavernous fistulas

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Abdominal pain; 1-hour duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Sharp pain in left upper quadrant and epigastric region; onset 1 hour prior to presentation
Medical_Record.Background: History of small bowel resection and open reduction internal fixation of right femur (2004) due to traffic accident; chronic lower back pain; regular use of acetaminophen and tramadol; no other regular medications

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Blood pressure 130/80 mmHg; heart rate 68 bpm; temperature 36.8°C; tenderness in left upper quadrant and epigastric region; no peritoneal irritation
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Contrast-enhanced CT: celiac artery dissection with intimal flap; splenic artery dissection with mural thrombus; splenic infarction

Diagnosis: Spontaneous celiac trunk and splenic artery dissection

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Breathlessness and expectorating cough; 2 weeks duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Wheeze and crackles on respiratory examination; other systems normal; diagnosed with acute bronchitis with secondary pneumonia; admitted for further evaluation
Medical_Record.Background: Known diabetic

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Wheeze and crackles on respiratory examination; vital parameters stable
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Blood glucose elevated; other blood investigations normal; sputum Gram stain: numerous pus cells, filamentous hyphae-like structures; Gomori’s methenamine silver stain: broad, aseptate, ribbon-like hyphae; chest radiography: mass-like consolidation in right lower lobe, veiling air space opacities bilaterally; chest CT: scattered ground glass opacities bilaterally, focal cavitary lesion with surrounding ground glass opacities in superior segment of right lower lobe; sputum culture: R. oryzae isolated, sensitive to amphotericin B and posaconazole; nasopharyngeal swab RT-PCR: COVID-19 negative

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Penetrating head injury from angle grinder; brought to emergency room
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Unconscious on arrival; responding to deep painful stimuli; GCS 7; accident with angle grinder
Medical_Record.Background: Euglycemic; normotensive; no mention of past medical history, surgical history, family or social history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Unconscious; GCS 7; both pupils equally reactive to light; lacerated wound 12 x 3 cm over right occipital region with particulate matter; multiple abrasions right side; no active bleeding; fracture neck of humerus; rib fractures (right ribs 3-6); hemodynamically stable; adequate saturation
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT head: bilateral cerebral multiple hemorrhagic contusions, acute subarachnoid hemorrhage, pneumocephalus, linear fracture right parieto-occipital bone; X-ray: fracture neck of humerus, right rib fractures (3-6); FAST scan negative; no evidence of pneumo or hemothorax

Diagnosis: Penetrating head injury with cerebral contusions, acute subarachnoid hemorrhage, pneumocephalus, and skull fracture

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Lump in right breast; 6-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressively increasing backache; 3-month duration; ignored breast mass; consulted orthopedics for backache
Medical_Record.Background: History of pulmonary tuberculosis treatment; no other background information provided

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: MRI spine: hypointense heterogeneous signal in multiple dorsal vertebrae (D3–D8); MRI suggested infectious spondylitis, likely tubercular; Sonomammography: heterogeneous lesion with irregular margin in retro-areolar region; FDG PET/CT: primary breast mass, axillary lymph node, multiple lytic destructive lesions in dorsal vertebrae, right iliac bone lesion; Fine-needle aspiration cytology: infiltrating duct carcinoma; CT-guided biopsy: confirmed metastasis

Diagnosis: Contiguous multilevel vertebral metastasis from breast carcinoma

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Hearing loss; delayed speech development
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Severe delay in speech development; inability to produce words at 2 years; referred for audiology evaluation
Medical_Record.Background: Born at term; no perinatal or neonatal issues; parents are first-degree cousins; family history of abnormal vision in parents and older brother

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Severe axial hypotonia; seizures; ataxia; slight conjunctivitis; normal visual system
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Normal otoscopic findings; normal tympanograms; absent acoustic reflexes bilaterally; bilateral severe to profound sensorineural hearing loss on audiometry; significant delay in speech perception and production; absent auditory brainstem responses bilaterally; normal transient evoked otoacoustic emissions

Diagnosis: Auditory Neuropathy/Dyssynchrony due to Biotinidase Deficiency

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Sudden bluish-black discoloration of left breast; few days duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Awoke with left breast completely blue and almost black; no pain; no trauma; color change resolved to yellow with red macula after one week; ecchymosis resolved after one month
Medical_Record.Background: History of invasive ductal cancer of left breast; breast conserving surgery with sentinel lymph node biopsy two years prior; postoperative radiotherapy to left breast; hormonal treatment with tamoxifen; history of sarcoidosis (skin, liver, erythema nodosum) treated with corticosteroids; hypertension treated with atenolol; hypertriglyceridemia treated with atorvastatin; former smoker; bilateral breast reduction one year after cancer diagnosis; recurrent seroma in left breast requiring resection and remodeling

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Distinct bluish discoloration of entire left breast; gross telangiectasia in boost area and inframammary fold; red macula after one week; no pain
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Blood analysis: elevated reticulocytes (27/1000); slightly elevated γGT (42 U/L); high triglycerides (218 mg/dL); other labs normal; full-thickness skin biopsy: ectatic venules with intraluminal fibrin thrombi, slight perivascular lymphocytic infiltrate, normal epidermis and hypoderm; repeat biopsy: dilated vessels, extravasation of red blood cells, no vasculitis, no tumor cells; MRI: no cancer relapse, remnant seroma

Diagnosis: Radiation-induced cutaneous vasculopathy of the breast

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Fever, cough, increasing dyspnea; 1-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive dyspnea; treated with cefpodoxime for 5 days; deterioration to acute respiratory failure
Medical_Record.Background: Hypertension; type 2 diabetes; chronic kidney disease (baseline GFR 59 ml/min); no cardiac complications; no surgical history; medications include cefpodoxime; no allergies mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Talking dyspnea; tachypnea (respiratory rate 24/min); SpO2 93%; bilateral diffuse crackling; temperature 37.2°C; unassisted systolic arterial pressure 80 mmHg; metabolic acidosis (pH 7.28); lactate 2.1 mmol/l
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: ECG: sinus rhythm, prolonged QT interval, T wave inversion; lung CT: bilateral opacity; nasopharyngeal PCR: positive for SARS-CoV-2; lymphopenia (1.33 g/l); fibrinogen 7.88 g/l; ferritin 665 μg/l; interleukin-6 520 pg/ml; CRP 339.4 mg/l; procalcitonin 4.97 ng/ml; neutrophil count 7.95 g/l; creatinine 197 μmol/l (GFR 30 ml/min/1.73 m2); troponin T up to 637 ng/l; transesophageal echocardiography: LVEF 40%, apical ballooning; follow-up: restoration of LVEF, decreased apical ballooning; persistent ECG T wave inversion

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Violent behavior, paranoid delusions, poor sleep, weight loss; 8-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Onset of violent behavior, accusing mother of witchcraft, social withdrawal, poor sleep, talking and laughing to self, threatening neighbors, poor personal hygiene, weight loss; anterior neck swelling noticed 30 months earlier; palpitations, excessive sweating, tremulousness, increased appetite, skin pigmentation, eye protrusion
Medical_Record.Background: Lived in UK for 11 years; returned to Nigeria 8 months prior; no past or family history of psychotic or psychiatric illness; no history of fever, head injury, depression, or suicidal ideation; previously managed as paranoid schizophrenia; placed on antipsychotic medications; no significant improvement; referred for medical treatment after features of hyperthyroidism discovered; no drug allergies mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Chronically ill appearance; staring gaze; lid lag; lid retraction; mild pallor; tremors on outstretched hand; increased skin pigmentation; anterior neck swelling 6x8 cm, moves with swallowing, firm to hard, smooth surface, no retrosternal extension, no palpable lymph nodes, no bruits; conscious, agitated, irrelevant speech, delusions, no insight; poorly groomed, restless, irritable, threatening, talkative, abusive, flight of ideas, persecutory delusions; pulse 120 bpm; blood pressure 120/70 mmHg; normal heart sounds; normal chest and abdominal exam
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Thyroid function tests: T3 330.9 ng/dL (high), T4 261.6 nmol/L (high), TSH 0.12 microIU/L (low); repeat: T3 2.1 ng/ml (high), T4 163 ng/ml (high), TSH 0.1 microIU/ml (low), anti-thyroid antibody 69.5 IU/mL (high); thyroid ultrasound: multinodular goitre; PCV 26%; WBC 3.5 × 10^9/L; Neutrophils 30%, lymphocytes 66%, monocytes 4%; platelets 160,000/L; blood film: hypochromic erythrocytes, relative lymphocytosis; ESR 28 mm/hr

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Right elbow pain and occasional locking; 18-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Gradual onset right elbow pain; occasional locking; slight extension deficit up to 5°
Medical_Record.Background: No significant past medical history; no previous major trauma to elbow; right-handed; 7 years of national level ice-hockey

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Slight extension deficit up to 5° of right elbow; no other clinical abnormalities
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Radiographs show flattening and subchondral lucencies of capitellum; multiple loose bodies in joint space; osteophytes at medial aspect of elbow; joint effusion; MRI shows cartilage defects, bone marrow edema, osseous changes in capitellum, intra-articular loose bodies; arthroscopy reveals mild synovitis, loose bodies, softening of cartilage on capitellum

Diagnosis: Osteochondritis dissecans of the humeral capitellum

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Space-occupying mass on right lung; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive lung lesion; bone metastases; lymph node enlargement; new brain metastatic lesion; pericardial and pleural effusions; repeated increase in pleural effusion; respiratory failure
Medical_Record.Background: No smoking history; no family cancer history; no significant PMH; multiple lines of chemotherapy and targeted therapy; no drug allergies mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Chest CT: right upper lobe lesion (5.55 cm), enlarged pretracheal retrocaval lymph nodes; whole-body bone scan: bone metastases; brain CT and abdomen MRI: no metastasis; CT-guided percutaneous pneumocentesis; histopathology: stage IVB adenocarcinoma; genetic tests: negative EGFR, negative ALK fusion, PD-L1 10% TPS; NGS: MED13L-ROS1 and EZR-ROS1 fusions, NF1 p.G127Ter, BRAF p.V600E mutation, FGF19/FGF4/FGF3 amplifications, NRAS p.Q61R, NTRK amplification, CDKN2A deletion

Diagnosis: ROS1-rearranged advanced non-small-cell lung cancer with lorlatinib-induced BRAF V600E mutation

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Right knee pain and swelling; 24-hour duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Diffuse lateral right knee pain rated 10/10; non-radiating; not position-dependent; inability to bear weight; excruciating pain with movement; no antecedent trauma; no left knee pain; no recent increase in alcohol or red meat consumption
Medical_Record.Background: Diabetes mellitus; hypertension on diuretics; hyperlipidemia; right total knee arthroplasty 11 years prior; left total knee arthroplasty 12 years prior; no mention of family history, social history, medications (other than diuretics and allopurinol), allergies, immunizations, or travel history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Tachycardia (heart rate 109-123); afebrile; normotensive; right knee diffusely tender, moderately swollen, warm; well-healed midline surgical incision; no erythema; limited active range of motion (5-60 degrees flexion) due to pain; motor strength 4/5 in right knee extension; left knee: no effusion, warmth, or erythema; full painless range of motion; motor strength 5/5 in flexion and extension
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Serum WBC 12.9 bil/L (elevated); 82.7% neutrophils; ESR 73 mm/hr (elevated); CRP 218.5 mg/L (elevated); radiographs: suprapatellar joint effusion, periosteal reaction proximal lateral tibia metaphysis, well-aligned surgical components, no loosening or osteolysis; initial right knee synovial fluid: mucoid straw-colored, WBC 72,320/mm³ (99% neutrophils), RBC 11,520/mm³, no organisms; intra-operative findings: brownish synovial fluid, thickened inflamed synovium, minimal polyethylene wear, stable components; left knee aspiration: brownish-turbid synovial fluid; intra-operative: thickened inflamed synovium, intact components, polyethylene wear; synovial tissue sent to pathology; synovial fluid positive for monosodium urate crystals; serum uric acid 10.6 mg/dL (elevated); final blood cultures negative; intra-operative cultures: many neutrophils, no growth; histology: inflamed synovium, increased neutrophils, crystal deposition; post-op left knee aspiration: few polymorphonuclear cells, no growth

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Ophthalmological evaluation post-allogeneic PBSCT; asymptomatic at 114 days post-transplant
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: No ocular symptoms at 114 days post-PBSCT; positive MMP-9 test; superior corneal epithelial thinning; presence of inflammatory cells at corneal sub-basal nerve plexus; increased corneal staining and severe tear deficiency at 121 days; resolution of findings at 219 days after combinatorial topical treatment
Medical_Record.Background: Diagnosed with myelodysplastic syndrome with excess blasts 2; underwent allogeneic PBSCT; no ocular bulbar redness; no other background information provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: No ocular bulbar redness; asymptomatic (OSDI=0)
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Positive matrix metalloproteinase 9 test; corneal epithelial OCT maps: superior thinning; corneal IVCM: inflammatory cells at sub-basal nerve plexus; increased corneal staining; Schirmer I: severe tear deficiency

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Worsening dyspnea; over one week
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Increased oxygen requirement; productive cough with mucopurulent sputum; no fever; no improvement after three days of antibiotics
Medical_Record.Background: HIV infection; CD4+ 253/mm3; frequent interruptions of HAART; severe COPD with bronchiectasis and emphysema; lifelong smoking and inhaled drug use; previous tuberculosis; chronic respiratory insufficiency requiring continuous domiciliary oxygen; not vaccinated for HPV; previous cervical cytology negative for dysplasia

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Pulmonary CT: polypoid lesion in tracheal lumen; bronchoscopy: papillomatous lesion; biopsy: squamous cell papilloma without dysplasia; viral genotyping: low-risk HPV genotype 6; follow-up bronchofibroscopy: tracheal obstruction by papilloma; mechanical excision, cryotherapy, argon plasma coagulation, laser photocoagulation performed

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Headache and difficulty walking; unknown duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Headache; difficulty walking; diagnosed cerebrum tumor; scheduled for radical tumorectomy under general anesthesia
Medical_Record.Background: Obese (BMI 32.0 kg/m2); slight hypertension (155/85 mmHg, HR 92 bpm) preoperatively; no abnormal oral cavity, respiratory tract, or chest radiograph; no mention of medications, allergies, family or social history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Able to fully open mouth (Mallampati Grade I); no sore throat, swelling, or edema of upper airway postoperatively
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Chest radiograph normal; postoperative pathological diagnosis: hemangioblastoma; ETT cuff leak detected by bubbling noise and collapsed pilot balloon; water immersion test showed pinhole rupture at cuff

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Intermittent tooth pain and left mandibular gingival mass; 2-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Intermittent tooth pain; left mandibular gingival mass; 4-cm oral cavity mass on admission; no fever, hepatosplenomegaly, or other symptoms
Medical_Record.Background: No significant medical or family history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: 4-cm oral cavity mass; no fever; no hepatosplenomegaly
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CRP 4.71 mg/dl; IgG 1,770 mg/dl; ferritin 140.0 ng/ml; IL-2R 11,930 U/ml; ESR 117 mm/h; normal blood cell count; normal transaminase; normal coagulation; chest X-ray: mild cardiomegaly, 6-cm extrathoracic mass; CT: 43×25 mm osteolytic left submandibular bone mass, 56×46 mm left 3rd costal bone mass, two masses (23 and 15 mm) in left ventricular cavity, pericardial fluid; ECG: mild diffuse ST-elevation, no arrhythmia; biopsy: small abnormal lymphocyte proliferation, large atypical lymphocytes; immunohistochemistry: CD3+, UCHL-1+, Granzyme B+, CD56+, CD30+, ALK+, EMA+; MRI angiography: occlusion of left popliteal artery and right anterior tibial artery

Diagnosis: Anaplastic Lymphoma Kinase-Positive Anaplastic Large Cell Lymphoma with cardiac metastasis and arterial tumor embolisms

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Perirectal abscess followed by right lower quadrant abdominal pain and diarrhea; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Initial perirectal abscess; subsequent right lower quadrant abdominal pain and diarrhea; weight loss of 6 kg over 7 months; abdominal distension on day 13 after infliximab infusion
Medical_Record.Background: Diagnosis of Crohn's disease; BMI 19.8; anal skin tags; perianal fistula scar; no mention of occupation, family history, social history, allergies, or immunizations; received infliximab therapy; prescribed mesalazine 2.25 g/day; plant-based diet initiated

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Anal skin tags; perianal fistula scar; otherwise non-contributory
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Laboratory data consistent with Crohn's disease; plain abdominal film showed isolated air-fluid level; enteroclysis revealed stenotic portions and longitudinal ulcers in distal ileum; plain abdominal radiographs on day 13 showed clear air-fluid levels; elevated C-reactive protein; improved erythrocyte sedimentation rate; perioperative endoscopy showed no additional stenosis; resected specimen showed round and longitudinal ulcers; pathology showed non-caseating epithelioid cell granulomas

Diagnosis: Early intestinal obstruction after infliximab therapy in Crohn's disease

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Carbamazepine overdose; 4-hour duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Ingestion of 4000 mg carbamazepine; no co-ingestion; gastric lavage performed; transferred after 4 hours; low sensorium; intubated; developed circulatory shock on day 1; several episodes of hypoglycemia on day 3; managed with dextrose infusion; no further hypoglycemia after 60 hours
Medical_Record.Background: On anti-epileptic therapy with carbamazepine; pregnant; no mention of other medications, allergies, or significant past medical history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: GCS 3/15; pulse 138/min; BP 110/70 mmHg; respiratory rate 25/min; pupils dilated 6 mm bilaterally, reactive to light; sluggish deep tendon reflexes; negative Babinski sign; unremarkable systemic examination
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Serum carbamazepine >20 μg/ml (therapeutic 6-12 μg/ml); hemoglobin 8 g/dl; WBC 15,200/cumm; renal, liver, coagulation normal; low procalcitonin (0.34); negative cultures; serum carbamazepine 17.3 μg/ml on day 3, 2.97 μg/ml on day 7

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Lower abdominal pain; urinary incontinence
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Lower abdominal pain and urinary incontinence; history of self-induced perineal incision six years prior; recent insertion of toilet brush handle into perineal defect two weeks prior; unable to retrieve foreign object
Medical_Record.Background: History of self-mutilation for sexual gratification; history of sexual abuse perpetration over twenty years ago; alcohol intoxication prior to recent event; no information on occupation, medications, allergies, family or social history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: 6 cm longitudinal self-induced incision along perineal raphe; 8 cm deep perineal defect; bulbar urethral-cutaneous fistula
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT scan; open cystotomy revealed intravesical foreign body (toilet brush handle)

Diagnosis: Intravesical foreign body via vesicoperineal fistula

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Shortness of breath at rest and on exertion; unknown duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Symptomatic iron deficiency anemia; hemoglobin 3.7 g/dL on admission; no hematemesis, melena, hematochezia; negative fecal occult blood test; negative rectal examination for blood, melena, stool
Medical_Record.Background: Past medical history of iron deficiency anemia; no NSAID use; no significant findings on colonoscopy except internal hemorrhoids

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Hemoglobin 3.7 g/dL (admission), stabilized to 8.2 g/dL after transfusion; mean corpuscular volume 67 fL; ferritin 2 μg/L; transferrin saturation 2%; colonoscopy: internal hemorrhoids; EGD/push enteroscopy: friable antral erythematous gastric fold, 2-mm gastric polyp; pathology: severe chronic inactive gastritis, diffuse plasma cell infiltration of lamina propria; immunohistochemistry: diffuse polyclonal plasma cell proliferation, CD20 positive in follicles, CD38 and CD138 positive in lamina propria, kappa and lambda positive

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Altered mental status; unknown duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Found face down, covered in urine and feces; last seen two days prior in usual state; retrograde amnesia; confabulations; jerky movements of extremities; tonic-clonic seizure; involuntary, continuous shaky movements in all extremities; tongue fasciculations; intention tremor aggravated by activity; unable to perform activities of daily living
Medical_Record.Background: History of concussion (age 39); hepatitis C; asthma; hypertension; bipolar disorder; anxiety; panic attacks; psychosis (first episode at age 47, inpatient psychiatric treatment in 2011 and 2016); suicidal thoughts (ages 18 and 25); treated with Prozac and clonidine; alcohol use on weekends; daily marijuana use; long-term clonazepam use; methadone 25 mg daily; born and raised in New York; completed high school and some college; no current employment

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Disheveled appearance; alert; oriented x2/3; able to move all extremities; jerky movements; tonic-clonic seizure; involuntary tremors; tongue fasciculations; no sensory deficits; vitals within normal limits; stage 1 pressure ulcers on extremities; right eye conjunctival injection; left eye periorbital ecchymosis and purulence
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Leukocyte count 13,400 (initial), decreased to 6,600; creatinine phosphokinase 1541; sodium 146; lactic acid 7.6; CBG normal; troponins negative; CA 19.9 41 (slightly increased); CA 125 and CEA normal; blood-alcohol and acetaminophen undetectable; blood ammonia 52; lithium <0.1; valproic acid <10.0; urine drug screen positive for THC and benzodiazepines; blood cultures grew S. epidermidis and S. hominis (deemed contamination); CT brain, cervical spine, thorax, abdomen negative for acute pathology; CT pelvis: large complex left adnexal mass (mature cystic ovarian teratoma); lumbar puncture: CSF serology negative for encephalitis antibodies; CSF WBCs: 3 in tube #1, 6 in tube #4; other CSF tests negative; MRI brain: no acute intracranial pathology; scattered T2 foci in subcortical centrum semiovale and corona radiata; no abnormal enhancement; no infarct, mass effect, hydrocephalus, or hemorrhage

Diagnosis: Seronegative NMDAR encephalitis associated with ovarian teratoma

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Worsening right pleural effusion; new oxygen requirement
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Metastatic oesophageal cancer; metastatic disease to bones and lungs; locally advanced invasion causing right lower lobe obstruction; persistent pain despite radiotherapy; dysphagia due to oesophageal narrowing; significant pitting oedema to knees; anxiety and panic attacks; BMI 18 kg/m2; new oxygen requirement; no prior pleural intervention
Medical_Record.Background: Metastatic oesophageal cancer; metastatic bone and lung disease; prior radiotherapy; no prior pleural aspiration; low albumin; palliative care admission; dietary supplements; no pulmonary embolism on CTPA; advanced cancer and frailty

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Central trachea; reduced breath sounds right chest; significant pitting oedema to knees; no chest pain
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CTPA negative for pulmonary embolism; chest X-ray: worsening right pleural effusion, post-aspiration hydropneumothorax appearance; bedside thoracic ultrasound: simple right-sided effusion

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Difficulty with mastication; chronic duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: History of mandibular osteosarcoma; treated with marginal mandibulectomy and fibula-free flap reconstruction two years ago; persistent difficulty with mastication after partial denture rehabilitation; alveolar ridge modification and implant placement performed; secondary implant surgery one year later; bacterial infection around implant treated with antibiotics and local lavage; inflammation resolved before free gingival graft; palatal mucosa grafted; fixed prosthesis set three months after graft
Medical_Record.Background: History of mandibular osteosarcoma; marginal mandibulectomy; fibula-free flap reconstruction; partial denture rehabilitation; no additional background information provided

Diagnosis: Mandibular osteosarcoma status post marginal mandibulectomy and fibula-free flap reconstruction; peri-implantitis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Malaligned teeth; difficulty chewing right side; duration not stated
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Malaligned teeth; difficulty chewing right side; multiple cystic lesions in jaws; displaced crowns of 41 and 42
Medical_Record.Background: No significant past medical or dental history; no family history of syndrome; no skin lesions; parents and siblings examined clinically and radiographically

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Displaced crowns of 41 and 42; palmar-plantar keratosis; syndactility in both feet; no basal cell nevi
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Routine blood investigations; orthopantomogram shows multiple lytic lesions in jaws with unerupted permanent teeth; lateral cephalogram; CT scan with 3-D reconstruction; chest X-ray shows bifid ribs; cortical expansion right mandible; radiolucent lesion in right premolar region

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Fever; 5-day duration during second induction chemotherapy
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Fever 38.0°C; persistent bilateral ankle and heel pain; swelling and tenderness; dry cough; mild headache; daily fevers with peak temperature 38.9°C; palmar-plantar erythrodysesthesia
Medical_Record.Background: Newly diagnosed acute myeloid leukemia (M2); chemotherapy with cytarabine and idarubicin via PICC; no significant prior medical history; persistent neutropenia; PCR-proven herpes simplex virus type 1 labialis; disseminated intravascular coagulation; diffuse rash after first cycle of cytarabine; leukocytoclastic vasculitis attributed to allopurinol or ciprofloxacin; medications include vancomycin, cefepime, meropenem, amikacin, voriconazole, liposomal amphotericin; no allergies mentioned; no family or social history provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Alert; not in distress; blood pressure 124/66 mmHg; heart rate 96 beats/min; temperature 38.0°C; respiratory rate 18 breaths/min; oxygen saturation 95% on room air; mildly tender, erythematous swelling of both ankles and lower legs; bullae on feet; desquamations on fingers and palms; non-inflamed PICC line insertion site; remainder of examination normal
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: WBC 0.4×10^9/L (low); absolute neutrophil count 0×10^9/L; hemoglobin 63 g/L (low); platelet count 31×10^9/L (low); albumin 28 g/L (low); total protein 57 g/L (low); chemistry panel otherwise normal; chest radiograph shows atelectatic changes at bases; blood cultures from peripheral sites and PICC; blood culture grew Gram-negative rod; 16S rRNA sequencing identified Dokdonella koreensis; antimicrobial susceptibility testing performed; follow-up blood cultures sterile

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Severe lower back pain; worsening lower extremity weakness; saddle anesthesia; urinary retention; onset 8 days after lumbar puncture
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Nuchal rigidity; proximal weakness upper and lower extremities; numbness after bowel resection; initial lumbar puncture showed leukocytosis and elevated protein; antibiotics and IVIG with marginal improvement; repeated traumatic lumbar puncture; subsequent development of severe neurological symptoms
Medical_Record.Background: History of diverticulitis with intra-abdominal abscess; status post bowel resection; no mention of medications, allergies, family or social history

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Lumbar puncture: leukocytosis (146 cells/μl, 93% lymphocytes), elevated protein (162 mg/dL), traumatic tap with RBCs >31,000/μl; MRI lumbar spine: intrathecal subarachnoid and subdural hematoma L3-sacral; intraoperative finding: ventrolateral epidural hematoma compressing spinal cord at L4

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Severe low back pain and bilateral lower extremity pain; 1-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: 5-year history of low back pain; repeated hospital admissions for lumbar pain; recent worsening with difficulty walking and lying down; pain in both lower extremities
Medical_Record.Background: History of Parkinson's disease; receiving drug therapy; Hoehn-Yahr classification III; no trauma; no mention of surgical history, family history, social history, medications (other than Parkinson's), allergies, immunizations, or travel

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Severely restricted trunk range of motion due to pain; positive femoral nerve stretch test; hypesthesia in bilateral L3 region
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Normal WBC, ESR, CRP; HLA-B27 negative; no sacroiliac arthritis; radiographs show flowing ossification Th2-L5, disruption at L2-L3 disc level; myelography shows stenosis at L2-L3; flexion-extension radiograph shows instability at L2-L3; postoperative radiographs show loosening of pedicle screw and abnormal motion at L2-L3; plain radiographs 1.5 years after surgery show rigid bony union at L2-L3

Diagnosis: Spontaneous symptomatic pseudoarthrosis at the L2-L3 intervertebral space with diffuse idiopathic skeletal hyperostosis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Refractory bilateral leg edema; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive bilateral lower extremity edema; pruritus and pain; initial diuretic therapy ineffective; worsening edema with redness and tenderness; lesion spread from ankle to thigh; development of fibrotic induration and joint contractures
Medical_Record.Background: History of stage 3a chronic kidney disease; hypotrophic left kidney; hypertension; amlodipine 2.5 mg; radical prostatectomy for prostate cancer two years prior; recent pelvic MRI with gadoterate meglumine; prior iodinated contrast CT; no family or social history provided; no allergies mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Temp 36.8°C; BP 110/60 mmHg; height 161.3 cm; weight 53.2 kg; BMI 20.4 kg/m2; grade 2+ pretibial pitting edema with redness, mild heat, tenderness in both lower extremities; no inguinal lymphadenopathy
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: WBC 6,200/μL; hemoglobin 10.7 g/dL; platelet 253,000/μL; BUN 41 mg/dL; serum creatinine 2.07 mg/dL (improved to 1.18 mg/dL after fluid therapy); eGFR 32 mL/min/1.73 m2 (improved to 63.9 mL/min/1.73 m2); sodium 134 mmol/L; potassium 3.4 mmol/L; chloride 102 mmol/L; total CO2 20 mmol/L; calcium 9.3 mg/dL; phosphate 1.5 mg/dL; total protein 6.9 g/dL; albumin 4.0 g/dL; AST 43 U/L; ALT 15 U/L; CRP 0.96 mg/dL; urine pH 6.0; trace proteinuria; spot urine protein/creatinine ratio 209 mg/g; spot urine albumin/creatinine ratio 60 mg/g; thyroid function normal; fractional excretion of Na 0.1%; fractional excretion of urea 17.6%; chest X-ray and echocardiogram normal; Doppler sonography of lower extremities normal; negative antinuclear antibody, anti-Scl 70, anti-centromere antibody; no eosinophilia or paraproteinemia; skin biopsy: dermal thickening with collagen fibers extending into subcutaneous septa, numerous spindle-shaped fibrocytes

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Worsening dyspnea due to hydrothorax
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive dyspnea; admitted for hydrothorax; underwent liver transplantation; postoperative day 8 acute increase in aminotransferases; worsening abdominal pain
Medical_Record.Background: Cirrhosis due to alcohol abuse; refractory hydrothorax and ascites; liver transplantation from 29-year-old female donor (EBV and CMV IgG positive); immunosuppressive therapy with tacrolimus, mycophenolate mofetil, prednisone taper; prophylactic valganciclovir; no prior oral or genital HSV infection

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: ALT 712 U/L, AST 780 U/L (elevated); liver ultrasound normal; CT abdomen shows suspected mesenteric artery pseudoaneurysm; liver biopsy shows patchy hepatocyte necrosis; serum HSV-2 IgM antibody and HSV DNA by PCR positive; pathology confirms HSV hepatitis with hepatic necrosis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Sore throat for 10 days; chest pain for 2 days; fever and respiratory distress for 1 day
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Sustained sore throat without obvious cause; oral amoxicillin for 5 days with no significant relief; progressive left chest pain; chills; fever; respiratory difficulty; peak temperature 39°C
Medical_Record.Background: No previous medical history; healthy lifestyle; no mention of surgical history, family history, social history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Temperature 39.1°C; pulse 122 beats/min; respiration 25 breaths/min; blood pressure 81/54 mmHg; moist rales over left lung
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Chest CT: left lung infection foci, left pleural effusion, cavity formation; laboratory: WBC 39.8 × 10^9/L, neutrophil count 37.7 × 10^9/L, neutrophil ratio 94.8%, CRP 310.4 mg/L, procalcitonin 48.8 ng/ml; blood culture, throat swab culture, BALF culture, pleural drainage culture negative; bronchoscopy: purulent secretions; BALF-NGS: F. necrophorum detected; head CT, neck vascular ultrasound, liver/spleen/kidney ultrasound: no abscesses or neck vein thrombosis

Diagnosis: Fusobacterium necrophorum lung abscess with pleural effusion

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Acute onset hoarseness of voice and binocular diplopia; 10-hour duration; severe hypophonia with dysphagia; 4-hour duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: No visual blurring; no history of eating canned food; no abdominal pain; no gastrointestinal symptoms; no recent fever or infection; no prior episodes of bulbar or limb weakness; symptoms did not fluctuate
Medical_Record.Background: No significant past medical history; no history suggestive of diphtheria, sarcoidosis, recent ingestion of canned food, or treatment with chemotherapeutic agents

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Tachycardia; hypertension; multiple cranial nerve palsies (bilateral pupil sparing oculomotor, trochlear, abducens, trigeminal with facial sensory impairment, facial, glossopharyngeal, vagus); generalized limb hyperreflexia; normal tone and power; absent jaw jerk; flexor plantar reflex bilaterally; no orthostatic hypotension; no autonomic dysfunction
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Normal contrast enhanced MRI of brain; normal CT of base of skull; facial nerve NCS shows bilaterally decreased amplitude with neuropathic pattern on EMG; limb NCS and RNS normal; ice pack test and neostigmine test negative; acetylcholine esterase antibody negative; normal blood sugar, glycosylated hemoglobin, serum electrolytes, ECG, renal and liver function tests; normal muscle enzyme levels (CPK, CPK-NAC); CSF normal proteins, two lymphocytes, normal glucose; CSF PCR for HSV-1 and VZV negative; HIV, ANA, VDRL, ACE, borrelia burgdorferi antibodies negative; low TSH (<0.01 uIU/mL); high free T3 (19.2 pmol/L); high free T4 (39.2 pmol/L); thyroid ultrasonography normal; anti-TPO and anti-thyroglobulin antibodies negative

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Advanced heart failure; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive heart failure; recurrent ventricular tachycardias; chronic pacing indication; failed CRT-D upgrade due to venous occlusion; frequent episodes of ventricular tachycardia; NYHA III despite optimal therapy; improved to NYHA II after LVAD implantation; frequent VTs; intracranial haemorrhage under anticoagulation; seven episodes of pump thrombosis; fully pacing dependent; no escape rhythm >30 beats/min
Medical_Record.Background: Cardiac sarcoidosis; two-chamber ICD implanted in 2005; CRT-D system implanted through right cephalic and subclavian veins; ineligible for heart transplantation due to irreversible pulmonary hypertension; LVAD (HeartWare, Medtronic) implanted in 2016; restrictive tricuspid valve annuloplasty, left atrial appendage amputation, VT cryoablation performed; Staphylococcus aureus bacteraemia in 2016; chronic antibiotic suppressive therapy (flucloxacillin); radio-frequency VT re-ablations; therapeutic anticoagulation; clopidogrel; no family or social history specified; no drug allergies specified

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Extensive thoracic venous collaterals; no heart failure-related hospitalizations during follow-up
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Chest X-ray shows five transvenous leads and implanted hardware; ECG before procedure; contrast venography reveals right subclavian vein occlusion with extensive collateral system; QRS-duration and configuration comparable to initial biventricular capture

Diagnosis: Advanced heart failure due to cardiac sarcoidosis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Waist and back pain; 3-day duration; intensified over previous 8 hours
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive waist and back pain; no heart or lung abnormalities; no palpable pulsating abdominal masses
Medical_Record.Background: No information on occupation, PMH, surgical history, family or social history, allergies, immunizations, or travel; post-operative medications: low-molecular-weight heparin (3 days), rivaroxaban (5 mg/day), clopidogrel (75 mg/day), switched to aspirin after 12 months

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Blood pressure 140/81 mmHg; good general health; soft abdomen; no palpable pulsating masses
