Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CTA: two thoracoabdominal aortic aneurysms (max diameter 6.6 cm); Type III TAAA (distal thoracic aorta to aortoiliac bifurcation); post-operative CTA: stent grafts in position, no endoleaks, visceral arteries patent; 2-year CTA: superior mesenteric artery stent occluded with thrombus, other arteries unobstructed; 3-year CTA: findings similar to 2-year

Diagnosis: Crawford Type III thoracoabdominal aortic aneurysm

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Failed cannulation of left upper extremity AV graft; acute presentation
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Multiple failed attempts to cannulate AV graft; absence of thrill or pulsatility; no signs of volume overload or uremia; positive COVID-19 test
Medical_Record.Background: End-stage renal disease; maintenance hemodialysis; contrast allergy; potassium 5.2 mmol/L on admission

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: No thrill or pulsatility along AV graft
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Limited ultrasound: separation of graft fabric layers, thrombus in false and true lumen; fluoroscopy: wire unable to advance beyond midportion; contrast injection: access within delaminated false lumen; brachial arteriogram: restoration of arterial flow, focal area of extra-luminal contrast; post-procedure: 36 successful hemodialysis sessions

Diagnosis: Arteriovenous graft dysfunction due to graft delamination and fracture

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Bilateral eye redness, photophobia, ocular discomfort; 2-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Intermittent spontaneous epistaxis; fatigue; lethargy; unintentional weight-loss; acute haematuria; dizziness; new confusion; word-finding difficulties; atypical dysarthria
Medical_Record.Background: Ischaemic heart disease; hyperlipidaemia; hypertension; right hip osteoarthritis awaiting replacement; medications: aspirin, metoprolol, atorvastatin; no previous ophthalmic history; no prior ocular surgery

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Best corrected visual acuity 6/5 (right), 6/9 (left); normal intraocular pressures; nodular scleritis right nasal limbus; clear cornea; quiescent anterior and posterior segments; normal fundus and optic nerve appearance; acute infarct left inferior parietal cortex; >80% stenosis left proximal internal carotid artery
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: ANCA positive; anti-proteinase 3 antibody 112 U/mL; C3 elevation 1.95 g/L; normal C4 0.46 g/L; anti-myeloperoxidase antibody <3 U/mL; negative glomerular basement membrane antibodies; negative infectious screen (sarcoidosis, tuberculosis, syphilis); negative rheumatology factor and anti-cyclic citrullinated peptide; normal coagulation studies; creatinine 96 μmol/L; eGFR 71 mL/min/1.73 m2; urine cytology: red blood cells, polymorphonuclear leucocytes, no malignant cells; normal transaminases; elevated alkaline phosphatase 199 U/L; elevated GGT 164 U/L; negative hepatitis B/C and HIV serology; CT: lung, liver, prostate, bladder, nasal, ethmoidal/maxillary sinus involvement; biopsies: inflamed granulation tissue, reactive atypical squamous epithelium, multinucleate giant cells; no dysplasia or malignancy; MRI: acute infarct left inferior parietal cortex, no cerebral vasculitis; duplex carotid ultrasound: >80% stenosis left proximal internal carotid artery

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Fatigue at 200–400 meters; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: History of secundum atrial septal defect closed percutaneously in May 2008; referred for evaluation of valvular heart disease; exercise stress testing terminated due to fatigue; no chest pain during evaluation; no ischemic changes on ECG; recent decline in exercise capacity compared to previous year
Medical_Record.Background: Moderate, posteriorly directed, eccentric mitral regurgitation; mild prolapse of anterior mitral valve leaflet; mild aortic insufficiency; history of systemic hypertension; previously on hydrochlorothiazide, switched to lisinopril; mandatory military Medical Evaluation Board initiated due to moderate valvular disease; no mention of allergies, family history, or social history

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Transthoracic echocardiogram: technically difficult, suboptimal image quality due to mesocardia; normal left ventricular wall motion; moderate mitral regurgitation; mild mitral valve prolapse; mild aortic insufficiency; echo bright structure near tricuspid annulus; right ventricle and right atrium not well visualized. Chest X-ray: possible right ventricle on left side, possible dextrocardia or ccTGA. Cardiac CT angiography: normal coronary arteries; right ventricle receives blood from left atrium via tricuspid valve; left ventricle receives blood from right atrium via mitral valve; right ventricle ejects into aorta; left ventricle pumps into pulmonary artery; right ventricle concentric hypertrophy (9.9 mm at mid-interventricular septum); findings consistent with congenitally corrected L-transposition of the great arteries (ccTGA). Exercise stress test: 12 min 26 sec on Bruce protocol, 14.2 METS, 96% max heart rate, terminated due to fatigue. Cardiopulmonary exercise test: 7 min 10 sec, peak VO2 29.7 mL/kg/min (8.5 METS, 77% predicted), anaerobic threshold at 51% VO2 max, peak heart rate 180 bpm, BP 146/70, delayed heart rate recovery, peak respiratory rate 42/min, VE 68 L/min, VE/VCO2 slope 29.9, SpO2 >95%

Diagnosis: Congenitally corrected transposition of the great arteries

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Atypical pneumonia; recent foreign travel
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Started ceftriaxone and azithromycin; developed acute kidney injury with sudden increase in serum creatinine from 0.98 mg/dL to 4.36 mg/dL on day 4; required hemodialysis
Medical_Record.Background: No significant past medical history; no mention of surgical history; no family history stated; no social history stated; recent travel; medication: ceftriaxone, azithromycin; no allergies stated; immunization status not stated

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Serum creatinine increased from 0.98 mg/dL to 4.36 mg/dL; renal biopsy consistent with drug-induced acute interstitial nephritis; no rash; no eosinophilia; no pyuria; no eosinophiluria; no hematuria; no significant albuminuria

Medical_Record.Demographics: 58-year-old female; resident of Pirabad village, Lorestan Province
Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Abdominal and back pain; duration of recent month
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Intermittent fever and chills; coughing; sore throat; bloody sputum; cutaneous manifestation; no significant weight loss
Medical_Record.Background: History of consumption of raw aquatic plant (watercress/Balmak); no other significant history mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: ELISA positive; stool examination shows F. hepatica eggs; PCR band ~700 bp for Fasciola spp.; sequencing confirms F. hepatica; post-treatment stool exams negative for F. hepatica eggs

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Purpuric lesions on bilateral lower extremities; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Purpuric lesions with pedal oedema; no fever; no joint involvement; no systemic involvement
Medical_Record.Background: No significant past medical history mentioned; initial treatment with prednisolone and azathioprine; flare-up of rashes with prednisolone <10 mg/day; cyclosporine added for corticosteroid-sparing; further flare-ups; corticosteroid dependence; azathioprine and cyclosporine withdrawn; tofacitinib started; improvement in inflammatory markers and regression of ulcers with scarring; no relapse at 6-month follow-up

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Purpuric lesions on bilateral lower extremities; pedal oedema
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Skin biopsy of right leg: leucocytoclastic vasculitis and fibrinoid necrosis of small vessels in upper and mid dermis; histopathology consistent with cutaneous polyarteritis nodosa; improvement in inflammatory markers

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Palpable mass in left axilla; unknown duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Palpable lump in left axilla; non-tender; history of surgical excision of accessory breast in left axilla several years ago
Medical_Record.Background: No history of estrogen replacement therapy; no familial history of breast cancer

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Non-tender, palpable lump in left axilla
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Mammography: 4 cm asymmetry with fine pleomorphic microcalcifications; several enlarged lymph nodes in left axilla. Ultrasound: 45-mm indistinct hyperechoic area with internal irregular hypoechoic nodules; increased vascularity; seven suspicious lymph nodes at levels 1–3. MRI: 36-mm non-mass enhancement at subcutaneous fat layer of left axilla; no breast lesions. US-guided core needle biopsy: invasive ductal carcinoma. Immunohistochemistry: ER positive 98%, PR positive 20%, HER2 positive (3+), Ki 67 index 50%. Abdominal CT: multiple low-density masses in both liver lobes. PET-CT: abnormal radioactive concentration in liver masses (SUV max 5.1). Clinical stage: cT2N2M1. Repeat abdominal CT after 6 months: decreased size of hepatic lesions

Diagnosis: Primary invasive ductal carcinoma arising in axillary accessory breast with hepatic metastases

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Abdominal pain, vomiting, weakness; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Abdominal pain, vomiting, weakness; weight loss 2-3 kg over recent weeks; no fever or sweating
Medical_Record.Background: History of hip joint replacement surgery; no significant past medical history reported; no allergies or medications reported; Karnofsky performance status 80%

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Mild tenderness in middle abdominal quadrant; adenopathy 2 × 1 cm at left jugulodigastric chain; adenopathy 3 × 1 cm at left supraclavicular area; otherwise normal
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Hemoglobin 9.1 mg/dl (low); AST 71 u/lit (elevated); ALT 656 u/lit (elevated); normal CBC, renal function, alkaline phosphatase, LDH; abdominal CT: 71 × 61 mm mass at aortic bifurcation; echocardiography: 74 × 60 mm mass in right atrium, LV ejection fraction 65%; thoracic CT: intra-cardiac mass; ECG: no significant changes; pathology: CD20 positive, HMB 45 and CK negative, compatible with B-cell non-Hodgkin lymphoma; bone marrow biopsy: hypercellular, lymphoma infiltration; post-chemotherapy CT: no evidence of disease

Medical_Record.Demographics: 39-year-old female; former real estate agent; housewife

Medical_Record.Background: Married; one five-year-old son; husband works long hours; no mention of PMH, surgical history, family history, medications, allergies, immunizations, travel

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Admission for Alzheimer's dementia; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Anxious expression; difficulty with oral intake; developed myelodysplastic syndrome with anaemia and thrombocytopenia; suspected sepsis; progressive deterioration
Medical_Record.Background: History of chronic subdural haematoma, old cerebral infarction, dysphagia, glaucoma; brimonidine tartrate drop administered; nutritional support via central venous hyperalimentation; multiple antibiotics administered (ampicillin sodium, meropenem hydrate, ceftazidime hydrate, gentamicin sulphate)

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Height 150 cm; weight 30.1 kg; body temperature 37.1°C; blood pressure 94/65 mmHg; heart rate 70 bpm; normal sinus rhythm on ECG; respiratory rate 20 breaths/min; oxygen saturation 94%; anxious expression
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: WBC 12,490/μL on admission, increased to 17,580/μL; C-reactive protein 1.31 mg/dL on admission, increased to 2.20 mg/dL; ANMS monitoring showed marked linear decrease in LF and HF of HRV components; heart rate increased by ~10 bpm over 3 days

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Acute right-sided sensomotoric hemiparesis and aphasia; duration since 08:15, last-seen-normal at 03:00
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Wake-up stroke with severe right-sided weakness and aphasia; substantial worsening of preexisting weakness on right side; new facial weakness; NIHSS score 20 on admission; improvement after mechanical thrombectomy and speech therapy
Medical_Record.Background: Genetically confirmed Duchenne muscular dystrophy; known dilated cardiomyopathy; history of left ventricular thrombus (August 2015); on low molecular weight heparin (interrupted in error), bisoprolol, magnesium, vitamin D; moderate- to high-grade hypotonic tetraparesis due to DMD; no atrial fibrillation; no thrombophilia; no drug allergies or family/social history mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Vital parameters stable; moderate- to high-grade hypotonic tetraparesis; severe right-sided hemiparesis; aphasia; new facial weakness; NIHSS score 20 on admission, improved to 12 at discharge
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: INR 0.9; cerebral CT: slight early ischemic changes in LMCA territory (ASPECT-Score 8), hyperdense media sign on left; CT angiography: proximal LMCA occlusion; echocardiography: no intracardial thrombus, reduced ejection fraction; prolonged ECG: no atrial fibrillation; CK 1883 U/L (elevated), LDH 321 U/L (elevated), CK-MB 144.5 U/L (elevated); creatinine 0.25 mg/dl (low), cystatin C 1.10 mg/L, GFR 83 ml/min; follow-up CT: demarcation of ischemia in left basal ganglia with mild edema; hemostaseology: no thrombophilia

Diagnosis: Acute ischemic stroke in Duchenne muscular dystrophy

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Developmental delays; facial dysmorphisms; duration since birth
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Eyes unable to follow objects; hypotonia; global developmental delay; unable to hold head up or crawl at 8 months; unable to respond to name at 17 months; sitting only with hand support; unable to grasp objects
Medical_Record.Background: Born at 39 weeks gestation; birth weight 3,220 g; prenatal abdominal mass; multicystic dysplastic kidney with normal renal function; ligation surgery for patent ductus arteriosus at 3 weeks; no parental chromosome analysis

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Prenatal and postnatal ultrasonography: multicystic dysplastic kidney; brain MRI: delayed myelination; EEG: high amplitude spike discharges left frontotemporoparietal area; chromosome analysis: 46,XX,del(22)(q13.3); FISH: ARSA gene deletion; MLPA: SHANK3 gene deletion; developmental tests: global developmental delay

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Visual disturbance in right eye; immediate onset after coil embolization
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Large visual field defect in right eye; mild relative afferent pupillary defect; no abnormal anterior segment findings; visual acuity 20/20 initially; visual acuity decreased to 20/25 over two weeks; gradual improvement in retinal opacification and edema; persistent small arteriolar obstructions and capillary nonperfusion
Medical_Record.Background: History of ruptured anterior communicating artery aneurysm treated with coil embolization 6 months prior; recent prophylactic coil embolization for right distal internal carotid artery aneurysm; no other background information provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Pupils reactive; mild relative afferent pupillary defect in right eye; no abnormal anterior segment findings; fundus shows diffuse retinal opacification sparing papillomacular bundle in right eye
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Fluorescein angiography: delayed arterial filling, multiple small branch retinal arteriolar obstructions, tortuosity and mild leakage in inferior temporal branch retinal artery; optical coherence tomography: inner retinal edema, hyperreflectivity on temporal macula; visual field test: superior and inferior arcuate scotomas sparing center field; follow-up: improved retinal opacification and edema, persistent small arteriolar obstructions and capillary nonperfusion

Diagnosis: Branch retinal arteriolar occlusion following coil embolization

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Incidentally identified hypercalcemia; duration not stated
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: No symptoms reported; hypercalcemia found during routine blood tests

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Recurrent vomiting; 10-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Persistent vomiting; febrile; dehydrated; low body mass index; acute kidney injury; hypokalaemia; hyperphosphatemia; vomiting persisted despite fluid and electrolyte replacement
Medical_Record.Background: History of cerebrovascular disease, diabetes, hypertension; no surgical history, family or social history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel history mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Febrile; dehydrated; low body mass index; depressed level of consciousness; myoclonus; sinus tachycardia; polypnea; pleural effusion; peripheral edema
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Creatinine 4.1 mg/dl; K+ 3.2 mg/dl (initial), 2.7 mg/dl (after TPN); Pi 5.4 mg/dl (initial), 0.6 mg/dl (after TPN); Mg2+ 0.9 mg/dl (after TPN); Na+ 162 mg/dl (after TPN); nasogastric intubation: stasis (1800 cc/24h); upper GI endoscopy: duodenal lumen narrowing; CT scan: heterogeneous mass in pancreatic head, Wirsung duct dilation, duodenal compression

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Headache and vomiting; 10-day and 3-day duration respectively
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Headache began 10 days ago; vomiting for 3 days; no history of trauma or bleeding disorders; recent hip prosthesis placement 20 days ago; general anesthesia after failed epidural anesthesia; enoxaparin 100 mg/day for 3 days postoperatively; headache fronto-occipital, not postural
Medical_Record.Background: No history of trauma or bleeding disorders; recent hip prosthesis placement; enoxaparin administered postoperatively

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Normal neurological examination
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Cranial CT: 15-mm-thick bilateral frontoparietal chronic subdural hematoma compressing brain

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Fever, joint pain, petechial rash; 3-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: History of systemic juvenile idiopathic arthritis; initial presentation with quotidian fevers, evanescent rash, polyarthritis at age 15; well-controlled on canakinumab for 5 years; recent onset of fever, joint pain, petechial rash; subsequent episode with fever, hypotension, diffuse erythematous rash, facial and conjunctival swelling, 10 days after discharge and 3 weeks after starting TMP/SMX
Medical_Record.Background: No significant past medical history other than SJIA; no surgical history mentioned; no family or social history provided; medications include canakinumab, emapalumab, TMP/SMX, acyclovir, prednisone; no allergies mentioned; immunization, travel, and other contextual data not stated

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Fever; hypotension; diffuse erythematous rash on neck, back, chest, arms, hands; facial swelling; conjunctival erythema
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Ferritin 6028 ng/mL; platelets 47×10⁹/L; fibrinogen 117 mg/dL; AST 142 unit/L; CXCL9 34,638 pg/mL; bone marrow biopsy: increased CD8 positive T cells, scattered haemophagocytosis, no leukaemia or lymphoma; EBV PCR 501,400 IU/mL; negative EBV IgG/IgM; profound lymphopenia and thrombocytopaenia; worsening hyperferritinaemia; elevated d-dimer; negative blood cultures; decreased EBV viral load; no peripheral eosinophilia

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Malaise, dark urine, jaundice; several days duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Malaise, dark urine, jaundice; no prior liver disease; no alcohol or substance use; new liraglutide started 2 weeks prior; herbal and dietary supplements (Nux vomica, Arnica montana, greater celandine) started 3 months prior for chronic abdominal pain and nausea
Medical_Record.Background: Diabetes, diabetic neuropathy, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, irritable bowel syndrome, chronic pain; home medications: acetaminophen-hydrocodone, aspirin, atorvastatin, glipizide, insulin glargine, metformin; no abnormal liver tests previously; prior endoscopy and abdominal imaging normal

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Vital signs within normal limits; jaundice; no hepatic encephalopathy; no hepatosplenomegaly; no ascites
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Serum total bilirubin 12.3 mg/dL; alkaline phosphatase 507 U/L; alanine aminotransferase 974 U/L; aspartate aminotransferase 1,119 U/L; R value 5.8; viral and autoimmune hepatitis serologies negative; abdominal ultrasound and CT normal; liver biopsy: hepatitis, lymphocytic inflammation with eosinophils, hepatocyte necrosis, grade 3 activity, stage 1 fibrosis, mild fatty changes

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Lower GI bleeding; acute onset
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Initial episode of lower GI bleeding; stabilized with transfusion; solitary diverticular-like lesion in sigmoid colon detected; symptom improved after endoscopic clipping; recurrent lower GI bleeding after 7 weeks; scheduled for laparoscopic segmental resection
Medical_Record.Background: History of alcoholic liver cirrhosis; diagnosed with hepatocellular carcinoma 6 years ago; treated with transarterial chemoembolization 7 times; no ascites; no encephalopathy; Child-Pugh grade A; no mention of occupation, family history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Hemoglobin 7.5-7.8 g/dL; AST/ALT 27.8/13.8 U/L; alkaline phosphatase 41 U/L; albumin 2.8-3.3 g/dL; a-fetoprotein 26 ng/mL; bilirubin 1.6-0.94 mg/dL; prothrombin time 12.3 seconds; colonoscopy shows solitary diverticular-like lesion in sigmoid colon; abdominopelvic CT scan; intraoperative findings: right side fixation of sigmoid colon, hepato-sigmoidocolic fistula, midgut malrotation, metastatic hepatocellular carcinoma invading sigmoid colon; gross specimen: perforation between sigmoid colon and liver; microscopic: 4.5 x 5 cm metastatic hepatocellular carcinoma invading sigmoid colon

Diagnosis: Metastatic hepatocellular carcinoma invading sigmoid colon with hepato-sigmoidocolic fistula and midgut malrotation

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Fever, jaundice, hepatosplenomegaly, pancytopenia; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Fever, jaundice, hepatosplenomegaly, pancytopenia; abnormal liver function tests; acute EBV infection; no response to initial treatment; developed CNS symptoms including convulsion, ataxia, spasticity, slurred speech
Medical_Record.Background: Product of consanguineous marriage (first-degree cousins); no family history of HLH, immune disorders, hepatic diseases, or blood malignancies; no relevant past medical or surgical history provided

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Elevated AST, ALT, LDH, total and direct bilirubin; prolonged PT and aPTT; serum ferritin nearly 1000 ng/ml; low fibrinogen, total protein, albumin; high EBV VCA IgM; negative hepatitis A, B, C serology; normal autoimmune hepatitis antibodies; normal ceruloplasmin and 24-h urine copper; inconclusive liver and bone marrow biopsy; normal CSF analysis; brain MRI: white matter hypersignal intensities on T2 and FLAIR; whole exome sequencing: novel homozygous missense mutation in PRF1 gene (c.1120 T > G, p.W374G); Sanger sequencing confirmed mutation

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Jaundice and elevated liver enzymes during temozolomide chemotherapy; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Temporal-parietal glioblastoma WHO IV° diagnosed after cephalea; complete resection performed; adjuvant radiochemotherapy with temozolomide started; initial tolerance good; developed grade II° thrombopenia and increasing liver enzymes after 32 days of temozolomide and 24 fractions of radiotherapy; jaundice developed; reported use of Chinese herbs twice daily for 2 weeks during treatment; liver enzymes normalized 3 months after cessation of temozolomide and Chinese herbs
Medical_Record.Background: Hypertension; recurrent cutaneous herpes infections; co-medications: dexamethasone, pantoprazole, levetiracetam, mirtazapine, valaciclovir; no neurological deficiencies post-resection; Karnofsky performance status 90%; no mention of allergies, occupation, immunizations, or travel history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Jaundice; no neurological deficiencies; Karnofsky performance status 90%
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Bilirubin 16.7 mg/dl; AST 263 U/l; ALT 585 U/l; exclusion of viral hepatitis, Epstein-Barr virus, cytomegalovirus infection; CT scan; autoantibody screening negative; endoscopic retrograde endoscopy negative for biliary/pancreatic pathology; negative herpes PCR; [18 F]-fluorethylenthyrosin PET positive for residual tumor

Diagnosis: Toxic hepatitis induced by Chinese herbal medicine during temozolomide chemotherapy

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Incidental finding of enlarging mediastinal mass; asymptomatic
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Left pericardial soft tissue mass documented by serial CT scans for six years; originally thought to be pericardial cyst; gross increase in size noted on routine chest X-ray prior to colonoscopy; no symptoms reported
Medical_Record.Background: No significant past medical history; no reported medications, allergies, or family history

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Chest X-ray shows increased mass size; CT with contrast reveals mediastinal mass in left infrahilar region, increased from 4.6 x 3.7 x 3.2 cm to 5.6 x 5.2 x 4.2 cm over three years; PET CT shows increased F18 FDG uptake (SUV 7.2) in mass, multiple calcified and noncalcified mediastinal and bilateral hilar lymph nodes (up to 9 mm, SUV up to 3.5); echocardiogram negative for pericardial involvement; left thoracotomy with resection of 81g, 6 x 5.5 x 5.0 cm well-encapsulated pedunculated mass under parietal pleura; multiple calcified subcarinal and left hilar lymph nodes excised; frozen section: lymphoid tissue; final pathology: small lymphocytes with intermixed epithelioid cells, hyalinized pleural nodules; immunohistochemistry: thymoma, B1 type

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Persistent productive cough; 1-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Productive cough; exertional dyspnea; unintentional weight loss; chronic diarrhea; history of Pseudomonas aeruginosa in sputum culture
Medical_Record.Background: No systemic symptoms; no joint pain; no skin or mucosal symptoms; parents healthy, consanguineous, Palestinian descent; sibling deceased after complicated respiratory infection; healthy younger brother; no significant past medical history reported

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Appears younger than stated age; comfortable; not in distress; oxygen saturation 95% on room air; normal vital signs; normal cardiovascular exam; scattered ronchi; bilateral decreased breath sounds; enlarged liver; no digital clubbing; no cyanosis
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Chest CT: diffuse bronchiectasis, tree-in-bud pattern, liver cirrhosis, cholestasis, splenomegaly, no ascites; Sputum culture: pansensitive Klebsiella; Sinus CT: chronic sinusitis; Quantitative immunoglobulins, acid-fast bacillus cultures, liver enzymes, liver function tests: normal; Sweat chloride test: normal conductivity (<9mmol/L); CFTR gene analysis: homozygous unclassified variant c.2490insT; Parental CFTR sequencing: both heterozygous; sibling homozygous normal; hyperglycemia on follow-up

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Left flank pain; 1-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Left flank pain; left costovertebral angle tenderness; initial impression of ureter stone
Medical_Record.Background: Previous smoker; hypertension on medication; history of spontaneous intracerebral hemorrhage 9 years ago; history of ureter stone 7–8 years ago

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Left costovertebral angle tenderness
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Non-contrast CT: two masses in left kidney; contrast-enhanced CT: 7-cm lobulated mass in lower pole involving Gerota’s fascia, 4.4-cm necrotic mass near upper pole, suspected metastatic lymph node in hilum; radical nephrectomy with adrenalectomy performed; histopathology: two well-circumscribed solid masses, areas of hemorrhage and necrosis, rhabdoid features, lymphovascular invasion, papillary adenomas; immunohistochemistry: positive for CD10, focal epithelial membrane antigen, pan-cytokeratin, vimentin; negative for cytokeratin 7, CD117, immune cell markers, muscular markers, HMB45, CD99; nuclear p53 focally positive; NGS: novel SMARCB1 mutation (c.1047G>A, p.Trp349*); loss of INI1 expression; follow-up CT: recurrent mass abutting left psoas muscle, invasion of posterior aortic wall; pathology: metastatic carcinoma with rhabdoid features

Diagnosis: Malignant rhabdoid tumor of the kidney

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Precordial chest pain radiating to left arm and neck; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Chest pain; no aggravating or relieving factors
Medical_Record.Background: History of hypertension; family history of coronary artery disease (father diagnosed at 42); no other medical, surgical, social history, medications, allergies, or contextual data mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Unremarkable physical exam
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Negative troponins; abnormal stress test; echocardiogram ejection fraction 60%-65%; invasive angiography shows absence of left circumflex artery, large right coronary artery with 30% stenosis, ostial left anterior descending with 60% stenosis

Diagnosis: Congenital absence of left circumflex coronary artery

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Progressive abnormal behavior, personality change, cognitive decline; 4-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Disinhibition, hoarding, aggression, compulsive behavior, apathy, dietary change; progressive cognitive decline with initial sparing of memory and visuospatial function; later onset memory impairment and visuospatial dysfunction; worsening disinhibition, apathy, increased appetite; dizziness, unstable gait
Medical_Record.Background: History of hyperlipidemia; no family history of neurological diseases; no mention of occupation, surgical history, medications, allergies, immunizations, travel

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Hyperactive deep tendon reflexes in bilateral biceps, brachioradialis, knees; positive Chaddock signs bilaterally; bilateral sway on tandem gait; xanthomas on bilateral dorsum of hands and Achilles tendons
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Mini-Mental State Examination score 22; clinical dementia rating score 1; global cognitive impairment; skin biopsy: diffuse infiltration of foamy macrophages in dermis; tendon biopsy: numerous lipid crystal clefts, few foamy macrophages; brain spectroscopy: hypoperfusion in bilateral frontal and right temporal lobes; brain MRI: periventricular white matter changes, progression and symmetrical hyperintense lesions in dentate nucleus; 18F-flutemetamol PET: negative for amyloid; nerve conduction study: no peripheral neuropathy; SSEP and VEP: abnormal; bone mineral osteodensitometry: osteoporosis; ophthalmic exam: age-related macular degeneration; serum cholestanol 12.4 mg/L (elevated); 7α,12α-dihydroxycholest-4-en-3-one 0.485 nmol/mL (elevated); very-long-chain fatty acids and arylsulfatase A: normal; genetic analysis: CYP27A1 gene mutations (c.1001T>A, p.Met334Lys; c.1420C>T, p.Arg474Trp)

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Fever, chills, myalgias, fatigue; 2-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Fever, chills, myalgias, fatigue for two weeks; no prior relevant medical history; 6 lifetime male sexual partners; inconsistent condom use
Medical_Record.Background: No history of sexually transmitted infections; no predisposing skin conditions; HIV serology negative

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Temperature 100.2°F; erythematous rash with papules and scaling over malar region; multiple tender small ulcerations over labia and perineum
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: HSV-2 IgM positive, IgG negative; HSV-1 IgM and IgG negative; viral culture of genital lesions positive for HSV-2; HSV-2 PCR in blood 1.1 million copies/mL, declined after acyclovir; elevated liver function tests; negative HSV CSF PCR after treatment; normal labs and exam at 1-month follow-up; seroconversion to HSV-2 IgG positive

Diagnosis: Disseminated Herpes Simplex Virus with Fulminant Hepatitis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Confusional state; 10-day duration after earthquake
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Unusually silent and secluded; frequent intrusive recollections of destroyed buildings; terrifying dreams; feelings of loneliness and helplessness; confusional state; later difficulty recalling names; fluent but senseless speech; inappropriate language; vain hilarity
Medical_Record.Background: 5 years of education; lived in tent for 3 weeks after earthquake; relocated for 4 months; no physical injury; EKG and laboratory exams normal; treated with benzodiazepines and quetiapine; MMSE 27 initially, later 25

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: EEG dominant frequency 9.0 Hz; MRI mild age-related diffuse atrophy, later frontal and bilateral temporal atrophy, increased lateral ventricles; lumbar puncture: increased tau and phospho-tau proteins, Aβ 1-42 level 813 pg/mL

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Bedwetting; persistent since age 2
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Difficulty starting urinary stream; intermittent interruption of urinary stream; persistent bedwetting; no hematuria
Medical_Record.Background: Agenesis of right kidney; pelvic ectopy of single left kidney; cyst of bladder; regular medical checkups; no surgical interventions; second child of five; no family history of similar health problems

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Well appearance; blood pressure 100/60 mmHg; pulse 82 beats/min; agenesis of vagina
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Urine analysis normal; creatinine 90 μmol/L; sonography: right kidney not visualized, left kidney in pelvic region (51.8 × 62.8 cm), bladder cystic mass (23 × 20 mm); CT: right kidney agenesis, left kidney pelvic ectopy, bladder cystic mass (24 × 17 mm), uterus and vagina agenesis; intravenous urography: right kidney not visualized, left kidney normal function, bladder cystic mass; excretory cystography: bladder cystic mass; transvesical surgery: excision of multiple cystic masses; histology: rudimentary multicystic dysplastic kidney features

Diagnosis: Pelvic dystopia of right rudimentary multicystic dysplastic kidney with single pelvic ectopic left kidney and Mayer-Rokitansky-Küster-Hauser syndrome

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Sudden sharp continuous right calf pain; 4-day duration after third Pfizer-BioNTech vaccine dose
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Pain progressed to anterior leg, ascended asymmetrically to thigh, hip, genitalia, both lower limbs; tingling sensation in pant-like distribution, worse on right; rash developed next day as grouped vesicles over posterolateral right leg, extended to both lower limbs, back, head; no headache, weakness, confusion, urine retention, or loss of sphincteric control
Medical_Record.Background: History of childhood chickenpox; no varicella booster; no similar conditions in household; no contact with infected individuals; diabetes type II (well-controlled on dual oral hypoglycemics); essential hypertension (controlled on single agent); vitamin B12 deficiency (on replacement); generally fit and athletic

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Disseminated rash involving multiple dermatomes; shiny grouped vesicles and single-spaced vesicles; impaired right foot dorsiflexion; decreased pinprick sensation over dorsum of foot and lateral leg; normal power, tone, reflexes; normal ophthalmological exam
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Serum varicella zoster IgG and IgM reactive; HIV screen negative; MRI spine: thickening and prominent enhancement of right L5 nerve (lumbosacral plexopathy); CSF: leukocyte count 500, protein 1000, positive PCR for varicella-zoster virus; nerve conduction study: affected common peroneal nerve

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Right neck masses; 5-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Gradual enlargement of right neck masses; rapid growth of middle mass; dysphagia; labored breathing; dizziness; occasional earaches; left limb weakness; hoarseness; prior craniotomy with hematoma removal and tumor resection; masses continued to grow after neck exploratory surgery
Medical_Record.Background: No family history of meningiomas or neck tumors; prior metaplastic atypical meningioma (WHO grade II) with local de-differentiation (WHO grade III); no radiotherapy post-operatively

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Two right neck masses (10 cm × 8 cm upper, 8 cm × 5 cm middle); 18.0-cm lateral surgical scar; tracheal deviation to left; right vocal cord paralysis; grade 3 muscle strength in left upper and lower limbs
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Routine blood tests, coagulation, liver and kidney function, blood electrolytes normal; CT and MRI show right calcified mass (7.1 cm × 5.8 cm × 6.0 cm) and large cystic mass in right parapharyngeal space (5.9 cm × 9.2 cm × 8.1 cm); masses extend to sublingual space and thorax; adjacent blood vessels displaced; trachea, oropharynx, hypopharynx deviated to left; angiography shows right common carotid artery compressed and occluded, internal carotid artery diameter reduced, jugular vein enveloped and occluded; balloon occlusion test shows no perfusion in right common carotid artery; anterior communicating artery compensates for cerebral circulation

Diagnosis: Malignant meningioma with jugular vein invasion and carotid artery extension

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Progressive weakness and numbness of both lower limbs; 3-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Chronic constipation; difficulty passing urine; continuous dribbling of urine; bedridden for 5 months
Medical_Record.Background: No history of spine surgery; no previous lumbar puncture; no neurocutaneous markers; no cutaneous stigmata of occult spinal dysraphism

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Severely spastic paraparesis; complete sensory loss below T2 dermatome; lax anal tone
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Pre-operative CEMRI: rim enhancing ventrally placed cystic intradural lesion at D2-3; heterogeneous lesion posteriorly at D3-4 causing cord thinning; CT: crescent-shaped ossification in dorsal spinal canal; motor evoked potentials normal in upper limbs, not recordable in lower limbs; D-wave not recordable; post-operative serum and CSF germ cell tumor markers normal; histopathology: mature teratoma with ossification

Diagnosis: Ossified upper thoracic intradural mature teratoma

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Frequent episodes of fatigue and irritability; 6-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Episodes of fatigue, irritability, impaired concentration, tremor without loss of consciousness; episodes resolve after eating; road traffic accident 2 months ago due to hypoglycemic event
Medical_Record.Background: Recently diagnosed hypertension controlled with amlodipine 5 mg daily; elective laparoscopic cholecystectomy 5 years ago; no contributory family or social history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Afebrile; blood pressure 115/68 mmHg; pulse 72 beats/minute; respiratory rate 14 breaths/minute; normal neurological and cardiorespiratory examination
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Serum glucose 50 mg/dL during episode; insulin 40.1 uIU/mL (elevated); C-peptide 4.8 ng/mL (elevated); abdominal CT: single enhancing lesion at head of pancreas (1.5 × 1.0 cm); histopathology: neuroendocrine pancreatic tumor, synaptophysin positive

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Persistent depressive mood, social withdrawal, behavioural and eating disorders; duration since age 16, worsened at age 22
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Tendency to isolation, deflected mood, somatizations since age 16; social withdrawal, behavioural and eating disorders onset at age 22; persistent symptoms despite previous treatments; compulsive overeating without purging; fear of contamination with repeated hand washing; intense anxiety; superficial relationships, impulsivity, intense anger; psychosomatic symptoms (skin reddening and itch with fabrics, intolerance to smells and materials); psychosomatic genital symptoms (reddening and itch) during second year of treatment
Medical_Record.Background: History of Major Depressive Disorder; treated with atypical antipsychotics, antidepressants, benzodiazepines, psychotherapeutic interventions; arterial hypertension; type 2 diabetes mellitus; BMI 45 at presentation; completely toothless; medications: risperidone, sertraline, delorazepam, enalapril, metformin; no organic cause found on EEG and allergologic testing; supportive psychotherapy ongoing; progressive weight loss during treatment; normalization of glycaemic values; antihypertensive therapy continued

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: EEG normal; allergologic patch test negative; psychodiagnostic assessments: BPD-scale 40, HAM-D 35, HAM-A 41, Y-BOCS 35, BULIT-R 94 at baseline; HAM-D 15, HAM-A 9, Y-BOCS 6, BULIT-R 81 at 1 year; HAM-D 6, HAM-A 6, Y-BOCS 3, BULIT-R 56 at 2 years; BMI reduced from 45 to 33; fasting glycaemia reduced from 15.5 mmol/l to 4.3 mmol/l

Diagnosis: Borderline Personality Disorder with comorbid Obsessive-Compulsive Disorder and Bulimic Disorder

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Diffuse abdominal pain; 1-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Insidious onset abdominal pain; migratory; progressive; associated with nausea, vomiting, decreased appetite
Medical_Record.Background: Normotensive; nondiabetic; euthyroid; no abnormal blood glucose, liver, or renal profiles

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Hemodynamically stable; abdominal distension; moderate rebound tenderness in right iliac fossa; localized peritonitis; positive McBurney's sign; positive Rovsing sign; positive Dunphy's sign; unremarkable respiratory and cardiovascular examinations; unremarkable digital rectal examination
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Laboratory parameters indicate acute appendicitis; ultrasonography shows elongated cystic, dilated, aperistaltic, non-compressible gut loop in right lower quadrant with internal echoes; no interloop fluid; no mesenteric lymph nodes; intraoperative findings: mucocele of appendix (6 × 1 × 1 cm); histopathology: crowded tubular structures, no epithelial atypia, acellular mucin pooling (35 ml), no malignancy

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Acute pressure-like chest pain; >20-minute duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: High-intensity chest pain; diaphoresis; mild shortness of breath; no relation to emotional stress or intense exercise
Medical_Record.Background: No atherosclerotic risk factors; no family history of cardiac disease, sudden cardiac death, or autoimmune disease; no regular medication

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Slightly anxious; heart rate 90 bpm; blood pressure 122/67 mmHg; respiratory rate 19/min; oxygen saturation 98% on ambient air; normal S1 and S2; no murmurs or gallops; no signs of heart failure
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: ECG: sinus rhythm; 3-4 mm ST-segment elevations in V2-V6; coronary angiography: dual lumen defect (TIMI 0), intimal dissection of left anterior descending coronary artery, ramus intermedius, extension to left main coronary artery (Type 1 SCAD); intravascular ultrasound: near-circumferential haematoma in left main coronary artery; stent placement in left anterior descending coronary artery; electrical defibrillation for ventricular fibrillation; post-procedure ECG: normalization of ST-segment, anterior Q-waves (V1-4), mild T-wave inversion; cardiac troponin T: 117 ng/mL (elevated); full blood count, kidney function, electrolytes: normal; transthoracic echocardiogram: apical thrombus, severe left ventricular dysfunction (ejection fraction 30%), anterior wall akinesia; CT angiography: fibromuscular dysplasia in right renal, right femoral, and brain arteries

Diagnosis: Multivessel spontaneous coronary artery dissection involving the left main coronary artery

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Increased abdominal circumference; 3-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive abdominal distension; solid hepatic mass detected on ultrasound; MRI revealed large liver tumor involving left lobe and segment V; initial AFP 6,130 ng/ml; neoadjuvant chemotherapy initiated; tumor size decreased after chemotherapy; referred for possible liver transplant; restaged MRI showed mass in segment IVb; AFP decreased to 447 ng/ml
Medical_Record.Background: No reported past medical history; no reported surgical history; no family or social history provided; no medication or allergy information; under ambulatory pediatric care

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: No physical exam abnormalities at 1-year postoperative follow-up
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Abdominal ultrasound: solid mass 52 × 50 mm in right hepatic lobe; MRI: large tumor (~12 cm), left lobe and segment V, middle hepatic vein infiltration; chest x-ray: no pulmonary metastases; follow-up MRI: lesion in segments II, IV, V, decreased size, no vascular involvement; restaging MRI: mass in segment IVb, no vascular or extrahepatic involvement; chest CT: no disease extension; AFP: initial 6,130 ng/ml, post-chemotherapy 447 ng/ml; three-phase liver angiotomography: segment IVb mass 5.5 × 3.5 × 5 cm, patent vessels; preoperative LFTs: minor AST elevation; postoperative angiotomography: unchanged mass, portal vein ligation changes, segments VI and VII volume 231 ml; pathology: hepatoblastoma, mixed differentiation, 90% epithelial, 10% mesenchymal, 100% tumor viability, no vascular invasion, clear margins; postoperative imaging: normal echocardiogram, chest CT, abdominal MRI, no recurrence; AFP: slight increase, then progressive decrease

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Nausea, vomiting, hematemesis, melena; 3-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Nausea and vomiting for 3 days; two episodes of hematemesis and melena; failed to respond to fluid bolus; required norepinephrine infusion; received pantoprazole and octreotide infusions; massive blood transfusion initiated
Medical_Record.Background: Alcohol use disorder; cirrhosis; chronic pancreatitis; no baseline renal dysfunction; no mention of allergies, surgical history, family history, or occupation

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Temp 36.9°C; heart rate 133 bpm with sinus tachycardia; respiratory rate 24/min; blood pressure 60/40 mmHg; SpO2 90% on room air; lethargy; full orientation; conjunctival pallor; scleral icterus; signs of dehydration; soft, mild to moderately distended, non-tender abdomen; normoactive bowel sounds; no cutaneous bleeding
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Hemoglobin drop to 7.5 g/dL from 12.1 g/dL; MCV 91 fL; RDW-CV 23.8%; platelet 224,000 to 11,000 cells/μL; WBC 20,000 cells/mL; PT 20 sec; PTT 39 sec; INR 1.6; lactic acid 13.4 mmol/L; total bilirubin 9.7 mg/dL; alkaline phosphatase 138 U/L; AST 717 U/L; ALT 83 U/L; creatinine 2.2 mg/dL; potassium 4.3 mmol/L; sodium 134 mmol/L; magnesium 1.9 mg/dL; MELDNa score 22; Maddrey's discriminant function 28.1; EGD: grade 3 esophageal varices, banding, esophageal ulcers with stigmata of recent bleeding; fibrinogen normal; no schistocytes on peripheral blood film

Diagnosis: Refractory octreotide-induced thrombocytopenia in active gastrointestinal bleeding

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Painless progressive decrease in vision in both eyes
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Gradual vision loss; no pain; poor mydriasis in both eyes; duration not specified
Medical_Record.Background: On imipramine therapy (25 mg once daily) for 10 months; stopped 4 months prior; scheduled for phacoemulsification; no other history provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Ocular examination normal except bilateral cataract; preoperative pupil dilation to 5.0 mm

Diagnosis: Intraoperative Floppy Iris Syndrome (IFIS) associated with imipramine

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Cow’s milk allergy; referred for evaluation
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Peanut and tree nut sensitisation; no prior peanut consumption; mild oral itch after incremental peanut doses during DBPCFC; abdominal pain after last dose; delayed onset extensive urticarial skin lesions and abdominal pain 4 hours post-challenge; symptoms resolved after anti-histamine
Medical_Record.Background: Atopic; positive sIgE to peanut (2.1 IE/L); positive SPT with peanut extract (13 mm); sensitisation to Ara h 6 (11.2 ISU-E) and Ara h 8 (3.3 ISU-E); primary Bet v 1 (PR-10) sensitisation (56 ISU-E); advised peanut avoidance

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: sIgE to peanut positive (2.1 IE/L); SPT with peanut extract positive (13 mm); ImmunoCAP ISAC: Ara h 6 (11.2 ISU-E), Ara h 8 (3.3 ISU-E), Bet v 1 (56 ISU-E); DBPCFC positive for peanut

Diagnosis: Mono-sensitisation to peanut component Ara h 6

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Lightheadedness with activity; progressive heart failure symptoms over 3 years
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Sudden cardiac arrest in 2003; RV lead fracture and total failure to capture in 2015; marked bradycardia; complete heart block; right bundle branch block escape rhythm; monitored for 48 hours; progressive heart failure symptoms; decreased LV ejection fraction to 35% in early 2015
Medical_Record.Background: Complete infranodal heart block diagnosed in 2000; dual-chamber pacemaker implanted; long QT syndrome; dual-chamber ICD upgrade in 2003; right breast cancer in 2012 treated with doxorubicin; cardiomyopathy; unclear etiology of cardiomyopathy (chemotherapy vs pacing-induced)

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Marked bradycardia; hemodynamically stable
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Electrocardiogram: complete heart block, right bundle branch block escape rhythm; echocardiogram: LV ejection fraction 35%; telemetry monitoring for 48 hours

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Fever 39.5°C, erythema nodosum in both legs, bilateral knee arthritis, perineum aphthae; acute onset
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Fever; erythema nodosum; bilateral knee arthritis; perineum aphthae; ocular symptoms including decreased vision and uveitis; recurrent neuroretinitis
Medical_Record.Background: Born in Israel; Kurdish, Iraqi, and Yemenite ancestry; family history of ulcerative colitis and psoriasis; no mention of surgical history, medications prior to presentation, allergies, immunizations, or travel

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: BCVA 20/25 both eyes; right eye normal; left eye mild anterior uveitis (cells +1), mild intermediate uveitis (vitreous haze +1), macular star appearance; later, BCVA 20/30 right eye, finger counting left eye; right eye mild intermediate uveitis; left eye significant anterior uveitis (cells +4, flare +2), mild intermediate uveitis (vitreous haze +1), recurrent neuroretinitis
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Leukocytosis 20,000/μL (76% neutrophils); CRP 89 mg/L (elevated); ESR 84 mm/h (elevated); normal chemistry; normal ACE; negative ANA; normal ASLO; negative Bartonella henselae serology; abdominal ultrasound, colonoscopy, colon biopsy normal; right eye OCT normal; left eye OCT: hyperreflective foci in vitreous, subretinal fluid, intra-retinal cysts, intraretinal exudates; left eye ultrasound: thickening of posterior coats, sub-Tenon fluid, exudative retinal detachment; elevated liver enzymes after methotrexate

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Abdominal pain, vomiting, weight loss; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Abdominal pain, vomiting, weight loss; persistent symptoms despite dietary adjustment; development of neuropsychiatric symptoms and progressive generalized motor weakness; acute tetraparesis; deterioration to tetraplegia; gradual improvement with therapy
Medical_Record.Background: Celiac disease; positive gliadin-antibodies; heterozygous mutation in HMBS-gene (c.517C > T, p.Arg173Trp); no surgical history, family/social history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel history mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Progressive generalized motor weakness; tetraparesis; tetraplegia; axonal loss on nerve conduction studies
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Brain and spinal cord MRI normal; CSF analysis normal; nerve conduction studies show axonal loss; urine: high delta-aminolevulinic-acid and porphobilinogen; genetic testing: HMBS-gene mutation

Diagnosis: Acute intermittent porphyria with severe motor neuropathy

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Headache; 4-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Persistent headache; no nausea; no vomiting; no seizure; no blurred vision
Medical_Record.Background: Allergic to penicillin; no significant past medical history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Stable vital signs; intact neurological examination
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: MRI: sellar region lesion; T1 hypointense; T2 partial hyperintense; capsule enhancement; elevated prolactin 744.0 mIU/L; other pituitary hormones within normal range; postoperative MRI: residual hyperintense signal in sellar turcica without enhancement; histology: dysplastic ganglion cells, neoplastic glial cells, hyperplasic pituitary cells; IHC: positive synaptophysin in ganglion cells, positive GFAP in glial cells, positive CD34 around blood vessels, positive ACTH, FSH, TSH, GH, LH, PRL in pituitary cells, <2% Ki-67 labeling index; no ADH or oxytocin

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Advanced gastric cancer; referred for management
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Type III advanced gastric cancer in lesser curvature; biopsy shows papillary adenocarcinoma; suspected lymph node metastasis; no distant metastasis on imaging; lymph node recurrences at para-aortic region 4 months post-surgery; gradual enlargement of para-aortic lymph nodes; grade 3 anorexia and fatigue during chemotherapy; lung tumor detected 6 years after surgery
Medical_Record.Background: Performance status 1; open total gastrectomy with D2 lymph node dissection; pathological stage IIIC (T4a N3 M0); moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma; HER2 3+ on IHC; adjuvant S-1 chemotherapy; systemic chemotherapy with trastuzumab plus paclitaxel; second-line trastuzumab with XP chemotherapy; stepwise dose reduction of cisplatin and capecitabine; trastuzumab plus capecitabine combination therapy; right lung lobectomy for metastatic lung tumor; survived 6 years 9 months post-surgery

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Upper GI endoscopy: type III advanced gastric cancer; biopsy: papillary adenocarcinoma; preoperative imaging: no distant metastasis; eCT: para-aortic lymph node recurrences, regression after chemotherapy, lung tumor detected at 6 years; IHC: HER2 3+ in gastric and lung specimens; postoperative histopathology: lung metastasis of gastric cancer

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Acute painless profound vision loss in both eyes; 3-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Vision loss started in right eye, involved left eye one day later; central vision loss progressing to generalized; preceded by low-grade fever and headache two weeks prior; no somnolence, altered consciousness, limb weakness, nausea, vomiting, chronic cough, or rashes
Medical_Record.Background: Previously healthy; BMI 35.9 kg/m2 (obese); no treatment sought for prior symptoms

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Normal vital signs; obese; normal systemic and neurological examinations; visual acuity: perception of light in both eyes; sluggish pupillary light reflex; normal extraocular movements; unremarkable anterior segment; right eye: swollen and hyperaemic disc, spontaneous venous pulsations, no nerve fibre layer infarct; left eye: less swollen and hyperaemic disc; normal maculae; no vitritis, vasculitis, or retinitis
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CSF: lymphocytic pleocytosis; normal haemoglobin and total white blood cell count; negative serology for toxoplasmosis, syphilis, leptospirosis, mycoplasma, HIV, hepatitis C, hepatitis B, herpes-simplex virus; negative ANA, p-ANCA, c-ANCA, AQ4, MOG antibodies; CT brain and orbit: normal; MRI: normal optic nerve, no brain lesion

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Painless progressive dimness of vision in left eye more than right eye; 9-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Gradual worsening of vision; no history of contact lens usage
Medical_Record.Background: Known case of pellucid marginal corneal degeneration; no additional history provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Slit-lamp examination shows clinical features of pellucid marginal corneal degeneration in both eyes (left eye greater than right eye); grade 1 cataract in both eyes as per LOCS grading system
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Corneal topography on Pentacam HR shows typical features of pellucid marginal corneal degeneration in both eyes; left eye astigmatism of +9.00 at 118.30; preoperative UDVA 20/60 in right eye improving to CDVA 20/30 with -1 Dcyl at 180°, UDVA 20/400 in left eye improving to CDVA 20/60 with +2.5 Dsph/-9 Dcyl at 120°; postoperative UDVA 20/40 in left eye with CDVA 20/20 with -2.5 Dcyl at 65°; aniseikonia charting shows no significant distortion; postoperative aberrometry shows improved visual quality with no rotation of intraocular lens

Diagnosis: Cataract associated with pellucid marginal corneal degeneration

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Syncopal episode at school; recent headaches worse upon wakening; 2-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Single syncopal episode; headaches began two months earlier; headaches treated with over the counter non-steroidal anti-inflammatory medicines
Medical_Record.Background: No significant past medical history; tonsillectomy at age six; no current medications

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: MRI: large mass (1.2 x 2.3 cm) in midline within superior sagittal sinus; MRV: large punched out defect in superior sagittal sinus at junction of posterior two thirds and anterior one third; abnormal large cortical vein on left side with unusual loop; superior sagittal sinus slightly enlarged posterior to defect; follow-up imaging at one year: no change in size of AG

Diagnosis: Giant arachnoid granulation associated with anomalous draining vein

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Right foot pain and swelling; 1-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Throbbing pain localized to right foot; increasing intensity; hindered ambulation; exacerbated by walking and ankle movement; unable to bear weight; 20-pound weight loss over 6 months
Medical_Record.Background: Latent TB diagnosed 9 months prior; incomplete isoniazid therapy; no trauma, insect bites, or recent travel; HIV positive; iron deficiency anemia; no significant PMH, surgical history, family or social history, medications, or allergies mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Right foot warm and tender; edema from mid-foot to ankle; decreased range of motion; pedal pulses intact; no erythema, pallor, lesions, or discharge; remainder unremarkable
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: WBC 10.8; hemoglobin 10.5; hematocrit 31; platelets 172,000; sodium 130; potassium 4.6; chloride 94; bicarbonate 25; BUN 17; creatinine 0.96; elevated alkaline phosphatase 584; HIV viral load 76,168; CD4 count 89; chest x-ray and CT suggestive of miliary TB; MRI of right foot/ankle shows navicular cuneiform joint destruction and osteomyelitis; CRP 5.24; ESR 100; uric acid 6.4; LDH 248; ANA negative; anti-CCP <16; rheumatoid factor negative; Quantiferon-TB Gold positive; AFB sputum smears/cultures negative; bone biopsy: severe acute and chronic mycobacterial osteomyelitis with numerous AFB; cultures positive for mycobacterium TB; follow-up chest x-ray and MRI show improvement

Diagnosis: Miliary tuberculosis and acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS)

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Skin defects in left pretibia area; 1-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Skin defects present for 1 month; underwent wound debridement and full-thickness skin graft from groin; hematoma developed postoperatively
Medical_Record.Background: Diabetes; hypertension; atherosclerosis obliterans; on anti-coagulant agent for ASO

Diagnosis: Skin defect of left pretibia with postoperative hematoma after skin graft

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Swelling in right inguinal region; 10-year duration with sudden increase in size for 2 months
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Single, firm 3 cm swelling in right inguinal region; no abnormality in left inguinal region; no other lesion in right leg or thigh; no fever, rigors, weight loss, or loss of appetite; no history of tuberculosis exposure
Medical_Record.Background: Well built and nourished; no pallor; no generalized lymphadenopathy; no abnormality on systemic examination; baseline blood investigations within normal limits

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Single, firm 3 cm swelling in right inguinal region; no other local or systemic abnormalities
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Ultrasonogram: circumscribed hypoechoic mass in right inguinal region; abdominal ultrasonogram unremarkable; cytology: dual cell population with oval to polygonal cells and mature lymphocytes; excision biopsy: neoplasm in lower dermis and subcutis, nests of round to oval cells with granular eosinophilic cytoplasm, S100 positivity, CD68 and inhibin cytoplasmic positivity

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Suspected ingestion or aspiration of endodontic hand file; 2-hour duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Undergoing root canal therapy on maxillary molar; two episodes of excessive coughing and dyspnea, each lasting several minutes; dentist noted missing endodontic file; referred to Emergency Department for investigation
Medical_Record.Background: History of ischemic heart disease managed pharmacologically

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Stable observations; normal bronchial and vesicular breath sounds; no respiratory distress, cough, dysphagia, abdominal pain, or vomiting; normal oral cavity examination
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Frontal chest and abdominal radiographs: 27-mm linear radiopaque foreign body at L2/3 disc level (duodenum); subsequent radiographs: migration to distal ileum/ascending colon, then transverse colon; no radiographic evidence of pneumoperitonium; foreign body no longer visualized on day 2

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Swelling of right lower limbs and chest tightness; 2-hour duration after road traffic accident
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Road traffic accident; right lower limb swelling; chest tightness; CT: mediastinal high-density shadow, right lung high-density shadows; right distal femur fracture; open reduction and internal fixation performed; stable vital signs at discharge after 25 days; died 2 months later after repeated coughs
Medical_Record.Background: No mention of past medical history, medications, allergies, family or social history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Healing soft tissue injuries; operation scar in left thigh; comminuted fracture of distal femur; no abnormalities on head, neck, chest; stomach filled with 1800 g clotted blood; duodenum and small intestine contained 500 mL liquid blood; trachea and bronchial lumen with small amount of blood; other organs unremarkable
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT: mediastinal high-density shadow, right lung high-density shadows; histopathology: ascending aorta pseudoaneurysm with intravascular agglutination, fibrous connective tissue hyperplasia, red blood cells, monocytes, lymphocytes, neutrophils, hemosiderin deposits; toxicology negative for drugs and poisons

Diagnosis: Traumatic ascending aortic pseudoaneurysm ruptured into the esophagus

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Shortness of breath and haemoptysis; 3-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive shortness of breath; haemoptysis; no fevers, night sweats, weight loss, sick contacts, nausea, vomiting, or urinary complaints
Medical_Record.Background: History of coronary artery disease; mixed connective tissue disease; remote prednisone use; hypertension controlled on metoprolol, fosinopril, hydrochlorothiazide

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Serum creatinine increased from 1.44 mg/dL to 5.21 mg/dL over 72 hours; urinalysis with >100 red blood cells per high-powered field, 2 proteinuria, no granular casts; chest CT with ground glass opacities; bronchoscopy diagnosed diffuse alveolar haemorrhage; serologies negative for HIV, hepatitis B/C, cryoglobulins, ANA, c-ANCA, complement, anti-GBM antibody; positive perinuclear ANCA (1:160); initial kidney biopsy non-diagnostic; second kidney biopsy: 24% glomeruli with cellular crescents, 12% globally sclerotic, 16% with fibrinoid necrosis; immunofluorescence: weak linear C3, strong linear IgG on GBM, weak IgM granular in mesangium, negative C1q and IgA, weak linear κ and λ light chains

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Bilateral non-specific leg pain; 2-week duration; refusal to walk
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: High fevers for several days; onset of nonspecific leg pain three days prior to admission; pain worsened leading to refusal to walk; clinical improvement after NSAIDs
Medical_Record.Background: Previously healthy; family history of recurrent paresthesia and sensory loss in father and uncle; sister with 17p11.2 deletion (PMP22 gene); no reported allergies; no medication history; no surgical history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Normal exam on admission; no arthritis, edema, or limitation of limb motion; unremarkable neurological exam despite refusal to walk; follow-up: left foot weakness, absent Achilles reflex, sensory impairment
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Elevated CRP; normal CBC and chemistry; normal blood smear; negative blood cultures; normal immunoglobulins and complement; normal left leg radiographs; bone scan: non-specific decreased absorption in left foot; normal lumbosacral MRI; prenatal CMA in sister: 17p11.2 deletion (PMP22 gene)

Diagnosis: Hereditary neuropathy with liability to pressure palsies (HNPP)

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Scheduled for ureterotomy
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: No preoperative neuropathy; underwent spinal anaesthesia; developed lower-limb myoclonus 60 minutes post-procedure; myoclonus lasted less than three minutes; resolved spontaneously; no recurrence
Medical_Record.Background: Bronchitis; coronary artery disease; diabetes mellitus; medications: salbutamol, nitrates, metformin; no history of neuropathy; no allergy information

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Adequate motor and sensory block at five minutes; sensory block up to T6 dermatome; standard perioperative monitoring; no abnormal findings intraoperatively

Diagnosis: Spinal myoclonus following central neuraxial anaesthesia

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Oliguria after kidney transplant; 24-hour duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Acute onset oliguria unresponsive to fluid resuscitation after elective living-donor kidney transplant; progressive increase in serum creatinine
Medical_Record.Background: End-stage renal disease due to bilateral vesicoureteral reflux; recurrent urinary tract infections; bilateral ureteral reimplantation; negative family history; preoperative assessment unremarkable

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Soft, nontender abdomen; normal vital signs
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Baseline serum creatinine 687 μmol/L; post-op nadir 273 μmol/L; progressive increase in creatinine; Color-Doppler sonography: renal graft normal size, subcapsular renal hematoma 20 mm thick, 7.1 cm length, high resistive flow (RI 1), diastolic reflux, patent graft vessels; post-evacuation CDUS: resolution of hematoma, normal RI 0.62; serum creatinine declined to 64 μmol/L

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Multiple scalp nodules; 2-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Multiple nodules on scalp; no pain; no itching; gradual progression over 2 years
Medical_Record.Background: No history of head trauma; no other medical conditions; no relevant family genetic history; no information on medications, allergies, immunizations, travel, or social history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Numerous skin coloured nodules (0.5–3 cm) on occipital area; no enlarged superficial lymph nodes
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Normal blood count; normal hepatic and renal function; biopsy shows irregular hyperplastic vessels with hypertrophic endothelium, endothelial cells protruding into lumen with spiked appearance, vessels surrounded by lymphocytes and few eosinophils

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Dyspnea, cough, right-side chest pain; 2-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Dyspnea, cough, right-side chest pain; failed antibiotic treatment for right pneumonic infiltration and pleural effusion; impaired vision, loss of consciousness, generalized seizure after pigtail catheter insertion
Medical_Record.Background: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease diagnosed 5 years ago; bronchodilator therapy; current smoker, 30-pack-year history; treated for pulmonary tuberculosis 2 years ago; no drug allergies, family history, or other contextual data mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Blood pressure 120/70 mm Hg; pulse rate 84 bpm; respiratory rate 18/min; body temperature 36.5°C; inspiratory crackle at right lower lung field; no abnormal findings on fundoscopic examination; no change in auscultation after event
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Arterial blood gas: pH 7.45, PaCO2 27.2 mm Hg, PaO2 59.0 mm Hg, HCO3 18.5 mmol/L, SaO2 92.2% at room air; WBC 16,400/mm3; hemoglobin 13.4 g/dL; platelets 194,000/mm3; C-reactive protein 32.5 mg/dL; chest radiograph: pneumonic infiltration in right lower lobe; chest CT: emphysematous changes, consolidation in right lower lobe, right pleural effusion; pleural fluid analysis: pH 8.0, RBC 460,000/mm3, WBC 1,220/mm3 (neutrophil 90%, lymphocyte 10%), protein 6.1 g/dL, LDH 176 IU/L, glucose 63 mg/dL; brain CT: multiple low densities in right occipital lobe (gas emboli); post-event ABG: pH 7.34, PaCO2 46.2 mm Hg, PaO2 114.3 mm Hg, HCO3 20.4 mmol/L, SaO2 99.8%; chest X-ray: decreased right pleural effusion, no pneumothorax; brain MRI: no abnormal findings; EEG: no epileptiform discharge

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Fever; recurrent episodes after antibiotic therapy
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Diagnosed with aortic native valve infective endocarditis; initial treatment with ampicillin/ceftriaxone for 4 weeks; first relapse 3 weeks post-treatment; second course of ampicillin/ceftriaxone for 6 weeks; fever and positive blood cultures 24 hours after treatment; started on daptomycin and ampicillin, ampicillin withdrawn after 5 days due to lack of synergy; fever and positive blood cultures 10 days after completing daptomycin; started on ampicillin monotherapy; death from heart failure due to worsening valve function and fluid overload
Medical_Record.Background: Child C liver cirrhosis; high-level resistance to aminoglycosides; no additional data

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Positive blood cultures for Enterococcus faecalis; time-kill curves showed lack of synergy between daptomycin and ampicillin; no additional laboratory or imaging data

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Admission after right-sided nephrectomy, evacuation of retroperitoneal hematoma, and removal of abdominal tamponade
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: History of polytrauma involving chest, abdomen, and right hip; right lung contusion; major right kidney laceration; minor right liver laceration; extensive retroperitoneal hematoma; fractures of left clavicle, first left rib, right iliac crest; sedated and hemodynamically stable at admission; underwent CT angiography and embolization of right renal artery; emergency surgery with removal of retroperitoneal coagulum and right-sided nephrectomy; major bleeding from vein cava inferior; received blood products and hemostatic agents; persistent thrombocytopenia, high fibrinogen, elevated D-dimer, prolonged aPTT, low antithrombin; extubated after two days; sudden hemodynamic instability on third day; massive thrombus in pulmonary trunk and right ventricle strain on echocardiogram; unsuccessful percutaneous mechanical thrombectomy performed; patient died
Medical_Record.Background: No data on occupation, past medical history, medications, allergies, family or social history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Hemodynamically stable at admission; sedated; post-surgical status; hemodynamic instability on third day
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Whole body CT: right lung contusion, right kidney major laceration, right liver minor laceration, extensive retroperitoneal hematoma, fractures of left clavicle, first left rib, right iliac crest; CT angiography: right renal artery embolization; Laboratory: persistent thrombocytopenia, high fibrinogen, elevated D-dimer, prolonged aPTT, low antithrombin; Echocardiogram: massive thrombus in pulmonary trunk, right ventricle strain; Angiography: extensive thrombotic mass in pulmonary trunk, right basal and segmental arteries; Autopsy: high-risk pulmonary thromboembolism confirmed

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Rest pain and cold sensation in left lower leg; 2-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Severe pain in left lower leg at rest; persistent for two months
Medical_Record.Background: History of hypertension, diabetes, smoking

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Strong left femoral artery pulse; weak left popliteal artery pulse; non-palpable left dorsalis pedis artery pulse
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Left ankle-brachial index 0.44; CT and angiography show diffuse significant arterial stenosis in proximal to mid left superficial femoral artery; total occlusion of left popliteal artery; total occlusion of left tibioperoneal trunk to proximal portion of three distal run-off vessels

Diagnosis: Peripheral arterial disease with critical limb ischemia

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Abdominal distention after PEG tube feeds; 1-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Abdominal distention after initiation of PEG tube feeds; failed to improve with nonoperative management; increased abdominal distention; diffuse peritonitis
Medical_Record.Background: Critically ill; recent tracheostomy; recent percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy tube placement; no further PMH, surgical history, family or social history, medications, or allergies provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Increased abdominal distention; diffuse peritonitis
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Abdominal X-ray shows possible small bowel obstruction; CT scan shows dilated proximal small bowel loops, distal collapse, transition point near gastrostomy tube site; intraoperative findings of small bowel adherent between gastric lumen and anterior abdominal wall; PEG tube transected into omental fat causing small bowel kink and erosion

Diagnosis: Small bowel obstruction and bowel erosion secondary to percutaneous endoscopic gastrostomy

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Acute upper gastrointestinal bleeding; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Admitted for acute upper gastrointestinal bleeding; underwent rapid sequence intubation for planned upper and lower endoscopies; intraoperative hypoxia episodes; post-anesthesia tachypnea and low tidal volumes; rapid SpO2 decrease to 70%; copious clear secretions in endotracheal tube
Medical_Record.Background: History of hypertension, diabetes mellitus, systemic lupus erythematosus, end-stage renal disease on hemodialysis

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: SpO2 98% preoperatively; intraoperative SpO2 85-90%; post-anesthesia respiratory rate >25 breaths per minute; low tidal volumes; SpO2 decreased to 70%
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Fiberoptic bronchoscopy: endotracheal tube in right main stem bronchus; right upper bronchus arising above carina; CT scan performed

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Worsening chest pain, muffled voice, facial and neck swelling; 6-day duration following right-sided wisdom tooth extraction
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive chest pain; muffled voice; facial and neck swelling; trismus; orthopnea; onset 6 days after dental extraction
Medical_Record.Background: Otherwise healthy; no significant past medical history provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Blood pressure 117/77 mm Hg; heart rate 130 bpm; respiration rate 28/min; temperature 98.4°F; mild respiratory distress; muffled voice; diffuse submandibular swelling; trismus; right submandibular tenderness, swelling, and fluctuance without erythema; crepitus under right mandible extending to clavicle; diminished right breath sounds; distant heart sounds; orthopnea
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Chest radiograph: pneumomediastinum, subcutaneous emphysema; CT chest: mediastinal air, small bilateral pleural effusions, subcutaneous air tracking into neck; WBC 8.65 x10^3/μL; lactic acid 3.3 mmol/L (peak 12 mmol/L); esophagram performed

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Delirium; acute onset
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Delirium; history of seizure disorder after frontal meningioma resection
Medical_Record.Background: On divalproex and zonisamide; prior frontal meningioma resection; no additional history provided

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT head: skull defect over right frontal lobe encephalomalacia; EEG: focal epileptiform discharges in F4, phase-reversing sharp and slow waves, clear-cut epileptiform spikes in T3 and F7

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Mildly pruritic scaly eruptions on back and front of chest; 2-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Single large eruption on left breast 10 days ago; history of upper respiratory infection 2 weeks before first lesion with mild fever, coryza, malaise for 5 days; multiple large scaly lesions developed on trunk and lateral thighs; minimal itching; lesions resolved within 2 weeks with slight hypopigmentation; no recurrence for 6 months
Medical_Record.Background: No history of similar lesions; unremarkable past and family health; no history of allergic or irritant contact dermatitis; no recent systemic medications except ibuprofen, paracetamol, cetrizine; no travel history; no tick bites; prescriptions verified, no steroids

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Large oval plaque on left breast (7x6 cm) with peripheral collarette scaling and central clearing; multiple sharply demarcated large scaly lesions on trunk and lateral thighs; symmetrical distribution; collarette scaling at periphery; palms, soles, mucosal surfaces uninvolved; general and systemic examinations normal
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Complete blood counts, blood sugar levels, urinalysis, HIV antibodies, VDRL test normal or negative; fungal scrapings negative; no skin biopsy

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Recurrent bright red blood per rectum; 1-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Ten attacks of hematochezia; dizziness; tachycardia
