Medical_Record.Background: Recurrent metastatic endocervical cancer; history of pelvic surgery and radiation; recent contained sigmoid colon perforation managed conservatively; indwelling ureteric stents exchanged 6 weeks prior; no complications reported

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Dizziness; tachycardia
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Hemoglobin 6.6 mg/dL; CT angiography shows 9 mm pseudoaneurysm from proximal left external iliac artery related to surgical clips; contrast extravasation to contained colonic perforation; angiography confirms pseudoaneurysm and contrast reaching sigmoid colon

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Second paraganglioma recurrence with systemic symptoms; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: History of paraganglioma since 2003; urgent laparotomic resection of pelvic mass with heart failure; 2006 recurrence with multiple pelvic nodules; non-complete resection; persistent disease in left pelvic wall, left parametrial tissue, paravesical space; six cycles of adjuvant chemotherapy; November 2020 exacerbation of hypertension and lipothymia; hypertensive peaks in supine position
Medical_Record.Background: No family history of PH/PGL syndrome; no other background information provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Left gluteal mass; solid mass in left pararectal space; no invasion of vaginal or rectal mucosa; compression of left gluteal mass leads to hypertensive peak; negative trigger points on sacral plexus palpation
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Elevated epinephrine in blood and urine; normal CA125, CA19-9, CA15-3, CEA; pre-operative MRI: multiple pelvic nodules (4.5×2.7×3 cm left gluteal, 2×1.7×2 cm and 3×1.7×2 cm ischiorectal fossa, 8 mm obturator space, 15 cm left external iliac, 1.4×1.7×1.5 cm vesical-vaginal septum); intraoperative findings: partial involvement of autonomic pelvic innervation, infiltration of vaginal and bladder wall; histopathology: malignant paraganglioma, poorly differentiated cells, partial vascular invasion, strong chromogranin/synaptophysin/NSE positivity, negative pan-cytokeratin/S100, Ki67 20%, negative surgical margins, 2/9 lymph nodes positive for metastasis; post-op: normal blood pressure, normal catecholamines, no abnormal uptake on metaiodobenzylguanidine scan, disease-free at 18 months follow-up

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Chest discomfort radiating to jaw; 1-hour duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Nausea; diaphoresis; ST elevation in V1-3; hemodynamically stable; no heart failure signs
Medical_Record.Background: Prior coronary stent implantation to proximal LAD in 2015; non-smoker

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Hemodynamically stable; no clinical signs of heart failure
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Pre-hospital ECG: ST elevation in V1-3; Emergency coronary angiogram: left dominant circulation, patent LAD and Circumflex, in-stent restenosis in proximal LAD, thrombotic occlusion of proximal right coronary artery; Drug-eluting stent implanted; Resolution of chest pain and ST elevation; Post-reperfusion ECG: no Q waves or T wave inversion in anteroseptal leads; Pre-discharge echocardiogram: normal RV chamber size, moderate RV systolic dysfunction

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Anal bleeding; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Persistent anal bleeding after ALTA injection for internal hemorrhoids; lower rectal cancer detected by colonoscopy; underwent laparoscopic partial intersphincteric resection with diverting ileostomy; sudden discharge of gas and feces from vagina 14 months after ISR
Medical_Record.Background: History of internal hemorrhoids; ALTA injection; laparoscopic partial ISR with diverting ileostomy; pathological stage I (pT2N0M0) lower rectal cancer; negative resection margins; adjuvant chemotherapy (UFT and leucovorin) for 12 months; ileostomy reversed; no evidence of local recurrence for more than 1 year; alive without recurrence for more than 6 years

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Colonoscopy detected lower rectal cancer; CT and MRI revealed anastomotic-vaginal fistula at right anterior side of coloanal anastomosis; colposcopy showed pin-hole fistula on posterior vaginal wall; biopsy from fistula negative for malignancy; follow-up CT and MRI showed no local recurrence

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Acute dyspnea; several hours duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Onset after tearing and ingesting diaper; progressive dyspnea; cyanosis; diminished respiratory sound; faint inspiratory stridor
Medical_Record.Background: Severe dementia (clinical dementia rating 3); history of diaper pica; no psychiatric medical history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Blood pressure 88/54 mmHg; pulse 112/min; respiratory rate 18/min; oxygen saturation 74% on room air; cyanosis of lips; diminished respiratory sound; faint inspiratory stridor
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Arterial blood gas: pH 6.39, PaO2 45 mmHg, PaCO2 150 mmHg (severe acidosis); WBC 16,700/μL (73% neutrophils); hemoglobin 14.5 g/dL; CRP 0.03 mg/dL; chest X-ray normal; chest CT: foreign bodies in trachea and esophagus; flexible bronchoscopy: HMWPD visualized in trachea and main bronchi; esophagus and stomach filled with HMWPD and torn nonwoven fabric; post-procedure ABG: pH 7.39, PaO2 111 mmHg, PaCO2 49 mmHg under 2 L oxygen

Diagnosis: Acute respiratory failure due to upper airway obstruction from diaper pica

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Sudden onset epigastric pain
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Acute epigastric pain; no prior abdominal trauma, alcohol abuse, abdominal operations, or symptoms of pancreatitis, cholangitis, gastroduodenal ulcer, or cardiovascular disease
Medical_Record.Background: No significant past medical history; no regular medication; no drug allergies; no family history provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Blood pressure 154/100 mm Hg; other vital signs within normal limits
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: WBC 7,900/μL (slightly elevated); no anemia; normal liver panels; normal pancreatic enzymes; esophagogastroduodenoscopy shows residual food in stomach and impaired duodenal dilatation; contrast-enhanced CT reveals 13 mm aneurysm below head of pancreas with retroperitoneal hematoma; celiac trunk narrowed by dissection and dilated after dissection; common hepatic artery disrupted; angiography shows blood flow from superior mesenteric artery to proper hepatic artery through pancreaticoduodenal arcades and 15 mm anterior-inferior PDA aneurysm; post-treatment CT shows fully embolized PDA aneurysm

Diagnosis: Ruptured pancreaticoduodenal artery aneurysm caused by celiac artery dissection

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Acute worsening of chronic pelvic pain; 1-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Chronic pelvic pain since age 16; intermittent management with medroxyprogesterone acetate; acute worsening over past month; five emergency department visits and two in-patient admissions for pain control; intractable pain despite NSAIDs and narcotics
Medical_Record.Background: Gravida one para one; essential hypertension; BMI 60.7 kg/m2; early term cesarean delivery for oligohydramnios, intrauterine growth restriction, and breech presentation; prior laparoscopic left ovarian cystectomy for mature teratoma; no macroscopic endometriosis; ongoing opioid dependence post-treatment

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Leukocytosis with left shift; ultrasound showed mass read as fibroid with central necrosis; CT scan anatomy not well visualized; MRI showed unicornuate uterus with 8 cm noncommunicating rudimentary right horn; intraoperative findings: grossly distended rudimentary horn with blood (9 cm), normal bilateral ovaries and contralateral fallopian tube; pathology: benign uterine tissue, no microscopic endometriosis

Diagnosis: Outflow tract obstruction from congenital uterine anomaly (noncommunicating rudimentary uterine horn)

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Severe odynophagia; inability to tolerate oral intake; 1-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: One week severe odynophagia; inability to tolerate oral intake; history of well-controlled GERD; recent heavy daily use of THC and nicotine vaping for 2 months; no alcohol or NSAID intake
Medical_Record.Background: GERD treated with PPI for several years; no alcohol or NSAID use; no mention of other PMH, surgical history, family history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Non-toxic appearance; soft abdomen
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Esophagogastroduodenoscopy: Los Angeles Grade C esophagitis; esophageal biopsy: granulation tissue with acute and chronic inflammation; PAS-diastase negative; immunohistochemistry negative for HSV and CMV; no evidence of eosinophilic esophagitis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Inflammatory right hip pain; 3-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Pain controlled with NSAIDs; walking distance limited to 100 m; progressive functional limitation
Medical_Record.Background: HIV infection; on triple antiretroviral therapy for 1 year; CD4 count 473/ml; no documented viral load; no other significant PMH mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Right hip flexion/extension 80/20; abduction/adduction 40/20; internal/external rotation 20/15; trendelenburg gait; limb length discrepancy 3 cm; gluteus medius muscle power 4/5; right quadriceps amyotrophy
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Pelvic X-ray: joint space narrowing, loss of head sphericity, shortened hip length, no coxarthrosis signs; hemoglobin 13 g/dl; WBC 8000/μL (45% lymphocytes, 50% neutrophils); intraoperative cream-white liquid; gram stain negative; anatomopathology: active tuberculosis infection

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Progressive growth around stoma; over three months
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Growth on posterior aspect of stoma; difficult pouching; irritation; drainage; intermittent draining sinus adjacent to stoma; no fluid expressed on compression
Medical_Record.Background: End-stage renal disease; previous peritoneal dialysis; failed two cadaver kidney transplants; on hemodialysis; recurrent small bowel obstruction; prior extensive adhesiolysis; large segment small bowel resection; diverting loop ileostomy; no response to nonoperative management with stoma appliances and topical ointments

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Pseudoverrucous characteristics of peristomal lesions
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Operative findings: fistula in right upper quadrant of stoma; pathology: pseudoepitheliomatous hyperplasia with hyperkeratosis and parakeratosis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Chronic intermittent vague left forearm pain; over 10 years
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: No incident leading to pain onset; pain initially treated as muscle strain; sudden worsening of left shoulder pain with numbness prior to orthopedic clinic visit; no fever, night sweats, weight loss, or systemic symptoms
Medical_Record.Background: No prior medical conditions; no surgical history; no family or social history provided; no medication or allergy information

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Swelling over proximal forearm; engorged tortuous disfiguring veins left upper limb; pulsating cystic swelling proximal forearm with positive thrill; restricted supination left forearm; full pronation; mild pain on left elbow flexion and 10-degree extension; mild tenderness proximal left forearm; distal neurovascular intact
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: X-ray: aggressive osteopathic lesion proximal radius; Ultrasound: tortuous, increased diameter superficial veins (>1 cm), aliasing, turbulent flow, no thrombosis, no soft tissue mass or edema; CT chest/abdomen/pelvis: unremarkable; MRI: significant dilation/tortuosity vascular structures, extensive forearm infiltration, proximal radius erosion, no ulna/distal humerus involvement; CT angiography: arteriovenous malformation nidus left elbow/proximal forearm (4.7x7.3x9.8 cm), direct arterial feeders, venous drainage, cortical erosion/infiltration proximal radial shaft

Diagnosis: Arteriovenous malformation of the proximal radius with bone destruction

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Left ankle pain after sprain; 2-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Pain worsened over 2 months; pain decreased with rest and walking
Medical_Record.Background: No family history of similar injury

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Tenderness at distal end of fibula; no swelling; no restriction in ankle joint range of motion
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: X-ray: multilocular osteolytic lesions with cortical thinning at distal fibula; MRI: intermediate T1, high T2 signal, gadolinium-enhanced septum, soft tissue extension without joint involvement; Open biopsy: biphasic epithelial and fibrous pattern, tubular epithelial pattern, strong CK5 and vimentin immunoreactivity; Surgical specimen: same histology as biopsy

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Fever and vomiting; onset at 30 days of life
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Fever and vomiting; progression to seizures and acute hydrocephalus; persistent seizures; required orotracheal intubation and sedation
Medical_Record.Background: Delivered by cesarean section without complications; normal growth until 30 days of life; no skin rash; no serological test for B19 performed; no other significant history provided

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CSF pleocytosis (217 leucocytes/mL, 18% lymphocytes, 67% neutrophils, monocytes 10%, plasma cells 2%, eosinophils 2%, basophils 1%); 1 red blood cell/mL; protein 247 mg/dL (elevated); lactate 36.9 mg/dL (elevated); glucose 40 mg/dL; CT: supratentorial hydrocephalus, diffuse cerebral edema, diffuse subarachnoid hemorrhage, multiple hypodense areas in cortex and white matter; PCR positive for Haemophilus influenzae; persistent cytological changes in CSF; external ventricular drain inserted

Diagnosis: Encephalopathy caused by human parvovirus B19 genotype 1 associated with Haemophilus influenzae meningitis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Malaise; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Malaise; tumoral lesion detected in right hepatic lobe by ultrasonography; referred for further evaluation
Medical_Record.Background: Chronic renal failure; dilated cardiomyopathy; no other history provided

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Abdominal contrast-enhanced CT: 90×70 mm tumoral lesion in right hepatic lobe; tumor thrombosis in main trunk of portal vein; lower digestive tract radiography: circumferential stenosis, 50 mm mass from upper to lower rectum; abdominal angiography: tumor thrombosis from right branch to main trunk of portal vein; tumor markers: CEA 596.4 ng/ml (elevated), CA19-9 153 U/ml (elevated); histopathology: moderately differentiated adenocarcinoma; TMN stage IV (T3, N0, HEP); postoperative imaging: no recurrence initially, later recurrence in lateral segment of liver and left lung; echocardiography: left ventricular ejection fraction 41.1%; serum creatinine 2.5–3.2 mg/dl (elevated); KRAS wild type; EGFR positive

Diagnosis: Liver metastasis of rectal adenocarcinoma with portal vein tumor thrombosis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Proteinuria refractory to corticosteroids; duration since age 5
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive proteinuria; slow progression to CKD stage 3; bilateral optic nerve dysplasia; hyperuricemia
Medical_Record.Background: Father of case B; carries PAX2 mutation; no additional PMH, surgical history, family/social history, medications, allergies, or contextual data provided

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Renal sonography: bilateral renal hypodysplasia and cystic change; Renal biopsy: minimal change disease; Sanger sequencing: PAX2 mutation confirmed

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: General weakness and fever; 2-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Lower back pain related to menstrual cycle; received intramuscular diclofenac injection; developed general weakness, fever 39.3°C, shivers; progressive dyspnea; pain, redness, and swelling in left gluteal region; spread of swelling and redness to back and posterior thigh; palpable crepitations
Medical_Record.Background: Long-term corticosteroid therapy for systemic lupus erythematosus; partial thyroidectomy for hyperthyroidism; no mention of occupation, allergies, or family history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Tachypnea (30/min); tachycardia (110/min); hypotension (80/60 mmHg); peripheral oxygen saturation 98%; facial erythema; pale lips; dry tongue; unremarkable chest and abdominal exam; no limb swelling; local redness, swelling, and crepitus in left gluteal region, back, and posterior thigh
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: WBC 37.5 × 10^9/L with left shift; hemoglobin 10.6 g/dL; CRP 109 mg/L; procalcitonin 16 ng/mL; creatinine 124 mmol/L; AST 205 U/L; ALT 193 U/L; INR 1.37; aPTT 37 s; chest X-ray unremarkable; urine test negative; ultrasound no fluid collection; CT scan shows air collections and necrosis of left gluteal muscle; intraoperative swab positive for Clostridium perfringens

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Pelvic trauma; 12-hour duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Pain in lateral and posterior left buttock; left ankle extension weakness; progression to loss of left ankle flexion and extension; sciatic nerve palsy
Medical_Record.Background: No prior medical history; no surgical history; no family history; no social history; no medication history; no allergies

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Hemodynamically stable; responsive; truck wheel-shaped bruise on left thigh; scrotal hematoma; swelling; left ankle extension active movement against gravity with weakness against resistance; intact arterial pulses; sensory and motor deficits consistent with left sciatic nerve palsy
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Pelvic radiographs and CT: traumatic disruption of pelvic girdle without bony injury; left sacroiliac dislocation; pubic symphysis diastasis; increased CPK and LDH; intracompartmental pressure 46 mmHg in gluteus maximus compartment; acute kidney failure with anuria; increased serum urea and creatinine; laboratory markers normalized after one month

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Right shoulder and back pain; 2-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Pain aggravated for 1 day; radiates to right upper arm; limited arm raising and flexion; sleep disturbance; no relief with analgesic patch; no cough, sputum, chest tightness, shortness of breath, acid reflux, belching, abdominal pain, distension, diarrhea, backache, hematuria, black stools, or bloody stools
Medical_Record.Background: No previous tumors; history of tuberculosis over 20 years ago, cured; no family history of tumors or genetic disease

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Normal development; moderate nutrition; listlessness; heart, lungs, and abdomen normal; positive tenderness in right scapula area; limited scapular joint movement
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Radionuclide bone imaging: osteogenic enhancement in right 1st and 2nd ribs, T11 vertebra, right iliac bone; chest radiograph normal; tumor markers: CEA 6.27 ng/mL, CA 19-9 31.50 U/mL, others normal; PET/CT: destruction of right 1st and 2nd ribs, T11 vertebra, right iliac bone, increased FDG metabolism; old lesions in right upper lung lobe; brain and neck imaging normal; abdominal imaging normal; spine degeneration; CT-guided right iliac bone biopsy: cancer involvement, immunohistochemistry suggests urothelial cancer; cystoscopy normal; gene test: EGFR19del, EGFR amplification; tumor mutation burden low; PD-L1 <1%; microscopic findings: tumor cells in nests, fibrous proliferation, mucinous degeneration, large nuclei, high nuclear-cytoplasmic ratio

Diagnosis: Bone metastatic carcinoma with EGFR amplification and mutation

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Alopecia, skin tightening, dry skin, pruritus; 3-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Subtotal alopecia; thick hyperpigmented woody induration on back, shoulders, upper arms, forearms; normal muscle movement; no similar family history
Medical_Record.Background: History of autoimmune thyrotoxicosis; compensated liver cirrhosis; past hypothyroidism; previously treated with neomercazole and propranolol; discontinued treatment; no fever or infection; no diabetes; no significant family history; no drug allergies

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Subtotal alopecia; thick hyperpigmented woody induration on back, shoulders, upper arms, forearms; normal range of motion; normal auscultation
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Skin biopsy: basketweave keratin, focal flattening of rete ridges, focally thickened collagen bundles, focal increase in mucin; TSH >100 mIU/L; elevated anti-TPO antibodies; elevated LDH, transaminases, CPK; USG neck: atrophied thyroid glands; abdominal USG: parenchymal liver disease, dilated portal vein; Fibroscan: median stiffness 14.3 kPa; viral hepatitis profile negative; upper GI scopy: erosive gastritis; thrombocytopenia; ESR, CRP, rheumatoid factor, ANA normal; serum electrophoresis normal; calcium, phosphorus, PTH normal; blood sugar normal

Diagnosis: Scleredema adultorum of Buschke associated with hypothyroidism and liver cirrhosis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Acute and chronic shortness of breath; 6-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Shortness of breath; brief episodes of pleuritic chest pain for 2 weeks; left leg swelling with pedal edema; no cough, fever, abdominal pain, nausea, or vomiting
Medical_Record.Background: History of robotic supracervical hysterectomy, bilateral salpingectomy, left oophorectomy for menometrorrhagia and left ovarian cyst; positive family history of lung cancer in mother and brother; three long airplane rides in past 2 weeks; no known prior thromboembolic disease

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: BP 152/106 mmHg; pulse rate 113 BPM; afebrile; SpO2 97% on 3 L/min oxygen; respiratory rate 19/min; BMI 28.31 kg/m2; mild respiratory distress; normal cardio-respiratory findings; left leg swelling with pedal edema
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CBC and BMP normal; EKG shows sinus tachycardia; Troponin I 0.02 ng/ml; chest X-ray shows ill-defined nodular opacity in right mid-lung; BNP 308 pg/ml (elevated); CT pulmonary angiography shows sub-segmental pulmonary embolus in right posterior lower lobe pulmonary artery, multiple irregular non-calcified lung nodules, filling defect in right ventricle; duplex ultrasound shows clots in both popliteal veins; echocardiogram shows hypokinetic right ventricle with mass/thrombus, moderate tricuspid regurgitation, RVSP 51 mmHg, dilated right atrium, small loculated pericardial effusion; cardiac MRI shows tumor and thrombus in right ventricle; PET-CT shows hypermetabolic activity in right ventricle and right atrium, enlarged hypermetabolic lymph nodes in retroperitoneum and bilateral inguinal regions; US-guided biopsy of right inguinal node shows squamous cell carcinoma; autopsy shows tan mass in right ventricle (8x4x2.5 cm), invasion of ventricular wall and tricuspid valve, histopathology reveals metastatic poorly differentiated invasive squamous cell carcinoma, likely originating from uterine cervix; cervical tumor measures 3 cm

Diagnosis: Metastatic squamous cell carcinoma of uterine cervix with right ventricular involvement

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Developmental delay; lifelong duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Delayed walking and talking; mild cognitive impairment; mild mental retardation
Medical_Record.Background: History of preterm birth at 28 weeks gestation; graduated high school; no employment

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Normal muscle strength and tone; no motor deficits; no abnormal movements; normal cranial nerves; normal sensory system; normal deep tendon reflexes; dysmetria; dysdiadochokinesia; dysarthria; abnormal tandem gait; congenital esotropia
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Neuropsychiatric testing: mild cognitive impairment (31/59); IQ test: mild mental retardation (55-70); cranial MRI: cerebellar agenesis; diffusion tensor tractography: findings similar to case 1; residual vermis tissue smaller

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Severe massive hematemesis; 1-hour duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Fatigue and dizziness for 4 days; one episode of syncope lasting 15-30 seconds; no trauma or medication use; no eliciting factors
Medical_Record.Background: Unremarkable personal medical and surgical history; no reported allergies; no family history provided; no social history provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Pale; apyretic; hemodynamically stable; soft, non-tender, non-distended abdomen; no neurological abnormalities
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Hemoglobin 6.7 g/dL (initial), dropped to 5.9 g/dL; normocytic, normochromic anemia; normal WBC and platelet count; normal prothrombin and partial thromboplastin times; emergency EGD shows brisk bleeding from enlarged submucosal vessel in gastric fundus; diagnosis confirmed by jet hemorrhage after hemoclip placement; hemostasis achieved with adrenaline injection and clips; hemoglobin rose to 10.3 g/dL after 5 days, 13.5 g/dL at 4-week follow-up

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Left lower leg and thigh pain; gradual onset over 5 years; acute swelling and redness of left leg
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Slight pain in left lower leg and thigh gradually worsening over 5 years; progression to acute swelling and redness of left leg
Medical_Record.Background: History of metal-on-metal total hip arthroplasty for osteoarthritis due to developmental dysplasia of left hip; no immediate postoperative complications; no evidence of infection; no laboratory findings suggestive of inflammation; no mention of medications, allergies, family or social history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Increased left thigh circumference (42.2 cm vs 37.4 cm); heat, redness, swelling of entire left leg; height 160 cm; weight 60 kg; BMI 23.4
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Venous ultrasonography: no thrombosis, cystic lesion along iliopsoas tendon; plain radiography: no stem loosening, subsidence, or osteolysis; contrast-enhanced CT: large cystic lesion compressing left femoral artery and vein; MRI: well-defined cystic lesion (55.7 x 41.8 mm), hyperintense center, hypointense periphery on T1, high signal center and low rim on T2; percutaneous aspiration: 30 mL dark red fluid, negative bacterial culture; intraoperative findings: thick granulomatous capsule, dark red fluid, corrosion at head-neck junction with black metal debris; histology: foamy macrophages, lymphocytic infiltrate, no metal particles

Diagnosis: Pseudotumor associated with metal-on-metal total hip arthroplasty

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Left renal mass; 2-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Incidental right retroperitoneal mass on imaging; right flank pain; left renal mass with contrast enhancement on CT; interval growth of right retroperitoneal mass over 11 months
Medical_Record.Background: History of hypothyroidism and hyperlipidemia; medications: levothyroxine, atorvastatin; laparoscopic cholecystectomy in 2010; no pertinent family history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Right flank tenderness
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Ultrasound: left renal mass (3.3 cm); CT: left renal mass with contrast enhancement, right retroperitoneal mass (4.5 cm, infiltrative, inseparable from right adrenal gland, displacement of IVC, lobulated margins, fat infiltration); CT-guided biopsy: ganglion and Schwann cells, no atypia, mitosis, or necrosis; chest CT: no thoracic metastases; histology: grade 2 T1a clear cell renal cell carcinoma (left kidney), multiple clustered ganglioneuromas with infiltration of retroperitoneal fat (right retroperitoneal mass); immunostain S100 diffusely positive

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Right ocular pain and blurred vision; 5-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Onset of right ocular pain and blurred vision; progression to referral for iris metastasis; persistent elevated intraocular pressure despite therapy
Medical_Record.Background: Diagnosed 11 months prior with small cell lung carcinoma (cT4N2 or 3M1b) with left cerebellar metastasis, tracheal and mediastinal invasion; received 2 cycles carboplatin/etoposide and secondary chemotherapy with amrubicin; stable disease status; no other history, medications, allergies, or social history stated

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Visual acuity 0.1 OD, 0.5 OS; intraocular pressure 30 mm Hg OD, 10 mm Hg OS; right relative afferent pupillary defect positive; conjunctival injection; multiple temporal gray irregular iris masses; peripheral anterior synechia (PAS) 10%; neovascularization of iris; bilateral fundi normal
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Anterior optical coherence tomography and ultrasound biomicroscopy showed iris masses; anterior segment fluorescein angiography revealed leakage due to iris neovascularization
