Medical_Record.Background: No significant past medical history; no family history of similar symptoms; no information on medications, allergies, or social history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Normal vital signs; decreased bowel sounds; palpable 10-cm movable, fluctuant mass in lower abdomen; no tenderness
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Hemoglobin 12.5 g/dL; WBC 8,930/μL (84.2% neutrophil, 12.0% lymphocyte); platelet count 301,000/μL; ESR 10 mm/h; CRP 6.73 mg/L; normal liver function, metabolic panel, amylase, lipase, urinalysis; abdominal ultrasound: large cystic lesion with thin wall, homogenous fluid, inferior to umbilicus; abdominal CT: 12-cm low attenuated intra-abdominal cystic mass with thin septations; intraoperative findings: unicystic mass, intact intestinal serosa, cystic wall 9×8.5×4.2 cm, 152 g; immunohistochemistry negative; histopathology: single layer epithelial lining, fibrous structure

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Shortness of breath and pleuritic chest pain; 1-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Acute onset shortness of breath and pleuritic chest pain beginning evening prior; progressive worsening
Medical_Record.Background: History of hypothyroidism; obesity (status post gastric sleeve surgery last year); prior left lower extremity deep vein thrombosis after knee injury (completed 6 months anticoagulation); medications: levothyroxine, medroxyprogesterone acetate; no current anticoagulation

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Blood pressure 120/86 mm Hg; heart rate 136 BPM; respiratory rate 25 BPM; SpO2 94%; symmetric, nontender lower extremities
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Elevated pro-BNP (866 pg/mL), troponin T (0.10 mg/mL), CK-MB index (66%); unremarkable CBC and BMP; ECG: sinus tachycardia; chest X-ray unremarkable; lower extremity Doppler: acute DVT in right popliteal, posterior tibial, and peroneal veins; CTPA: RV dilation, septal bowing, LV/RV ratio >2.0, extensive embolic filling defects in all pulmonary lobes and main pulmonary arteries

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Persistent bleeding from cesarean section wound; four-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Lumbar pain due to bilateral renal lithiasis; expelled kidney stone; hematuria for three days; pain and stiffening in lower left thigh; ecchymosis and bleeding in buttock after intramuscular diclofenac; deep venous thrombosis of left lower limb; epigastric pain; blurred vision
Medical_Record.Background: No history of bleeding during childhood or adolescence; previous cesarean section with neonatal death due to chromosomopathy; allergic to tramadol

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Severe pallor; extensive ecchymosis on left thigh and lateral aspect of left knee; hematoma on right thigh; heart rate 117 beats/min; blood pressure 113/85 mmHg; oxygen saturation 93%
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Hemoglobin 6.4 g/dL (decreased from 10.4 g/dL); normocytic and normochromic moderate anemia (Hb=9.8 g/dL); blood glucose 160 mg/dL; AST 52 U/L; ALT 86 U/L; aPTT 91.2 seconds (prolonged); soft tissue ultrasound of right buttock shows subcutaneous collection and edema; doppler ultrasound of left lower limb shows no thrombosis; negative blood and urine cultures; ANA, complement C3 and C4, ferritin normal; mixing test shows partial correction of aPTT; factor VIII <1.0 U/dL; factor VIII inhibitor 8.64 Bethesda units/ml

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Left gluteal pain; 1-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive left gluteal pain after corticosteroid injection; pain worsened in past week; progressive left limb lameness
Medical_Record.Background: No history of medical disease

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Swelling in upper lateral quadrant of left gluteal; no erythema; no tenderness; no warmness; neurologic and other examinations normal
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Abdominal ultrasonography normal; chest x-ray normal; left gluteal ultrasonography shows 97x90x48 mm cystic lesion with multiple septations and daughter cysts; pelvic CT shows 108x76x48 mm cystic lesion; pelvic MRI shows 120x92x60 mm cystic lesion with multiple internal loculations in left deep gluteal muscle; unilocular cyst 78x54x52 mm in segment VII and VIII of liver with subcapsular extension; other organs normal

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Persistent retrosternal pain; 6-hour duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Retrosternal pain worsened by deep inspiration; onset after jumping from 10-meter bridge into river landing on back
Medical_Record.Background: Nonsmoker; no past history of asthma, respiratory problems, or significant health issues; no illicit or recreational drug use

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Blood pressure 139/89 mmHg; heart rate 88 bpm; respiratory rate 16 breaths per minute; temperature 37.5°C; oxygen saturation 99% on room air; slight sternal tenderness; no subcutaneous emphysema or crepitus in chest and neck; lungs clear bilaterally; regular heart sounds; rest of exam unremarkable
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Mild leukocytosis (15,000/mm3); creatine kinase 240 U/L; normal ECG; e-FAST negative for pneumothorax, effusion, or intra-abdominal fluid; chest X-ray shows mediastinal gas and subcutaneous emphysema in left axilla; CT confirms pneumomediastinum and small left pulmonary contusion; bronchoscopy negative for endobronchial lesion; CT with oral contrast negative for esophageal perforation

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Incidental solitary pulmonary nodule; unknown duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Pulmonary nodule detected on left upper lobe; lung cancer suspected; upper left lobectomy performed; uneventful postoperative course for two years; slight rise in serum CEA and CA 125; PET-CT showed increased FDG activity near left hilar lymph nodes; necrotic lesion at left upper lobe bronchial stump identified
Medical_Record.Background: 50 pack-year smoking history; no other significant history; not immunocompromised; pathologic diagnosis of small cell lung carcinoma; received postoperative chemotherapy and whole-brain radiation therapy

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: PET-CT: increased FDG activity (SUVmax 10.3, 8.3) near left hilar lymph nodes; bronchoscopy: necrotic lesion at left upper lobe bronchial stump; endobronchial biopsy: chronic inflammation, granulation tissue, numerous hyphae (Aspergillus species), no malignancy; cultures: positive for Aspergillus fumigatus; follow-up PET-CT: decreased SUVmax (4.3, 3.2); follow-up bronchoscopy: suture fragments recovered, cultures negative

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Breathlessness; 3-year duration; palpitations; 2-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Gradual onset breathlessness; initially asymptomatic; worsened with exercise; subsided with rest; palpitations developed over past 2 months
Medical_Record.Background: No family history of similar illness; no comorbidities; no prior surgical interventions

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: BMI 17.8 kg/m2; afebrile; pulse 88 bpm; BP 134/82 mm Hg; respiratory rate 16/min; raised JVP; bilaterally symmetrical chest; apical impulse at 6th ICS; grade II left parasternal heave; diffuse apical impulse; loud S1; wide, fixed split S2; grade 1 mid-diastolic murmur at mitral region; grade 2 ejection systolic murmur at left 2nd ICS; normal vesicular breath sounds; soft, non-tender abdomen; no organomegaly; normal CNS exam
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Normal hematological parameters; chest X-ray: cardiomegaly, right ventricular enlargement; ECG: tall, peaked T waves, QRS right axis deviation; transthoracic 2D echocardiography: acyanotic chronic heart disease, large OS-ASD, moderately severe TR, moderate to severe PAH, moderate to severe MS

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Progressive vision loss; long duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Poor vision since childhood; rapid progression; registered blind after few years; further deterioration of vision in both eyes
Medical_Record.Background: Previous diagnosis of severe macular dystrophy; differential diagnosis included fundus flavimaculatus, Sorsby's dystrophy, Best vitelliform macular dystrophy; family history of unknown eye problems in younger sister; referred by general practitioner; no information on medications, allergies, surgical history, social history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Able to count fingers with both eyes; vision not improved with pinhole; unremarkable anterior segment; clear lenses; sluggish pupil reactions bilaterally; normal intraocular pressure; retinal pigmentation with bony spicules in macular areas; paravenous pigmentation; mildly pale optic discs bilaterally; no macular edema
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Fluorescein angiography: profound retinal pigment epithelium atrophy at posterior pole; widespread retinal edema; microvascular changes; ERG: very low scotopic and photopic responses, almost no rod response, delayed a and b waves, reduced cone responses; EOG: abnormal, no light rise; OCT: outer retinal layer atrophy, macular pigmentation, no macular edema; genetic testing: compound heterozygous CRB1 mutations (CRB1c.498_506del9 p.(IIe 167_Gly169del), CRB1c.2688TA p.(Cys896Ter)), confirmed by Sanger sequencing

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Frequent fecal incontinence; more than 2 months
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Fecal incontinence four or more times daily; no other symptoms, triggers, or warning signs
Medical_Record.Background: No previous history of epilepsy or febrile convulsion; born by normal vaginal delivery after full-term pregnancy; no history of brain infection, brain trauma, or metabolic disease; no previous convulsions; family history of epilepsy

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Abdominal ultrasound normal; abdominal X-ray with contrast normal; bowel motility study normal; rectal wall biopsy normal; coeliac immunological screen normal; brain and spinal MRI normal; EEG shows focal epileptiform activity with fronto-temporal sharp transients

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Symmetrical polyarthralgia of knees and hands; odynophagia; temporal headache; retro-ocular pain; intermittent fever (max 38°C); initial duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Initial symptoms managed with azithromycin and anti-inflammatory agents; no resolution; developed oral mucosal lesions and vesicular rash on palms and soles after one week; compressive retrosternal pain without dyspnea or productive cough three weeks after initial presentation; persistent odynophagia; worsening headache and arthralgia
Medical_Record.Background: History of recurrent acute pharyngitis, essential hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, occasional abdominal pain and bloating; no recent travel; family history of IgA deficiency (son) and nonspecific colitis (father); regular medications: nifedipine CR (30 mg/day), rosuvastatin (5 mg/day)

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Nonexudative oropharyngitis; tender cervical lymphadenopathy; normal cardiorespiratory exam; absence of pericardial friction rub; abdominal tenderness in right lower quadrant without guarding; skin on palms and soles with scalded appearance; no vesicles present at time of exam
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: ECG: slight ST-segment depression in inferior leads (II, III, aVF); mildly increased troponin I and CK-MB; positive coxsackie A9 IgM (titer 1:160); positive IgA anti-transglutaminase and anti-gliadin antibodies; normal immunoglobulin levels; negative ANA, dsDNA, p-ANCA, c-ANCA, viral hepatitis, HIV; endoscopy: normal gastric and duodenal mucosa; biopsy: slight mucosal architecture disruption; echocardiogram: normal left ventricle, slightly hypertrophic interventricular septum, normal systolic function, left atrium upper limit normal; normalization of ECG and cardiac biomarkers after 5 days

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Headaches during warfarin therapy; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: History of transient ischemic attack; headaches during warfarin therapy; no radiological findings; switched to apixaban in 2016; no recurrent thrombotic or bleeding events until mid-2021
Medical_Record.Background: Past medical history of transient ischemic attack, dyslipidemia, diabetes mellitus; thrombophilia workup shows very high B2 glycoprotein I IgA (18.42-37.14) with 4 elevated readings; negative anti-cardiolipin antibodies; LAC not available; diagnosed with primary antiphospholipid syndrome (single positivity); warfarin therapy since 2014; switched to apixaban 5 mg twice daily in 2016

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Thrombophilia workup: very high B2 glycoprotein I IgA (18.42-37.14), 4 elevated readings; negative anti-cardiolipin antibodies; LAC not available; no radiological findings during headaches

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Severe abdominal distension; mild abdominal pain; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive abdominal distension; mild abdominal pain; globulous abdominal deformation; symptoms less severe than in two sisters; later developed jaundice
Medical_Record.Background: Known familial condition; previous MRI showed multiple giant liver cysts; refused liver transplantation and resection; regular follow-up every six months; no other background information provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Globulous abdominal deformation; jaundice
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: MRI: multiple giant liver cysts compromising abdominal cavity, sparing higher liver segments; cysts reaching hypogastric area and both inferior quadrants; new MRI: cyst compression of hepatic pedicle, common bile duct, and portal vein; serum FAL >1700 mg/dl; bilirubin 9.8/7.9 mg/dl; intra-operative cholangiogram: no further bile duct compression after fenestration

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Generalized convulsion; acute onset
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Uncontrollable convulsion; high-grade fever after levetiracetam administration; rapid elevation of liver enzymes
Medical_Record.Background: History of brain contusion due to traffic accident 20 years ago; symptomatic epilepsy; long-term valproic acid use; drinking habit; no hepatitis B or C; no surgical history mentioned; no family history mentioned; no drug allergies mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: High-grade fever 39.0°C
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Head CT: no new lesions; ALT 17 IU/L, AST 41 IU/L, total bilirubin 0.59 mg/dl on admission; ALT 93 IU/L, AST 459 IU/L several hours after levetiracetam; ALT 346 IU/L, AST 1,207 IU/L, total bilirubin 1.42 mg/dl next day; ALT 1,192 IU/L, AST 3,150 IU/L, total bilirubin 2.02 mg/dl 12h after drug withdrawal; viral serology negative for hepatitis B and C; DLST positive for levetiracetam (stimulation index 300%)

Diagnosis: Drug-induced liver injury caused by levetiracetam

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Repeated involuntary movements of lips, tongue, and limbs; 16-month duration; aggravation for more than 4 months
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Perioral involuntary movements: grimacing, grinning, chewing, sounding, uncontrolled frequent tongue and lip biting; appendicular involuntary movements: arms swinging, shrugging, stomping, abnormal gait; progressive worsening; development of gait disorder; frequent falls
Medical_Record.Background: Penicillin allergy; no history of drug exposure causing extrapyramidal dysfunction; no consanguinity; no family history of similar cases

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Gradual onset right upper extremity arm pain and chest pain
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Gradual onset right arm pain; chest pain; productive cough for one week; febrile
Medical_Record.Background: Hypertension; hyperlipidemia; diabetes mellitus type 2; peripheral vascular disease; right lower extremity below-knee amputation; no information on medications, allergies, family or social history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Temp 100.6°F; right upper extremity exquisitely tender to palpation; normal heart sounds; decreased breath sounds; dullness to percussion
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Duplex imaging: partially occlusive DVT of right axillary and brachial veins; superficial thrombus in right basilic and cephalic veins; CT chest: multiple patchy airspace opacities, no pulmonary embolus; ECG: ST-segment depressions V1-V4, ST-segment elevations V7-V9; cardiac cath: 100% thrombotic occlusion left circumflex artery; echocardiogram: ejection fraction 25%-30%, akinesis inferolateral and inferior wall; immunological studies: positive ANA (1:160, speckled), elevated beta-2 glycoprotein IgG (>150), cardiolipin IgG antibody (>120), phosphatidylserine IgG (>100), lupus anticoagulant; repeat immunological studies: persistent elevation of anticardiolipin, APL, lupus anticoagulant

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Painless mass in left palate; 1-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Well-defined, nodular, non-tender, soft mass with fluctuance; red surface mucosa; no erosion, bleeding, or ulceration; otherwise well
Medical_Record.Background: No significant medical history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Nodular mass in left hard palate; no marked lymphadenopathy
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: MRI: 26×24×17 mm mass on left hard palate invading nasal cavity; isointense on T1, hyperintense on T2, moderate enhancement; incisional biopsy: irregular nests of undifferentiated epithelial cells with lymphocytes and plasma cells, syncytial pattern, vesicular nuclei, large central nucleoli; immunohistochemistry: cytokeratin AE1/AE3 positive; in situ hybridization: EBV-encoded RNA positive in carcinoma cells; nasopharyngeal endoscopy: thickening, biopsies negative for tumor cells

Diagnosis: Primary lymphoepithelial carcinoma of intraoral minor salivary gland

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Persistent bleeding in upper anterior deciduous incisor region; 24-hour duration post trauma
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Bleeding started after fall at home; no cessation for 24 hours; no loss of consciousness, epistaxis, or vomiting
Medical_Record.Background: Diagnosed with factor XIII deficiency due to prolonged umbilical bleeding 5 days post birth; transfused with one unit of cryoprecipitate prior to dental procedure; no other relevant history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Mild bruises on chin; intraoral bleeding between upper deciduous incisors; stable clot formation after debridement

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Severe diffuse abdominal pain; associated with nausea and vomiting
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Constant severe diffuse abdominal pain; nausea; three episodes of non-bilious, non-projectile vomiting; burning with urination; no urgency or frequency; no fever; admitted one month ago for laparoscopic cholecystectomy
Medical_Record.Background: History of bronchial asthma, hypertension, HIV on HAART; penicillin allergy (pruritic rash); no smoking, alcohol, or illicit drug use; family history negative for connective tissue disorder

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Mild distress due to pain; BP 78/56 mmHg; HR 94 beats/min; Temp 36.9°C; RR 18 breaths/min; O2 sat 97% room air; soft abdomen with mild diffuse generalized tenderness; bilateral renal angle tenderness; no guarding or rigidity; bilateral vesicular breath sounds; normal cardiovascular and CNS exams
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Baseline urea 14.3 mg/dl, creatinine 1.08 mg/dl; urinalysis with features of urinary tract infection; urine toxicology negative; no glomerular casts; non-contrast CT abdomen: bilateral pyelonephritis, no obstruction; echocardiogram: left ventricular systolic dysfunction, EF 40-45%; blood and urine cultures: Klebsiella pneumoniae (pansensitive); negative autoimmune workup; BUN/creatinine increased, eGFR decreased; initial urine output 100 ml after Foley insertion

Diagnosis: Acute Non-Obstructive Bilateral Pyelonephritis with Acute Kidney Injury

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Weight loss, hair loss, abdominal colic, altered taste, diarrhea; 4-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Hypoesthesia and paresthesia in hands and feet developed 6 months later; no pain, weakness, rashes, joint swelling, fever; vision, speech, hearing, smell unchanged
Medical_Record.Background: History of hypertension, hemorrhoids, glaucoma; no melena, hemetemesis, or blood in stools

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: No jaundice, pallor, or cachexia; soft, non-distended abdomen; no palpable hepatosplenomegaly or lymphadenopathy; mild motor weakness (4/5 MRC) in finger abduction, ankle dorsiflexion, plantar flexion (left side more severe); diminished deep tendon reflexes in both ankles; diminished touch and temperature sensation in hands and feet; intact vibration and position sense; normal gait and cerebellar testing
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Normal blood counts and electrolytes; hypoalbuminemia (5 μmol/L); normal thyroid, vitamin B12, folate; negative autoimmune tests; negative hepatitis B and C serology; CT abdomen: few diverticula in colon; CT colonoscopy: extensive nodular colonic mucosa, few polyps; gastroscopy: infiltrative lesions in stomach and duodenum; colonoscopy: multiple strawberry-like hamartomatous polyps, occasional tubulovillous adenomas with low-grade dysplasia; biopsies: regenerative and hyperplastic changes, lamina propria edema, increased eosinophils; nerve conduction study: asymmetrically reduced left peroneal sensory, right sural sensory, left peroneal motor, left tibial motor amplitudes, reduced bilateral ulnar sensory and motor amplitudes; normal sympathetic skin responses

Diagnosis: Cronkhite–Canada Syndrome with steroid responsive mononeuritis multiplex

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Sudden loss of consciousness; 2-minute duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: 2-year history of progressive rest throat and chest tightness in the morning; episodes lasted 3 minutes and resolved spontaneously; sudden loss of consciousness for 2 minutes; rest chest pain in the morning during hospitalization; symptoms resolved spontaneously
Medical_Record.Background: 60 pack-year smoking history; mild hyperlipidemia; treated with aspirin, clopidogrel, rosuvastatin, diltiazem, isosorbide mononitrate; counseled on smoking cessation

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Baseline ECG unremarkable; laboratory test showed mild hyperlipidemia; echocardiogram normal; ECG during episode: widening QRS complex, ST segment elevation in I, aVL, V1-V6, J waves in I, aVL, V2-V6 except V1, premature ventricular complex; angiography: 25%-50% stenosis of left ADCA, 70% stenosis of left circumflex coronary artery, 50% stenosis of right coronary artery

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Right lower lobe pulmonary infiltrates; unknown duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Known history of colon carcinoma; referred for right lower lobe infiltrates and mucous plugging on CT; concern for pneumonia
Medical_Record.Background: History of colon carcinoma

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT shows right lower lobe infiltrates and mucous plugging; bronchoscopy reveals broad based mass obstructing bronchus intermedius; pathology confirms mass consistent with colon carcinoma

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Impaired mobility due to non-functioning leg; chronic pain
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: 13-year history of recurrent failure after ACL reconstruction; multiple surgical interventions; recalcitrant deep joint infection; knee joint arthrodesis via Ilizarov frame; persistent immobilizing pain; opioid dependence for pain control
Medical_Record.Background: No specific PMH provided; mother of two children (ages 2 and 4); early degenerative joint disease in contralateral hip; well-informed about transfemoral amputation and osseointegrated prosthesis; no data on medications, allergies, family or social history

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT scan shows osseous fusion of knee arthrodesis

Diagnosis: Non-functioning limb after knee joint arthrodesis due to recalcitrant deep joint infection

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Incidental abdominal mass; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Abdominal mass found on ultrasound after admission for acute kidney injury from dehydration; no weight loss; no abdominal pain; no umbilical discharge; no hematuria; no voiding difficulties
Medical_Record.Background: History of HIV; anal HPV; former tobacco smoker (15-pack-year); history of alcohol abuse

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Vital signs unremarkable; physical examination unremarkable
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Abdominal ultrasound: 7.0-cm midline pelvic mass superior to urinary bladder; CT scan: 7.3-cm multiseptate anterior bladder wall lesion; Cystoscopy: mass effect on anterior bladder wall, no communication with bladder; Urinalysis: pH 6, minimal proteinuria, microscopic hematuria; Pathology: mucinous cystadenocarcinoma favoring urachal origin

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Diffuse, progressive anasarca; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive swelling of lower extremities, upper extremities, and abdomen; recent travel 1 month prior; initial presentation with anasarca; readmission with right lower extremity pain, chest pain, and shortness of breath four days after discharge
Medical_Record.Background: History of osteoarthritis and obstructive sleep apnea; no mention of surgical history, family history, social history, allergies, or immunizations; medications during admission included IV furosemide, enalapril, atorvastatin; outpatient medications included oral furosemide, enalapril, atorvastatin, later switched to bumetanide, metolazone, prednisone, apixaban, sulfamethoxazole/trimethoprim; hypercoagulable workup unremarkable

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Afebrile; hemodynamically stable; regular heart rate and rhythm; breath sounds clear to auscultation; abdominal ascites with fluid shift; lower extremity 2+ pitting edema; on readmission, +1 pitting edema of right lower extremity with positive Homan sign; oxygen saturation 97% on room air
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Albumin 1.9 gm/dL; globulin 3.5 gm/dL; urinalysis 3+ proteinuria (1015 gm/dL); urine creatinine 165 mg/dL; urine protein:creatinine ratio 6.15; total cholesterol 363 mg/dL; LDL 262 mg/dL; CT abdomen/pelvis showed anasarca; bilateral lower extremity venous dopplers initially negative for DVT, later showed occlusive thrombus in right posterior tibial vein; CT angiography of chest initially negative for PE, later CTPA showed filling defects in distal main bilateral pulmonary arteries extending into segmental branches in both upper and lower lobes; ANA, cytoplasmic ANca, anti-myeloperoxidase antibody negative; complement C3 104 mg/dL, C4 33.7 mg/dL; anti-double strand DNA antibody 6.0 IU/mL; SPEP with immunofixation showed monoclonal IgM kappa chain gammopathy; left renal biopsy: effacement of foot processes in 70%, normal glomerular basement membranes, no immune complexes, mild vascular sclerosis, minimal interstitial fibrosis, PAS negative, immunofluorescence negative for IgG, IgM, C3, C1q, albumin, globulin, positive for 2+ IgA, kappa, lambda in tubular casts; serum IgG 469 mg/dL, IgA 161 mg/dL, IgM 527 mg/dL; kappa 39.3 mg/dL, lambda 15.8 mg/dL, kappa/lambda ratio 2.49; bone marrow biopsy: normocellular, less than 10% plasma cells; outpatient hypercoagulable workup unremarkable

Diagnosis: Monoclonal gammopathy of undetermined significance, minimal change disease, bilateral pulmonary emboli

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Progressive fatigue and intermittent chills; 5-day duration; loose stools; 1-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive fatigue; intermittent chills for five days; loose stools for one day; presented to emergency department on nephrologist's advice
Medical_Record.Background: History of renal cancer; status post left nephrectomy and renal transplant; hypertension; morbid obesity; sleep apnea

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: SARS-CoV-2 infection confirmed; inflammatory markers elevated but stable at discharge

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Worsening dizziness and left-sided hemiplegia; overnight duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Sudden onset dizziness; progression to left-sided hemiplegia; initial improvement after rehabilitation; recurrence of symptoms after endovascular treatment including occipital headache, back neck pain, dysarthria, and elevated blood pressure
Medical_Record.Background: 10-year history of hypertension and type 2 diabetes; no other medical, surgical, family, or social history mentioned; no medication or allergy information provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Grade 0 muscle strength in upper left extremity; grade 3 muscle strength in lower left extremity; left-sided hypoesthesia; later grade 4+ muscle strength in left extremities; postoperative occipital headache and back neck pain; dysarthria; elevated blood pressure (170/100 mmHg); final exam: normal speech, grade 5 muscle strength in left limbs, slightly increased muscle tone in upper left limb
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: MRI: new-onset ischemic stroke in right anteromedial medulla oblongata; old hemorrhage in right medial pons; CTA: bilateral vertebral artery stenosis in intracranial segment; DSA: preocclusive (>90%) narrowing of left intracranial vertebral artery, tortuosity of left vertebral artery; CT perfusion: marked hypoperfusion in brain stem and cerebella; high-resolution MRI: atheromatous plaques in left vertebral artery; postoperative MRI: acute infarction of left posterior medulla oblongata, hyperintensity in left medulla oblongata and cervical cord; DSA: intact vertebrobasilar arteries, patency of left vertebral artery, left PICA, and stent; final MRI: near-normal intensity in medulla oblongata and cervical cord

Diagnosis: Medulla oblongata and cervical cord reperfusion injury after intracranial vertebral artery angioplasty and stenting

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Black stools for 2 days; vomiting blood for 1 hour
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Relieving black stools; vomiting blood (approx. 200 mL); ineffective hemostasis after endoscopic sclerotherapy
Medical_Record.Background: History of recurrent pancreatitis; diabetes for half a year

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Abdominal contrast-enhanced CT: blurred pancreatic structure, swelling of surrounding fascia, extensive occlusion of splenic veins, tortuous expansion of gastric veins; Endoscopy: severe esophageal varices, varices in fundus and body of stomach; Splenic venography: splenic vein occlusion, peripheral collateral vessels; Follow-up CT and endoscopy: disappearance of gastric varices

Diagnosis: Chronic splenic vein occlusion with left-sided portal hypertension

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Neck and chest swelling; 1-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Swelling around chest and neck noticed evening before presentation; worsening by morning; history of blunt traumatic injury two days prior; deterioration with altered phonation and increased neck swelling after arrival at trauma centre
Medical_Record.Background: No past medical history, surgical history, family or social history, medications, allergies, or other contextual data mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Glasgow Coma Scale 15; BP 125/66 mmHg; HR 92 bpm; SpO2 95% on 5 L/min oxygen; moderate subcutaneous emphysema; significant laryngeal swelling; multiple rib fractures; lacerated scalp
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Chest X-ray: subcutaneous emphysema; CT chest/abdomen/pelvis: left-sided pneumothorax, subcutaneous emphysema, laryngeal swelling, Grade 1 liver laceration; bronchoscopy: no proximal tracheobronchial injury; repeat bronchoscopy day 18: normal; CXR day 23: normal

Diagnosis: Acute airway compromise due to subcutaneous emphysema

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Palpitations; unknown duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Ventricular ectopics; progressive dyspnea; choking sensation; cough; abdominal distension; constipation; dysphagia to solids; knee arthritis; puffiness of hands; morning stiffness (10 minutes); inability to close fist; proximal muscle weakness (grade 4); irregular menstrual cycle; urinary urgency
Medical_Record.Background: Diffuse cutaneous systemic sclerosis (3 years); sister with rheumatoid arthritis; positive hepatitis C virus (PCR); positive cryoglobulinemia; medications: diltiazem, prednisolone, warfarin, furosemide, spironolactone, verapamil, omeprazole, domperidone, simethicone, calcium carbonate, colchicine; no data on occupation, surgical history, allergies, immunizations, travel

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Pitting edema of extremities; peripheral skin tightness; coldness; Raynaud's phenomenon; sluggish peripheral circulation; increased modified Rodnan total skin score (MRSS 37); multiple purpuric eruptions on legs
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Skin biopsy: small vessel (leucocytoclastic) vasculitis; pulmonary function test: restrictive pattern (FEV1 58.2%, FVC 64.7%, DLCO 16.9%, FEV1/FVC 74.5%); transesophageal echocardiography: pulmonary hypertension (RVSP 60 mmHg), EF 63%, moderate pericardial effusion; non-contrast CT chest: pericardial effusion; ESR 114 mm/1st hr (reduced to 85 mm/1st hr); follow-up: improved pulmonary function (FEV1 77%, FVC 79.2%, DLCO 45.2%, FEV1/FVC 88.6%), EF 73%, reduced pericardial effusion, RVSP 34 mmHg

Diagnosis: Diffuse cutaneous systemic sclerosis with small vessel cryoglobulinemic vasculitis and pulmonary hypertension

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Joint pain and deformities; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Short stature; poor dentition; dark skin pigmentation over small joints of hands; widening of fingers, most obvious in ring and little fingers of both hands; limitation of range of motion of fingers
Medical_Record.Background: Pre-diagnosed galactosemia during infancy; symptoms included vomiting, poor feeding, jaundice, liver dysfunction, failure to thrive; family history of galactosemia in cousin; managed with galactose-free diet since infancy

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Short stature; poor dentition; dark skin pigmentation over small joints of hands; widening of fingers, most obvious in ring and little fingers of both hands; limitation of range of motion of fingers
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Serum total bilirubin 8.7 mg/dl (elevated); AST 89 U/L (elevated); ALT 94 U/L (elevated); alkaline phosphatase 400 U/L (elevated); liver biopsy: degeneration of hepatocyte with giant cell transformation, moderate cholestasis, minimal necro-inflammatory changes; GALT 1.7 U/g (deficient); DXA scan: osteopenia (Z score -2.2); skeletal survey: decreased bone density, wide medulla

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Seizure-like episodes; 12-hour duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Found lethargic, confused, with blood at mouth; no recollection of event; right ankle pain; two seizure-like episodes in first 24 hours; episodes with leg jerking, trunk tensing, unresponsiveness, post-ictal confusion; reproducible spells with hyperventilation; later developed hemodynamic instability, multiple seizures, acute respiratory failure
Medical_Record.Background: History of zolpidem use (30-60 tablets of 5 mg daily); last use 72 hours prior to admission; history of alcohol withdrawal seizures; no current alcohol use

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Lethargy; confusion; right ankle pain; tachycardia (140s); tachypnea (30s); hypertension (160s/100s); cyanosis; incontinence; impaired consciousness; acute respiratory failure
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Orthopedic evaluation: right ankle fracture; labs unremarkable; MRI unremarkable; spot EEG: no correlation with functional spells; continuous EEG: runs of discharge during seizures

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Right leg claudication after walking 300 m; 3-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Gradual onset right leg claudication; no thigh or buttock pain; erectile dysfunction developed alongside claudication; erectile dysfunction resolved after intervention
Medical_Record.Background: History of coronary artery bypass graft operation 2 years prior; hypercholesterolemia; no diabetes mellitus, hypertension, or chronic renal disease; other laboratory tests within normal limits

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Weak pulse in right groin and ankle; normal pulse in left leg
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Color Doppler ultrasonography: occlusion of right external iliac artery, patency of right common iliac and common femoral arteries, left iliac artery patent; distal abdominal aorta aneurysmal (36 mm); angiography: fusiform aneurysmal dilatation of distal infrarenal abdominal aorta, occlusion of right external iliac artery, dilated right internal iliac artery with high flow, normal left common and external iliac arteries, patent left internal iliac artery

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Failure to thrive, irritability, constipation; duration since 6 months of age
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Persistent failure to thrive, irritability, constipation; onset at 6 months; progression with poor growth
Medical_Record.Background: Full-term pregnancy; no antenatal or perinatal complications; no additional PMH, surgical history, family or social history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel history mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Small, undernourished; peculiar facies; weight 6.3 kg; length 74 cm; head circumference 42 cm; all below third centile; rest unremarkable
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Serum calcium 17.5 mg/dl (elevated); serum phosphorus 4.2 mg/dl (normal); urinary calcium/creatinine ratio 1.1 (elevated); serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D 32.3 ng/ml (normal); renal ultrasound: grade III bilateral medullary nephrocalcinosis; echocardiography: mild supravalvular aortic stenosis; FISH probe: deletion at 7q11.23 (elastin gene); serum intact PTH 1.5 pg/ml (suppressed); follow-up: stable nephrocalcinosis, improved growth parameters

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Severe headache, nausea, vomiting; onset after coitus
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Drowsiness; no neurologic deficit; Hunt and Hess grade 3
Medical_Record.Background: No underlying diseases; no evidence of head injury; no additional history provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Drowsy; alert postoperatively; no motor weakness; no brain stem sign; sensorineural hearing loss; tinnitus
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT and MRI show subarachnoid hemorrhage on cerebellopontine angle cistern; small vermian intracerebral hemorrhage; intraventricular hemorrhage in fourth ventricle; Fisher grade 4; digital subtraction angiography shows aneurysm at branching point between caudomedial and rostrolateral branch of left distal AICA; aneurysm size 2.7×2.8 mm, neck 1.5 mm; AICA proximal diameter 0.8 mm; postoperative CT shows increased cerebellar hemorrhage; no obstructive hydrocephalus

Diagnosis: Ruptured distal anterior inferior cerebellar artery aneurysm

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Cardiac arrest; acute onset
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Cardiac arrest; resuscitated; no acute findings on repeat angiography
Medical_Record.Background: History of extensive vascular aneurysms (aorta, celiac artery, bilateral carotid arteries, bilateral iliac arteries, bilateral internal mammary arteries); 2 prior type B aortic dissection repairs; recent ascending type A aortic dissection repair with bioprosthetic aortic valve replacement; reimplantation of right coronary artery; single-vessel coronary artery bypass graft with left internal mammary artery to left anterior descending coronary; ligation of aneurysmal left main coronary artery; implantable cardioverter-defibrillator placement; discharged on amiodarone; planned ventricular tachycardia ablation

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Repeat angiography: aneurysmal left internal mammary artery graft; no acute findings

Diagnosis: Left main coronary artery and bilateral mammary artery aneurysms with extensive aortopathy

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Worsening dyspnea on exertion; 3-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive shortness of breath; non-ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction; urgent sternotomy and 4-vessel coronary artery bypass graft surgery; postoperative hypoxemia; acute motor deficit in right upper extremity on postoperative day 6
Medical_Record.Background: Essential hypertension; aortic stenosis; heart failure with preserved ejection fraction; chronic kidney disease; multivessel coronary artery disease; moderate tricuspid regurgitation; patent foramen ovale; no intervention to aortic valve; no aortic stenosis related symptoms prior to admission; nosocomial pneumonia during hospital stay

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Moderate decrease in right ventricular function; moderate aortic stenosis; moderate tricuspid regurgitation; patent foramen ovale; normal left ventricular function; acute motor deficit in right upper extremity
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Transthoracic echocardiogram: normal LV function, moderate RV dysfunction, moderate aortic stenosis; left heart catheterization: multivessel CAD, moderate aortic stenosis; TEE: 4.7-mm PFO, right-to-left shunting, moderate RV dysfunction; arterial blood gases: pre-CPB pH 7.36, PaO2 292, PaCO2 41.5, HCO3 23.9, BE -1 (FIO2 0.9); post-CPB pH 7.31, PaO2 82, PaCO2 42, HCO3 21, BE -5 (FIO2 1.0); pulse oximetry 88%-96% post-CPB; chest X-ray: low lung volumes, atelectasis, consolidation, pulmonary edema or pneumothorax; CT brain: ischemic stroke of artery of Heubner territory

Diagnosis: Patent foramen ovale with right-to-left shunt causing acute hypoxemic respiratory failure and ischemic stroke following coronary artery bypass surgery

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Liver tumor; discovered incidentally during cancer screening
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Asymptomatic; no positive signs on examination; no prior medical interventions
Medical_Record.Background: History of hepatitis B virus infection; positive hepatitis B virus antigen; no elevated serum tumor markers; gastroscopy and colonoscopy normal

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: PET-CT shows liver mass; CT reveals 6.0 cm low-density caudate liver mass with two components; enhanced CT shows right tumor arterial phase enhancement and delayed washout, left component hypovascular; MRI shows low intensity on T1, iso-high and heterogeneously high on T2; DWI shows high intensity; ADC values 1.19 and 1.95 × 10−3 mm2/s; Gd-EOB-DTPA-MRI shows arterial phase hyperintensity and hepatobiliary phase hypointensity; FDG-PET shows [18F]-FDG accumulation; macropathology shows 7.5 cm tumor with two components; histopathology shows adenocarcinomatous and sarcomatous elements; IHC: adenocarcinoma cells positive for CK7, CK19, CD56, EMA; sarcomatous cells positive for S-100, SMA, CD10; Ki67 index 22% in sarcomatous elements

Diagnosis: Primary intrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma with sarcomatous stroma

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Confusion and mild dysphasia; 4 days post-surgery
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Left sensorineural hearing loss and trigeminal nerve pain for 7 months prior to diagnosis of left intracanalicular vestibular schwannoma; underwent translabyrinthine resection; developed confusion and mild dysphasia on postoperative day 4; further worsening of confusion and speech disturbance
Medical_Record.Background: No additional PMH, family, social history, medications, or allergies mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT brain: hypodense collection in left temporal lobe; MRI brain: fluid collection in left temporal lobe, significant oedema, mass effect, no haemorrhage or abscess; evidence of pseudomeningocele formation in subcutaneous tissues adjacent to wound

Diagnosis: Temporal lobe cystic collection with associated oedema following translabyrinthine resection of vestibular schwannoma

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Undifferentiated shock; 1-day worsening diarrhea
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Chronic diffuse watery non-bloody diarrhea; relapsing-remitting course for approximately 7 years; recent marked worsening; persistent fever of unknown origin; migratory arthralgias; nausea; nonspecific neurologic symptoms (headache, unilateral visual impairment, paresthesia of left upper extremity)
Medical_Record.Background: History of seronegative rheumatoid arthritis diagnosis; 7 years of immunosuppressive and DMARD therapy (tocilizumab, leflunomide, anakinra, rituximab, hydroxychloroquine, prednisone); recent relocation; outside medical records unavailable

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Blood pressure 60/40 mmHg; heart rate 116 BPM; temperature 35.9°C; no cardiac valvular dysfunction
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: X-ray and CT: chronic inflammatory changes of cecum and ascending colon, mild mesenteric edema, peritoneal and paracolic fluid, calcified mesenteric lymph nodes, pleural thickening and effusion; PET: hypermetabolic activity lower esophagus to cardia, partially calcified lymph nodes, diffuse hepatic steatosis; labs: metabolic (lactic) acidosis (pH 6.8), mild leukocytosis (13.3 k/uL), hyperkalemia (7.5 mmol/L), low total protein (3.8 g/dL), severe anemia (hemoglobin 5.9 g/dL), coagulopathy (PT 42.2 sec, platelets 31 k/uL), multi-organ damage, liver failure (AST 2792 U/L, ALT 1625 U/L, albumin 1.9 g/dL, total bilirubin 1.4 mg/dL); blood cultures negative

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Severe headache; prior to admission
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Sudden onset severe headache; no prior underlying disease; emergency brain imaging performed
Medical_Record.Background: No history of underlying disease; no additional PMH, surgical history, family or social history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel history mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Brain multi-phase CT angiography: subarachnoid hemorrhage in left crural and ambient cisterns; 3D imaging: elongated, tortuous vascular abnormality (IADE) on left P2 segment; aortic arch anomaly with left subclavian artery originating posteriorly from descending aorta at T4; MRI: focal acute infarction in left lateral thalamus

Diagnosis: Subarachnoid hemorrhage due to ruptured posterior cerebral arterial dolichoectasia with aortic arch anomaly

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Hepatitis of unknown etiology; duration approximately 20 years
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Elevated liver enzymes for about 20 years; referred for evaluation of hepatitis; no alcohol consumption; underweight
Medical_Record.Background: History of craniopharyngioma at 11 years old; treated with craniotomy and radiotherapy; sex hormone replacement for hypogonadotropic hypogonadism from 15 to 44 years old; diagnosed with ACTH, TSH, LH, and FSH insufficiency; central diabetes insipidus; osteoporosis; no alcohol use; no family or social history provided; no medication or allergy history provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Underweight; height 149.3 cm; weight 36.5 kg; BMI 16.4 kg/m2
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Elevated AST 131 U/L, ALT 106 U/L, γGTP 238 U/L; extremely low IGF-1 (12 ng/mL); abdominal ultrasonography shows fatty liver; negative for hepatitis B surface antigen, anti-hepatitis C virus antibody, anti-nuclear antibody, anti-mitochondrial M2 antibody; liver biopsy compatible with NASH; GHRP-2 loading test: basal GH 0.1 ng/mL, peak 0.4 ng/mL; BMD T-score lumbar spine -2.0 SD, femoral neck -2.5 SD

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Device-related infection; 4-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Implanted with CRT defibrillator for idiopathic cardiomyopathy; developed local pocket infection with chronic positive blood culture for Staphylococcus Pseudintermedius; underwent transvenous lead extraction 4 months after implant
Medical_Record.Background: History of idiopathic cardiomyopathy; CRT defibrillator implantation; no additional medical, surgical, family, social history, medications, or allergies reported

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Chronic positive blood culture for Staphylococcus Pseudintermedius; fluoroscopy of CS lead; angiography; sub-selective CS venography showed distal branch occlusion, likely due to fibrosis; post-extraction examination showed extended fibrosis on lead body

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Fetal demise; 4-day duration after onset of maternal symptoms
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Rhinorrhea; fatigue; cough; fever 38.8°C; responded to acetaminophen; persistent fever for 48 hours; absence of fetal movement two days after symptom onset
Medical_Record.Background: G3P0; blood group A+; immune to rubella; negative for HIV, hepatitis B, and sexually transmitted diseases; unvaccinated for SARS-CoV-2; epilepsy; history of generalized tonic-clonic seizures; on lamotrigine and Dilantin (Dilantin discontinued during pregnancy); seizure during first trimester after Dilantin discontinuation; CT: bilateral subcortical calcification frontal and parietal lobes; MRI: vascular malformation; dog bite at 24 weeks and two days gestation; wound sutured; amoxicillin/clavulanic acid given; no further complications; family history of similar symptoms; no medications given for elevated blood pressure; no preeclampsia

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Blood pressure 130/80 to 140/80 mmHg; fetal heart rate 130 bpm at 24 weeks and two days gestation
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Anatomy ultrasound normal at 20 weeks; ultrasound at 24 weeks and five days: fetal demise; SARS-CoV-2 swab positive for mother; fetal autopsy: normal male fetus; fetal liver PCR for SARS-CoV-2 negative; chromosome microarray normal male complement; placental disk 215 g; gross: normal umbilical cord and membranes; cut sections: diffuse beige material occupying 90% parenchyma; microscopic: acute and chronic intervillositis; perivillous fibrin deposition; multiple intervillous thrombi; loss of nuclear staining in villi; SARS-CoV-2 RNA in situ positive in placenta; no histologic correlates of hypertension

Diagnosis: SARS-CoV-2 placental infection resulting in fetal demise

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Unable to taper prednisone below 20 mg daily without relapse; duration since 2015
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Diagnosed with minimal change disease by renal biopsy in 2015; multiple relapses when tapering prednisone; received rituximab in January 2019 after negative tuberculosis and hepatitis B screening; remission achieved, relapse in October 2019 with proteinuria 7.3 g and serum albumin 3 g/dL after upper respiratory tract infection; second rituximab course given; proteinuria improved to 1.9 g in two months; lost to follow-up for one year; returned May 2021 with urine protein/creatinine 0.2 mg/mg; remained in remission until January 2022; COVID-19 infection with increased proteinuria; treated with prednisone 10 mg daily and tapered off in one month; remission maintained for close to two years
Medical_Record.Background: No additional immunosuppression between May 2021 and January 2022; travel history; no mention of other comorbidities, medications, allergies, or family history

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Renal biopsy confirmed minimal change disease; post-infusion absolute CD19 positive cell count 0 x 10^6/L; relapse CD19 positive cell count 26 x 10^6/L (normal 91-295 x 10^6/L); proteinuria 7.3 g, serum albumin 3 g/dL during relapse; proteinuria improved to 1.9 g after second rituximab course; urine protein/creatinine 0.2 mg/mg in May 2021; CD19 positive cell count 78 x 10^6/L in May 2021; positive protein in urinalysis during COVID-19 infection

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Bilateral hydronephrosis; 3-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: No lumbar pain; no abdominal pain; no bladder irritation
Medical_Record.Background: Previous right ureteral stent placement for bilateral hydronephrosis; failed left ureteroscopic placement; left ureterotomy and stent implantation; stents removed after 3 months; no other past history; no relevant personal or family history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Normal external penile development; bilateral testes on left side of scrotum; fused epididymis; left-sided scrotal swelling with positive transillumination (hydrocele)
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Biochemical blood tests normal; ureteroscopy shows bilateral ureteral malformation, seminal vesicle displacement to left; CT shows bilateral hydronephrosis, ureteral dilatation, ureteral confluence on left bladder side, malformation opening on left bladder wall, intrapelvic soft tissue shadow (germline malformation: bipenis)

Diagnosis: Intraperitoneal ectopic bipenis with bilateral ureteral malformation and hydronephrosis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Recurrent fever and bilateral flank pain; 1-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Recurrent fever; bilateral flank pain; 1-week duration; admitted for evaluation
Medical_Record.Background: History of deep vein thrombosis; no data on occupation, family history, social history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Severe pulmonary hypertension (PASP 72 mmHg); no other findings reported
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CRP 91.57 mg/L (elevated), ESR 60 mm/h (elevated); FDG-PET/CT: abdominal aortic aneurysm with highly metabolic wall (SUVmax 9.3); blood cultures negative; CTA: aneurysm below superior mesenteric artery (4.4 x 4.9 cm), high-density shadow with edge enhancement, left renal artery compression and narrowing, mural thrombus in right common iliac artery, severe narrowing of right internal iliac artery; echocardiogram: severe pulmonary hypertension

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Abdominal pain and hematemesis; 1-day duration for hematemesis, 10-day duration for tarry stool
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Intermittent epigastralgia for over 10 years; worsening abdominal pain for 2 years; tarry stool passage 10 days prior; bloody vomitus 1 day prior; known gastric tumor for 10+ years
Medical_Record.Background: Hypertension; gout; no family history of GIST; no other GISTs; declined prior surgical intervention

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Upper abdominal tenderness; mild muscle guarding
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Abdominal CT: 6 cm gastric tumor with well-circumscribed calcification; plain radiography: irregular calcification over upper abdomen; UGI scope: submucosal gastric tumor with central ulceration, deep gastric ulcer with foreign body; CT: irregular space-occupying lesion with plate calcifications and localized free air; intraoperative: infiltrative mass between stomach and transverse colon, thick calcified plate penetrating gastric mucosa and pericolic soft tissue, submucosal tumor 2.3 cm adherent to calcified plate; histology: spindle-shaped tumor cells, low mitotic frequency (4/50 HPF); immunohistochemistry: strong CD117+, CD34+, S100-, desmin-

Diagnosis: Gastrointestinal stromal tumor (GIST) of the stomach with thick calcification and penetration into pericolic soft tissue

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Incidental thrombocytopenia; three-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Platelet count dropped from 40×10^9/l to 24×10^9/l in one week; no bleeding; no petechiae; no easy bruising; no febrile illness; no joint pain or swelling
Medical_Record.Background: Known hypothyroidism; on thyroxin replacement; alopecia universalis diagnosed 12 months ago; treated with local steroid injection; iron deficiency anemia and B12 deficiency diagnosed six months ago; treated with parenteral iron and cyanocobalamin; smoker (11 pack-year); non-alcohol consumer; no family history of thrombocytopenia or rheumatological disease; no use of quinine or diuretics

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Total loss of body hair including scalp, eyebrows, mustache; erythematous skin; no malar rash; no petechial rash; no ecchymosis; no lymphadenopathy; no gingival hyperplasia; no hepatosplenomegaly
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Autoimmune serology positive for anti-thyroid peroxidase, anti-gastric parietal cell, anti-tissue transglutaminase, anti-gliadin antibodies; hepatitis serology, HIV, H. pylori stool antigen, anti-intrinsic factor antibodies negative; blood smear shows thrombocytopenia, mild leukocytosis, mild left shift of neutrophilia, toxic granulations; gastroscopy with duodenal biopsy shows no celiac disease or gastritis; bone marrow aspiration shows normal trilineage, adequate megakaryocytes, no infiltration; cytogenetic analysis shows normal karyotype; abdominal ultrasound shows no chronic liver disease, no hepatomegaly, no splenomegaly, no adenopathy; recent B12 and iron profile normal

Diagnosis: Multiple Autoimmune Syndrome with Alopecia Universalis and Immune Thrombocytopenic Purpura

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Tender growing lesion on trunk; 2-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Initial sterile pustule; rapid progression to painful lesion with violaceous tender borders
Medical_Record.Background: No underlying medical disease; no similar ulcers elsewhere

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Skin biopsy shows infiltrative tumour; islands and cords of epithelioid cells; vesicular nuclei; prominent nucleoli

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Chest tightness during winter; symptom onset while jogging; resolved with rest
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Chest tightness with exertion; rare use of rescue beta agonist; nocturnal cough several nights per week
Medical_Record.Background: Allergic to house dust mite and cat hair

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Slowly progressive Huntingtonian disorder; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Short memory impairment since age 52; increasing difficulties with activities of daily living; olfactory hallucinations and obsessive cleaning since age 56; perioral movements; suicide attempt at age 58; psychiatric admission; worsened gait, balance, and involuntary movements at age 61; walker required for last 3 years; numbness in calves; weight loss; recent fecal incontinence
Medical_Record.Background: Type 2 diabetes mellitus; bilateral sensorineural hearing loss since age 58; follicular thyroid tumor; silent carrier of alpha-thalassemia; negative family history; no school education; immigrated to Sweden at age 33; no evidence of feeding dystonia or dysphagia

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Chorea in feet and perioral area; dystonic posturing in hands; reduced arm movements; waddling gait; bradykinesia; apraxia; hand muscle atrophy
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Psychometric evaluation: significant deficits; EEG: normal; neurophysiologic studies: sensorimotor demyelinating polyneuropathy and myopathy; muscle biopsy: COX-negative and ragged-red fibers; brain MRI: atrophy in left perirolandic frontal and temporal cortex; FDG-PET: reduced bilateral hypometabolism in frontal, temporal, and insular cortex; CT: no brain calcifications; acanthocytes on wet blood smears; whole exome sequencing: compound heterozygous ELAC2 variants; ECG: normal; echocardiography: mild ventricular septum hypertrophy; fibroblasts: accumulation of unprocessed mitochondrial transcripts, severe growth impairment with galactose

Diagnosis: Chorea-acanthocytosis syndrome due to ELAC2 mutations

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Sudden-onset vertical separation of images; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Vertical double images on distance gaze; bottom image blurry, colored, diaphanous; persists with either eye closed, disappears with both eyes closed or looking away; occurs for stationary and moving objects; no visual field loss, scotoma, photopsia, micropsia, macropsia, metamorphopsia; preserved color perception; normal visual acuity; able to read and write; no headache, arm or leg weakness
Medical_Record.Background: History of asthma and ulcerative colitis; medications: azathioprine, lansoprazole, mesalamine, montelukast; family history: mother with coronary artery disease, father with cerebrovascular disease; non-smoker

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: BP 150/92; pulse 71, regular; height 5 feet; weight 185 pounds; BMI 36.1; negative precordial exam; no carotid bruits; normal neurologic exam; normal gait, station, cadence, tandem walking; normal cranial nerves; full ocular motion; no strabismus; normal cover/uncover and alternate eye cover tests; preserved accommodation; no pupillary asymmetry; normal visual field confrontation; normal visuomotor praxis; no apraxia; normal Ishihara color testing; power 5/5 throughout; normal sensory exam; symmetric, lively deep tendon reflexes; no dysmetria or intention tremor; normal heel to shin motion
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Brain MRI: DWI hyperintensity in left mesial occipital lobe (V1), extending to V2, indicating ischemic infarct; GRE hypointensity in V2; carotid duplex normal; transcranial Doppler normal; cardiac loop monitor implanted; transthoracic echocardiogram with bubble study normal; automated Humphrey visual field: subtle, patchy incongruous right homonymous hemianopia

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Progressive proximal muscle weakness, skin ulcers, intermittent abdominal pain; 1-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive proximal muscle weakness; skin ulcers; intermittent abdominal pain for 1 month; initial improvement after blood transfusion, methylprednisolone, and cyclophosphamide; recurrence of abdominal pain and fever after 4 weeks; subsequent development of seizures and peritonitis
Medical_Record.Background: Past history of juvenile dermatomyositis; treated 1 year earlier with methylprednisolone and immunosuppressant; severe malnutrition; anemia; no mention of family or social history, allergies, or other contextual data

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Severe malnutrition; anemia; maculopapular rashes symmetrically distributed over extensor sides of joints of all extremities; partially scabbing skin ulcers on extensor side of left elbow and both axilla; proximal muscle weakness; edema in both upper limbs; manifestations of peritonitis; seizures
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Hemoglobin 59 g/L; abdominal contrast-enhanced CT initially normal; abdominal ultrasound shows thickened bowel wall and poor motility; repeat abdominal CT reveals bowel perforation; MRI brain shows swelling and abnormal signals in right temporal lobe, bilateral parieto-occipital lobes, and right thalamus; cerebrospinal fluid tests negative

Diagnosis: Gastrointestinal perforation in anti-NXP2 antibody-associated juvenile dermatomyositis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Worsening left medial midfoot pain; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Known history of giant cell tumor of left first metatarsal; prior curettage and PMMA cementation two and a half years ago; recurrence six months after index surgery treated with repeat curettage, liquid nitrogen adjuvant, and bone substitute graft; ambulatory post-procedure, occasional boot use, avoidance of high-impact activities
Medical_Record.Background: No additional PMH, family history, social history, medications, allergies, or other contextual data mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Prominent first metatarsal base; well-healed dorsal incision; tenderness to palpation throughout scar area
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Radiographs: expansile, radiolucent lesion of first metatarsal base surrounding cement; MRI: large soft-tissue mass circumferentially surrounding first metatarsal, abutting second metatarsal, high T2 signal, no T1 changes at base of second metatarsal; CT: expansile lucency at proximal first metatarsal base, cortical breach, bone expansion, abutting base of second metatarsal, no direct extension or osteolysis in second metatarsal

Diagnosis: Multiply recurrent giant cell tumor of bone of the first metatarsal

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Right breast pain and swelling; 1-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Pain in right breast due to friction by clothes; noticed swelling of nipple; tenderness on palpation; onset after one month of antituberculosis therapy including ethionamide
Medical_Record.Background: History of tuberculosis; received Category I and II antituberculosis treatments; multidrug-resistant tuberculosis; on kanamycin, levofloxacin, ethionamide, terizidone, PAS, pyrazinamide, pyridoxine; no abnormal laboratory findings; no allergies mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: 3 × 3 cm tender nodule behind right nipple; not fixed to underlying tissues; local temperature slightly raised; no significant color change
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Ultrasonography: hypoechoic mass 2.5 × 0.92 × 2.6 cm behind right nipple; no infiltration to deeper structures; laboratory investigations within normal range

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Auditory hallucinations and aggressive behavior; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: History of schizoaffective disorder since age 46; recurrent psychotic symptoms including paranoid delusions, auditory hallucinations, disorganized thinking, affective symptoms; multiple hospitalizations for exacerbation; recent refractory auditory hallucinations despite quetiapine, olanzapine, and valproic acid; paliperidone ER added, followed by sudden drop in WBC and neutrophil counts
Medical_Record.Background: No premorbid symptoms; no family history of psychosis or other mental disorders; previous hospitalizations for psychotic symptom exacerbation; medications: quetiapine, olanzapine, valproic acid, paliperidone ER, lithium carbonate; no allergies reported

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Initial WBC 4.04 × 10^9/L, neutrophil count 2.01 × 10^9/L; after paliperidone ER, WBC dropped to 2.83 × 10^9/L, neutrophil count 0.79 × 10^9/L; liver and renal function normal; after lithium carbonate, WBC 4.34 × 10^9/L, neutrophil count 2.29 × 10^9/L; later WBC 6.86 × 10^9/L, neutrophil count 4.74 × 10^9/L

Diagnosis: Paliperidone-induced leukopenia and neutropenia in schizoaffective disorder

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Rapid palpitations; short duration; near syncope
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Episodes of rapid palpitations and near syncope in 2016; recurrence of isolated palpitations since 2008; initial diagnosis of idiopathic ventricular premature beats in 2006; symptoms persisted despite beta-blocker and magnesium therapy
Medical_Record.Background: History of rheumatoid arthritis treated with tumour necrosis factor alpha inhibitor; no improvement with metoprolol 25 mg daily; no pericarditis post-ablation; no significant coronary lesions; normal cardiac MRI and 18FDG-PET scan; normal immunofluorescence for ACM markers; no heart failure; no drug allergies mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Well-groomed appearance; cardiopulmonary auscultation within normal limit; no sign of heart failure
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: 12-lead ECG: VPB with inferior axis, LBBB morphology, R/s transition in V4; Holter: frequent non-sustained VT from RVOT, VPB burden 3%; Transthoracic echocardiography: normal; Coronary angiogram: no significant lesions; Cardiac MRI: normal; 18FDG-PET scan: normal; Endomyocardial biopsy: normal ACM markers; Electroanatomical mapping: low voltage area at septal RVOT; Epicardial voltage map: localized low voltage at antero-septal epicardial RVOT; Cytology: few atypical cells in pericardial fluid; Programmed ventricular stimulation: non-sustained VT; Pace-mapping: match to clinical VT; Echocardiogram post-procedure: no pericardial effusion

Diagnosis: Re-entrant ventricular tachycardia as a complication of ablation of idiopathic ventricular premature beats from the right ventricular outflow tract

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Acute right groin pain
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Sudden onset right groin pain; tenderness at right groin on palpation
Medical_Record.Background: History of hypertension; prior hysterectomy

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Stable vital signs; right groin pain and tenderness
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Leukocytosis 20,000/μL; CT abdomen and pelvis shows incarcerated right femoral hernia with inflamed appendix

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Elective radical prostatectomy for prostate cancer
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: No airway symptoms; difficult intubation during anaesthesia; asymptomatic prior to surgery
Medical_Record.Background: History of coronary artery bypass graft in 1992; ex-smoker (5 pack-years); lives on cattle farm; no reported drug allergies; no significant family history provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: No abnormal findings prior to surgery; Cormack and Lehane Grade II laryngeal view during intubation; difficult passage of endotracheal tube
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Fibreoptic bronchoscopy: sessile lesions on lateral tracheal wall, multiple mucosal lesions in trachea, right main bronchus, right bronchus intermedius; up to 40% tracheal lumen narrowing; PSMA PET: calcified lesions in trachea and right main bronchus; Histology: squamous metaplasia with metaplastic trabeculated bone in submucosa; repeat bronchoscopy: narrowing of right upper lobe bronchus, no critical stenosis

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Hematuria; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Detection of low-grade urothelial neoplasia on urinary cytology; referred for endoscopic low urinary-tract re-evaluation; 2- to 3-cm bladder tumor found on cystoscopy; TURBT performed for 3.5-cm tumor on left lateral bladder wall
Medical_Record.Background: History of non-muscle invasive bladder cancer (2002, relapsed 2007); treated with Taxol, Hydat-b, intravesical BCG until 2009; TURP for benign prostate enlargement (2002); 30-year smoking history; hypertension; chronic kidney disease (creatinine clearance 25 ml/min); sick sinus syndrome treated with dual-chambered pacemaker (2016)

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Negligible findings
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT scan: numerous bladder diverticula, no proliferative heteroformations; cystoscopy: 2- to 3-cm tumor on left lateral bladder wall; TURBT: 3.5-cm tumor with thin stalk; histology: interlacing fascicles of spindle cells, multinucleated osteoclast-like giant cells, invasion of bladder muscular wall, tumor necrosis, 4 mitoses per 10 HPF, no mature bone or osteoid; immunohistochemistry: positive for vimentin, SM actin, PR, CD44 (focal), HHF35; negative for cytokeratin AE1/AE3, EMA, ALK; OGCs positive for CD68; resection margins free of tumor

Diagnosis: Well differentiated urinary bladder leiomyosarcoma with osteoclast-like multinucleated giant cells

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Colicky abdominal pain; 1-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Pain initially periumbilical, shifted to right lower quadrant; associated with anorexia, nausea, two episodes of non-bilious vomiting; no fever; no bowel or urinary complaints
Medical_Record.Background: No history of similar illness; no previous abdominal surgery or trauma; no chronic medical diseases; regular menstrual cycle; last menstruation 7 days ago

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Vital signs within normal range; no abdominal surgical scar; right lower quadrant tenderness; positive psoas sign
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: WBC 10,000/μL with 60% neutrophil (normal); urinalysis non-revealing; negative HCG; Alvarado score 6; ultrasound shows increased appendix diameter and periappendiceal fluid; intraoperative exploration: appendix not identified; no mesenteric lymphadenopathy, Meckel’s diverticulum, or other abnormalities; normal fallopian tubes and ovaries

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Bilateral complete cleft lip and palate; scheduled for cheiloplasty
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Cyanotic spells since birth; symptom-free after right modified BT shunt surgery 2 months ago; cyanosis after excessive crying during IV access attempt; oxygen saturation 90% on room air
Medical_Record.Background: History of common atrium, common atrioventricular valve, single ventricle (right ventricle predominant), infundibular pulmonary stenosis; right modified BT shunt (subclavian artery to pulmonary artery) with 4-mm synthetic graft; on aspirin (discontinued 5 days prior to surgery); no history of failure; written high risk consent obtained; fasting as per guidelines; premedicated with oral midazolam; infective endocarditis prophylaxis given (ceftriaxone); difficult airway cart prepared; rectal paracetamol used

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Cyanosis after crying; SpO2 90% on room air; hemoglobin 17.5 mg/dl
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Echocardiography: common atrium, common atrioventricular valve, single ventricle (right ventricle predominant), infundibular pulmonary stenosis (gradient 80 mmHg), shunt patency confirmed, main PA 8 mm, right PA 6.5 mm, left PA 5.5 mm, pressure gradient across pulmonary valve 70 mmHg, mild common atrioventricular valve regurgitation; chest radiograph: cardiothoracic ratio 0.5; other hematological and biochemical investigations normal

Diagnosis: Single atrium and single ventricle physiology with bilateral cleft lip and palate

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Constipation and postprandial abdominal pain; 2-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Abdominal pain initially transient then increased in intensity; associated with nausea and vomiting; no fever
Medical_Record.Background: History of adenocarcinoma of hepatic flexure of colon; treated with right hemicolectomy 2 years prior; no evidence of recurrence

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: WBC 19.9 K/μL (elevated); amylase 136 U/L (elevated); lipase 823 U/L (elevated); abdominal X-ray: prominent small intestine loops, multiple air-fluid levels; CT abdomen: inflammatory process in proximal jejunum, localized luminal air, inflammatory changes in adjacent fat, numerous small intestine diverticula near jejunum

Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: History of VKC; under treatment for 1 year; recurrence of corneal plaque; right eye pain; referred for further management

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Clinical score 213; CCL24 (eotaxin-2) mRNA expression 349.6 at baseline; after 10 weeks: clinical score 3, CCL24 (eotaxin-2) mRNA expression 9.6

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Binocular diplopia, right axial proptosis, right hemicrania, tinnitus, pronounced vertigo on position change; 2–3 days duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Diplopia, proptosis, hemicrania, tinnitus, vertigo for 2–3 days; nausea and vomiting for 24 hours before admission; during hospitalization, intense lumbar and left flank pain with sudden onset and anterior irradiation; deterioration to hemodynamic instability
Medical_Record.Background: No known underlying medical conditions; no prior knowledge of Ehlers–Danlos syndrome

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Hemodynamically unstable (BP 70/40 mmHg, HR 120/min); signs of hemorrhagic shock; lumbar suppurative wound at nephrectomy incision; narrow nose, translucent skin, thin vermilion lips
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Abdominal CT: two left renal arteries, aneurysmal dilation, retroperitoneal/peripancreatic/peri-renal hematoma, left kidney infarction; emergency surgery: left nephrectomy, left adrenalectomy, aortic repair with DACRON prosthesis; postoperative acute kidney failure, need for renal replacement therapy; ophthalmic exam: right eye visual acuity 1/50, elevated intraocular pressure (24 mmHg), conjunctival hyperemia, chemosis, proptosis, ophthalmoplegia, lens opacities, tortuous vessels; brain MRA: right carotid-cavernous fistula, proptosis, dilated superior right ophthalmic vein, meningeal and cerebellar hemorrhage, pituitary adenoma, right frontal sinusitis; cerebral angiography: direct carotid-cavernous fistula (Type D), left MCA stenosis (80%), irregular ACA/MCA branches; genetic testing: missense mutation in exon 39 of COL3A1 gene

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Major haemoptysis; acute respiratory failure
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Onset of dyspnea and asthenia since July 2013; several episodes of spontaneous haemoptysis; admitted December 2013 for major haemoptysis and respiratory failure; recurrent sudden major bleeding with acute desaturation; progressive hypoxia
Medical_Record.Background: Hypertension; atrial fibrillation since December 2011; failed antiarrhythmic medications; catheter ablation for atrial fibrillation in September 2012; heavy smoker; occupational inhalation exposure; no fever, chills, night sweats, or weight loss; normal rheumatological and otolaryngological exams

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Severe hypoxia; PaO2/FIO2 = 118; positive end expiratory pressure (PEEP) 10-15 cmH2O; patchy bilateral infiltrates on chest X-ray; static compliance of respiratory system 52 ml/cmH2O
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Complete blood count, coagulation study, arterial blood gases, cultures, virologic and autoimmunity studies, ECG, chest radiography, PET: no abnormalities; echocardiogram: normal biventricular function, EF >70%, pulmonary artery pressure 25-30 mmHg; thoraco-abdominal CT: mediastinal lymphadenomegalia; bronchial endoscopy: hemorrhage from tracheobronchial mucosa, normal bronchial anatomy; angiography: no active bleeding source, convoluted bronchial arteries; chest CT angiography: severe concentric stenosis of right superior pulmonary vein, 50% stenosis of both left pulmonary veins, right inferior vein ectatic

Diagnosis: Pulmonary vein stenosis after catheter ablation for atrial fibrillation

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Low back pain; neck pain; upper thoracic pain; radiating numbness, tingling and pain into left arm; left lateral and anterior chest wall pain; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Pain increased by coughing and sneezing; denied chest pain and shortness of breath; pain reproduced with manual over pressure of left lower cervical spine
Medical_Record.Background: High-grade papillary transitional cell carcinoma of bladder; pacemaker; 30-pack year history of cigarette use; non-smoker for 50 years; prior gross hematuria; cystoscopy showed 8 mm papillary tumor near right ureteral opening and trigone, 5 mm mass on left lateral bladder wall; two prior TURBT procedures; pathology: high-grade transitional cell carcinoma invading subepithelial connective tissue, negative for muscular infiltration; completing second round of BCG immunotherapy

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Tenderness to touch of cervical paraspinal muscles and left upper trapezius; diminished light touch of left upper extremity
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Cervical radiographs: moderate degenerative changes of cervical spine, moderate carotid bulb atherosclerosis; CT: large destructive soft tissue mass along left aspect of C6-T1 with osseous destruction of vertebral bodies and transverse processes; lytic lesion in first right rib

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Pregnancy with history of Paroxysmal Nocturnal Hemoglobinuria; worsening anemia during pregnancy
