Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Acute abdominal pain postpartum
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: US doppler: portal and superior mesenteric vein thrombosis; platelet count 17–33 × 10^9/L; RBC and platelet transfusions intrapartum; infant: birth weight 4000g, Apgar score 9, dysmorphic features, macrocephaly, hypotonia, right undescended testes, Hirschsprung disease

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Generalized weakness, poor appetite, constipation; 1-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Generalized weakness, poor appetite, constipation for 1 month; weight loss of 1-2 kg in preceding month; no fever, night sweats, muscle weakness, arthralgia, or rash; no respiratory symptoms
Medical_Record.Background: Diabetes mellitus and hypertension for 7 years; post-menopausal; total abdominal hysterectomy for dysfunctional uterine bleeding 8 years ago; medications: insulin, glimepiride, atenolol, multivitamin; received two injections of Vitamin D 60,000 IU 1 week apart about 1 month before presentation; no known drug allergies

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Thin build; blood pressure 130/90 mmHg; pulse rate 86/min; respiratory rate 18/min; general physical examination non-contributory; no peripheral lymphadenopathy; cardiac, respiratory, and abdominal examinations normal
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Ultrasound neck: no thyroid or parathyroid nodule; serum electrophoresis normal; mammogram negative; CT abdomen negative for lymphadenopathy; HRCT chest: reticulonodular shadows in both lung fields, one small paratracheal lymph node, two isolated pleural nodules; renal biopsy: non-caseating granulomatous interstitial nephritis with acute tubular injury, patchy chronic interstitial nephritis; temporary reduction in serum calcium to 13.4 mg/dL after initial treatment; serum creatinine stable at 1.5 mg/dL at last follow-up

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Recurrent desaturations and lower respiratory tract infections; prolonged duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Antenatal diagnosis of right atrial isomerism, unbalanced atrioventricular septal defect, supracardiac total anomalous pulmonary venous drainage, pulmonary atresia; maintained on prostaglandin infusion for ductal patency; underwent PDA stenting; post-procedure necrotising enterocolitis managed medically; recurrent desaturations and respiratory infections; prolonged hospital admissions; unable to wean from respiratory support at 6 months
Medical_Record.Background: No occupation; no additional PMH, surgical history, family or social history, medications, allergies, immunizations, or travel history mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT thorax: right-sided aortic arch, duct near left main bronchus, confluent pulmonary arteries; post-stenting CT: anteroposterior tracheal compression by ductal stent; bronchoscopy: severe tracheomalacia with external tracheal compression; angiogram: good flow to pulmonary arteries and innominate artery

Diagnosis: Airway compression due to iatrogenic vascular ring after patent ductus arteriosus stenting

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Decreased vision; 3-week duration after DEX implant
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: History of complicated cataract surgery with posterior capsule rupture and sulcus IOL implantation; central retinal vein occlusion with macular edema occurred 3 months post-surgery; received five monthly intravitreal anti-VEGF injections with poor response; DEX implant performed; decreased vision noted 3 weeks after implant
Medical_Record.Background: No additional PMH stated; no surgical history beyond cataract surgery and IOL implantation; no family or social history provided; no medication or allergy information; ethnicity: Caucasian

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Visual acuity 20/200; intraocular pressure 25 mmHg; corneal edema; Descemet's membrane folds; implant migration into anterior chamber
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Slit-lamp examination showed corneal edema and Descemet's folds; post-surgical BCVA 20/63; resolution of corneal findings; no signs of anterior chamber inflammation

Diagnosis: Anterior chamber migration of dexamethasone implant with corneal edema

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Right breast tumor; unknown duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Right breast mass; mild dyspnea; abdominal pain; facial and upper extremity edema
Medical_Record.Background: No occupation stated; no PMH stated; no surgical history prior to mastectomy; no family history stated; no social history stated; no medication allergies stated; underwent right mastectomy with axillary lymph node dissection; multiple lines of chemotherapy including paclitaxel, carboplatin, vinorelbine, cisplatin, anthracycline, cyclophosphamide, docetaxel, gemcitabine, capecitabine, and eribulin

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Edema of face and upper extremities
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Core needle biopsy: invasive ductal carcinoma; PET scan: isolated right breast mass; Histopathology: biphasic myoepithelial and ductal epithelial cells, nuclear pleomorphism, prominent nucleoli, high nuclear-cytoplasmic ratio, increased mitotic figures; Immunohistochemistry: ductal cells positive for pan-CK, CK5/6, vimentin, E-cadherin, negative for p63, S100; myoepithelial cells positive for p63, vimentin, S100, negative for CK5/6, E-cadherin; tumor cells positive for p53, 90% Ki-67; negative for estrogen and progesterone receptors; no HER2 amplification; Lymphovascular invasion; PET/CT: hepatic, pleural, abdominal wall metastases; Chest CT: SVC invasion; Biopsy: metastatic malignant AME

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Blurry vision in left eye; 1-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Blurry vision in left eye; recent elevated intraocular pressure; recurrent anterior chamber inflammation; IOP remained uncontrolled despite steroids, ocular hypotensive medications, and valacyclovir

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: OCT: normal RNFL right eye (75 μm), superior RNFL thinning left eye (71 μm); UBM: PCIOL in capsular bag, no iris-haptic touch, no Soemmering’s rings or foreign body in sulcus; anterior-chamber tap for virology, chest X-ray, syphilis and Lyme disease screening, HLA-B27 serology all negative

Medical_Record.Background: History of AIDS (stage IV HIV infection) diagnosed 13 years ago; poor antiretroviral therapy adherence; recent CD4 count 15-85/μl; HIV-RNA 10,560-24,343 copies/ml; previous appendectomy with ileostomy; history of diffuse malignant B-cell lymphoma; treated neurotoxoplasmosis 2 years ago with sulfadiazine, pyrimethamine, folinic acid, dexamethasone; on follow-up for lymphoma; no cognitive disorder; no current medications or allergies mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Normal neurological examination; no cognitive disorder
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Brain CT: extensive hypodensity in left nucleocapsular region with ring enhancement and perilesional edema; Brain MRI: residual lesion in left nucleocapsular region; Polysomnography: sleep efficiency 74.2%, total sleep time 290 minutes, N1 16.4%, N2 36.9%, N3 27.6%, REM 19.1%, 16.6 arousals/hour, wake after sleep onset 97.5 minutes, apnea-hypopnea index 1.0/h, nadir SaO2 97%, periodic limb movements index 1.4/h

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Periareolar swelling in right breast; 2-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive periareolar swelling; erythema; tenderness; axillary lymphadenopathy; no fever; no breast trauma; no lung disease symptoms
Medical_Record.Background: History of psychiatric disorders; hypertension; smoking habits

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Mammography: increased density in right perimammary cutaneous tissue; palpable lump; ultrasonography: irregular collection with thickened walls (30 mm); right axillary adenopathy (14 mm); abscess drainage with 19G needle; pus observed; Gram stain: many leukocytes, many Gram-positive rods; anaerobic culture: colonies after 2 days; MALDI-TOF MS: Actinomyces neuii identified; susceptibility: sensitive to penicillin, amoxicillin, clindamycin, cephalosporin

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Normal neurological examination at initial presentation

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Blurred vision, headaches, finger paresthesias, fatigue; several days duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive visual changes and headaches; paresthesias of fingers; fatigue; initial improvement with acetazolamide and methylprednisolone; recurrent headaches and vision loss despite VP shunt and nerve sheath fenestration; eventual symptom progression
Medical_Record.Background: Previously healthy; no past medical history provided; no surgical history provided; no family or social history provided; no medication or allergy history provided

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CBC: WBC 4,000/μL, hematocrit 18%, platelets 32,000/μL, leukoerythroblastic smear; CT: 5 cm right pelvic mass, lytic lesion left iliac crest; MRI brain: diffuse dural thickening, dural enhancement, restricted diffusion in calvarium, absence of normal flow in transverse sinuses; Bone marrow: 80% involvement by neuroblastoma; Biopsy: composite (nodular) ganglioneuroblastoma; Immunohistochemistry: positive for tyrosine hydroxylase and synaptophysin; Urine norepinephrine: 694 μg (elevated); Serum VMA: 243 ng/mL (elevated); Serum HVA: 93 ng/mL (elevated); CSF cytology: negative for neuroblastoma; Restaging: pelvic mass increased to 7.3 x 5.6 cm, persistent bone marrow involvement

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Intermittent fluttering and stabbing chest pain with radiation to left shoulder; 8-hour duration

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Low back pain and bilateral leg pain; duration over two years

Medical_Record.Background: History of vertebroplasty at L1 for osteoporotic compression fracture 8 years ago

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: CT: three nodular high density lesions in anterolateral epidural space at T12; MRI: three nodular dark T1 and T2 signal intensity lesions at T12 with thecal sac compression; Histology: epitheloid cells in granuloma-like pattern, fibrocellular stroma with spindled fibroblastic cells, calcified materials

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Headache, vomiting, blurred vision; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Initial presentation with headache, vomiting, blurred vision; pituitary tumor diagnosed; received 3300 rad to sella. Two years later: impotence, joint pains, perspiration. Serum GH 16.2 μg/L (elevated, not suppressed by glucose). Subnormal serum testosterone (423 nmol/L). Visual fields normal; skull X-ray: enlarged sella. Diagnosed with acromegaly and partial hypopituitarism. Further radiation (4000 rad), testosterone replacement. GH normalized, later developed hypothyroidism and hypoadrenalism; replacement therapies started. Fourteen years later: elevated GH (25 μg/L), CT: partially empty sella, no tumor. Bromocriptine therapy (discontinued due to side effects). No surgery due to prior irradiation. Eighteen years later: progressive enlargement of hands, feet, nose; GH 104.5 μg/L; CT: sellar mass. Attempted transsphenoidal exploration abandoned due to failed intubation. Octreotide therapy started, dose increased to 500 mg three times daily by continuous infusion; GH reduced to 14.5 μg/L but not normalized. Four years later: octreotide discontinued, pergolide started; GH continued to increase. Twenty-seven years after onset: soft, painless 4 cm mass below right mandible; fine-needle aspiration suspicious for lymphoma; excisional biopsy performed. Histopathology: neuroendocrine tumor, GH-secreting. Immunohistochemistry: positive for synaptophysin, GH, prolactin. Diagnosis: metastatic pituitary carcinoma. GH decreased post-surgery but rose again. One year later: radionuclide scan showed uptake in sella, neck, spleen. Declined further investigation or active treatment; symptomatic management until death at age 72.
Medical_Record.Background: No occupation specified; no family history, social history, allergies, or medication history provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Progressive enlargement of hands, feet, nose; soft, painless 4 cm mass below right mandible
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Skull X-ray: enlarged sella; serum GH elevated (16.2 μg/L, 25 μg/L, 104.5 μg/L, 363 μg/L, 101 μg/L); serum testosterone subnormal (423 nmol/L); CT: partially empty sella, later sellar mass; fine-needle aspiration: suspicious for lymphoma; excisional biopsy: neuroendocrine tumor, GH-secreting; electron microscopy: membrane-bound dense core granules, globular fibrous bodies; immunohistochemistry: positive for synaptophysin, GH, prolactin; radionuclide scan: uptake in sella, neck, spleen

Medical_Record.Background: Hypertension; hypothyroidism; hyperlipidemia; all under treatment

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Epigastric tenderness; no signs of peritoneal irritation; normal vital signs; no fever on admission
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Abdominal CT: lesion near pancreatic head with air locules and inflammation; MRI: diverticulum close to ampulla of Vater; repeat CT: free fluid at sub-hepatic space, spleen, right paracolic gutter, 5 cm abscess near pancreatic head; lab: potassium 3.4 mmol/l, WBC 14.33 K/μL (77.9% neut, 11.1% lymph), Hb 10.3 g/dL, Hct 31.3%; CRP 73.10 mg/l, procalcitonin 0.2 ng/ml; upper GI transit: negative for extra-luminal spillage; repeat CT and MRI: duodenal diverticulum with mild inflammation

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Low back pain; recurrent episodes
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Initial onset of low back pain while traveling abroad; required hospital treatment with subcutaneous morphine and blood transfusions for severe anemia; recurrence of back pain after discharge; referred to hospital; no prior similar complaints; no history of bleeding disorders, trauma, fever, abdominal pain, motor or sensory complaints; intact bowel and bladder functions; worsening back pain radiating to right groin and right thigh
Medical_Record.Background: Transfusion-dependent β-thalassemia; hypersplenism; regular red blood cell transfusions; on deferasirox (35 mg/kg per day); last serum ferritin 3,247 ng/mL; extremely high liver iron content (LIC 39.9 mg/g dry liver); no personal or family history of bleeding disorders; no endocrine complications

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Weight 56 kg; height 161 cm; stable vital signs; severe pain; lying in bed with right leg flexed; positive straight leg raising test on right; hepatosplenomegaly; tender fullness over right iliac crest; tenderness on right upper gluteal area; passive hip motion aggravated pain; no focal neurological deficits
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: WBC 2.4x10^3/uL (low); platelets 110x10^3/uL (low); hemoglobin 6.5 g/dL (low); INR 1.5 (elevated); aPTT 41 sec (elevated); D Dimer 0.98 mg/L FEU (elevated); fibrinogen 5.3 g/L (elevated); factor VII 25% (reduced); indirect hyperbilirubinemia; AST 45 U/L (mildly elevated); MRI: hematoma in right iliopsoas muscle extending to upper thigh, size 12x5x2.5 cm

Diagnosis: Spontaneous iliopsoas hematoma in transfusion-dependent β-thalassemia with hypersplenism

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Heavy postmenopausal blood loss; acute onset
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Heavy vaginal bleeding in postmenopausal period; presented to emergency department
Medical_Record.Background: History of hypercholesterolemia; two vaginal deliveries (G2P2A0M0); allergic to penicillin; at least one family member (mother) at recent at diagnosis of breast cancer

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Circumferentially distended uterine cervix on vaginal examination
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Vaginal ultrasound and MRI: strongly vascularized mass involving entire cervix (118 × 117 × 124 mm), irregular echogenicity, central necrosis, suspicious for sarcomatous degeneration; PET-CT: heterogenous, irregular hypermetabolic uterus, no distant metastases or lymphadenopathy, right hydroureteronephrosis at at level at ureter; Surgery: total abdominal hysterectomy, bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy, end-to-end anastomosis of right ureter, frozen section confirmed cervical leiomyosarcoma; Pathology: uterine weight 1397 g, cervical mass 15 × 13 × 12 cm, spindle-cell neoplasm with high cellularity, cytonuclear atypia, high mitotic activity, necrosis, no lymphovascular or perineural invasion; Immunohistochemistry: positive for SMA, Desmin, Caldesmon, CD34 positive intravascular, negative in spindle cells, PHH3 confirms high mitotic activity, P53 positive, ATRX negative; Staging: FIGO stage 1B (pT1b) leiomyosarcoma of uterine cervix

Diagnosis: Primary leiomyosarcoma of the uterine cervix

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Failure to respond to complete cycle of anti-SARS-CoV-2 BNT162b2 mRNA vaccine; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: No significant antibody response after two doses of BNT162b2 mRNA vaccine; minimal anti-Trimeric S IgG and anti-RBD antibody levels compared to healthy controls; low-affinity S+ MBCs detectable; high-affinity S++ MBCs below quantification; no MBCs specific for viral RBD before or after vaccination
Medical_Record.Background: Congenital generalized lipodystrophy type 4 due to c.526G>T (p.Glu188Ter) homozygous variant in CAVIN1 gene; extreme reduction of white fat; hypertrophic cardiomyopathy with recurrent atrial fibrillation; severe chronic respiratory failure; no increased susceptibility to infection; no reduction of serum antibodies; no impaired response to vaccination reported previously

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Repeated serum antibody measurements: anti-Trimeric S IgG 45.5 BAU/mL (3 weeks post-vaccine), 10.45 BAU/mL (3 months); anti-RBD antibodies 23.1 BAU/mL (3 weeks), 93.9 BAU/mL (3 months); low-affinity S+ MBCs detectable; high-affinity S++ MBCs below quantification; MBCs specific for viral RBD absent; after Ad26.COV2.S vaccine: anti-Trimeric S 2080 BAU/mL, anti-RBD 4366 BAU/mL, high-affinity S++ MBCs 0.2%

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Recurrent episodes of pneumonia; several years duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: History of recurrent aspiration pneumonia; inability to produce tears since infancy; halitosis and vomiting with retained food since age 4; difficulty swallowing; growth retardation; recurrence of dysphagia and pneumonia after initial surgical treatment
Medical_Record.Background: Consanguineous parents; one healthy sibling; born by natural vaginal delivery at term; birth weight 2750 g; previous admissions for pneumonia; prior diagnosis of achalasia; underwent esophago-cardiomyotomy; no mention of medications, allergies, or other contextual data

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Weight 34 kg; height 104 cm; blood pressure 80/60 mmHg (left arm), 85/60 mmHg (right arm); slight nail plate pigmentation; short stature; light hyperpigmentation in nail beds; easy fatigability
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Barium swallow: dilated esophagus with distal narrowing and barium stasis; EGD: dilated esophagus with retained food; high resolution manometry: normal LES resting pressure, incomplete relaxation, prolonged IRP, raised intrabolus pressure; baseline serum cortisol 6 μg/dl (low); baseline ACTH 126 pg/ml (elevated); ACTH stimulation test: cortisol 12 μg/dl (low); Schirmer's test: wetting 3 mm (right), 2.5 mm (left) in 5 minutes (low)

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Severe bilateral leg pain and weakness; onset during third cycle of bortezomib therapy
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Toothache-like pain in thighs and calves; mild paresthesias; muscle spasms; progressive bilateral lower extremity weakness; unable to walk within one week; required wheelchair
Medical_Record.Background: Multiple myeloma diagnosed December 2010; IgG kappa paraprotein 3 g/dl; 25% kappa light chain restricted plasma cells in bone marrow; anemia (hemoglobin 9 g/dl); type II diabetes mellitus controlled with Metformin and Sitagliptin; bortezomib started December 30, 2010; lenalidomide added January 20, 2011; dexamethasone withheld due to diabetes; no surgical history, family history, social history, allergies, immunizations, or travel history mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Cranial nerves normal; extraocular muscles intact; manual motor test: deltoid, biceps, triceps, wrist extensor 5/5; finger extensor 4/5 bilaterally; first dorsal interosseous 3+/5 bilaterally; abductor digiti minimi 3/5 bilaterally; abductor pollicis brevis 4/5 bilaterally; iliopsoas 4/5 right, 4-/5 left; quadriceps femoris 5/5 bilaterally; hamstrings 4/5 bilaterally; tibialis anterior 4-/5 right, 1/5 left; decreased pin prick in distal gradient distribution to above ankles; temperature sensation intact; vibratory sensation at toes 1 bilaterally, knees 4 bilaterally, right finger 5; deep tendon reflexes zero throughout
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: MRI of cervical, thoracic, lumbosacral spine normal; cerebrospinal fluid: normal cell count (2 × 10^6/L), high protein (133 mg/dl); nerve conduction study and EMG: widespread severe sensory motor peripheral neuropathy with axonal demyelination; serum anti-GM1, anti-NS6S, anti-MAG, anti-GQ1b, anti-Ho, anti-Yu antibodies negative

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Exertional dyspnea (mMRC II) and general weakness; 2-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive exertional dyspnea; general weakness; no exposure to chemical agents, toxins, or dusts; no arthralgia, skin rash, dry mouth, or Raynaud's phenomenon
Medical_Record.Background: Never-smoker; no symptoms of rheumatic or collagen vascular diseases; no significant past medical history mentioned; no drug allergies or relevant family history mentioned

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: No cyanosis; afebrile; tachypnea (26/min); bilateral inspiratory crackles on both lung fields
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Chest radiography: peribronchiolar consolidation in bilateral lower lobes and lingular division; air-bronchogram in lingular division; HRCT: multifocal subpleural or peribronchial consolidations in both lungs with small pleural effusion; hemoglobin 13.1 g/dL; WBC 10,800/μL (neutrophil 73.5%, lymphocyte 17.3%, monocyte 6.0%, eosinophil 2.4%, basophil 0.8%); platelet 181,000/μL; ESR 45 mm/hr; CRP 0.67 mg/dL; ABG: pH 7.454, PaCO2 28.7 mm Hg, PaO2 48.6 mm Hg, SaO2 86.9%, HCO3- 19.7 mmol/L; PFT: FVC 1.19 L (63% predicted), FEV1 1.03 L (85% predicted), FEV1/FVC 87%; BAL: 50% macrophages, 17% neutrophils, 26% lymphocytes; no microbiological agents or malignancy; ANA, anti-dsDNA, C3, C4, ACE negative or normal; IgG, IgM, IgA negative; echocardiogram: EF 79%, no abnormal findings; VATS lung biopsy: polypoid plugs of loose organizing connective tissue in respiratory bronchioles, alveolar ducts and spaces, mild alveolar wall thickening, mild interstitial inflammation; tissue cultures and stains negative

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Rapidly enlarging anterior neck swelling; 4-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Long-standing painless anterior neck swelling for 10 years; rapid increase in size over 4 months after blunt trauma to anterior neck; no dysphagia; no respiratory distress; no hoarseness; no constitutional symptoms; no symptoms of hypo- or hyperthyroidism
Medical_Record.Background: No external injuries after trauma; no significant past medical history stated; no family or social history stated; no medication or allergy information provided

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Large anterior neck mass extending from mandible to sternal notch; soft; non-tender; smooth surface; no skin discoloration; mobility on swallowing or tongue protrusion difficult to assess; comfortable; no airway compromise or pharyngeal wall compression on laryngoscopy
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Thyroid function test: euthyroid; CECT neck: large, well-capsulated cystic mass (9.3 x 9.0 x 10.7 cm) attached to hyoid bone; thyroid gland in normal position; FNAC: cystic content, no malignancy; histology: confirmed thyroglossal duct cyst

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Shortness of breath; 3-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Shortness of breath worsened on inspiration, lying flat, and ambulation; improved with leaning forward and rest; pleuritic chest pain for 2 days; chronic orthopnea and paroxysmal nocturnal dyspnea unchanged
Medical_Record.Background: History of systemic lupus erythematosus; end-stage renal disease secondary to SLE-associated membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis; failed kidney transplant; intermittent hemodialysis for 2 years; non-ischemic heart failure with reduced ejection fraction; mild-intermittent asthma; increasing opioid use for chronic pain; no information on allergies, family history, or social history

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Tachypnea; lungs clear to auscultation
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Arterial blood gas: acute respiratory acidosis, oxygen saturation 99%; elevated D-dimer and erythrocyte sedimentation rate; troponin, brain natriuretic peptide, and ECG unremarkable; chest X-ray and CT pulmonary angiography: no pulmonary embolism or parenchymal lung disease; serial chest X-rays unremarkable except slight elevation of left hemidiaphragm; transthoracic echocardiogram: ejection fraction 63%, normal systolic and diastolic function, normal right ventricular size and function; autoimmune workup: positive ANA titer 1:320 (speckled), low C3, normal C4; aldolase, CPK, SSA/SSB, myositis antibodies negative; electromyography: possible chronic myopathy, negative for phrenic mononeuropathy; MRI and muscle biopsy negative for myopathy; pulmonary function tests: restrictive pattern, reduced lung volumes, reduced diffusion capacity, reduced respiratory muscle force; flow-volume loop: restrictive deficit; volume-time curve: decreased FEV1 and FVC

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Abdominal pain and watery diarrhea; one-week duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Left lower quadrant abdominal pain; most intense in LLQ; relieved by heating pads; increased frequency of bowel movements; malaise; no environmental exposures, dietary changes, fevers, chills
Medical_Record.Background: History of papillary thyroid carcinoma with complete thyroidectomy; ulcerative colitis status post colectomy with IPAA (J-pouch); no evidence of dehydration; no abnormal thyroid panel; no Clostridium difficile; negative stool culture

Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Stool osmolality 309 mOsm/kg (secretory diarrhea); abdominopelvic CT: J-pouch thickening, no obstruction, ascites, adenopathy, or pneumoperitoneum; flexible sigmoidoscopy: patchy mild erythematous mucosa; biopsy: severe acute inflammation, degenerative changes, no dysplasia or malignancy

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Coldness and pain in right arm during minimal physical strain; movement inability in right arm; 1-year duration; worsening 2-3 weeks prior to hospitalization
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Progressive coldness and pain in right arm; movement limitation; pain worsened recently, limiting daily activities
Medical_Record.Background: History of right-sided mastectomy 16 years ago with radiotherapy; smoker; hypertension; diabetes; no prior upper limb trauma; no cardiac symptoms; on aspirin 100 mg daily; loaded with clopidogrel 600 mg before intervention; pre-hydrated with normal saline; all laboratory examinations within normal range

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Systolic blood pressure difference of 50 mmHg between arms (80 mmHg right brachial, 130 mmHg left brachial); right radial and ulnar arteries hardly palpable
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Duplex ultrasonography: high suspicion of right axillary artery occlusion; 2D echo: EF 65%, no cardiac chamber enlargement or valvular disease; coronary angiography: no significant coronary artery disease; peripheral angiography: long segment calcified chronic total occlusion of right axillary artery; post-intervention duplex ultrasonography: normal and symmetric arterial signals; follow-up angiography: patent stents, normal flow

Diagnosis: Chronic total occlusion of right axillary artery

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Tall stature; duration not specified
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Tall stature noted; no remarkable medical history; no family history of similar conditions
Medical_Record.Background: Born large for gestational age; birth weight 4,000 g at 40 weeks; father's height 188 cm (above 97th percentile); mother's height 164 cm (50th-75th percentile); midparental height 182.5 cm (90th-95th percentile); no significant past medical history; no surgical history; no reported medications or allergies

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Height 184.4 cm (above 97th percentile); weight 78 kg (above 97th percentile); BMI 22.94 kg/m2 (75th-90th percentile); Tanner stage P3; testicular volumes 10 mL bilaterally; no signs of Marfan syndrome; no pes cavus, genu valgum, pectus excavatum, or pectus carinatum
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Normal complete blood count, routine chemistry, urine analysis, thyroid function, IGF-I, IGFBP-3; oral glucose tolerance test with suppressed GH (<0.1 ng/mL); normal tandem mass and urine organic acid tests; bone age consistent with chronological age; predicted adult height ~200 cm; sella MRI: Rathke's cleft cyst (2 mm) in pars intermedia; normal echocardiogram; normal visual field analysis; chromosome test: 47,XYY karyotype

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Generalized edema with fatigue; 4-year duration; aggravation with mental disorder and blackness; 1-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Generalized edema; fatigue; poor spirit; anorexia; abdominal distension; constipation; chills; memory loss; swelling of hands and feet; chest palpitations; black haze; syncope; auditory hallucinations; persecution delusions; violent behavior; onset of severe mental problems 1 month prior to admission
Medical_Record.Background: Previously healthy; no surgical history stated; no family history stated; no social history stated; no medication history prior to admission stated; no allergies stated

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Height 155.5 cm; weight 58.4 kg; BMI 24.1 kg/m2; cold expression; slow response; rough skin; heart rate 49 bpm; irregular rhythm; weak heart sounds; no pathological murmur; slight swelling of face and limbs; normal orientation; auditory hallucinations; relationship delusions; exaggerated delusions; persecution delusions; emotional indifference; normal intelligence and calculation
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: ECG: significant sinus bradycardia; sinoatrial block; frequent cardiac arrest (max 4.5 seconds); TSH >98 μIU/mL (elevated); FT4 0.12 ng/dL (decreased); FT3 1.90 pg/mL (decreased); antithyroglobulin antibody negative; thyroid peroxidase antibody 993.70 IU/mL (elevated); thyroglobulin 6.67 ng/mL; TSHR simulation-blocking antibody >40 IU/L (elevated); total cholesterol 6.59 mmol/L; triglyceride 2.06 mmol/L; hemoglobin 96 g/L (mild anemia); echocardiography: LVEF 65%, pericardial effusion, left atrial enlargement; chest CT: enlarged heart shadow, small pericardial effusion, bilateral pleural effusion

Diagnosis: Severe hypothyroidism with complicated sick sinus syndrome and acute severe psychiatric disorder

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Progression of pyoderma gangrenosum on left arm; 8-month duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Redness on left arm a few hours after Sinopharm COVID-19 vaccine; lesion formation after 4 days; self-medicated with amoxicillin and painkillers; no follow-up for 8 months; lesion increased in depth and circumference; admitted for significant progression
Medical_Record.Background: Hypertension; non-compliant with medication; smoker; history of leukopenia; previous similar skin lesions on face (currently absent); no history of malignancy or autoimmune diseases; no unprotected sexual behavior, recent travel, or animal/insect/tick exposure

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Conscious, alert, oriented; normal vital signs; indurated ulcer with erythematous area on left arm; skin pigmentations on lower limb; hepatomegaly; no cardiovascular or respiratory abnormalities
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: WBC 1.9 x 10^3/L (leukopenia); ANC 0.4 x 10^3/mL (neutropenia); platelet count 147 x 10^3 (thrombocytopenia); prothrombin time 14.7 seconds (increased); normal Hb, MCV, MCH, Vit B, folate, LFT, KFT; ANA negative; rheumatoid factor normal; cancer antigens 15-3, 19-9, 125 not detected; ulcer biopsy: neutrophilic infiltration; pus culture: no pathogens

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Primary infertility; 2-year duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: History of menarche at 18 years; irregular menses every 3–4 months lasting 2–3 days for initial 2–3 years; withdrawal bleeding only after sequential estrogen and progesterone therapy; unsuccessful ovulation induction and IVF with ovum donation
Medical_Record.Background: No occupation stated; laparohysteroscopy showed small-sized uterus, normal fallopian tubes, bilateral small ovaries; normal female external genitalia and breast development Tanner Stage 3; hormone levels: FSH 43.14 mIU/ml, LH 36.23 mIU/ml, TSH 3.08 μIU/ml, prolactin 3.21 ng/ml, AMH 0.27 ng/ml, testosterone 0.52 ng/ml; karyotype 46XY; family history: younger sister with similar presentation; no data on medications, allergies, immunizations, travel

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Normal female external genitalia; breast development Tanner Stage 3
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Laparohysteroscopy: small-sized uterus, normal fallopian tubes, bilateral small ovaries; hormone levels: FSH 43.14 mIU/ml, LH 36.23 mIU/ml, TSH 3.08 μIU/ml, prolactin 3.21 ng/ml, AMH 0.27 ng/ml, testosterone 0.52 ng/ml; karyotype: 46XY; ultrasound: hypoplastic uterus, bilateral small ovaries; histopathology: dysgenetic gonads

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Abdominal pain radiating to flanks, more prominent on left; 4-day duration
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Hematuria and dysuria; 1-day duration; fatigue; recent fall; decreased oral intake; unintentional weight loss of 58 lbs over 3 months; denies fever, chills, shortness of breath, chest pain, diarrhea, constipation, extremity swelling
Medical_Record.Background: History of non-obstructive coronary artery disease, hypertension, hyperlipidemia, chronic pancreatitis, atrial fibrillation on apixaban, sick sinus syndrome status post dual-chamber pacemaker, gastroesophageal reflux disease, benign prostatic hyperplasia, gout; surgical history includes cardiac catheterization with stent placement, pacemaker placement, laparoscopic cholecystectomy, EGD/EUS for pancreatic head mass (nonpathological), ERCP for dilated biliary ducts, percutaneous biliary stent placement, exploratory laparotomy, partial colectomy, choledochoduodenostomy, hernia repair, right carotid endarterectomy, colonoscopy

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Left lower quadrant pain with palpation; no rebound tenderness; suprapubic tenderness; heart rate 75; SpO2 97%; temperature 99.1°F; blood pressure 158/97 mmHg; respiratory rate 16
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: WBC 18.4 k/cmm; urinalysis positive for occult blood and leukocyte esterase; BUN/Cr 21/1.86 mg/dL; albumin 2.0; alkaline phosphatase 122; AST/ALT 37/25; total bilirubin 0.6 mg/dL; calcium 8.2 mg/dL; ionized calcium 0.99 mg/dL; lipase 514; abdominal X-ray: possible ileus, enteritis, or partial obstruction; abdominal and retroperitoneal ultrasound: 7.5-mm calculus in head of pancreas, pancreatic duct dilated to 9 mm; CT abdomen/pelvis: status post cholecystectomy, choledochoduodenostomy, partial right colectomy, choledocholithiasis, dilated common bile duct 1.1 cm, smaller adjacent calculi, pneumobilia, inflammatory changes of pancreas, acute on chronic pancreatitis, findings consistent with sump syndrome; appendix enlarged

Diagnosis: Calculus of bile duct without cholangitis or cholecystitis without obstruction

Medical_Record.Chief_Complaint: Watering and discharge from orifice near left lower eyelid; increasing on windy days
Medical_Record.History_of_Present_Illness: Congenital lacrimal fistula present since birth; symptoms of watering and discharge; no excoriation, inflammation, or swelling
Medical_Record.Background: Full-term birth after uncomplicated pregnancy; negative family history for congenital ocular or renal anomalies

Clinical_Findings.Physical_Examination: Lacrimal fistula inferomedial to left medial canthus; spheroidal opening 1 mm diameter; small amount of sebaceous material; no excoriation, inflammation, or swelling; uncorrected visual acuity 20/20 both eyes; pupils equal; no relative afferent pupillary defect; normal anterior segments; normal fundus; normal intraocular pressure; rest of ocular findings normal bilaterally
Clinical_Findings.Investigations: Syringing of lower punctum: fluid passed to nasopharynx without regurgitation; probing confirmed connection to lower lacrimal sac; MRI: right renal agenesis, left ectopic pelvic kidney; histology: stratified squamous epithelium

Diagnosis: Unilateral congenital lacrimal fistula with right renal agenesis and left pelvic kidney
